My last order was missing a few diapers, was ripped open but "taped" half hazardously with zero communication behind it.

reviews.name: OEKAYA
reviews.title: Not happy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2021
reviews.review: Its our 3rd time buying the same product but this time we had a bad experience. We received a product which has lower quality. Thinner, has different pattern on it and looks cheap. We started the process for replacement

reviews.name: Mel
reviews.title: New pooh/eeyore diapers are total garbage.....
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2019
reviews.review: 0 stars! So i have to say that the new pooh/eeyore diapers they just released are complete trash. Not only did they push the price up they cut the number of diapers you get. (We would go through about 250-300 diapers a month). I have 18 month old twins a girl 19 pounds and boy 25 pounds. In have been using little snugglers since they came out of nicu and never had a problem with the older diapers. These new ones are terrible after a 45 minute nap she's soaked through. If it manages not to leak like a sieve in a hour the diaper starts seeping through and again leaving the clothes damp. Night time in these is not an option at all i was up all night every 45 to 60 mins changing diapers! My husband thought i was exaggerating so.... he got them on his day off all by himself. Half a day later he was on his way to get diapers at the grocery store.... and came home with every diaper not huggies.... i couldnt get them all in the photo my dinner table had been taken over by diapers.... Talked to huggies to see if there maybe was something wrong with the box I received was told to put them in next size up and guess what? Leaked even worse because in have a 19 pound toothpick in a sail. Thanks huggies.... In my opinion the crappy grocery store diapers hold way better and are a quarter of the cost. Cancelled my subscription and will never use these again. Still have about 130 of them left was thinking donating them but i dont want someone to be as miserable as i was! Huggies i understand keeping costs low but when you deal in baby products you can't cut corners..... how unethical can you be?

reviews.name: JHanlon
reviews.title: Horrible rashes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2018
reviews.review:
Correlation is not causation is what I would say to many reviews that blame diapers for this that or the other but in this case, it was ABSOLUTELY the diapers that caused the rash.

We switched to Huggies to save money and because our son kept having leaks and blowouts with various organic brands. We used Huggies lil snugglers at the hospital and they seemed fine. Baby was now 3+ months. Stared using Huggies and began getting a rash. Figured it was normal, tried normal solutions - barrier cream, baking soda baths, cornstarch powder, diaper free time. Nothing worked, started getting horribly worse. Thought maybe it was a yeast rash. Nope, antifungals didn’t make a dent. Cortisone didn’t make a dent. Doctor prescribed and even stronger steroidal cream, and that finally started to make a dent after 48 hours. This rash thing went on for over 2 months! Then our shipment of Babyganics arrived and we supplemented our Huggies stash with those. No lie, 2 days using the other diapers and the rash was completely cleared up. So then we figured it was just because we had been caring for the rash diligently and changing the baby frequently. Maybe the horrible rash had just run its course. Went back to the Huggies. He started getting a bit of a rash after day 1, worse on day 2, by day 3 full blown terrible rash. Switched back to Babyganics, rash gone. No special creams or treatments.

I don’t know what’s in these things or if it’s how they’re designed or what, but they give my child absolutely terrible diaper rashes. We will absolutely never ever use these again. We used pull-ups (a Huggies brand) with my daughter several years ago and those were fine. But with these big name diapers the formulas are always changing and they’re constantly replacing ingredients and materials to cut costs. Obviously some parent love Huggies. But if you use them and your child develops a horrible diaper rash, just warning you, yes, it’s definitely these diapers. If your child has sensitive skin, I would advise not taking any chances with these.

reviews.name: Nozi
reviews.title: Diaper rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2025
reviews.review: I’ve been using Huggies snuggles since my son was born. But these last one I bought were just different, they feel lighter and thinner. I just opened them 2 days ago and my son has the worst diaper rash. The one on the right is from my previous order and the one on the left is from my recent order

reviews.name: Jack Ehli
reviews.title: RIP OFF ALERT!!! RIP OFF ALERT!!! RIP OFF ALERT!!! RIP OFF ALERT!!! RIP OFF ALERT!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.review:
I purchased size 6 Huggies 120 count 3 times in the past so I went to my purchasing history and clicked on my previous purchase. I decided to purchase size 5 this time so I clicked on size 5. It REDIRECTED to the '50' count instead of staying on the '120' count. The price of a 120 count compared to a 50 count is $6.84 more. $42.03 vs. $48.87. Who in their right mind wouldn't spend $6.84 for 70 more diapers. THIS IS A BLATANT SCAM!!! The fact that it AUTOMATICALLY switched me from 120 to 50 is what is outrageous.
You would think that a company like Huggies would not conduct business in this manner knowing that the are many young people trying to just provide for their children without being deceived by a multi million dollar corporation. SHAM ON HUGGIES!!! I will never buy from this RIP OFF company ever again and neither should you!!!

reviews.name: Jackerz83
reviews.title: Manufacturing issue?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.review:
I have bought this item/brand since newborn stage and I am very pleased EXCEPT for this box… it’s like the machine cut off the mark. It’s too short. This is a diaper from the old box, remainder are in my diaper bag the other is the new box. It’s missing the top ~1/2in. The band of fastened straight can touch the skin and rub, there’s no buffer of material.

Is the product still functional? Yeah.

Do I have to be extra careful? Yeah bc the strips are rough on his skin. Also bc he’s a heavy wetter and I feel like there’s less protection. I’ve been changing more frequently than normal in case it leaks at the top.

Just wanted to send this out in case anyone else has this issue!

reviews.name: Asialee84
reviews.title: Unprofessional
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2025
reviews.review: All of my items smelled like marijuana! I had to open the package and let it air outside...i am highly disappointed. I am not a smoker and the smell gives me headaches

reviews.name: christina suszynski
reviews.title: Defective
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2025
reviews.review: Diapers were defective but Amazon won't help with the issue so I had to call Huggies corporate and they hung up on me while I was giving them my name and sent me directly to a survey.

reviews.name: fractal97
reviews.title: Fails every night
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2024
reviews.review:
This thing is expensive and fails every night. 12 hours leak protection is wishful thinking. I have to change baby clothes every night as well as sheets.
And if you pull a bit too much on the tapes to close the diaper, the tapes will just fall off. Basically, avoid and look for standard diapers.

reviews.name: Alex
reviews.title: Bad batch!! Strong chemical odor!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2021
reviews.review:
We just had a really bad experience with these that we ordered from Amazon and just wanted to warn people.

I started smelling a strong bad odor every time my 6 month old daughter had a wet diaper. Since we always use Huggies we assumed it must be her urine and that she must have a UTI or something. She was also getting diaper rashes and seemed fussier than normal so we Brought her to the pediatrician yesterday. They gave her a catheter to extract urine to check for UTI.

I randomly had a thought to try a Pampers diaper on her today since we had some to just make sure it was actually her pee that was giving off the odor. Once that diaper was wet It just smelled normal and like pee.

I just took one of the unused Huggies and poured water on it and got the horrible smell again right away. Almost smells like nail polish remover or something.

I feel like a horrible mom for not figuring this out sooner but there is something wrong with this batch of diapers we got from Amazon. Will not be ordering diapers from here again

reviews.name: MJ
reviews.title: Constant blowouts
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2025
reviews.review: Leakproof is a joke. We’ve been using these diapers for the past few days and our newborn has had multiple blowouts, which we did not have as often with Pampers or Honest newborn diapers.

reviews.name: Sam
reviews.title: The diaper is fine
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2025
reviews.review: Amazon shame on you for sending me a box of diapers that is all ready opened and missing some but was taped back shut. Then when I try to get support my only option is to contact the manufacturer. This is completely unacceptable.

reviews.name: Elizabeth
reviews.title: Poor quality compared to diapers purchased elsewhere
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2016
reviews.review: This is the second box of diapers I have purchased from Amazon. I generally love Amazon as a company and think they have good products for good prices. When I bought the diapers, I was excited by the lower price, and signed up for the subscription as the price was even better, and it seemed very convenient to have diapers delivered to my home monthly. Unfortunately, however, both times the Huggies little swaddlers I purchased from Amazon have been of notably poorer quality than those I buy at Kroger (which are, alas, more expensive per diaper). The Huggies I received from Amazon were thinner, fit poorly and resulted in poop leakage EVERYTIME! At first, I thought it was my technique but I have decided it is not since it has happened EVERYTIME with the Amazon-purchased diapers and rarely happened with the Kroger-purchased diapers. The diapers are clearly of poorer quality even by visual inspection. I am saddened by this and concerned that since it has happened with both boxes of diapers I tried from Amazon, that it is not just a matter of an accidental, isolated case of one bad batch of diapers. I canceled my Amazon diapers subscription and will buy my diapers elsewhere because the price on Amazon is not really a good price if the product is poor quality.

reviews.name: Lindsay
reviews.title: Just bad for my baby
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2024
reviews.review: Unfortunately, these did not work for my baby. They were not keeping him dry when wet. It would soak through his clothing and the cotton on the diapers would get on him and stick. I also lost about 10 diapers to accidentally pulling off the tabs. They do have cute designs of Winnie the Pooh on them though, I wish they wouldn’t leak.

reviews.name: Sarah Hunt
reviews.title: More like two hours of leak protection
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2024
reviews.review: These claim 12 hours of leak protection. My baby was occasionally leaking with his Pampers by the morning, so I thought I would try something different. Once trying Huggies, I quickly went back to Pampers because he was leaking through the diaper within a matter a hours.

reviews.name: B. Nguyen
reviews.title: Redesign needs to be revamped
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2017
reviews.review: I'm not quite sure what product redesign they did, but whoever is in charge of it didn't go through all the QC checks before signing off on the final product. I'd been using Little Snugglers faithfully ever since they introduced them in the hospital for my son 19 months ago. I used Pampers previously for my other two kids and was pleasantly surprised how Huggies stepped up their game. My most recent February order changed from the soft sage green Winnie the Pooh designs you see advertised to a more cartoonish whimsical Pooh design. The liner still feels soft to me and is quilted, but the size is smaller than the previous design's size 3 that I'd been using. I'm not going to knock the graphics. I think it's cute. But it no longer says Little Snugglers and the diapers leak like crazy. I would also have to go up a size for the diapers to fit my son next month, and this isn't right because I'll be having to pay more/diaper for the bigger size since the quantity is less. My son has woken up to soaked pajamas every morning - something that NEVER happened with the previous design. I'm lucky that he hasn't rashed up like crazy like other Amazon customers have experienced. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this new design of the Little Snugglers.

reviews.name: H. Hun
reviews.title: Surprisingly bad
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2016
reviews.review:
I love huggies. Spoke so highly of them. My son is 2 months old and on size 3. I ordered this large box of size 3 and apon almost being out of the pampers I got from my baby shower opened up this box. They are terrible. There is this purple strip on the location of where you affix the back straps to the front. It seems like it could be used to affix the straps better in theory but I can't seem to get them to work, the velcro just pops right off. So to get passed the purple strip I have to tighten the diapers passed where I normally would. But...minus the fact that my baby is plump and means I can't use these diapers for as long as I would like so buying the big box was wasted. ...also the strap that affixs to the front as rough sharp edges. I've seen diapers cut skin before and I can now see why.
Soooo here I am in the mountains with a box of diapers I have to return and can't use (40$...), alone, with a son who was circumsised today so harder to drive to town with, and the new box of PAMPERS won't be here for 2 days unless I pay an additional 10 dollars. ..might just do that. At least I get to return these terrible ones.

reviews.name: NAsloan
reviews.title: Leak every time
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2016
reviews.review: We ordered a dash button for Huggies and used it frequently when LO was in newborn size diapers. The Huggies Little Snugglers worked fine in size NB and looked similar to Pampers NB. When we moved up to size 1, we used Pampers that were given as gifts. Once we ran out, I switched the dash button to size 1 and the look and feel of the diaper seemed different. I wouldn't mind except every time my son has had a poopy diaper, it has leaked out the top of the diaper! At first I thought it was because he was lying down, but it literally seeped out the top back when I was holding him sitting straight up. Other times it has leaked out the leg. It never fails that if it's a dirty diaper, everything else gets dirty. This only happens for poopy diapers; the absorbency seems to be better in the front of the diaper. I also don't like the way the tabs fold in because of the elastic waist so you can't use them to close it up before you throw it away. How I have a bunch left that I don't want to use. I'm ordering the Snug and Dry via the Dash Button and hope they work better.

reviews.name: Tim
reviews.title: Defective and returning
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2021
reviews.review:
Beware if you do buy these that there is a risk of getting something incorrectly made

After getting a newborn you would think "I should order a bunch of diapers". Everytime we have bought huggies from target and costco there has been no issues. Finally ordered here for convenience and sure enough they are defective/incorrectly made. The velcro is on backward and doesn't provide the same leak protection as the other ones we buy from the store. While I assume that all Huggies sold here are not like this, its pretty frustrating to find out when changing a dirty diaper.

I tried look around and try to find any contact information to make them aware of this and it is either not listed or hard to find.

Returning for refund instead of replacement bc we are afraid the same thing will happen again

reviews.name: Sravani
reviews.title: The limited edition models were not good at all. Please revert back to regular one's
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2023
reviews.review:
I have been using the regular edition model for my baby and they were very good. But since 2 months the new default edition are not good at all for some reason.

Issues
1. Leaks are happening
2. Filling capacity is reaching very quickly compared to the regular model.
3. Quality, touch and feel were not good at all compared to the regular model.
4. Thread fabric is Getting damaged easily

Pictures shown

The left side one's are old model, which are very good.
Right side one's are the new 100 years disney edition model which were not good at all.

reviews.name: Mrs. H B
reviews.title: Defective Batch
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2020
reviews.review: I'm extremely disappointed with the quality of these diapers. Initially, I was so hopeful and anticipated the arrival of these diapers due to the high reviews. After experiencing numerous leaks and blowouts, I now question the validity of these ratings. I can say, however, that the diapers I received appear to be defective- 1st package contained varying defects with tabs and lining and 2nd package had loose inner lining on left side of diapers. I surrendered following 1st diaper of 2nd package due to a massive leak at midnight, causing linens and garments to be changed (3rd time needing to change linens from diaper leaks in 1 week). I checked some of the other diapers in that pack and noticed the common defect. Therefore, I may have just received a bad batch, but the numerous episodes caused little desire for me to ever consider Huggies Little Snugglers again. Typing this review following aftermath of leak:(

reviews.name: Gregory Hunter
reviews.title: Defective size 2 Huggies diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2025
reviews.review: Some of the diapers in the package are missing the Velcro tab and can’t be used.

reviews.name: amanda
reviews.title: These are terrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2024
reviews.review: These are the WORST Huggies I ever bought. Leaks every night and during a car ride! Poor kid was soaked when I took her out of the shopping cart at grocery store when she had it on for an hour and a half!!! THESE ARE NOTHING LIKE LITTLE MOVERS!!!!

reviews.name: Kristen Knouse
reviews.title: I wouldn’t get these from Amazon again!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2020
reviews.review: I purchased these same diapers from Amazon before, in size 1, after getting a sample from my registry gift box and loved these. I bought the pack in size 3 and 4 because I have the registry discount and had no issues the first time, HOWEVER, the pack of size 3 have little pokey, sharp/hard spots throughout every diaper (some more than others) almost as if they got wet and dried within the packaging. They were in the plastic sealed when received so I have no idea how this occurs. I may call Huggies themselves to complain about this because it is no good for baby’s sensitive skin and may update this review when I call. Will likely return the size 4 for fear they have the same problem. Such a waste of these size 3s.

reviews.name: Elizabeth Cohen
reviews.title: Quality check - faulty diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2024
reviews.review: I have bought Huggies for all of my kids but this is the first box I’ve bought where I’ve had to throw out diapers because the tab on the back that helps secure them to the front is completely missing. Very frustrating I’ve thrown out 10 so far from one bag, haven’t even opened the other bags in the box. Quality dropping over at Huggies? Or is this seller sending out factory seconds?

reviews.name: Lewis Luna
reviews.title: Why wont it stop leaking!!!!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2024
reviews.review: These are terrible diapers i wish i could get a refund they keep leaking every single time almost. We've been using this box for about a month and 8 out of 10 diapers on baby will leak we've had to continually wash clothes after clothes doing additional washes for the constant leaks. I literally just had a leak and came on here to buy different diapers and took a moment to write this review. Please DO NOT BUY THESE.

reviews.name: 11BravoHawk
reviews.title: Poor, Poor design
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2020
reviews.review: These are the worst diapers I have ever seen, whomever designed them either doesn’t have kids, or never tried them on an actual baby/toddler - the design is terrible. They are made in a way that my little girl looked like she was wearing a g-string, so they obviously always leaked, they covered nothing. And if she pooped... pray that it is contained in the diaper, because most of the time it was on the edge- one more minute and it would have been everywhere. Ugh. They have this ruffle on them for some unknown purpose. My baby was wetting through the diaper onto the bed every time I put this diaper on. Although cheaper than most diapers- they just were not worth it. I will pay a few extra dollars to keep my baby, bed, crib, couch dry.

reviews.name: Nails Art
reviews.title: No lo recomiendo
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2022
reviews.review:
Buscando algo de mejor calidad para mi bebe decidí comprar los afamados huggies y fue la peor decisión, resultó en un gran sufrimiento para mi bebe pz 2 pañales fueron suficientes para que quemara horrible la piel de mi bebé. Mi bebé de 5 meses eran gritos de dolor tratando de sanar esas heridas que ese pañal le provocó llagas horribles.
Para más una marca tan barata como luvs nunca me le provocó eso recién nacida. Así que no confíes y mi recomendación quédate con lo que ya conoces que le funciona a tu bebé xq x cosas nuevas puedes arriesgarlo a sufrir de gran manera.
Mis diapers favoritos son marca kirkland nunca he tenido problemas con ellos, luvs y pampers baby dry.

reviews.name: Tiffany
reviews.title: Newborn size LEAKS OFTEN
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2024
reviews.review: The diaper itself is nice enough but my 7.3 lb newborn has peed through the sides at least 2 times a day all over his clothes and us. We change him every 1.5-2 hours and it doesn’t matter if the tabs are tight enough. Very disappointing. The hospital uses Pampers which worked great and we’re about to try the Honest Co ones. Not worth getting these.

reviews.name: Eliz2110
reviews.title: Quality is inconsistent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2023
reviews.review: We have been purchasing these diapers through subscribe and save for 7 months. Overall we are happy with them but the quality of the diapers varies from order to order. Our last shipment had a heavy chemical smell on the diapers and we could not use them. We were not able to return the diapers due to Amazon’s health and safety policy but we did get a refund. Diapers from a previous shipment did not have a chemical smell upon opening but had a strange chemical smell once the diaper was dirty. All of our other shipments were normal.

reviews.name: HouDat
reviews.title: Experiment Gone Bad!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2016
reviews.review: As a new mom, I was encouraged by friends to try various brands of diapers. I subscribed to receive Pampers monthly but then my baby was running low on diapers and still required the newborn size, so I ordered Huggies because I was not pleased with Pampers. My baby although less than 8lb, had massive blowouts in the Pampers swaddlers. When I received my shipment today, I was eager to try it. I made sure everything was strapped on well and pulled out as recommended. Later on (first diaper change), I felt urine on me; somehow, urine managed to escape from the side of the diapers. The diaper was not even wet. I was flabbergasted and thankful that it was not #2 and I was home. Maybe because my son is rather slim and this is the reason for this epic fail but I am done and it's so sad because I received a large box of size 1 as a gift and I have to figure out what to do with them. I was really hopeful. I am experimenting with Huggies wipes next, wish me luck.

reviews.name: Dana Johnson
reviews.title: Leaves and plastic pieces inside box. Dirty and dusty
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2024
reviews.review: I got my order on time however, this being a baby product there should be more care in packaging . Broken plastic pieces and leaves inside box when delivered

reviews.name: Roxy R
reviews.title: Where is the belly cut out?!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2020
reviews.review: I had been gifted other diapers. The only reason I ordered these is cuz it said they had the belly cut out. Open it to see. NO CUT OUT! I was upset cuz it’s our first born. We are all learning and exhausted with barely any sleep, I still managed to to order BEFORE I ran out, then opened these when we ran out, to see no belly cut out! I folded the top but now I had to send my husband to store to see if he can find ones with cut out. Once his belly button stub falls off we can use these but, I already had plenty with out cut out. Maybe remove the picture that states there is a cut out for bellybutton so people don’t buy mislead

reviews.name: K3LL3Y
reviews.title: Very disappointed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2016
reviews.review:
We love huggies little snugglers for our daughter and usually purchase from the store. Decided to try ordering from Amazon to save a few dollars and signed up for the monthly subscription to have it automatically delivered. First, it didn't come in the huggies box shown on the site which wasnt a big deal until opening the box and realizing that they are NOT the same diapers. There is nothing the same about them compared to the original snugglers from the store. The elastic band is weaker, tabs are cheap, different lining, thinner and had a weird chemical smell. Will go back to purchasing them from sams club.
Attached are pictures. The diaper on the left is the huggies from the store and the diaper on the right is the one that I received from Amazon.

reviews.name: Lisa
reviews.title: Diapers stolen from box and repackaged
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2024
reviews.review: Diapers were stolen from the box. There are two packs of diapers in the box. The one pack had been ripped open with half the diapers removed. The box was then resealed with packaging tape.

reviews.name: shopper14579
reviews.title: Run small, so many leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
reviews.review: I have a very active infant and it seems like these diapers don't work for a baby so active. They leak A LOT. They also run small. I don't recommend if you have a baby who likes to wiggle and kicks their legs a lot, or a baby who sleeps on his side.

reviews.name: RB
reviews.title: HORRIBLE DESIGN
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2021
reviews.review: I was excited to try huggies, we had just ran out of pampers and I wanted to see if huggie snugglers were better but the box we received came with purple tabs for size 2 diapers, there’s no advertising that states that the diapers would have the double velcro and it’s HORRIBLE. When changing our LO, since LO likes to try to roll diaper changes can be a struggle so I want a diaper that easily can be thrown on but with the purple tabs if the diaper folds on itself and it gets stuck and then tears when trying to pull it off the purple tabs. These are a horrible design and we will be switching back to pampers.

reviews.name: Yoanna
reviews.title: Open Box/ Leaking Diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2017
reviews.review:
I have 3 weeks old baby( 9lbs), so I wanted to try Huggies and ordered size 1.
The box came Open!, the packages inside seemed to be closed though, so I decided to give it a try.
It's a second day I put Huggies on my baby and every time the diaper leaks and get her clothes Dirty. The first few times I thought it might be me putting it wrong...so I kept on. After 16-20 diapers believe that it's the Huggies' diaper that's poor product.

Extremely Disappointed! Especially knowing that I ordered a box of 216 count... that I don't want to continue using nor can I return since it's already open.

Hope that the box of diapers I received was defective and my case is exception but I Will Not Order again and Will Never Recommend to a Friend, will stick with the other brand I used.

reviews.name: Chanele Williams
reviews.title: Good diapers; Horrible smell
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2016
reviews.review:
I've been using Huggies Snugglers since my little guy was born and never had any issues. This pack of diapers I ordered via Amazon has a SERIOUSLY HORRIBLE stench! The first sleeve was fine, but when I cracked open the second sleeve anytime my son would pee even a little bit, the diapers emitted a horrible smell I could detect just by holding him. Tried another brand of diapers, and the smell was non-existent. Tried to give these the benefit of the doubt and opened a third sleeve of diapers- the stench was back!

I've ordered Huggies from Amazon before and they were delivered in an official Huggies box. These diapers however, arrived in a nondescript cardboard box with sleeves of diapers. I don't think I'd ever order diapers from Amazon again. Sadly I'm left with tons of diapers I can't use or give away to anyone because of this defect.

reviews.name: iqra
reviews.title: So disappointing
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2023
reviews.review: I order the same brand 2 earlier and those were so comfortable and nice for my baby so i ordered twice but this time it was totally disaster, not even same what i order before, cheap material leaked very badly and runs very small , my baby is just 12lb and its just fit on his belly he can't use this diaper on 13 lb even . I wish if i can return that but i just throw the box in the garbadge without even using them .

reviews.name: Sarah N
reviews.title: Believe the negative reviews!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2017
reviews.review:
The only reason this gets one star is the customer service. I got these diapers based on positive reviews and figured that the negative reviews would shake out as the newer redesign got better. Boy was I wrong!

We started using these diapers 3 days ago and have had 5 leak through already! I am so mad that I keep having to wash clothes--and in NYC that's hard! The diapers have a gap at the top (my baby is 12.5 pounds and still in size 1) that urine will come out of and poop comes out of the sides of the legs. When I changed a poop diaper recently it hadn't absorbed at all and was all pooled in the bottom and coming out of the sides. So gross.

Huggies--this is a terrible product and doesn't work! Please fix this issue! If you've had this problem, email or call customer service for Huggies and you can get your money back.

reviews.name: Connie Forehand
reviews.title: Delivered diapers almost empty
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024
reviews.review: False advertisement. I was supposed to get 72 diapers and only got one package of 22. Box was opened and damaged. Advertised as like new with 72 diapers. Very frustrated because I am on a very fixed income and my baby needs diapers.

reviews.name: R. McCoy
reviews.title: Don’t bother
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2020
reviews.review: I have been using the little snugglers since my baby was a newborn and never had any issues, up until now. We ordered a box of size two and they were normal. Ordered a second box and the diapers were different - the design was more vibrant and they now have purple tabs on the front and AND they now have an awful chemical smell. It’s faint until there is urine in the diaper and then it’s overwhelming. I thought there was something wrong with my baby because the smell is so bad. Now I have half a box of diapers that is useless. Soooo disappointed with the changes.

reviews.name: Yunaisy Marante
reviews.title: Pampers size 4
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2024
reviews.review: Siempre compro con este mismo vendedor y hasta ahora me parecía Exelente. La verdad esta vez pedí size 4 por segunda ves y nada que ver . Calidad súper mala , muy finos y no le duran nada a mi bb . No pienso pedirlos más aquí . No pierda su dinero hay un dicho que dice que lo barato sale caro

reviews.name: Maria
reviews.title: Does not have leak protection.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2020
reviews.review: When I first tried huggies (store bought) it was great, I did not have any issues. I really like the straps as they have a good stretch to them. When I purchased huggies through amazon they don’t seem to have a good leave protection making me make a lot of laundry which I am not too happy about. It’s really unfortunate because I really liked these diapers when I first tried them. I have included pictures of the gap between baby and diaper, these seem to lose their elasticity. My son is 15 1/2 pounds, I had to go back to another brand (in the 2 size) and I have not had any issues.

reviews.name: Becky
reviews.title: Disappointing changes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2021
reviews.review:
I’ve used the Huggies Little Snugglers size 1 (purchased @ Walmart) & size 2 (purchased from this seller). The diapers were everything I wanted for my little Princess. Unfortunately, this pack I purchased (size 3) is different from the 2 previous items. These diapers had the same Winnie the Pooh cartoon characters but the padding inside was not the same, was of a poor quality & had a horrible chemical smell to it. I WILL NOT BE BUYING IT AGAIN!!!
FYI: I only gave 1 ⭐️ because I have to do so before I can give a review.

reviews.name: Lem
reviews.title: Leak, Messes up clean clothes and floor
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2023
reviews.review: This product really disappointments me. I was so anxious to just complete the remaining stocks of this crap I have left so I could try find something else that is leak free and works well. Despite having the right size for baby using these diapers might as well your baby goes butt naked. Cause clothe still gonna mess up wearing these crap. Thank God after searching I found Pampers that actually does the Job

reviews.name: Shuojia Shi
reviews.title: Strong plastic odor
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2017
reviews.review:
Used to love this diaper. It was soft, absorbent, and easy to use with the indicator. So I subscribed to this product for my lo. Starting from two months ago, the shipment arrived in a new design. The first thing I noticed after opening the box is the strong plastic odor from the diapers, which did not exist in the previous boxes. It was horrible! I went to a store and purchased a box of little mover diaper and it did not have the odor.

I did not cancel my subscription fast enough and received the next box of diaper. The same terrible plastic smell right out of the box. How does the company think it would be a good idea for babies to use products with any strong chemical odors? Cancelling my subscription now. Do not recommend this product any more.

reviews.name: Firuza
reviews.title: Bad quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2023
reviews.review: The quality of diapers is bad material like trash bags. I saw in reviews pictures old Huggies but thought is will be the same. After when I received them I was surprised that quality doesn’t good as good as i thought and just looked back to the reviews and they was 2019-2021. So just make sure that new ones bad quality. Pampers much better I just wanted to try Huggies but don’t wanna buy them again

reviews.name: Danaeyda
reviews.title: Not the same from store
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2022
reviews.review: I’ve been buying Huggies since my baby was born so decided to sign up for the subscription on Amazon. The quality from store bought and Amazon felt different the ones from Amazon felt more stiff. I’ve never had problems with diaper rashes but when I use the ones from Amazon my baby breaks out. I see they also come from Huggies store so I don’t know what the difference could be. I will continue using Huggies but buying from the store.

reviews.name: katelyn
reviews.title: Not like regular little snugglers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2022
reviews.review: These have been awful. We’ve used these since we came home from the hospital with no issues. We haven’t been able to find size 5 in stores so when I found them on Amazon I figured it was great but not so much. They clump up in weird places. They do not have the typical absorbency. We have been going through diapers like crazy when typically we last until our next autoship. The only plus is that they still don’t give a diaper rash but we will be looking for other options now because these just aren’t working.

reviews.name: Sonia
reviews.title: Poor quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviews.review: I've used both Huggies swaddlers and snuggles in N up to size 3. I didn't have an issue until this batch of size 3s. The straps rip off when you open them, they leave fibers on my baby's skin and strings in the creases. I threw away an entire case and half since the issue was with every diaper. Unfortunately I will not be purchasing Huggies again.

reviews.name: Ahmed Mahmoud
reviews.title: Rash and redness
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.review:
I don't know what's wrong
I have a twins and i was using Kirkland, Huggies and pampers for them
They have never had any booty rash or redness till we bought Huggies from amazon
There was something wrong so my wife suggested to cut it out and change the diaper brand to make sure that the problem is the diaper and it was !!!!!

reviews.name: Britney ♥️♥️
reviews.title: Not the one
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2025
reviews.review: Get snug and dry . This pampers doesn’t hold well.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: We know well the design of "little bump" is hard to FAKE and that is the best thing worthy of Huggies diapers for its good work
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2016
reviews.review: This is FAKE! I have been a huge fan of Huggies since I have two kids using this brands for 4years now. I used to bought diapers more often from supermarket except this time. Comparing the Snugglers size 2 from supermarket with the size3 with blue tag from Amazon, the inside of absorbing parts are different. We know well the design of "little bump" is hard to FAKE and that is the best thing worthy of Huggies diapers for its good work on absorbs. The blue tag one has nothing with the design at all. I can say definitely the amazon one is FAKE! I will ask for compensation and return!!!!

reviews.name: Jsachin
reviews.title: Quality is cheap
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2024
reviews.review: last week i ordered size 1 huggies diapers, when i am using it for my newborn, the threads are starting coming off everywhere. I prefer huggies brand over pampers but this is what i did not expect. Very cheap quality,seems amazon delivered duplicate items. Highly disappointed with this purchase

reviews.name: Rowdy Jensen
reviews.title: Not soft and terrible design
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2021
reviews.review: I haven’t had problems with huggies leaking. However, there are a couple things I don’t like. The double Velcro for starters. I don’t understand the purpose. The only thing this design seems to do is make changing diapers more difficult. Second, these diapers are not soft. The diapers feel clumpy and hard. I am keeping a close eye out for any rashes that may appear. I’ve been debating between Huggies and Pampers for a couple months now and testing both out to give each a fair chance. Pampers is the only brand I will be using from now on.

reviews.name: Carla
reviews.title: En dos horas se llena
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2024
reviews.review: No sé que pasó está vez pero mojo la cama solo los llevaba puesto como 3 horas y con ningún pañal en tan poco tiempo se llenaba a tal punto de mojar todo

reviews.name: Tamika Thompson
reviews.title: Huggies 1 star
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2024
reviews.review: Almost every 5th Diaper the diaper straps are broken or stuck to the diaper. I have threw away about 30% of the diapers just based of manufacturing

reviews.name: Liubov poshivailo
reviews.title: 3 size terrible quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2024
reviews.review: why did size 3 become worse in quality? 1 and 2 are excellent, but 3 inside has become very bad, does not absorb well, is wet to the baby’s skin! I don't need such a product!

reviews.name: yumin zhao
reviews.title: ALMOST CUT MY SON
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2024
reviews.review: Glue was left on the diaper,and it was so hard that my son cried, almost cut my son.

reviews.name: Charli
reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!! CHEMICAL SMELL NOT REAL HUGGIES!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2020
reviews.review: These are NOT real huggies, the inside pad has such a strong chemical smell it gave me a head ache. No way I am putting these on my daughter!! I don’t know how anyone in their right mind would give these a good review!!! Please do not buy these! As much as I was excited to save some money on diapers it’s not worth it!!! The padding on the inside gives it away with the smell and different material. The only reason I gave this 1 start is because I had to in order to write a review. Amazon needs to remove this for sale.

reviews.name: Ellie
reviews.title: Don't buy. 75% of them were ripped and unusable!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2023
reviews.review: I am shocked! Nearly all of the diapers in this package are missing the right back side of the diaper, the stretchy adhesive part that sticks to the front. The ones that weren't missing were ripped so deeply that they can't be used. Obviously they're useless and I got a refund, but don't make the same mistake as me.

reviews.name: Chickencups
reviews.title: ... chorus - these have changed and not for the better! I have been using Little Snugglers for most ...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2017
reviews.review: I have to add my voice to the chorus - these have changed and not for the better! I have been using Little Snugglers for most of my son's life and they were wonderful. They didn't cause rashes, fit well and my baby stayed dry all night. These don't fit as well and leaked pee twice in the first week of use - during the day, when I change him frequently! I don't know what to do. I am going to have to hunt for a new diaper. So sad! If anyone knows how to get some of the pre-"improved" diapers, please let me know!

reviews.name: It’s meeee
reviews.title: Arrived damaged
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2024
reviews.review: Arrived damaged and received no support

reviews.name: Humphrys
reviews.title: Not saving any money!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2024
reviews.review: Sure, these are a little bit cheaper than Pampers premium. However, you end up spending more money on rash cream and cleaning up blowouts. So overall it's better for your kid and your wallet to just buy a better diaper.

reviews.name: Miranda K.
reviews.title: Big Size Difference
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.review: Have been using the pack of diapers from the right. The ones ordered on Amazon are on the left. Now I have two boxes of 156 diapers that are not going to fit because they are built like a size 2 but say size 3

reviews.name: Eulalia Sullivan
reviews.title: Too thin!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2021
reviews.review: I thought these diapers would be great for my son because he was born preemie & Newborn sizes were too big at the time. Despite fitting my son’s body, these diapers were so thin that he kept peeing through them. I would have to change him after an hour of wearing these. I don’t recommend buying these. So happy he gained weight and can fit newborn sizes. Don’t waste your time buying these or you will be changing your baby’s wet clothes frequently.

reviews.name: Jon hernandez
reviews.title: Blowout city
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2024
reviews.review: These were perfect for newborn poops, but size 1 were awful. Fit was off and blowouts seeped through no matter what. Sticking with pampers pure.

reviews.name: Ricky Venable
reviews.title: Useless
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2021
reviews.review: Worst diapers we have used in our journey of two kids in diapers. We normally buy Huggies Snug & Dry, we will definitely be going back to them. We ordered these on accident, thought they would be ok since they were the same brand, ha, no. The only snuggling you'll be doing with these diapers is if you like snuggling wet babies whose diapers are constantly leaking. Complete garbage and sick of having to change my kid's soaking wet clothes after every single nap. Unbelievable. Save your money and don't buy these.

reviews.name: 3LO
reviews.title: Chemical smell when wet!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2021
reviews.review: We’ve used Huggies for 6 years (3 kids under 5). This last box we ordered was disgusting!!! Every time she peed/pooed the diaper would smell like chemicals. They were extra linty too. Not sure if we got a bad batch, or they changed their formula. Because of the awful chemical smell, we checked their ingredients and felt disgusted. They use dioxins (aka toxins), plastic and other things like chlorine. I guess ignorance was bliss. Now we’re going to try other non-toxic diapers. DISGUSTING!! 🤢

reviews.name: Melissa
reviews.title: Chemical Smell
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2020
reviews.review: Highly Disappointed with these diapers! When I opened the package several of the diapers had a chemical smell to it somewhat like a pesticide smell to it. Also not only did it smell heavily of chemicals but several of the diapers had a big hard crusty yellow stain on it (see picture). To top it off our daughter ended up with a bad diaper rash which she never has had in the 6.5months she's been born. Very upset and disappointed with the quality of diapers we got from Huggies. Be very careful!

reviews.name: Asamoah Sarpong
reviews.title: Nah. This ain’t right!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
reviews.review: These are NOT the same diapers that I get from Walmart! My baby had the WORSE rash that I’ve ever seen in my life. I thought she had eczema. Then one day when I was changing her I smelled a strong marker like odor. I came to check out the reviews and so many people were saying the same thing. I had a small box of size two from Walmart that lasted 2 weeks and I didn’t have this problem at all. I switched diapers and that terrible rash is gone completely.

reviews.name: M. L. Harris
reviews.title: Terrible sand paper like squares on the front
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2017
reviews.review: We just switched from size 2 to 3 and I hate the ones we received. As soon as I opened them I saw purple squares on these that were not on the size 2 that I had. The squares are really rough and feel like sandpaper. I decided to try them and just make sure the squares were covered by the side tabs. We have been using them for 4 days now and this morning when I went to change my daughter one of her legs was raw from rubbing against the purple square during the night. I don't know who thought it would be a good idea to add this to the diaper but I will no longer be purchasing these.

reviews.name: Alexandria Kuehn
reviews.title: Buyer Beware
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2022
reviews.review: DO NOT BUY!!! When I opened the package of diapers there was a strong scent of chemicals! I wish I had read reviews before purchasing. I just thought I was getting actual Huggies. However, the lining in the diaper as well as the print on the diaper are not the same as Huggies you buy from the store. I was refunded my money. I found it odd they didn’t want the product back. They must know how bad they are.

reviews.name: TheMushroomMan
reviews.title: Frequently leak through
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2018
reviews.review:
Overall these diapers do the job. However, urine tends to leak through when our 4 week old son urinates while on his side. This seems to happen about once a day, so not thrilled with the quality in that respect. We are only using these to bridge the gap until we start reusable diapers, but if I planned to use long term I would find a different brand.

Update: this most recent box we ordered is leaking out about 4 to 5 times a day. I don't know if it is a defective box or what, but definitely will not be buying this brand again. Changing to one star.

reviews.name: Shirin Bauerlein
reviews.title: Manufacturing defect
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
reviews.review: Usually love these diapers but this box seems to have a manufacturing defect. The back waistband pocket isn’t closed so lots of leaks

reviews.name: lvp
reviews.title: Never again.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2019
reviews.review:
I just had my baby a week ago and we ordered Huggies.. last night I gave my baby a bath and went to get a fresh diaper out of the pack, and there was a MAGGOT on it!!! Cant say enough how freaked out I was. I've been using diapers out of thah pack.. if theres one there are more.
Needless to say we threw the whole box of 220 huggies into the garbage and went to the store to buy Pampers.

So apparently maggots and huggies go hand in hand often.

I'm scarred for life! :/

reviews.name: Jessica Davis
reviews.title: Ok
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2024
reviews.review: I Prefer parents choice or pampers because there is no leaking and no rash, with this brand my kid got a rash

reviews.name: Jason Steed
reviews.title: Great diapers, poor product ordering policy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2020
reviews.review:
Great diapers for my newborn twins. Unfortunately Amazon has a policy only allowing four purchases of this item per month. This is unfortunate because Twins go through more than that in about a week. It took four very helpful customer service reps to be able to tell me this, and while I appreciate their information, none of it provided a solution to my issue of needing diapers. Would give these a 5-star if I could order more.

Amazon, if you can fix this limit, please let me know.

reviews.name: Tamara
reviews.title: Not best quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2023
reviews.review: I order size 1 and 2 and they were fine. Unfortunately soze 3 wasn’t great. Almost for each diaper the material was coming off and I had to wipe it off from my son. They refunded me one box and now I'll try the Amazon Brand we’ll see.

reviews.name: Maxine L.
reviews.title: DONT ORDER
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2022
reviews.review:
I thought I was crazy when my daughter started to get a rash that looked like a chemical burn, it dawned on me that I started using these diapers when it started.. after reading the reviews, I’m 100% positive these diapers have her a rash!! She’s used huggies since she was born but this is the first time I had to order THESE off amazon!! I’m PISSED. DONT ORDER THESE
*amazon immediately refunded me for them*

reviews.name: Makayla Mclaney
reviews.title: Bad diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2023
reviews.review: I didn’t open the diapers for 6 months, got them on sale while pregnant, but the line is blue on all of them and they smell spoiled. The box didn’t have any damage to it. Unsure of what happened but complete waste of money and past my return window!

reviews.name: Daniel Otero
reviews.title: broken diapers. Maybe a bad batch ?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2024
reviews.review:
Beware of broken, unsafe products to use with your baby.

reviews.name: Hayk
reviews.title: I was very satisfied with the quality and the price
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2015
reviews.review:
I refuse to use low quality products for my child.

After the my first purchase I have subscribed Amazon monthly subscription for Huggies diapers. I was very satisfied with the quality and the price, considering how much you safe with Amazon.

But unfortunately it all changed when I received Huggies Little Snugglers Diapers, Size 3. My child started to have random rashes which initially I did not think would be because of these diapers, as I never had issues with smaller sizes. Not sure if it is because of going to cheaper materials with bigger numbers, or something else. Interestingly enough the rash was gone when changing to other brands.

It is a pity that I have to look for another brand to replace Huggies and cancel my subscription, but my child's health is priority as for any other parent.

reviews.name: kleeann
reviews.title: You get what you pay for
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2016
reviews.review: Beware if you normally buy Huggies Little Snugglers diapers... These are different. I called Huggies to inquire. They are not fake, however they are an older design from prior to December 2015. Theses diapers (compared with newer Huggies Little Snugglers size one) are slightly larger, with circular tabs. The front of the diaper is rectangular (without the contoured shape around the leg, or the side tabs at the front of the hips). The non-contoured shape causes them to leak around the legs! In the newer design, elastic was added at the back, and the legs are more contoured with smaller rectangular tabs. This is the reason Amazon is able to offer them at such a highly discounted price. They are an outdated design! :/

reviews.name: Jennifer Brokmeier
reviews.title: Not as expeced
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2023
reviews.review: I bought these and sent these to my son's house for my new grandson. It was a great deal because it was supposed to come with the diapers and the 12 pack of wipes. Well the "wipes" didn't get delivered and when tracking said that part of my order got cancelled. Not such a great deal...very disappointed.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
reviews.review: I got two boxes of these and my 4 month old got the worst rash of his life. We could not figure out what was causing this and then we switched to Pampers Pure to see if it cleared up and it did. We then went back to try the Huggies again once rash was completely gone and bam! Huge rash again after 5 diapers!!! I will never buy these again! I can’t even return the unopened box.

products.product_name: Huggies Size 5 Diapers, Little Movers Baby Diapers, Size 5 (27+ lbs), 120 Count (2 Packs of 60)

reviews.name: Erin C.
reviews.title: Worth the extra $$
reviews.review:
Let me start by explaining how expert I am in reviewing diapers. I have 8 kids. I've had at least 1 kid in diapers almost constantly for the last almost 20 years. I have used a large number of different brands.

Huggies are worth the extra pennies per diaper because they work so much better. They absorb better, they prevent leaks better, and with infants in particular, they prevent blowouts up the back so much better. The tabs are stronger, and stick really well.

I've used the "value" brands and had things like the tabs tear off as I'm trying to fasten it on a wiggler. I've had them leak, I've had them come loose. It's worth the extra money up front to get the diapers that do a better job.

reviews.name: MyWifeIsMyLife
reviews.title: Favorite diapers EVER!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2024
reviews.review: I seriously won’t use any other diaper brand. We haven’t had any blowout's as long as I don’t let him roam around after he pooped which is a no brainer and I can usually smell right away if he pooped, but unlike pampers, Huggies doesn’t smell at all! My son and I cosleep and when he has to wear pampers at one point as a temporary thing until we purchased more Huggies, I almost puked the smell of pee after one pee is almost unbearable. The size is perfect it fits him so well that him being a very active 11 month old I never have to readjust or anything. The quality is amazing, super super soft and holds a lot of pee to the point I don’t need to buy Huggies overnights! These work just as well overnight! They are super thick and hug his waist great! There isn’t another diaper I’ve found that has this much elasticity around the waist and coverage. Diapers are expensive nowadays but this price is great for the quality and quantity! I love the designs as well he looks super cute with the Disney charachters!

reviews.name: Michelle John
reviews.title: I’ve tried LUVS, and PAMPERS AND THIS IS THE BEST
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.review:
Product: Huggies, Little Movers Baby Diapers

I have been using Huggies Little Movers Baby Diapers for my little one, and I have to say, they are fantastic. Here's why I highly recommend them:

First and foremost, the fit of these diapers is exceptional. They have a contoured shape and stretchy sides that ensure a snug and comfortable fit for my baby. The diapers stay in place even during active play, which is a great feature for little ones who are always on the move. I haven't experienced any leaks or blowouts while using these diapers, which gives me peace of mind.

The absorbency of the Huggies Little Movers diapers is impressive. They are designed to quickly absorb wetness and lock it away, keeping my baby's skin dry and preventing any discomfort. Even after several hours of wear, the diapers remain dry on the inside, which is essential for my baby's comfort and overall health.

I also appreciate the quality of the materials used in these diapers. They feel soft and gentle against my baby's sensitive skin, reducing the risk of irritation or rashes. The diapers are also hypoallergenic and free from any harmful chemicals, which is a priority for me as a parent.

The Huggies Little Movers diapers have a convenient wetness indicator, which changes color when it's time for a diaper change. This feature is incredibly helpful, especially for new parents who may be unsure when to change their baby's diaper. It eliminates the guesswork and ensures that I can provide the best care for my little one.

In terms of availability and pricing, Huggies Little Movers diapers are widely available in most stores and online retailers. They are competitively priced, offering excellent value for the quality and performance they provide.

Overall, I highly recommend Huggies Little Movers Baby Diapers to parents looking for a reliable and high-quality diaper option. They offer a great fit, excellent absorbency, and are gentle on a baby's delicate skin. With these diapers, I feel confident that my baby is comfortable and protected throughout the day.

reviews.name: Mona
reviews.title: The best diaper I have used
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2023
reviews.review:
Being a mom to a 6-month-old baby has been an amazing journey, and one product that has truly made a significant difference in my daily life is Huggies diapers. Let me share with you my detailed review of these diapers that have quickly become a staple in our household.

I have tried and use many diapers before I came to the conclusion that I will not go back to any of those again.

From the moment I started using Huggies diapers, I was impressed by their exceptional quality. The first thing that caught my attention was their softness. The gentle material used in these diapers feels incredibly comfortable against my baby's sensitive skin, preventing any irritation or redness. I've noticed that my baby seems happier and more at ease when wearing these diapers, which is a huge relief for any parent.

Absorbency is a top priority for any diaper, and Huggies has exceeded my expectations in this regard. Whether it's during daytime play or through the night, these diapers have consistently kept my baby dry. The advanced absorbent technology effectively locks away moisture, ensuring that my little one stays comfortable and rash-free. This level of dryness has undoubtedly contributed to longer, uninterrupted sleep for both my baby and myself.

The fit of Huggies diapers is another aspect that I truly appreciate. The snug yet flexible design ensures a secure fit that moves with my baby, preventing any leaks or accidents. The stretchy waistband and secure fasteners allow for easy adjustments, making diaper changes quick and hassle-free. As a busy mom, this feature has been a game-changer during those on-the-go moments.

One thing I can't overlook is the adorable designs on these diapers. Huggies offers a wide range of charming prints that add a touch of fun to diaper changes. It might seem like a small detail, but these cute designs have a way of making even the messiest moments a bit more enjoyable.

As a mom who values both quality and affordability, Huggies diapers strike the perfect balance. While these diapers are undoubtedly a premium choice, the peace of mind they provide in terms of comfort, absorbency, and leak protection is well worth the investment.

reviews.name: A. Moore
reviews.title: I mean they're Huggies!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2024
reviews.review:
1. My children have allergic reactions to all other disposable diapers.
2. Huggies diapers are the only brand that's been dependable and reliable all these years (18).
3. The little movers have an additional leg flap length to catch blow outs; granted some times even Huggies can't catch them all, but on those rare occasions it caught the mass and kept my kiddos dry.
4. The resealable side tapes have never ripped off like other brands either (on those occasions I had to use other brands during emergencies).
5. The wetness indicator for me is amazing especially when we're close to potty training or newborn age.
6. I prefer buying through Amazon for convenience and the amounts of each pack they offer.
Lastly, all in all after trying so many disposable brands from the expensive honests to those that pamper... in emergencies now, if I don't have Huggies, it's cloth diapers. I'm not settling for less.
*no this isn't a paid review, when you are behind a brand you trust the education and differences show*

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Huggies Size 7 are perfect for our 9 year old autistic daughter
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
reviews.review:
Finally able to get my hands on Huggies Little Movers Size 7. Previously used Pampers Baby Dry and Pampers Cruisers for my 9 year old daughter that has autism.

She isn't non-verbal but Potty Training has been like war, the past 2 times we tried. So I've continued with a combination of Pampers Cruisers Size 7 and Pampers Baby Dry Size 7, until now. The Huggies size 7 don't have air channels like the Pampers do, but I've found the huggies to be bigger/taller, better fitting, far more absorbant, smell less than the pampers (when dry and when wet), be more comfortable than the pampers (based on my 9yo daughter no longer having meltdowns over diaper changes or when she goes to the toilet in her diaper.

She is able to wee/urinate in her diaper 4 to 5 times, before her Huggies will be full, and needs a change. No issues with going poo in her Huggies either, no blow-outs, no leaks, no tab breaks.

Though one time, while I was changing her, she successfully managed to get one of her Huggies Little Movers Size 7 on her mommy's bottom, a testament to how big Size 7 Huggies diapers are I guess....

The thicker and longer wetness indicator is great and she doesn't leak overnight, with a fresh or dry diaper on before she falls asleep. She usually goes through 1 diaper a night but it can sometimes be 2 diapers a night. During the day, it's sometimes 1 but usually 2 diapers per day.

The Huggies size 7 also accommodates our daughters diaper alarm/humidity monitor, no problems (on the outside of her diaper, in between her legs, where girls begin urinating)

reviews.name: Catina
reviews.title: GREAT FOR ON-THE-GO TODDLERS, NOT FOR OVERNIGHT
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2024
reviews.review: These Huggies size 8 diapers fit well for my 3-year-old and have prevented any diaper rashes. The diapers are great at keeping in leakage, even when she's running around. They do look thin, so I wouldn't recommend them for overnight use. The curved and stretchy fit helps eliminate gaps at the legs and waist, making them perfect for active toddlers. The waistband and double grip strips provide a secure, flexible fit, and the fast-absorbing DryTouch liner keeps her skin dry. Overall, these diapers offer great protection during the day.

reviews.name: LAQUETTA WILKERSON
reviews.title: Good
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2024
reviews.review: Good

reviews.name: Megan Boomershine
reviews.title: Great diaper for no leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2021
reviews.review:
This is a great day time diaper for active babies. I compared this to pampers little cruisers, both in size 5, and while I like them both, this is a superior diaper. For some reason, the bulk pack of little cruisers in size 5 only doesn't have an indicator line, so strike 1 there. Huggies are definitely smaller and are more fitted. My baby has chunky thighs and when I tried huggies before they left red marks on her, but that doesn't seem to be the case now, many months later.

I do have a few problems with huggies, like they aren't as soft as pampers swaddlers (which is what I use at night), they don't wick away urine as nicely, and they are a bit annoying to put on. The diaper flaps in the front always fold in and stick on itself, so I have to pry it apart while my active baby squirms to get up. And the diaper is narrow at the bottom and I find you need to be careful with that and make sure the seals are where they should be. But those are minor quirks and the diaper works great. I have yet to experience a blowout or leak with these.

I think huggies would be better fitted for skinnier babies, but right now these are my baby's best day time diaper, which is a shame because huggies doesn't have a rewards program (unlike pampers, which I'd much rather use, but swaddlers don't cut it for day use without blowouts and I don't like cruisers due to lack of indicator line).

reviews.name: Moonglow ColorKid
reviews.title: Baby Diapers Size 3, 156 Ct, Huggies Little Movers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2021
reviews.review:
Probably great if your main issue is blowouts or leak protection as these diapers did contain a few blowouts while we gave them a shot. We also experienced no leaks, no leg gapping, and the diapers reliably hold even sudden big pees or poops without any running.

Unfortunately my baby's skin is super sensitive and the leakproof design means these diapers just don't breathe well enough, so she broke out in a mega rash every time we tried them. She's sensitive to the degree that only two brands of organic bamboo diapers have worked for us completely so far, so we are always the anomaly. It's unfortunate because these are great diapers that my sister in law raves about, but they just aren't going to work for us. They do fit great, are very soft, and have a wide size range so you'll get a good amount of time out of this size, but despite being really adjustable we didn't have any issues with ride up or loose fit.

I'm happy with Huggies quality-wise but they really aren't for hypersensitive skin kiddos in my experience. Hopefully one of my kids will have normal skin someday and I'll get to use these because they're sooo affordable! For now, I do recommend these but mostly to parents who don't seem to have the same severe sensitive skin issues we do.

reviews.name: Brian Partridge
reviews.title: I prefer Costco diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2022
reviews.review: I prefer Costco diapers. Is May 5 a little bit better, but I found that I need to change diapers more regularly including in the middle of the night to avoid supersaturation. I am guilty of buying these diapers when I didn’t quite understand the code. Little movers, Snugglers, swaddlers, Advanced plus. It is all confusing to me. I just wanna table that tells me what to expect from each.

reviews.name: Mrs. M
reviews.title: Run a Little Smaller Than Some, Not as Soft as Other Brands.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2021
reviews.review: I'm kind of a diaper geek. I love trying out different brands in search of "The perfect diaper." While these do work well, they're not my all time favorite. They run a little smaller than other Huggies and Pampers, and they are nowhere near being as soft as Pampers Swaddlers or Huggies Special Delivery. They do stay put really well for babies that are on the move due to the almost elastic like waistband, but that's not a big enough deal for me to choose these over Pampers... Especially since as of when I'm writing this they're the exact same price per diaper. I appreciate that they have the wetness indicator and the the Lion King graphics are super cute. These diapers arrived in 6 individual packs of 26 diapers each. While these diapers do the job they're meant to do, if I had to pick between these and Pampers Swaddlers at the exact same price, I'd have to go with the Pampers since they're just that little bit extra when it comes to softness, moisture wicking, and extra room.

reviews.name: Miguel
reviews.title: Son antialérgico
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2023
reviews.review: Le dan alergia a mi nieta

reviews.name: Ashley
reviews.title: Second best Huggies diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2021
reviews.review:
With 5 months old twins, I’ve gone through a LOT of diapers and I’ve tried them all. I prefer Huggies to all other brands, over Kirkland and Pampers as well. I will say that my favorite Huggies diapers are actually their newest “Special Delivery” brand for softness and snugness factors, but these are a close second place. Some key features of this product are:
Eliminates leaks for up to 12 hours (verified!)
Liner Absorbs wetness on contact
Wetness Indicator turns from yellow to blue when wet
Fragrance free, lotion free, paraben free
Free of elemental chlorine & natural rubber latex
These are great daytime diapers but as mentioned, I prefer nighttime Huggies or Special Delivery Huggies for overnight purposes. Enjoy!!

reviews.name: C. Teleki
reviews.title: Not the Softest but Great Fit
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2021
reviews.review:
There are other softer diapers out there. Anything bamboo is silky soft so if you’re after that Huggies is not your brand. They’re also not compostable or all natural or any of that. But they do work. They’re the workhorse of the diaper industry! The fit is great (which one can’t say of all the natural diapers), the absorbency is top notch, the price is reasonable, and my kids have never gotten a rash or red marks from them.
Pampers are softer with stretchier tabs, but their baby powder scent is not something I enjoy. So I stick with the Huggies!

reviews.name: Marcia
reviews.title: Standard fare, but great to have options
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2021
reviews.review: Important to have options available for larger children and reluctant potty trainers. These are pretty standard - they do a great job holding wet overnight or during busy play. They don't shift or tear easily, making them work well for busy kids. The four on softness is because there are much softer diapers on the market, not because of any particular issue -- these are standard diaper softness fare, nothing gritty or rough. There is some stretch, but not a lot. Once stretched, the tabs don't tear, but I wouldn't want to try to keep them on a kid much bigger than mine - and she's not close to the max weight.

reviews.name: MrsSunday
reviews.title: great flex and fit
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2021
reviews.review: What I love about buggies that you don't get with other diapers is that cinched/flex and stretch in the waist. It can stretch to fit a wider waist or sit and cinch on a smaller waist. It has a dang "blow out pocket" to trap the dreaded blow out. Does a great job of hugging the body without cutting into the skin. So much stretch and flex from this diaper. Love the blow out pocket love the stretch.

reviews.name: J1976
reviews.title: Nice but could be a little softer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2021
reviews.review:

The wetness indicator is a plus. The elastic can be a little rough and leaves red marks after a while.

reviews.name: DesertDweller
reviews.title: Fragrance Free Diapers, Great for Preventing Blowouts
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2021
reviews.review:
The flap on the back of these diapers does a good job preventing blowouts, a common issue with other diapers. These are unscented, also a plus. The fit is good and diapers are flexible. Good absorbency, perfectly fine for overnight use.

One issue we had with these was that when removing the dirty diapers, some diaper material sticks to skin. This seems to be an issue with the material used in these specific diapers, as we have never had this problem with other diapers.

reviews.name: Anthony Pantliano
reviews.title: Great diapers.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2021
reviews.review:
These Huggies diapers are soft and absorbent, but not overly thick. They have stretchy sides and strong tabs. The tabs can be reapplied without losing stickiness.

We are using the diapers exclusively at night on our mostly potty trained son. During the day he wears underwear. These diapers fit him well and stay in place throughout the night. In the morning when he has wet his diaper the Huggies have not leaked or caused our son any skin irritation.

The Lion King designs are cute and the diapers have a wetness indicator.

All in all... great diapers.

reviews.title: Did they start making these differently?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2023
reviews.review:
So with my first child, these were the only diapers I would buy, they were the ONLY ones my kid couldn’t pee or poop out of. Never got anymore poop stains or wet beds after I switched to these. I swore by these. So with my second kid, when people bought diapers, I requested these.

Now on my second child, either they make these different than they did 6 years ago or my second child is a monster. My child leaks through these all the time. I go through these packs of diapers sooo quickly and thank goodness for water proof mattress covers because the amount of times the bed got wet is crazy.

These are one of the more expensive diapers so I switched to cheaper ones now since these don’t work well for us.

It’s not as wide and often her butt cheek comes out even though its is meant for movers (she isnsuper active). So then that cause issues when she poops, it comes out the sides. Please fix this quality change!! As far as holding pee, it’s still top notch. The overnight huggies are the best!

reviews.name: Dr. Stanley
reviews.title: theyre ok
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2021
reviews.review:
I'll start by saying that I have 6 children. 5 of them are 4 years and under. At one point, a year ago, I had 5 kids in diapers at the same time (two of mine are special needs and in diapers longer than is typical). So when it comes to diapers I am pretty sure ive tried them all including reusable cloth diapers.
I'm cool with Huggies. They aren't the best of the best but they're a step up from generic. Generic diapers are fine if you must (and I do) - you just have to be more vigilant about changing the baby's because generics hold less and leak quicker than name brands.
I can't see a price at the time of this review, so I can't say whether these are a good value. I use 7's on my chunky boy who is 65 pounds with a badonk that makes most diapers look like g strings on his thighs. Hes older, with a bigger bladder, so while pull ups do fit him better they seem more geared towards holding light leaks from potty training kids, not full on emptying the entire bladder. Diapers are better for that. Unless I want to use the night time diapers, which I don't because they rock but they're sooooo pricey when you have to use them during the day and not just at night. Anyways, back to these. These Huggies hold big bladders emptying without leaking. The 7's aren't as big as I'd hoped. They're the same size as the generic size 7's, which can also hold 1 full bladder emptying. I was hoping that because they stretch around the legs that they wouldn't be quite so tight on a chunky toddler, but they are tight. These can work better at night than generic size 7's, and they're cheaper than night time diapers.
So overall, would I reorder these? No. But thats because I try to be frugal when it comes to diapers these days (I've changed thousands upon thousands of throw away diapers). If you've only got 1 or 2 kids in diapers and can afford them then these will work for you fine. If you're on a budget, the generic 7's are the same size and can hold a fair amount of liquid before they leak.
