reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2021
reviews.review: I’m not sure what changed other than switching to the lion king, but something more was changed with the quality! These diapers are HORRIBLE NOW!! Not only do they leak, my son has pieces of the diaper stuck to him every time I change him. It’s like fuzees that literally come off the diaper. She is 2 and we never had an issue until this new box and it happens to be the first box we’ve bought with the new characters on it.

As it’s been a while since I used huggies. Anywho, the exterior feel weird and thin, and the interior also subpar. Honestly. I threw these on my 5 month so I can’t say in terms how they hold up “actively moving”, but they do hold ( but keep in mind he’s actually in size 2 diapers- so this may change when he enters size 3). So even though my review is tentative for now- will update. Based on looks I really dislike and think they are subpar.
I will say though the main thing I do like is the character pattern and the double velcro to help keep diaper in place.

I’ve been using Huggies brand since we were released from the hospital with a newborn 13 months ago ... we’ve had practically zero issues the entire time (the poop flap at the rear of the Little Snugglers is brilliant!) my little girl is a crawling freak so and I was growing tired of the baggy saggy thing going down with these diapers - enter Little Movers! the old version seemed more sleek, had good leak protection, cute mickey designs. no poop flap but she’s on solids and we have fewer blowouts anyway. Huggies fan!

fast forward to the most recent purchase of “new” Little Movers. the design has changed (ok fine), there’s a poop flap (upgrade!), but now the absorbent beads are slipping out when the diaper is even a little wet (what?!) this means these little gel beads - of unknown toxicity - are floating around and into not one but two baby orifices! ick.

nope nope nope. Huggies, don’t mess with a good thing. I was a happy and standing customer, but this update is not a good one!

reviews.name: Cynthia Mabon
reviews.title: Not satisfied
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2024
reviews.review: Did not like the price cheaper at Sam’s club cancel all orders of little movers by Huggies from Amazon June ,July, August, September. And beyond

reviews.name: JENNIFER G MENDEZ
reviews.title: Side itches
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2021
reviews.review: I love HUGGIES and have been using them since my baby girl was a newborn but lately she had been complaining a bit and I could not figure out why. It wasn't until I came on and read the reviews and saw how many negative comments that it "clicked". My daughter had been trying communicate to me about the itchiness. She would lift up her shirt and point to either the left or right side of her waist and make sad face. I thought she was just playing, so after I inspected her sides I would kiss her tummy and she would walk away and then she would come and do it again. I stopped buying Huggies, sad cause I really liked them and started buying Pampers Cruisers. She has not complained one bit and I am very happy. BUT other than that HUGGIES has also been my go-to brand.

reviews.name: Fe
reviews.title: Little movers should have better construction in crotch area
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2023
reviews.review: So with a name like this I believe the only thing they did was ad velcro to the snap area to hold it on. But they should really put some focus into the crotch area because when my son moves around a lot the middle splits and it comes apart at the seams. That stuff is near impossible to get off skin. He is 2 and very active. Wasn't even full full wet. Ugh..

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: They serve its purpose but not as good as I thought
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2021
reviews.review: So I only bought huggies because my other go to brand is really expensive on Amazon lately. They do absorb but I’ve been having leaking issues at the top lately. I’ve had about 3-4 leaks since I bought these not even a week ago. I haven’t had any leaks with other brands since my son was a new born. My son is 10 months now so pretty active. I change his diaper pretty often also so the leaks are not from not changing often. Another thing I don’t like is the crunchiness of the diapers. Why are they so crunchy?! Other than those two issues they are a fine alternative although I won’t be buying again.

reviews.name: Travis Thornley
reviews.title: We love this brand of diapers, however we expect these on time! Amazon prime?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2022
reviews.review: We love this brand of diapers, however we expect these on time! Our baby ran out of diapers the day of the delivery date and it's been past 2 days since then. We are very busy parents and ate displeased with our "Amazon prime delivery!" Isn't this the treason we pay extra? We need these like.. 2 days ago and a discount! -very unhappy parents!

reviews.name: Steven Thompson
reviews.title: HORRIBLE
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2023
reviews.review: My 7-month-old literally leaks straight through these and he definitely can't wear these overnight. We typically use Pampers, but I thought I'd try these. The first thing I noticed was how thin they were compared to Pampers. He literally leaks right through after exactly 3 hours of wear. Never again.

reviews.name: Sandra
reviews.title: Poor quality for the price
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2022
reviews.review:
They are extremely expensive for the quality. The tabs on the ones I got keep breaking. They will still stick but fall off almost constantly. No one in our area has his size diapers so I cant even return them for a replacement because we wouldn't have anything to put on him in the meantime.

Save your money and buy Pampers.

reviews.name: Rachel
reviews.title: New Design is Horrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2021
reviews.review: I recently got the new Lion King variety and they are horrible. They are thinner and scratchier and left sores on my toddler’s upper thighs. The absorbency doesn’t seem like it’s any different though. I’ve been buying these since she was a newborn so two years and I’m so disappointed in these! I’m really hoping I’ll still be able to buy the old variety in stores, I don’t want to have to find a new diaper brand at this point since we will be potty training in the near future.

reviews.name: Valerie Moreno
reviews.title: Quality has gone down
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2021
reviews.review: I'm not sure why but the size 7 that I ordered are terrible. I compared them to the size 5 I use for my other baby and there's a huge difference in quality. Size 7 are thinner and less absorbent. To be even more honest, I placed them side by side and there isn't much difference in size, it looks like the size 7 could be the size 5 with less material. Extremely disappointed.

reviews.name: PerkReviews
reviews.title: Fat inferior to Pampers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2022
reviews.review: Grabbed these as backup for a trip we took, they are not very good! The tabs rip a lot. The diaper is narrow when they poop it gets all over their inner thighs and such. Also the diaper tends to shift off to one side leaving exposure for them to pee out of the diaper. Not impressed at all!

reviews.name: Bree G.
reviews.title: Lion king print is horrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2021
reviews.review:
THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE NEW LION KING PRINT.
The leak protection and absorbency hasn't changed. The size has changed, dramatically.
My daughter is in a 3, in the Mickey print. We tried the lion king print and they have to be at least a size smaller. I'm not overly impressed. They seem to be cheaply made the print looks cheap, and the sizing is horrible.

reviews.name: Amber borland
reviews.title: They are ok....
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2021
reviews.review: Great absobancy but every time I take the diaper off the "fibers" I guess you can call them or the fuzzy stuff is stuck to my son's genitals and creases between his legs and groin. It's wrapping even around his penis sometimes. This isn't small balls of fuzz. It's long strands that tangle and wrap. I will not buy these again.

reviews.name: Jenn Paliscak
reviews.title: Not the same Huggies you buy at the store
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2023
reviews.review: These Huggies as not the same as the brand you would buy in store. They leave fibers behind on your baby

reviews.name: Emily sewell

reviews.review: The leak protection is awful. My daughter typically wakes up dry. Now if she doesn’t get to the potty quick enough with this on. First thing in the morning, it will leak. The material gets clumpy like cheap diapers. My daughter is very sensitive to diapers and has always used Huggies or Pampers. These specific diapers give her a rash.

reviews.name: CeCe Tyshay
reviews.title: Least Dry or Durable of the Huggies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2021

They were the least durable and the baby was able to pull the thin part of the waist area apart way too easily.

I didn't realize that I have subscribed the wrong style I wanted till found baby rashes. I thought I subscribed little snuggle size 3 . We have no problem with little snuggle. But this little mover style make my baby red rash.
Can't return. So be aware of it

reviews.name: Marlea Y Foster
reviews.title: Crappy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2023
reviews.review: These are not made like they used to be 6 months ago! They don't even stay fastened nor do they hold much

reviews.name: Ayse New York

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2020
reviews.review: My first Baby I have tried 20 different diapers brand including Huggies, Pempers, Honest, Amazon brand, Babyganic, Seventh Generation, HelloBello and more. My honest opinion BUY BUY BABY BRAND DIAPERS IS THE BEST AND VERY REASONABLE PRICES 🙏🏻🙏🏻🙏🏻 I wish Size 6 comes bigger boxes 📦 Thank you

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.title: inner absorbent material feels a bit hard in places, like it has been fused together
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2021
reviews.review: These are generally a great product, but the last two times we bought them (from Amazon.com Services LLC) they arrived slightly damaged. The inner absorbent material feels a bit hard in places, like it has been fused together. They seem much more prone to leaks than they should be.

reviews.name: Alexa Waters
reviews.title: Huggies, please stop changing!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2022
reviews.review: Hate how thin and scratchy the new design feels and now less diapers for the same price! Honestly this is the last box of Huggies I’m buying. Hello Bello is much softer and more affordable.

reviews.name: Julie

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2022
reviews.review: I had to change my son so many times with these diapers! I had to wake up multiple times throughout the night to change him so he wouldn't leak all over his pajamas and the bed. They fit well but don't hold liquid well. At all.

reviews.name: R. Beckman
reviews.title: Chafing
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2021
reviews.review: After a few days, my little one developed a rash from the purple tabs. This isn't a matter of improper sizing--it fits fine. But the material that is used on the purple tabs is abrasive and if it touches the skin at all, it chafes.

reviews.name: Vanessa Lofstedt

reviews.review: My 8 month old had so many leaks with these diapers! They just aren't as absorbent as the competitor's diapers and feel so cheap. The tabs ripped on three diapers and we are only halfway through the pack.

reviews.name: chollyred

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2021
reviews.review: A single diaper at night and everything would be soaked in the morning. Tried double diapers and still no good. Often, the absorbent material would blow out of the diapers completely covering the baby; an awful mess!

reviews.name: frank Shortt

reviews.name: Krista Goldman

reviews.review: These diapers are not as expected they weren't the little movers I usually get. But for ppl who are used to little snuglers this is a little thicker

reviews.name: Allie

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2021
reviews.review: The image shows the hundred acre woods print but it showed up as lion king I could have just ordered the lion king ones if I wanted and they would have got here faster

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Low quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2024
reviews.review: They Didn't use good material. After using couple of hours the scales come out. Not sure if the employee was swinging gum. Look at the sticky thing in a brand new diaper. 🙄

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Terrible quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2022
reviews.review: Even though I sized up to a 4 for my long and thin 18 lb 9 month old, these Little Movers, along with a Huggies Overnight I had her in the night before, left rows of red, horizontal lines on her back and hips. It was so bad I could feel the ridges of the lines as I ran my hand over them. Even though these don’t leak and absorb ok, the materials and what they are capable of doing to a baby’s tender skin is just unacceptable, especially considering these are a top brand name and not exactly cheap. Cheaply made, perhaps. Going back to Pampers happily! Oh and all Huggies seem to be replicas of each other now; if you compare, the Little Snugglers are the same as Little Movers, just different designs and titles. Buyer beware.

reviews.name: Alguillory
reviews.title: Loved Huggies but considering a switch.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2023
reviews.review: We have been using Huggies since my baby was born. We recently started using size 3 diapers the little movers and I noticed immediately how thin they were. lately it seems like the diapers can’t hold anything. When you get her up in the morning to change her diaper, her diaper is soaked completely and her clothes are wet, I don’t know if we just grabbed the wrong type of Huggies or if they just get thinner as they get bigger but I’m not happy. I know that sometimes blowouts and accidents happen but this seems to be a frequent every day thing. I feel like I’m changing her diaper way more frequently than I was before because she can’t stand to have a wet diaper on and these don’t absorb that well I’m going to try the size 3 little Snugglers to see if it makes a difference.

reviews.name: Amazon Hoarder
reviews.title: These size 7 are Smaller than Kirkland Size 6
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2022
reviews.review: Very annoyed at Huggies. They claim to be the best but yet their diapers are smaller than Amazon Brand Mama Bear size 7 they are smaller than Kirkland Size 6. Yes that’s right, Kirkland Size 6 outdoes Huggies Size 7 in size and absorption. See the photos I’ve attached. Kirkland is the bigger size, and you can’t even see the Size 7 Huggies diaper when I place the size 6 Kirkland on top. I’m now buying Kirkland Size 6 because they are 1/3 the cost and better diapers. The Amazon brand is not as wide as Kirkland, which is why I chose Kirkland over them.

reviews.name: Amazon buyer
reviews.title: Leaked almost every night after 2-3 changes.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2022
reviews.review: Leaked almost every night after 2-3 changes.

reviews.name: Ryan B.
reviews.title: Might as well buy size 7
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2023
reviews.review: These diapers aren't as stretchy as the box claims to be. Huggies, make your diapers more stretchy than what you already have. Compete with Luvs and Pampers.

reviews.name: lily
reviews.title: Too thin and not soft enough!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2021
reviews.review: Too thin and not soft enough!

reviews.name: Taran
reviews.title: The quality of these is absolutely terrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2022
reviews.review:
I have been buying huggies for my son (8 months) since he was born.
Every other diaper (and yes ive tried them all for the most part) give him diaper rash, don't fit quiet right something. Huggies has always been the best fitting least leaks and blowouts and no rash.
But then i bought these and im not sure if its bad manufacturing or knock off generic branding but these are not the same huggies little movers i bought from amazon in a smaller pack less then a month ago. The design is different and the extra velcro the purple band to help keep diaper in place on hip is basically falling off. they dont stay together like they should. They are thinner and less absorbent over all and the purple part gets wrapped up under the tab from not being attached right and gives my son a horrible rash/redmark on his thigh from it rubbing and chaffing the skin under it. These aren't safe, they are not the huggies you buy in a store or even other sellers on amazon.

reviews.name: Makayla Vincent
reviews.title: Not cool
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2021
reviews.review: Wasn't impressed by these diapers. Tabs tore easily, not much stretch in the legs/waist, didn't stay put well, leading to leaks and diaper blow outs.

reviews.name: Ryan B.
reviews.title: Might as well buy size 7
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2023
reviews.review: Am really pissed and upset that I let my baby wear 70 of this diaper before common sense hit like a diaper should not smell heavily of chemicals. But because of the good name Huggies and I had tried their huggies overnight diaper before with no problems. I had ignored the horrible smell coming from this new pack of diapers when I opened the bag. I would always smell that horrible chemical sent when I picked up my 6 mths old old or blow bubbles on his tummy. But I kept brushing it off. My baby started having a slight wheezing sound on occasion and am like what could possibly make him start wheezing. Then i noticed he started stuffing his nose in the pillow each time i put him down to sleep. I found it strange. So today I decided to sleep next to him and go down to his level to smell what he's smelling. In his sleep he had wiggled his but close to my head and then the chemical smell coming from the diaper almost stiffle me with its obnoxious smell. My poor chunks was inhaling this constantly all this time. Especially as it's summer and I keep him in a onesy with no shorts on. It breaks my heart to know I am spending so much money on a diaper that his causing trouble for my son. I immediately took off that disgusting thing and lett him go bare bottom for now. I will go to the store tomorrow and try anothe brand. I will call the company tomorrow as well and let them know

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! Mom of 3-class action suit
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.review:
I’ve been buying either Huggies or Kirkland Sig for over 8 years and have never had an issue, recently purchased these Huggies beginning of Nov because I was out of my Kirkland Sig and needed diapers shipped out quickly. Our 1 year old who never gets diaper rashes broke out in a bright red and awful rash shortly after starting this package. We had been treating it as we would any other diaper rash, we used aquaphor, it didn’t improve, tried desitin, no improvement, maximum strength desitin and still it appeared to only get worse over the following weeks. We took her to her dr earlier this week and she suggested and antifungal, absolutely NO improvement. It has continued to get worse. I finally told my husband I thought it was these diapers, we opened our pack of Kirkland and are putting these in the garbage, we looked into recent reviews on here-all from Nov and many complaining of similar rashes. We googled and there is a class action suit for chemical burns with Huggies diapers.

I’m so disappointed because I’ve used these with good faith for all three of my children whenever they were on sale at Costco or whenever I was in a bind and needed to pick them up at a local store since my Costco is 30+ minutes away. We will not be using these ever again.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Twins constantly have wet onesies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2022
reviews.review:
I'm disappointed for SEVERAL reasons. My reasons are as follows:

RE: Size 4 Little Movers (Lion King design, if it matters)

1. I change my twins' diapers every night before they go to sleep (regardless if they need it or not so they'll have fresh diapers while sleeping)

2. My twins go to sleep between 8:30 pm and 9 pm and wake up every morning between 2:30 am and 2:50 am.

3. I have to CHANGE THEIR CLOTHES 100% of the time because their diapers are completely bursting in the front and have drenched the side and/or front of their onesies.

4. My twins wake up again by 6 am and require AN ADDITIONAL CHANGE OF CLOTHES.

This does not seem right. I did not have this problem with Kirkland brand diapers. I switched because of recommendations because the boys are tumbling and moving around so much during the day. However, this seems like a mistake.

Also, I never received 2 orders of diapers, and now have to wait 3 -5 business days to get my $105 back! Thank God I do not wait until the last minute to buy diapers or I'd be screwed. Amazon has a really bad habit of not fulfilling orders on time anymore. So not cool for essential items.

Guess, this is more of a reason to switch back to Kirkland. I'll have to deal with the heat, because I'm not giving Amazon anymore chances to take my money and not deliver my babies' diapers!

reviews.name: Charis Hair
reviews.title: Fake batch
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2025
reviews.review: By far the worst batch I’ve ever used. This batch is definitely fake! The diapers were not produced properly and so the stuffing comes out loose every single time and makes an entire mess all over the house after it’s been soaked with pee or poo. An absolute waste of money!

reviews.name: Tammy C.
reviews.title: Do not waste your money
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2025
reviews.review: These diapers are absolutely horrible. Do not use these. They leak horribly, and they are leaving marks on my daughter's legs. One spot is almost bleeding and I'm stuck with these useless diapers until I can get my original ones. Don't waste your money

reviews.name: Griselda Rubalcava
reviews.title: Never hated a diaper so much

They’re rough to the touch, ALWAYS causes diaper rashes on my baby and leaves marks around his thighs no matter if I size up. constant leaks as well! I only got them because I decided to give them another try after ending my subscription with parascol due to financial reasons but now I’m really considering going back to that brand. Please if you care about your baby stay away from Huggies.

reviews.name: Jan Marie
reviews.title: Quality is not the same

reviews.review: We have always used Huggies but recently the quality has been lacking. The last two boxes ordered from Amazon have had numerous leaks. I finally decided to trash the remaining diapers, after having almost every single one leak over the past 3 days. I am changing my child every 1-2 hours at most. There is no reason pee or poo should leak through. The Huggie diaper even feels different compared to the batch that we purchased from target. Will not purchase again.

reviews.name: Kristina Shchepina
reviews.title: I think these diapers are harmful to health.

reviews.review: The diapers have a chemical smell that is quite concerning, a poor absorbent strip, and they are not breathable, which causes moisture to accumulate on the skin inside. As a mother of a son, I do not recommend buying them, as they are especially harmful to boys. It’s better to consider something more natural.

reviews.name: Nikki1517
reviews.title: Tears in the inside!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2024
reviews.review: I’ve called and admitted these have something wrong with them as of late. I’ve been completely a Huggies household since my baby’s birth but these styles now a days are lacking in quality. We’ve switched to the Huggies Essentials as of now but yeah, be careful with the diapers and make sure to keep an eye on your baby. The filling is sticky but gel like cotton. It can get everywhere and specifically stick to such baby. Idk. Hope my review helps someone feel less crazy because I’m still looking into all of this considering the rash it left behind. Fortunately she’s healed but I’m still curious to figure out what happened. I’m

reviews.name: J
reviews.title: Not for overnights. Appears to have caused diaper rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2024
reviews.review: These are advertised as overnight diapers, which is just simply not true. My baby peed through these diapers 2 out of the 2 nights I tried them. Which is a rare occurance with our normal diaper brand (I only bought these because they were next day delivery and I was almost out of my normal brand). Also, my baby, who is 13 months now and does have pretty sensitive skin, had never had diaper rash. After using these for 2 days, he had diaper rash so bad he cried. These diapers are cheap garbage.

reviews.name: Ashlyn.Bookreader

reviews.review: So I ordered these a few weeks ago as back ups for when I ran out from my batch. But for some reason this box had many diapers where the side seams were detached, the tapes would break off with just a light tug and because of the seams being bad, my child had a lot of accidents in her pants after 1 use. I love Huggies and are the only ones I’ve ever used but this batch was really bad. Thank you but No!!!

reviews.name: Raina
reviews.title: Used to be my favorite diaper

The only difference that is visible to the eye with these new diapers is the inside of it is now blue. These are the only diapers that I would use and I think I'm gonna have to look for a different brand 😕

reviews.name: Gk
reviews.title: Pee leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2024
reviews.review: Disappointed with this diaper due to frequent leaks despite following size and fit guidelines. I have ordered this brand for the first time and want to give a try but persistent leaks disrupt routines and cause unnecessary mess and discomfort for my baby. The inconsistency is unacceptable, and I cannot recommend this brand to other parents seeking reliable diapers. I have also called the customer care they told me send a photos on email but I didn't get reply back for an email. I have ordered 2 pack of 140 diapers and it's no use for my baby. I told customer care that i will return it and they said it's non returnable and refundable. I do not recommend this brand to anyone and won't use it either.

reviews.name: Morgen Schwarz
reviews.title: Cheaply made.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2024
reviews.review: These aren’t anything like the diapers you get from the store . They definitely don’t feel like regular Huggies diapers . They feel aftermarket & look faded. Not worth the money . Get them from the store & save yourself a refund . The size 4 is from Walmart , size 3 is from Amazon. There’s definitely a color difference. They lack the quality I’m used to.

reviews.name: Krystal Hart
reviews.title: Meh....
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2023
reviews.review: We absolutely hate these diapers. It's like a brand name Target diaper. It gets so saggy ,soggy and unsightly. My son can't go more than an hour without being changed in this diaper and he's 14 months. This will be fine IF you change your child 10 times a day . These diapers are not sustainable for busy kids who may can't get changed SO often. I regret having these on subscribe and save BEFORE testing g them out. Total waste of money for us so we'll just give these away since the money is already gone. Pampers works MUCH better for little boys especially IMO.. I dont even want his twin sister in these diapers. Doesn't work for MY family.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Worst diapers ever
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2022
reviews.review: I have never written a negative review before, mostly because I suspect they could potentially cause more harm than good. BUT (1) I don't think my bad review could harm Huggies, and (2) it is my moral duty to warn fellow parents. THESE ARE THE WORST DIAPERS WE'VE EVER USED. And it isn't as if we have high standards (we usually use Sam's or Costco brand). Thesr diapers are extremely hard to put on and take a million adjustments to get them to lay right, they don't stay on well, they're a difficult fit. . . They just kind of want to clump-up and fold over on themselves all the time. And my baby can tell the difference, too -- he's always taking them off. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.

reviews.name: SABRINA BLAKE
reviews.title: SEVERE DIAPER RASH
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.review: We have been using these diapers for 1 month we started noticing the gel beads/absorbent beads coming out of the diaper each time we changed our child. We change her diaper every hour so this should not be happening. She now has a sever diaper rash that has gotten worse over the last month. We have been buying this diaper brand for the last year but the 100 year Disney edition seems to have the issues. This seems intentional. We will never use these again and will be throwing out the rest of them and switching brands.

reviews.name: NotSteve82
reviews.title: They run SMALL
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2021
reviews.review: I’m so disappointed with these diapers. My daughter wears Kirkland diapers in a size 6. They don’t leak, they are great quality and the only diapers that will still fit my large 2 year old. In a pinch, I ordered these Huggies in a size 7 when I couldn’t get to Costco and the Kirkland size 6 was sold out online. I figured that the Huggies size 7 would at least be as big as Kirkland size 6…think again! They are so small! They leak often and even when they don’t leak, the pee just saturates through the diaper and dampens her pants without actually leaking through the sides. Maybe because they are so small, they can’t hold much liquid at all. These do not work for us and run very small. They fail at their basic purpose; to keep my baby’s butt dry.

reviews.name: Ocie H.
reviews.title: Worst Diapers Ever!!!! DO NOT BUY!!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2024
reviews.review: These particular Luvs diaper are not good. I purchased these diaper to use on my 18mo grandson, and have to continuously change him every hour, because the diapers are thin, and do not absorb his urine outputs, or hold bowel movements at all. I have to keep changing his clothes thru out the day, because his clothes are wet, are stained from his bowel movements. These are terrible diapers and a waste of money.

reviews.name: Sus
reviews.title: Blisters
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.review: After a couple days of using these my baby has broken out into blisters all over his hips. I have always used pampers but not always the pampers pure so I didn’t think it could be the Huggies causing it. However, after continuing to break out into a rash and blisters I looked it up and there was as a lawsuit against Huggies just recently for causing blisters on some children due to unregulated levels of ahcovel. Very disappointed and only went through a couple days worth of diapers.

reviews.name: Bee
reviews.title: I'm not sure why I keep buying these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2023
reviews.review: I don't know what has changed lately but these diapers are horrible now. They're basically on the same level is pull ups. They hold absolutely nothing. My son was taking a nap in my bed and woke up with a huge wet spot underneath him. Somehow the pee managed to completely escape the diaper as it was bone dry. It was secured to his body so I don't understand how this continues to happen. And even when the diaper does catch the urine, it soaks right through, leaving the outside of the diaper feeling wet. So tired of this.

reviews.name: B.B
reviews.title: SERIOUS BURN
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2022
reviews.review:
I have been using Huggies since my baby was a newborn. I loved the material and the fact it doesn't have any scent to it.
However as soon as I switched to size 5 my toddler started to have serious chemical burn. It was soooooo bad that couldn't even sit in her bathtub.
At first I thought it was the wipes so I wiped her with warm wet towels instead every time. It did not help at all. I also changed her every 2 hours. It got worse and worse. Finally I changed to another diaper brand. Her skin recovered and there's no more burn.

reviews.name: Horribles siempre acostumbro a comprar los pañales aquí en Amazon pero esta ves esta caja de pañales es terrible un material horrendo malísimo no aguanta nada se le pasa el pis de mi bebé muy rápido decepcionada esta ves de esta compra completamente malísima calidad
reviews.title: Mala calidad
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2024
reviews.review: Malísima calidad esta ves de estos pañales horrible material no duran nada mi bebe mantiene mojado se le pasa muy rápido el pis a la ropa lo tengo que cambiar 4 veces al día de ropa porque el pañal no aguanta ni 3 horas

reviews.name: Crystall P.
reviews.title: THE WORST EVER!!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2024
reviews.review: I am sooooo disappointed that I gave Huggies a try! It is so cheaply made! It kept literally busting open and the silica inside got all over my baby’s private parts. Adding insult to injury, the seams kept ripping with strings hanging out! UNBELIEVABLE!!!!!!!! TOTAL DISAPPOINTMENT!!!!! I wish I could give zero stars instead of having to select one!!!!

reviews.name: Ellie
reviews.title: Be careful and check each diaper before use
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2022
reviews.review:
This is a modal window.

No compatible source was found for this media.
I have purchased these diapers maybe 3 or 4 times. I had zero issues with them for my 6 month old. However, I just opened a box today that was delivered this week. I was about to put a diaper on my baby before I noticed these weird bugs in his diaper. They were on several. The box and bag the diapers came in were completely sealed. I have zero clue how bugs are in and on the actual diapers. Just be careful to check a few times for any bugs. I definitely will not be buying again.

reviews.name: NurseT23
reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2023
reviews.review: Purchased $100 worth and received $20 off. These are terrible and nothing like the ones sold at Walmart or Target. They dropped terribly. Had brown stains on the outside of them. When I try to fasten the diaper closed, the straps rip right off!!! LOLOL. These are the most bizarre diapers ever. They leak. They're causing redness to the skin. I have no idea what is going on here, but I will never purchase diapers and or wipes ever again on here. Never.

reviews.name: Jennifer Sanchez
reviews.title: Stuck with unwanted diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2021
reviews.review:
This is a modal window.

No compatible source was found for this media.
Bought these thinking that I saved money but it’s safe to say that I’m better off spending an extra buck then being stuck with diapers with bad absorbency. These “Huggies” diaper are nothing compared to diapers sold at your local store. The material clunks up all together making the diapers appear full. Not only that but when it’s actually full, you can feel the urine leaking out of it. My son drinks a lot of fluids so this is a waste of money. Now I’m stuck with diapers I don’t want!

reviews.name: Brandon Hamilton
reviews.title: HORRIBLE WILL NEVER BUY AGAIN !!!!!!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2022
reviews.review: These diapers are overly horrible they literally get ono stars whatsoever . My daughter got a chemical burn on her Vagina from these diapers and also she pee once and the diapers expoloding like wow . I changed my baby so much so I know for a fact she doesn’t have a diaper rash nor the diapers should be busting the way they are . PLS DONT BUY THESE I AM HIGHLY PISSED OFF . ONLY GET 1 star because they forced it mfs wouldn’t get a star at all

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Constant leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2023
reviews.review: I don’t get why these are so highly rated. The amount of leaks we’ve had is ridiculous. We’ve tried sizing up, make sure the flaps are all correct, etc. it also claims to be 12 hours protection when my LO barely can sleep through the night and pee leaks through. We’ve had so many diaper explosions, so many clothes and linen destroyed cause of these. Do not recommend at all!

reviews.name: Amirah
reviews.title: The new ones I received are not absorbing. They are leaking after an hour only.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2024
reviews.review: They have decreased their quality and are not consistent at all. The latest ones I bought are leaking after an hour. Not buying again

reviews.name: L
reviews.title: Buyers beware
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2021
reviews.review: We thought all the negative reviews were of people probably exaggerating, but no. Yesterday the diaper had come apart by the seams and the absorbance beads were all over the place. This is so dangerous and scary as a parent! Never ordering this brand again! I seriously hope someone who works for Huggies see this passes this and the other negative reviews along to get this fixed. It's not even about product loyalty or changing to another company, now it's about the safety of the children. Good riddance!

reviews.name: Melissa
reviews.title: Not great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2024
reviews.review: This particular box, the diapers felt different, like less quality material. I usuAlly love this brand. The material is not soft. 2 diapers have ripped easily. They feel wet on the outside after some use. Would not recommend.

reviews.name: Elif Sahin
reviews.title: Not absorbing well!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2023
reviews.review: I always buy diaper from amazon and l was happy with previous purchases however l dont like this little movers huggies, l have to watch my baby while he s doing poop bec. I have to be hurry changing diaper righ away, otherwise it s not absurbed well and going out. Never buy huggies little movers at all.

reviews.name: rodrigo diaz
reviews.title: WHAT A JOKE!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2021
reviews.review: I have a 3 yo and a 5 mo baby, me and my wife used to love this diapers, unfortunately HUGGIES decided to go cheap and save money making them. The material is not the same anymore, it looks more like a piece of paper, they will leak everywhere. Unfortunately I’m going to have to find a new brand, if you want to see your kids wet and change their bedding clothes every single morning, give this one a shot and you won’t regret .

reviews.name: Emily
reviews.title: Worst diaper Experience
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2021
reviews.review: In the week I’ve used these, I’ve had nothing but issues with them. I thought they would be great for my baby who is in the go, unfortunately that wasn’t to be. They leak overnight, peel apart at the tabs, and worst of all they have been scratching my baby’s hips. I have now read several other reviews that had similar issues . I regret not reading more reviews before purchasing. Never had issues with the Snug and Dry from huggies but these are terrible

reviews.name: Unsatisfied Customer
reviews.title: Not worth the price
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.review: When I opened the box the diapers were crunchy. My baby had a fresh one on when she went to bed 8hrs later she has plastic beads coming out of her diaper the line was only half blue. this happened many times.

reviews.name: richard hinson
reviews.title: Loose Fibers Hurt My Child
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2024
reviews.review: Every other change I end up having to pull long, loose fibers out of my child's butt. It's awful and painful. I'm never buying these again.

reviews.name: Rho
reviews.title: Do NOT buy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2023
reviews.review: Do not purchase diapers. They are cheap quality. The inside has a lot of dark specks of something that is a bit rough. Who knows what materials are used to make these diapers. My son has always used Huggies but after two days using these, he’s had a bad rash.

reviews.name: Ben Liberto
reviews.title: Half of the diapers are unusable
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2023
reviews.review: A good amount of these diapers have loose cotton coming out of the top. It’s almost as if the tops were torn up. I would have returned them but I did use the ones that were ok because I was out and really needed them. But I am not satisfied that I paid for half of them to be unusable..

reviews.name: Richard C Johnson
reviews.title: My son broke out in blisters
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2021
reviews.review: We have used Huggies brand since my son was born. When he began walking we switched from Snug and Dry to these. Over the course of 2 days, he developed redness. On the second, he had blisters. We went back to the Huggies Snug and Dry, and it went away immediately. We also use the Huggies Overnite diapers as well without any issue. Not sure what is different, but, I would caution everyone away from them.

reviews.name: Michael Weiner
reviews.title: Leaking!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers might be larger than they say. I'm sticking with pampers

reviews.name: Tia
reviews.title: Diaper Erosion
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2022
reviews.review: I don’t even know what to rate the Huggies Little movers size 3.. we used them about a week if that and my baby’s bottom is Raw and eroded.. she initially didn’t want to sit down and was in so much pain when trying to change her.. every diaper change even if you catch it after one pee she is still soaked.. i would not recommend at all.. I am heartbroken.

reviews.name: Kelly C
reviews.title: Cause a horrible rash, chafing and bruises
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2021
reviews.review: The actual absorbent part of the diaper was hard and stiff. They busted constantly overnight. Leaked through after 2 hours or so it also caused a horrible rash almost like burns. The waist section caused chafing to the point of scabbing and the tabs on the side pinched her groin causing bleeding and bruising. Absolutely horrible diapers. Wouldn't recommend 100% I will be going back to pampers baby dry.

reviews.name: Mr. Hines
reviews.title: Diapers keep ripping
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2024
reviews.review: This is the 6th diaper that has ripped This is the first time I’ve ever had a problem with hubbies diapers not happy.

reviews.name: Krystal
reviews.title: Not good
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
reviews.review: I usually buy these huggies with no issues, however this time I think I got a bad batch. My baby wakes up wet since I bought my last set. It doesn't hold a lot, gets heavy really fast and It interrupts my baby's sleep.

reviews.name: Nayla
reviews.title: Worse pamper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2024
reviews.review: The worse pampers ever. It gives rashes. My son never has gotten diaper rash even when I don’t use the cream and these pampers gave him a diaper rash

reviews.name: Placeholder

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.review: I have used Huggies diapers for a long time and never have issues. The newest print seems to reek of an ink chemical smell and is just completely unwearable for my little ones. Disappointed!!

reviews.name: Erin A.
reviews.title: No longer a pull-up!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2021
reviews.review: We’ve been buying Little Movers for almost 4 years. It was a pull-up style, which is what we wanted. It’s changed and is now a diaper that is a little stretchy and can sort of (barely) pull up and down like a pull-up. Discovered it after opening the package, so now we’re stuck with a large package of very large diapers, which we have no need for.

reviews.name: kingKREEP
reviews.title: Leaky useless diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2021
reviews.review: We are regular users of another brand of diapers but unfortunately ran out and these were the only ones we could get in short order. These are the worst, most unreliable diapers we have ever used. They leak like a sieve, are terrible at absorbing and are just plan cheap. The tabs rip off them all the time rendering the diapers useless even before you use them. Never buying them ever again.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Smell
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.review: Guys. I purchased from this seller till my son now grew to size 5. I ordered it and when it arrived I immediately smelled it and smells chemically. Don’t order size 5 at lest

reviews.name: miguel

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2024
reviews.review: Didn’t like that one of the diapers had a sowing needle inside as I was going to change my son. Luckily I caught it on time before putting it on him.

reviews.name: Debbie

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2021
reviews.review: My 18 month old hasn't had a blow out since 6 months old and we've had 2 so far since the new version got released (Lion king print) - we also now have an issue with the diapers reeking of urine as soon as they get a little wet when we've never had that issue with odor before. save your money and don't buy these.

reviews.name: Walter

I change my son very very often. Wish i Had a picture to show the difference but im at work now i will come back with a Picture. I wish i could get my money back!

reviews.review: We usually buy the Little Snugglers, but they were sold out. When changing my son’s diaper, it was full of white beads that were all over him. We never had this issue with the Little Snugglers!

reviews.name: Amazon Customer

reviews.name: Amazon Customer

reviews.name: Amazon Customer

reviews.name: Demi

reviews.name: Austin
reviews.title: Like others, do not buy the Lion King version

reviews.review: We have bought these for years, but the last several boxes have been terrible. They rip easily, the lining disintegrates with liquid and leak, and it gives our daughter a bad diaper rash.

reviews.name: Ghost

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2022
reviews.review: The pampers are great I always order or buy these so the Pampers aren’t a problem but I have never gotten my recent package so I don’t know what kind of delivery people yah hiring, stealing pampers is crazy

reviews.name: tammie sanford
reviews.title: Diaper challenges
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2022
reviews.review: I do like the Huggies overnights and other products, but the Little Movers seep! The fit was right, and they didn’t leak out the legs or top, the diapers themselves seeped. I was disappointed in the quality.

reviews.name: Nina M.
reviews.title: ER VISIT ALLERGIC REACTION
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2021
reviews.review: Would give 0 stars if I could. I have always been a fan of Huggies (from Costco). But these lion king prints are not the same. They caused my baby an allergic reaction. We had to go to the ER and have been struggling with the aftermath for three days now.

reviews.name: Austin Freeman
reviews.title: If the Lion king characters are on the diapers the quality is far inferior
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2021
reviews.review: If the Lion king characters are on the diapers the quality is far inferior to the norma "little movers" diapers. the material is thinner, doesn't hold as much poo and pee, they feel papery, and are just poorer quality.

products.product_name: Huggies Size 6 Overnites Baby Diapers: Overnight Diapers, Size 6 (35+ lbs), 84 Ct (2 Packs of 42)

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Reliable Overnight Protection, But Not a Game-Changer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2025
reviews.review:
I’ve used Huggies Overnight Diapers for a while, and they perform as expected. They provide solid overnight protection, preventing leaks and keeping my little one dry until morning. The fit is snug without being too tight, and the absorbency is good enough to last through long stretches of sleep.

That said, I wouldn’t say these are dramatically better than regular daytime diapers with an extra absorbent layer. If your child is a heavy wetter, you might still experience some dampness by morning. Compared to Pampers Overnights, I don’t notice a huge difference in performance, but I do appreciate that Huggies has a softer feel.

Overall, a reliable choice for overnight use, but not necessarily a must-have if your child doesn’t struggle with leaks

reviews.name: T
reviews.title: Best overnight diapers for my kiddo
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2025
reviews.review:
We have a specials needs child, so she's needed diapers a little longer than other kids. We love the Huggies overnights, and normally just have them set to auto order.

The fit is great (she's roughly 38 inches tall and 32 pounds and size 6 fits great for her) and she's comfortable wearing them. They've never caused any rash or irritation. These aren't scented, which is what we prefer. The tabs have a strong hold.

The price is fair for the quantity and quality. It's rare we have leaks, as these hold a lot of urine. The longer ruffles these have around the thighs are awesome. If it's your first kid- make sure the ruffles are flared out lol. We have tried other brands that have good absorbency, but without those ruffles, they leak much easier than Huggies. Especially if your kid moves around a lot in their sleep!

reviews.name: Maddison Palacios
reviews.title: No leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2025
reviews.review: My child is 20 pounds and the size 3 fits perfect and no overnight leaks. They are soft like all other buggies and great for boys.

reviews.name: L. Craft
reviews.title: A Lifesaver for Dry Nights and Stomach Bug Emergencies!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2025
reviews.review:
Huggies Overnites Nighttime Diapers are an absolute game-changer for nighttime dryness! They are fantastic at keeping the bedding and clothes dry through the night, which means fewer laundry emergencies and better sleep for everyone.

These diapers can hold much more pee than a regular diaper, making them perfect for heavy wetters. On top of that, they were a lifesaver when my son had a stomach virus. I used these instead of regular diapers, and they did an amazing job at preventing blowouts during those tough days. The extra absorbency and secure fit provided peace of mind when we needed it most.

The fit is snug and secure without being uncomfortable, and the material feels soft and gentle on the skin. If you’re tired of nighttime leaks or need a reliable diaper for unexpected challenges, these are worth every penny. Highly recommend for dry nights and more!

reviews.name: E
reviews.title: Excellent Performance
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2025
reviews.review:
Huggies/Kirklands have been the best performing daytime diapers for my baby, and the overnight Huggies have been excellent for containing all of the overnight pee, with no leaks. These are working out better than the overnight Pampers (occasional leaks, baby can remove tabs, scented).

I have read a lot about sizing up for night. Haven’t had to do that, but I have always had to put him in the next size up once he gets within a few pounds of the lower limit (example: he’s in size 6 but he’s not quite 31lbs) because he is so delightfully chubby.

Highly recommend (especially if Huggies is your preferred brand/fit of diaper) for leak free nights. Have seen great deals on Amazon around the holidays.

reviews.title: Keeps the pee out of my bed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2024
reviews.review:

Huggies "Night Night Diapers" consistently delivers. If our toddler doesn't have one on when he falls asleep, I will risk waking him up to get one on, again, better to have to get him to sleep again than wake up in a puddle of pee. And wash queen size sheets. And comforter.

They cost a bit more than regular diapers, but doing laundry costs money too so I think it's a great investment in my sleep, my sheets and my sanity.

They have the extra hold strip on the side like little movers which helps keep everything in place especially if your baby moves a lot during the night. I would just recommend going up a size if you have a chunky baby. My son is a size 4 normally, but we started having small leaks with the size 4 overnights after using them for a month so I got him size 5s and they work perfectly + give him a little extra room.

reviews.name: Randi
reviews.title: These Diapers Saved My Sanity!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2024
reviews.review:
As a dad of three rambunctious little monsters, I've seen my fair share of diaper disasters. Enter Huggies Overnites: the unsung hero of parenthood.

First off, let's talk about the competition. Pampers? More like Dampers. Those things leak like a sieve and the tabs snap off faster than my patience after a sleepless night. But Huggies? Huggies are the Fort Knox of diapers.

Picture this: 2 AM, baby number three wakes up with that "I just peed a lake" face. I brace myself for the usual wet bed cleanup, but lo and behold, the Huggies Overnites have held the line! No leaks, no soaked PJs, no middle-of-the-night laundry sessions. It's like a miracle wrapped around my kid's bum.

And the tabs! These babies are sturdy. Unlike those flimsy Pampers tabs that seem to be made of tissue paper, Huggies tabs stay put, no matter how much wiggling and squirming my little one does. I could probably trust these tabs to hold up a suspension bridge.

So, if you're a fellow dad tired of diaper letdowns, do yourself a favor and switch to Huggies. Your sleep, sanity, and laundry pile will thank you.

reviews.name: Carmen
reviews.title: BEST ⭐️ NightTime Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2024
reviews.review: These are my favorite NightTime diapers for my baby!!! They keep moisture away, NO DIAPER RASH and last the whole night (up to 12 hours). Right now my baby goes down for bed around 8pm/9pm and will sleep until 7am/8am with the same Huggies NightTime Diaper. I have had no issues with leakage or blowouts with these at all. My baby started getting a rash with DayTime Diapers and I switched to ONLY these diapers temporarily while I found a better DayTime Diaper for my baby. Wish I found out about these sooner. Recommend these for babies that tend to sleep through the night like mine does: it is WORTH THE MONEY !!

Additional pluses are that they don't irritate his skin and that there are regularly coupons here on Amazon to make them more affordable.

reviews.title: Great extended wear diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024
reviews.review:
While haven't had too much trouble with the regular huggie diapers I find these to be very helpful. My baby got a terrible rash after introducing her to a new food and I really had to prioritize keeping her dry.
She is a great sleeper and will sleep up to 10-12 hours over night. I have been in the habit of interrupting her sleep to feed and change her.
With these they are noticeably more absorbent and softer too. If your baby is sleeping for longer stretches even if their diaper isn't leaking I think these would be much more comfortable for baby.
I think these would also be great for travel where you may be going longer than usual between changes or if they will be spending more time than usual in their carseat or stroller. The sides are softer and more flexible than the regular huggies.
I will definitely be purchasing again.

reviews.name: Jason Novitski
reviews.title: World of difference
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
reviews.review: I recently switched to Huggies Overnight Diapers, and they have made a world of difference for us! These diapers provide incredible absorbency, keeping my baby dry and comfortable throughout the entire night. The snug fit and secure tabs ensure that there are no leaks, even with a full night’s sleep. The soft, breathable material is gentle on my baby’s skin, preventing any irritation or rashes. I also love the adorable designs, which add a fun touch to bedtime. Huggies Overnight Diapers have truly helped us achieve more restful nights, and I highly recommend them to any parent seeking reliable and high-quality overnight protection for their little one.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer

reviews.name: Ruth

reviews.name: Angelina Mincer
reviews.title: No More Leaks!! Read to the end!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.review: These nighttime diapers are a game changer! We only use huggies diapers, and were sizing up for nighttime, but if the boys slept a little later in the morning, they would wake up soaked. We started using these night time diapers, and are still sizing up, and we never have leaks even with sleeping on their tummy. Make sure you are sizing up at least one size, sometimes even two sizes if they are on the cusp of needing daytimes upsized soon (ex. my boys are almost out of size 3s during the day and will be moving to 4s soon, and right now we are in size 5 at night). Even if they feel a little big, and the straps are overlapping, it is okay, just make sure the part around their legs are pulled snug!! Side note, its amazing these last all night because my one boy wakes up to feed throughout the night a few times, and my other two are fed with a feeding tube all night long. So these diapers are HEAVY in the morning!!

reviews.name: Hailey

reviews.name: Julie M.
reviews.title: Saves me from endless laundry
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2023
reviews.review: When my son started sleeping through the night, he also start flipping to his stomach to sleep and that's been his favorite sleep position ever since. When this started, we were having issues with him leaking out the front of his day time diapers and wetting the sheets of the crib pretty regularly, meaning extra laundry for mom! As a working mom, I don't have time to wash his sheets every day and didn't want to deal with buying extra sheets and changing them every day either, so we gave these a try! We haven't had a diaper leak at night since. Luck or coincidence? Maybe... but I'm thinking the diapers play a role. I hate spending the money on them since they are twice the price of our usual day time diapers, but that's the price for convenience and ease I guess. Overall, I'm just happy not to have leaks all the time anymore. If you're experiencing similar issues, I'd recommend at least trying them out! I also use these when we go on longer trips in the car to try and prevent any leaks or blow outs in the car seat.

So, I bought the size 3 overnight diapers (they don’t make them any smaller) and just fastened them as tight as they could comfortably go and hoped for the best. She hasn’t leaked out of one or peed through these yet. I do put diaper rash cream/spray on her before she goes to sleep for the night. But, we’ve had no issues. She is about to transition into size 3 regular diapers and I will continue using these in this size and the next size up when she needs them.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2024
reviews.review:
I have tried every over night diaper, I have sized up, I have had my son wear a diaper and then a pull-up on top.
This is the best over night diaper I have found for both my kids- and I love boosting it for a great 12 hour night coverage with the Dimples insert.
These are sturdy diapers, I have only had two adhesive tabs break on over 600+ diapers.

reviews.name: Austin Horka
reviews.title: Keeps Most Liquid In
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2024
reviews.review: These are the best overnight diapers I've found for my son. Super absorbent and soft compared to other brands. Will buy again!

reviews.name: Pat & Cindy
reviews.title: Give these a try. Great diaper. I order from the upper east coast area.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2021
reviews.review: Not sure why there are so many complaints about this diaper from this seller. I've never had one of these diapers break open. The only time I had leaks has been if I forget to pull out the seam at each leg hole (run your finger around each leg of any brand of diaper to pull the ruffles out, to help keep the seal), if I didn't make it right against the waist and my child sleeps on her stomach or when I needed to size up. If you make sure to have the appropriate larger size for your child, pull the leg seams out, and make it right to the waist, then these diapers should hold all night. My child normally sleeps 10-12 hours. They hold it all. Great diaper. No complaints. I have been ordering these from the seller for about a year now. I just sized up to a 4 last month. I had been using sizes 3. Before that my child used to wake so often that I didn't need overnight diapers until she got to a 3 and started sleeping all night long. Try these diapers from this seller and I don't think you will be disappointed. The diapers I have received in size 3 still had the blue insert in the front of the diaper. The size 4 diapers are now all white on the inside with a mickey mouse design still on the outside. They still work even without the blue inner liner.

reviews.name: Jordan
reviews.title: Works great!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2024
reviews.review: My baby can't handle many diaper brands, so buggies are always a great way to go for us. She sleeps 10-12 hours a night and I was up once or twice to change her, always upsetting both our sleep schedules. Finally got these and GAME CHANGER! No more leaks, no more waking up, no diaper rash. So happy!

reviews.name: Liz B
reviews.title: Mostly great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2023
reviews.review: We have used these for a few months now. My daughter is just over 2. Twice recently, we’ve had some serious leaks that have led to a load of laundry and stripped crib. The commonality in situation was that she seems to have wet the diaper while laying on her back. I think this is the case because she’s wet up her back. The padding of the diaper is much more central and I think as the urine tries to pool towards the back the diaper just can’t keep up where the padding is less. I’m glad our girl doesn’t wake up mad from the leak, but I feel bad finding her clothes cold and wet from the diaper not keeping up with her. I’m diligent to make sure all ruffles and ridges are where they need to be. If you have a toddler (girl) who tends to sleep on her back, you may have some leakage issues. We will keep trying but probably buy a different option when these are depleted.

reviews.name: Ariel Wright
reviews.title: Very absorbing
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2024
reviews.review: My baby drinks a lot and pees a lot at night 2 diapers will get her through the night.. for reference without these diapers she goes through 4 diapers

reviews.name: Jules
reviews.title: Personally...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2024
reviews.review: I prefer the pampers overnights. They seem to hold more, in comparison to these. You get fewer of these for a higher price, too. So, that's not my favorite. They did the job, don't get me wrong. I've just seen lesser diapers do just as good for not quite as expensive...

reviews.name: Sierra N. Granger
reviews.title: Smaller than expected
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2024
reviews.review: I have had no blowouts but they are smaller than I was expecting. They also seem to get soggy and full feeling faster than the Honest brand I was previously using

reviews.name: White Trash
reviews.title: Good not great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.review: If they pee a lot at night these will leak. If they pee normal amount you will be fine. We found out that we needed to limit grandson on liquid intake or he would leak. Overall I recommend

reviews.name: DH
reviews.title: Best overnight absorbency, but they smell horrific
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2021
reviews.review: These are the best overnight diapers we've used. The only time it might leak is when my daughter sleeps on her stomach the whole night (~12hrs) and the front of the diaper has to hold all of it. Even then, leakage is minimal (my daughter is 10 months old) and it only gets on her pjs a bit-- never her sheets. I took away a star, though, because as some other reviewers have mentioned, these diapers make your baby smell like a truck stop bathroom. We've used multiple boxes now, so it's not just a fluke. We used to just use her Pampers Swaddlers when she slept, and after 12 hours they never smelled anywhere near as bad (they just didn't hold as much). I can usually already start to smell it if my daughter pees in these once. The smell just smacks us in the face sometimes when we walk into her room in the morning, and sometimes we'll swear she has pooped, but it is just pee. They also make the diaper pail smell so much worse. It never seems to bother her, though, and she is comfortable in them. So as long as they keep me from changing the sheets, I'll keep using them, but if any representatives from Huggies are reading this-- some better deodorizers would go a long way.

reviews.name: Mike C
reviews.title: Great absorbent diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2024

Couple of hours, or one less wake during the night, try these.

Pass or purchase? :PURCHASE

reviews.review: Not sure what it is but both my kids have the knack to pee through regular diapers at night so often I thought I was going to keel over from all the extra laundry. reviews.name: PJ
reviews.title: Good night
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2023
reviews.review: These are generally pretty good diapers. But ever since Huggies switched to the Lion King pattern some time ago, my family has experienced an unexpected problem: Part of the decorative pattern on the outside of the diaper is a brown blob. Unless you are looking at it up close, any picture of Pumbaa on the butt, or next to the leg opening, looks very much like a diaper that has leaked. Even knowing about this, I *still* occasionally have a moment of panic, seeing this pattern through light-colored clothing, thinking that we are dealing with a blowout.

reviews.name: Mom of 3 Boys and a Lil Lass
reviews.title: Overall, a good night-time diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2016
reviews.review: After picking up a soaking wet baby each and every morning for days, I decided we needed something more than our usual daytime diaper (which we love and still use for daytime use) at night. As wonderful as our daytime diaper was during the day, it just couldn't handle the volume of output during the night, even when I changed the baby right before putting her down, again when I went to bed, and sometimes again mid-way through the wee-hours. I tried Huggies Overnites first because we'd had success with the Huggies Pull-ups Nighttime for my older son. I started with the same size overnight diaper that my daughter wore during the day (3). They still leaked, not as much as the other diaper, but enough. From there, I went up one size, and now she is a much drier, happier sleeper. It seems she needed the little bit of extra height at the torso/waist to keep the diapers from leaking out, something she doesn't need during the day. We have had a couple of mornings where she's woken up soaked, and covered in the gel-like substance that is inside the diaper because the diaper exploded, but that has been the exception rather than the rule. Most mornings, her diaper is wet, but her clothes and sheets are not - and that's a HUGE improvement.

reviews.name: GardenMindfully
reviews.title: Works 95% of the time

reviews.review: My 3 year old wears a size 6 currently and these are a MUST for overnights. She's a stomach sleeper and a heavy wetter. These are the only overnight diapers we've found that work. About 5% of the time we get leaks, but we use medical bed pads under her at night and those catch the rest. I recommend them.

*updated review* SIZE UP if your baby is a tummy sleeper that sleeps 10-12 hours straight per night. We were angry at how the diapers would not last through the night and we would have a soaking baby in the morning. I thought to size up to give it a second chance and it changed everything. So at about almost 18 lbs, he's now wearing a size 4 and no more leakage. Again, if you have a tummy sleeper... size up. It will hold. *******

AWFUL. I reallh wish I had read these reviews before purchace. My son is 17.8 lbs, we use size 3... and every morning he's soaked at the front. We are washing clothes more frequently because of this. To make it worse, I think just the regular Huggies size 3 diaper holds better through the night! Don't waste your money, please. Really don't.

reviews.name: sd2012
reviews.title: and they are all pretty consistent. DS is 14
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2014
reviews.review: When they work, they work for us for 13+ hours, and they are HEAVY with urine. My son is a heavy wetter. We cloth diaper mostly, and he can wet through a "normal" cloth diaper in an hour if he has had free access to water. Please note, though, that the sizing is WAY off compared to daytime diapers. We have used 3 different brands in daytime diapers, and they are all pretty consistent. DS is 14.5 months old, 24/25 lbs, and fairly tall and skinny (18 month pants don't stay up as well as I'd like to because the waist isn't tight enough), and has had bad leaks out the top the last 4 mornings in a row. This morning the whole front of his shirt was soaked (in a size 4). This has only happened when it's time to size up for us. The weight recommendations for size 4's is 22-37 lbs. I believe when we switched from size 3 to 4, he was still in 3's for daytime for 2+months. We'll switch to 5's tonight and see what happens...

For an older toddler (over 2 years old) this can be a real headache if the kid decides they like one design, and dislike the other.

My toddler kicks and screams whenever I try putting on the diaper with the playing Pooh design, which can easily add 10 minutes to bedtime. It would be so much easier if Huggies just made all the diapers look the same.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2024
reviews.review: Desde que nacio mi bebé eh usado 3 marcas distintas, Luvs que es PESIMO, Pamper y Parent’s Choice, hoy quise probar la marca Huggies y aunque aun no uso el producto ya veo un gran margen de diferencia entre Huggies y Pampers, jamas eh tenido una fuja con Pampers, Pamper sin duda es mas acolchado que Huggies, no me gusta el echo de que los broches de Huggies vienen tan pequeños porque mi hijo es gordo y el broche se le desprende fácilmente, Huggies me parece un pañal pequeño, en cambio Pamper viene muy amplia y los broches vienen anchos para un mejor agarre del pañal, en cuestión al precio es casi el mismo, si van a comprar pañales overnites para tu bebé sin duda es preferible que compres Pamper

reviews.name: MK
reviews.title: Overnites, Not My Cup of Tea
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2023
reviews.review:
While I'm a fan of Huggies and have relied on their products for my baby, I have to admit that the Huggies Overnites Nighttime Baby Diapers didn't quite meet my expectations.

Balloon Effect (2/5): The biggest issue I had with these diapers is the way they puff up like a balloon overnight. It's a bit unsettling, and while I understand that they're designed for overnight use, the sheer expansion left me and my babya little uncomfortable.

No Noticeable Difference (3/5): What's more, despite the extra puffiness, I honestly didn't notice a significant difference in terms of absorbency compared to regular Huggies. I was hoping for better overnight leakage protection, but it seemed somewhat on par with the standard diapers.

Prefer Regular Huggies (4/5): Considering these factors, I found myself leaning towards regular Huggies. They do a commendable job in terms of absorbency without the overinflated feel, making them a more comfortable option for my baby.

In Conclusion (3/5): While the Huggies Overnites Nighttime Baby Diapers might work well for some, they weren't the right fit for me and my baby. The ballooning effect was a bit too much for my comfort, and the added absorbency didn't seem substantial enough to justify it. I'll stick with regular Huggies, which have consistently served us better.

reviews.review:

I’m not sure how diaper companies can make claims relating to length of time considering it would depend on how much fluid there is within said time… right?

Anyway.. has more padding so will absorb more than a regular diaper. Was worth a shot for me considering it may cut out one out of many diaper changes, which can really wake my little one up and make it hard to get him back to sleep.

They leaked every single night and I ended up using them during the day for a couple of hours only. They are well-made and as cute as the other Huggies but I would not recommend them for overnight.

reviews.name: M.C.
reviews.title: Not very absorbent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2024
reviews.review: We used these for about a week. Our 1 1/2 year old was waking up wet so we are continuing his normal diapers at night which are working perfectly.

reviews.name: Ed
reviews.title: Decent for the price
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2024
reviews.review: Not a bad product for the price

reviews.name: BryAnna S
reviews.title: Not for tummy sleepers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2024
reviews.review: Been trying to use these for my 9 month old twins since 6 months. Worked great for a while but once my one twin became a strict tummy sleeper, he now leaks through every night. My suggestion is buy a sposie pad to put in there as well.

reviews.name: Ryck
reviews.title: Not that great.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2024
reviews.review: They work better than the daily diapers overnight, but not a whole lot better to make it worth the extra money.

reviews.name: AmazonReviewer
reviews.title: Fine sometimes; several instances of filling coming out and leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
reviews.review: We started using Huggies overnights about a year ago, after thinking they better than the Bullseye-Store brand. We've had semi-regular leaks with Huggies too, so they aren't perfect (but my kid sometimes does drink a lot in the evenings, so we might be asking a lot of the diapers). This last box I got is worse, though, and most nights we've had the absorbent gel leaking through the top of the diapers. These have bigger Winnie the Pooh characters (like 3" vs. 1"), which I would have thought was just a superficial style change but the gel leaks have me wondering if there are other changes too. Might as well buy the cheaper store overnights based on our hit-or-miss experience!

reviews.name: Andrew
reviews.title: I would think expensive Huggies would be better made, but overnight diaper options are limited.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2023
reviews.review: I like that these absorb more than regular day time, but they still require a doubler, for which I use a sposies insert. I think Pampers holds more but we can't use them because of the fragrance. What I find most frustrating about these diapers is about once a week, the seam at the belly comes undone and I have diaper all over my baby and all in his sleeper. This is particularly gross as it is a 12 hour diaper, from overnight, and often has poo in it. Never the less, we use these diaper every night, and sometimes for naps

reviews.name: Allison
reviews.title: Beware!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.review: We are a Huggies family, but the overnights are the EXACT same as the Huggies movers. The padding is no different, and my son leaked overnight in the morning. He was soaked two mornings in a row. We like Rascal and Friends diapers instead for overnight.

reviews.name: Shae
reviews.title: Same quality as regular Huggies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2024
reviews.review: I didn’t notice any substantial differences in these vs the regular Huggies diapers.

reviews.name: Ksenia
reviews.title: Quality has changed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2023
reviews.review:
Since I purchased these last time , I've noticed that these overnights have decreased in the amount for the price as well as the quality. They feel much thinner! Honestly, I don't know what to expect anymore, but kids should not be an area where corners are cut!!
They kept my little girl dry overnight 60%...the other 40% she leaked onto the pj's. It is what it is what can I expect parents will still buy them for their kids regardless. I'll just be careful. Not to purchase too these here

reviews.name: Christine Hollander
reviews.title: Still leaks at night
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2024
reviews.review: These were no better than the Kirkland brand diapers my baby uses during the day. They still require a change between 3-5am.

reviews.name: Natalia Álvarez
reviews.title: It leaked every single night.
