reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2024
reviews.review: That's it. Get any other brand. Now, their regular diapers I love, but for some reason their overnights are crap.

reviews.name: review
reviews.title: Not sure
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2023
reviews.review: I'm not sure if it was due to my bf putting the diaper on wrong or this diaper in general but I noticed leaks through the night with these. I just noticed accidents in the middle of the night compared to Kirkland ones actually leaking through when you push the front They are slightly thicker than regular Huggies so I thought they'd work better but it's hard for me to tell. I used during the day fine but some nights were not leak free

reviews.name: Christina Coats
reviews.title: Still soaks through
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.review: I was excited to try these after the reviews, but unfortunately my kiddo still soaks through at night and we have to use two diapers anyway. I’d rather save the money and just use two regular diapers.

reviews.name: Daniel Hsu
reviews.title: Leaking 3-4 nights a week
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2023
reviews.review: This overnight diaper is very absorbent - it's always super heavy every morning when I change my kid's diaper. However, almost every other day I had to change the whole bedsheet too because some of the pee leaked out of the diaper. Not sure if I'm putting on the diapers wrong or something, but it did not work well with my kid.

reviews.name: Amanda B. Grueneberg
reviews.title: Good, but not Great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.review: Toddler still waking up wet in morning when using these diapers. They do hold more than the regular diapers, but not significantly. Don't plan on getting these again.

reviews.name: KellyH
reviews.title: Meh, just okay
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2023
reviews.review: I know a lot of parents swear by these but I didn’t notice a significant difference between these and a regular diaper. If your baby pees a lot (like mine) and you’re looking for a solution to frequent night wakes, then this probably won’t work for you. But if you’re just looking for a good leak-proof diaper, then this should work. We ended up just using the rest of the pack as regular diapers and we won’t be getting them again.

reviews.name: NDeM
reviews.title: Not as good as Pampers or Honest
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2023
reviews.review: I bought these because they would ship faster than the Pampers Overnights I had previously purchased. They are NOT as good. Baby woke up soaked thru his pajamas on several occasions before I gave up and bought a box of Honest brand overnights. They are a bit more expensive but less bulky, do not leak and keep his skin as dry as can be expected. Huggies = FAIL.

reviews.name: Just Lin
reviews.title: Not as absorbant
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2023
reviews.review: My grandson is a year old and I have been using Huggies overnights almost from the day he was born. I tried another brand first but found Huggies to really keep him dry throughout the night, although we would change him several times throughout the night. But now, as he’s getting older even with changing him during the night, the pamper leaks. Not to happy about that.

reviews.name: Ashley
reviews.title: absorbency
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2023
reviews.review: im not sure if these are any different than the huggies overnight diapers at meijer, but my daughter could go through 3, 8oz bottles from 8pm - 8am & not leak through from the ones at meijer. with the ones ive ordered through amazon, which are also huggies overnight, she only had a 10oz bottle the last 2 nights from 8pm - 1220am (so 4ish hours) & has leaked through both nights. so frustrating! 🥺😡

reviews.name: DS
reviews.title: Poor customer service.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2015
reviews.review:
Bought these in size 4 because I remembered we really liked these diapers when we used them a few months back.
The diapers go from 22lbs and my baby is 23 lbs. Thought it would be perfect. Well it wasn't quite so. When we used it the first night, it was great but every other night would be a leaky disaster.
I contacted the customer service department and was basically told that there are many different styles for me to purchase and try going a size up in order to find the right fit.
That's a lot of time and money to commit in order to find a diaper in my opinion. Plus a 23 pound baby needs a size 5 diaper? Then the range for size 4 shouldn't start at 22.
I was very surprised to receive such a response because it was of no help and some of the questions written in their email were already things stated in my initial email. I can deduce for myself that this diaper didn't work and a different one is needed. I thought maybe because I had just bought a box of these that they would be a little more understanding of the fact that it was not a good fit.
Kimberly Clark Corp should treat customers better.

reviews.name: Kari Kirfman
reviews.title: Not enough to last through the night
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2022
reviews.review: Our daughter sleeps an incredible 12 hours at night. We aren’t willing to wake her up just to change her diaper. We have tried Huggies overnight diapers in sizes 4 (normal size) - 6. None of these are enough on their own to keep her from soaking her clothes. We add an adult pad to the diaper and poke some holes in the bottom, and that keeps her clothes dry all night.

reviews.name: Brittany Markey
reviews.title: New Version less substantial and leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2023
reviews.review: I swore by these diapers and now have two who use them for overnights. I haven’t had a leak or issue with either child over the last 2 years until the diapers changed design and are noticeably thinner and I have had leaks 3/5 of the first 5 nights and I am so disappointed.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: New/old version?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2019
reviews.review: Since I’ve purchased these before, I assumed I would be getting the same thing. Unfortunately, either I’ve gotten an old version that was still in stock or a new version of this diaper. If this is a new version, Huggies, please I beg of you, go back to the other version. This package I’ve just received has different side straps that are too stretchy with square velcro tabs. The “good” kind have less stretchy sides allowing the diaper the retain better shape eliminating side leakage and the rounder Velcro tabs stick better. Unfortunately, now I’m stuck with an open 68 pack of diapers that are a substandard version of what I had purchased previously and I will have to make due until I can hunt down the better version.

reviews.name: Sarahjane Baxter
reviews.title: Miss Mickey Mouse ones but these work
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2021
reviews.review: I never review but had to . I have been using these for ages in the Mickey Mouse print and they are amazing . I recently ran low and ordered and signed up for a subscription. I got the subscription and the box was Mickey but diapers were Winnie the Pooh . Now the review for Pooh are horrible but I haven’t had any issues with them except the tab are a bit crazy. They do balloon up a bit quicker too . I haven’t had any leaks with both my twins unless it’s user error . If anything I know we are up a size on each twin from there days time .

reviews.name: The Ward Family
reviews.title: Absorbent but gave baby a rash.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2022
reviews.review:
We use Kirkland brand diapers religiously but ran out and needed these last minute. They absorb a ton. However my daughter never had a rash a day in her life until these diapers. They gave her pretty bad bikini rash.

Once we switch back to Kirkland they are now slowly getting better. Not sure what that was about if it was the material or what but we will definitely be sticking with Kirkland.

reviews.name: Chao Li
reviews.title: Not comfortable
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2023
reviews.review: It just looks like normal dipers but called overnight dipers. I can feel wet in the morning when changing it,

reviews.name: Cynthia Hoffman
reviews.title: Overnight huggies changed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2023
reviews.review: The last batch of overnight Huggies did not work well. My baby now wakes up wet. This is unusual, because I always buy this brand and this never happens. I know its the correct size. Did Huggies change their formula and remove a liner? They even look different.

reviews.name: Andy
reviews.title: Not As Absorbant, Disappointing
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2018
reviews.review:
I used a previous version of these before, and they were monsters. Totally amazing. Most absorbant diaper I’d ever seen. Fast forward to today, and my heavy wetter peed straight through this overnight diaper, found herself in a puddle of pee this morning. This was the exact scenario I bought these diapers to avoid. These aren’t absorbant enough.

When I took them out of their packaging I was skeptical since my other Huggies diapers were thicker than these “overnights.” The outside is less breathable and doesn’t leak as easily (when it’s not 110% saturated) as other outsides do because of that, but it isn’t even as absorbant as the diapers I was using before. I don’t plan on buying them again. I had subscribed to these, but had to cancel because these diapers are nothing special. This was a disappointing purchase.

reviews.name: Phil W.
reviews.title: Diaper Falls Apart
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2023
reviews.review: What is going on with Huggies! These are overnight diapers but the little movers daytime diapers work better in my opinion. An overnight diaper should not fall apart constantly.

reviews.name: maryjane
reviews.title: Pretty good!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2022
reviews.review: I did not get this exact box my box only came with 36 dippers I did not get the 42 count but I do love these dippers they absorb though the night and don’t have to worry bout my child’s bed being soaked though the night. Don’t have to constantly wash their favor blanket due to accidents throughout the night.

reviews.name: E Russell
reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2022
reviews.review:
We use Huggies on a daily basis and thought we’d give the overnights a try. Ended up having to do a diaper change in the middle of the night otherwise she leaks.
Just not as good as Honest Co.

reviews.name: The Honest Truth
reviews.title: Not a Fan of Huggies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2023
reviews.review: I am a Pampers lover. Tried these and they are fine they just leak sooner and our kids just need the longer backs from pampers

reviews.name: Poke8212
reviews.title: Don’t be fooled by Night Time in name
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2021
reviews.review: Do not be fooled, this does not protect any better than regular Huggies. I was hoping for better protection at night. My baby still cannot go through the night without waking up wet, especially if she wants a bottle in the night. If I do not change her before a bottle she wakes up soaked. I love Huggies brand, I used them for all three of my girls, it is all I could use for their sensitive skin, they break out with all other brands. I just was hoping for more from the night time version.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Wish it could be better
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2020
reviews.review: Helps with leak protection compared to their other diapers that claims to have "12 hour" protection (baby wears little movers during day). Biggest complaint is that the diaper doesn't fit well. Tight around thighs and not stretchy in the tummy so I have to adjust the tabs a few times because when my baby sits up, the diaper becomes too tight below the tummy. Also, Huggies brand gives my baby a saggy/poopy diaper look. If this could be like the fit of a Pampers Cruisers 360 but leak protection of these diapers, it would be perfect.

reviews.name: Kellie Forziat
reviews.title: Doesn’t have enough absorbency
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2023
reviews.review: Child still wakes up soaked after 6+ hours of sleep. Was very hopeful this would keep him dry all throughout the night (pad is thicker than the regular diaper, but needs more and it all around the diaper).

reviews.name: Brandon Heysham
reviews.title: High rating BUT reaction to diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2022
reviews.review: They do not leak and absorb. It’s why I gave them a higher rating. Unfortunately, whatever they use for this, it breaks my daughter out. So Huggies does what it is suppose to do but if you can buy a tiny pack or find one to try, I’d highly recommend it first.

reviews.name: k3nzi3
reviews.title: What the different?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2023
reviews.review: Can’t tell the difference between the day little movers and these over night… only get them to off set a month of days being used more frequently

reviews.name: Buyer
reviews.title: Probably Not Worth It
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2021
reviews.review: They are good quality as regular diapers. I am honestly not sure if they are more effective at preventing "soak throughs" then regular diapers. My 6 month old baby was still able to pee all over himself in these a few times, but it was maybe slightly less than the regular diapers? We do still use them just in case, but, like I said, they still aren't a guarantee of a not soaked night. I won't be purchasing again unless they were to yeild significant results.

reviews.name: Rachel
reviews.title: Huggies Changed their Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2022
reviews.review: I used to love the Huggies night time diapers, but they changed them and they leak every night he wears them now. And really bad a lot of the times. And we use a size bigger. Changed to the Pampers night time ones and he rarely leak through those and it he does, its very little. I'd recommend the pamper ones instead.

reviews.name: Constitution stands.
reviews.title: Not great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2023
reviews.review:
My one year old grand child is wet and also wears rubber pants.
I cut off liquids an hour before bedtime.

reviews.name: Skyler
reviews.title: Okay
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2022
reviews.review: These work pretty good, my son hasn't leaked through yet. I do feel the hello bello night diapers are a little more absorbent tho.

reviews.name: FayyeinOK
reviews.title: Size up!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2022
reviews.review: In none sleep diapers my baby wears a 3. I was able to put my baby in them but they were definitely snug and they leaked because they were so small. I sized up to a 4 and they never leak and fit much much better!

reviews.name: T. R. F.
reviews.title: not what i was expecting
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2020
reviews.review:
i like the way these diapers absorb vs other diapers, but they definitely aren’t 12 hour protection, more like 4-5 hour protection.
i’m not fond on the closures on these either. they seem to be more harsh on my sons skin and he often wakes up with red marks like the diaper leaves scratches on his skin, even with me leaving the tags looser. the tabs almost feel like they have a plastic coating on them.

reviews.name: Katie
reviews.title: Materials not soft, very stiff
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2018
reviews.review: I normally use Huggies little movers diapers, however they aren’t that ideal for bedtime as they don’t seem to hold as much liquid as the little snugglers diapers she use to wear. I thought I would give these overnight diapers a try since they are marketed as such. I must say, I was a little disappointed when they arrived. I expected them to be soft and comfy but instead they are very stiff. They do hold a lot more liquid than the little movers diapers but I’ll probably switch to little snugglers for night time instead of buying another box of these.

reviews.name: Jocelyn Brannan
reviews.title: Not how they used to be
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2021
reviews.review: I’ve been getting these diapers for my twin boys for over a year and they were awesome. I noticed immediately that the most current box I received was different. Thankfully we use Sposie pads inside so we haven’t had any issues with leaking but I hate the way they fit. They are definitely thinner and not as wide. I hope they go back to the way they used to make them.

reviews.name: Sam
reviews.title: Not great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2022
reviews.review: I typically buy pampers overnights but I wanted to switch it up. These hold up ok, but they leak a little. They’ve also given my daughter a rash which she’s never really had before.

reviews.name: Debbie Clark
reviews.title: They work but not great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2023
reviews.review: They don't absorb that much urine. They also are scratch, the tabs are a pain with the double stick.

reviews.name: Lauren
reviews.title: just okay
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2021
reviews.review: We used to love these overnight diapers, but the last 2 boxes we’ve ordered have been subpar. My son sleeps 11-11.5 hrs. each night and these diapers used to keep him dry, but with the newer boxes they are practically falling apart when I get him up in the morning. I’m wondering if they have changed the way they make them? We’ve switched brands and no more leaks!

reviews.name: Glitchtastic
reviews.title: Size 4 and up need more per box like size 3.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2014
reviews.review:
Here me out:

While I love the overnites, the amount of diapers per box from size 4 and up just doesn't make sense. I do the subscription purchase and when you use one diaper per night (because my toddler sleeps straight through the night) getting them every month is too close and two months is not enough. Just annoying really. Why can't they all be at least 64 for some leeway? I get that they are trying to cram as many in a box as they can, but I'm about to cancel my subscription because the bigger my daughter gets, the more inconvenient my purchase will get unless Amazon does a 6 week subscription.

Maybe it's not fair for me to leave this review here (since it's partially an Amazon issue) but it doesn't really fit in the packaging/shipping reviews. Ya know?

reviews.name: JessicaLee
reviews.title: Good but the material leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2020
reviews.review: I have been using this product for about 6 months. It’s absorbing and soft, capable of overnight use up ton13 hrs. However, recently I noticed that the absorbing material inside the diaper leaks, leaving some clear gel balls on my baby’s diaper area. I check the diaper itself: there’s no opening so I am confused where the things com out. Worried that I will harm my baby, will change to another brand.

reviews.name: Carly
reviews.title: Never had a leak with pampers, second night in these my 20 month old woke up soaking wet 😖
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2022
reviews.review: Will be going back to pampers! I bought these cause they were on sale so I figured I’d give them a go 🤷🏻‍♀️ but my daughter had her first overnight leak EVER since trying these. Pros are they are soft and fit well I guess.

reviews.name: Sj34
reviews.title: Overpriced, and Not the best
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2022
reviews.review: They left my son puffy and wet in the front every morning. They hold a lot of pee, but don’t do a good job of keeping my sons skin dry.

reviews.name: Allie
reviews.title: I don’t see a difference
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2022
reviews.review: I like them, i just don’t see a difference between these the regular huggies. You still are gonna have to change the diaper after the same amount of time you would with regular huggies.

reviews.name: Westcoastmama
reviews.title: ... for these - but the Little Movers actually work better than these nighttime ones
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2017
reviews.review: We use Huggies Little Movers so we had high hopes for these - but the Little Movers actually work better than these nighttime ones!! My 16 month old son leaks through almost every night if I don’t change him in the middle of the night if he wakes up. Working on not giving him as much liquid at night but he loves his milk before he goes to bed!! I’ll use this box but definitely won’t bother to order again. We will just use the same diapers we use for daytime!!

reviews.name: Melanie N
reviews.title: Not sure what went wrong...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2015
reviews.review: I've used this brand of diapers for my 16 month old for the past few months...LOVED the size 3's! There were no issues until he got taller and I figured it was time to move to size 4. From day one we've had leaks with these; what happened? He's in the right size according to their package (he's 25lbs and 33in) but for a week straight he's woken up saturated to the point I've been having to change sheets and give him a bath. Really disappointed because like I said I loved using the size 3's but these have just been a no-go. To Amazon's credit they did issue me a refund so thank you for the great customer service...just wish I knew why these aren't working for us.

reviews.name: cb
reviews.title: Still don’t quite cut it
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2022
reviews.review: These are better than day diapers for sure, but I swear I’m still replacing sheets every other day because the diaper doesn’t absorb enough. Maybe my kid just drinks too much but I was hoping for better.

reviews.name: Panuskar246
reviews.title: A bit disappointed when the product breaks apart
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2020
reviews.review: I purchased the size 4 Huggies overnight diapers for my 11 month old. They were a good value but did not hold together. Several times while fastening the diapers, the tabs broke right off! Then the whole diaper is trash. The price is decent but the quality was nothing to write home about. I will not be purchasing again.

reviews.name: D. Wicks
reviews.title: Definitely not the best
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2023
reviews.review: These diapers filled up and leaked every night. Had better results with Costco brand overnight diapers.

reviews.name: K.D.
reviews.title: Huggies got cheap!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2021
reviews.review: Diaper isn't as thick as it use to be 6 months ago. It's like Huggies cut it in half. The tabs are smaller and the purple grip strip is not only half the size, but now pieces of the diaper gets caught on it unlike before. WHAT'S GOING ON HUGGIES???!

reviews.name: Arysa Lalonde
reviews.title: Don’t leak but performed like her regular diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2022
reviews.review: I got these to help my daughter sleep longer but she woke up the same amount of times with a wet diaper seems like the same as her daytime diapers I didn’t see a difference

reviews.name: chgowersdf
reviews.title: Several diapers had stuffing come out
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2022
reviews.review: These diapers absorb more than regular diapers, however, I’ve had several diapers have crystals or some sort of dust come out of the diaper and onto my baby. I had to bathe him to get it off.

reviews.name: Elsie Zhang
reviews.title: Buying Huggies Diapers is like opening a box of chocolate
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2017
reviews.review: Buying Huggies Diapers is like opening a box of chocolate, you never know whether it has the indicator line or not...Or if it has the double grip strips which is fine for the overnites but annoying for the normal one, it makes changing diaper more challenging...Every box is different, there is NOT single box that I bought is identical and constantly satisfactory even though I definitely bought the same type/set...Please, Please fix your changes and be constant. I want the indicator line of EVERY huggies diapers!

reviews.name: skjag
reviews.title: New formula = wet baby and leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2017
reviews.review: I've been a big fan of these for several months as my little one is a heavy wetter at night. They were super absorbent, didn't leak and the baby's skin was always dry (so good wicking). However, they must have recently changed the formula or components, because now they don't nearly hold as much and he's had several leaks. We are now finding ourselves waking up in the middle night just to change him because he's uncomfortable. Not buying these again unfortunately.

reviews.name: Jane Doe
reviews.title: Work but smell like chemicals
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2022
reviews.review: These work just as well as the Honest overnights I was using before, but they had a slight chemical small to them which is obviously not my favorite. No leaks so far though

reviews.name: A. Said akin
reviews.title: Not so different than little movers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2023
reviews.review: I would go with little movers almost the same absorber and better price

reviews.name: Minnesorta gal
reviews.title: Not bad. But not as good as honest brand.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2021
reviews.review: I’m not crazy about these diapers, but they’re not terrible. Ordered these because they’re a little bit cheaper than honest brand but after trying them, I’m convinced that the honest diapers are worth the extra money.

reviews.name: Christopher A.
reviews.title: Leaks, good when it doesn’t
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2021
reviews.review: We have our 2.5 year old in these overnight diapers every night. We’ve had diaper leaks 1-2 nights a week- sometimes right after putting them on before bed and sometimes the next morning. Her clothes, sleep sack, and mattress would be soaking wet. But when the diapers don’t leak, they hold up pretty well.

reviews.name: Jesse
reviews.title: No more absorbent than daytime huggies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2022
reviews.review: 13month old pees right through these in the night. Not worth it.

reviews.name: Lacey Gray Okere
reviews.title: Buy Pampers these diapers rip easily and are not absorbent enough for night time.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2023

reviews.name: AK
reviews.title: Just as Daytime ones
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2022
reviews.review: I thought these could help as baby sleeps through the night. These leak just as the regular daytime ones. No difference besides these are larger. I guess volume would help? Not that cute design as others. Good quantity vs regulars.

reviews.name: zigley
reviews.title: Good experience, then leaks!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2014
reviews.review: We used the Overnites for sizes 2 and 3, but began having side leaks with size 4. I would usually change my son's diaper when he got up to nurse and after the forth time of changing sheets we no longer use them. We had previously had such great success with the other sizes I tried several different things but they would leak out of the side even if I had just changed the diaper. All the wetness would leak out the side and the interior of the diaper would hardly be wet!

reviews.name: Natalie claghorn
reviews.title: there are better
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2022
reviews.review: dont seem overnight, my kid fills these with one or two urinations

reviews.name: Sara R.
reviews.title: Great fit, not enough absorbency
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2021
reviews.review: I have loved using these for my toddler for awhile now, but there are too many mornings he wakes up and his diaper has exploded all over him… silica bead city! And/or he wakes up soaking wet.

reviews.name: Tony Scholl
reviews.title: Basically the regular day-time diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2019
reviews.review: I’m disappointed with these. I want the old diapers back. These don’t hold well. They’re just not snug and small poops come out the sides. This wouldn’t happen with the old overnights. Its as if they just took the regular diapers and put them in the overnights box.

reviews.name: V.
reviews.title: Came damaged
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2022
reviews.review: These work. But package came damaged and opened. Better going to target to get them!!

reviews.name: Katilicus
reviews.title: Lasts as promised, but has issues.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2014
reviews.review:
I'll be honest - they absorb very well. There hasn't been any issues with my 9 month old leaking. They meet the 12 hour mark, as promised.

With that said, they feel "cheap." I hate the papery feel. They have also caused some rash on my daughter. They also do not hold up well to blow outs. I have switched to simply finding the best day time diaper I can that holds up to large poops and using it at night.

While the diaper does last 12 hours as promised, I simply cannot use them on my daughter.

reviews.name: PhuckAmazon
reviews.title: These things don’t change them self
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2021
reviews.review: These things don’t change themselves or clean the toosh. They don’t keep the stink in. When they leak they don’t clean up the mess. 3 stars

reviews.name: Kate Sanders
reviews.title: More leaks than Little Snugglers.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2018
reviews.review: An okay diaper, but i wouldn't say it works better than the Huggies Little Snugglers as far as overnight goes. Actually, we've had 3 leaks in the last 2 weeks where the Little Snugglers it would only happen say once a month. Will not be purchasing the overnites again because it didn't make a huge difference like i had hoped!

reviews.name: Kathy Alexis
reviews.title: Not working for my guy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2021
reviews.review: I have a stomach sleeper and I was hoping that this diaper would prevent the leaks. It has great absorbancy but there's still leakage onto his bed.

reviews.name: Jess L.
reviews.title: they have the nice wetness indicator and he has not gotten any diaper ...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2017
reviews.review: These have not worked well for my child. I have had to use an extra pad in these diapers to keep him dry for a full 12 hours. That being said, they have the nice wetness indicator and he has not gotten any diaper rash or anything while wearing them. They work well for car rides where he may be in a diaper a bit longer than usual.

reviews.name: Frances V. Roberts
reviews.title: 6 hours protection
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2015
reviews.review: About 6 hours of protection before leaking. They swell up and push away from the belly. So the absorbant layer pushes the top rim of the diaper away from skin and exposes to the clothing which wicks up the urine. If you have a baby who pees alot while sleeping. I use on both my toddler and infant. I change them before I go to bed myself once and then the protection is good. You cannot beat the price offered here with coupon and convienance.

reviews.name: Soldatny
reviews.title: Not for nights, maybe a few hrs during the day, get the regular ones not night
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2019
reviews.review: They look like they fit snug unfortunately they leak. I had to change my child in the middle of the night, change his clothes and his bed was even all wet. Very disappointing because i tried the regular ones not night time and they work much better.

reviews.name: Deanna
reviews.title: Wish the hadn’t changed the thickness of the diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2021
reviews.review: I loved the old night time Huggies. These new ones with the Winnie the Pooh are so much thinner! Super disappointed and will now be canceling my subscription

reviews.name: Candy Marr
reviews.title: Same diaper but more expensive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2021
reviews.review: No different from the regular diaper. I gave it a three because I expected more absorbency throughout the night. Not happening. Why pay more for the same product?

reviews.name: Dani
reviews.title: Chemical smell
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2020
reviews.review: I love the diapers, they’re the only ones that last throughout the night without leaking. My issue that I’m having with them is that they have a chemical smell to them. I’m considering changing brands because of it.

reviews.name: Geovanna Berrios
reviews.title: Tiene que ser size 5. Debido a que el tape no pega bien tiene que ser size 5
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2022
reviews.review: Tiene q ser size 5.

reviews.name: Jeanine
reviews.title: Leaked
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2022
reviews.review: Leaked through for overnight use

reviews.name: S
reviews.title: Product defect
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2020
reviews.review: I subscribe the product for several months, I liked to use them night time that absorbency was great and reasonable price. This month I noticed many strips were fallen apart. I won’t buy this product anymore

reviews.name: Jade Kristin
reviews.title: I was hoping that these would be even better & more absorbant than Costco brand but the are ...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2017
reviews.review: These diapers are very similar in absorbency to the Costco brand, which is what we use (& love) during the day. But at night, they just aren't enough, we have to change mid-night. I was hoping that these would be even better & more absorbant than Costco brand but the are not & for the price, they are not worth it.

reviews.name: Fuzbunny
reviews.title: Meh.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2017
reviews.review: They last twice as long as a regular diaper for my 8 month old... which means I only have to change him once per night instead of two. Using regular diapers is cheaper but one less change in the middle of the night is kind of nice. I haven't decided if they're worth it.

reviews.name: Jacquelyn Kokos
reviews.title: Great absorbency but horribly made
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2018
reviews.review: I loved these diapers the first time we bought them. This box has been super annoying because the tabs rip off every time I am putting a diaper on. No matter how gentle I am with the tab it always rips and it’s so disappointing.

reviews.name: Bryce R.
reviews.title: ... my son was around 6 months the diapers worked fantastic. I had been using normal diapers up until ...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2014
reviews.review: Initially when my son was around 6 months the diapers worked fantastic. I had been using normal diapers up until then but he kept wetting through them after some time. Once I made the change into OverNites the problem disappeared until around 18 months. Now he's wetting through them again and he isn't big enough for size 5 just yet. The only thing that has helped is that now at 20 months we've started potty training and he always asks to potty right before bed.

reviews.name: Mary B.
reviews.title: Wanted to protect from leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2021
reviews.review: Disappointing. Happy with performance for daily use where you can change often, but leaked when we needed it to hold up for several hours.

reviews.name: Candy Marr
reviews.title: Same diaper but more expensive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2021
reviews.review: No different from the regular diaper. I gave it a three because I expected more absorbency throughout the night. Not happening. Why pay more for the same product?

reviews.name: Carly
reviews.title: No difference.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2025
reviews.review: I tried these out because my baby was filling up and leaking through the Kirkland brand diapers at night. I don't see any difference in absorbency or comfort. Not worth it.

reviews.name: Danielle
reviews.title: Honestly don’t feel like they’re any different than regular diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2025
reviews.review: My baby leaked more in these than when he wore the regular Huggies at night… we’re doing away with them and will just be using the regular diapers for overnights.

reviews.name: Angie
reviews.title: Number of diapers has gone down
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2024
reviews.review: I love these diapers so I am giving a couple stars, but they have started giving you 6 less in a box. For this reason I’m going to try another brand of overnight diapers for a similar price that still does give 42 in the box. See the photo of a box I received from the same recurring order a few months ago versus the new boxes.

reviews.name: Stephanie
reviews.title: Less absorbent than Pampers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2024
reviews.review: I wanted to love them because they have the extra grip tab to keep the diaper in place. But the last 3-4 nights in a row my son has peed through the diaper. I bought them because he ran out of Pampers so I needed something quick, but I’ll be going back to Pampers. Maybe they will work for kids who don’t sleep through the night and usually get a change halfway through. Or kids that don’t drink a lot of water/liquids throughout the day.

reviews.name: Connor Bergmann
reviews.title: Leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2024
reviews.review: Our original over night diaper was out of stock so had to grab these. We are about half way through the box and have had 3-4 nights with major leaks. We will probably go back to our original overnight diaper and not even finish the box.

reviews.name: Honestly
reviews.title: Only a bit better than regular day diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2024
reviews.review: I haven't found a big enough difference using these vs regular day diapers.

reviews.name: maryanne grant
reviews.title: Don't waste your money! Exploded twice!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2024
reviews.review: I bought these because both of my kiddos were having occasional leaks overnight. I thought these would help! They have actually had MORE leaks with these diapers than with the regular ones. They have also exploded twice - with the silica gel everywhere resulting in an immediate bath. That stuff is so hard to clean up! Don't waste your money - it is not worth the mess. Going back to our regular diapers overnight.

reviews.name: Kandy
reviews.title: They’ve changed the diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2023
reviews.review: I used to swear by these overnight diapers, they were the best at keeping my daughter comfortable through the night. But this last box i ordered is horrible! Huggies changed up the design on the outside and the quality on the inside.. i could feel the difference the minute i pulled one out of the pack, it’s thinner. Gave them a chance anyways, it’s been 3 nights .. this is now the third night my daughter has woken up in the middle of the night for a diaper change.. & i also ordered the big pack of the regular day time Huggies and don’t think i didn’t notice the change in those also…. I’ve been flying through them because i have to change her more often now. Will not be wasting my money on these again .. which really sucks cause they’re the only diapers my daughter knows. I thought I’d gotten lucky and avoided the great diaper hunt for the best diaper out there but i guess for me that starts now

reviews.name: ZamoraHouse
reviews.title: Baby nursing overnight? These may not be the one for you
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2023
reviews.review:
I’ve purchased two boxes of these. My son is completely within the size range. He gets a full feeding before bedtime and then nurses once in the middle of the night for 15-20 minutes. The diaper doesn’t hold up to the point where I can leave him in it the whole night. So I decided to change him during the middle of-the-night feed (which I was trying to avoid so he wouldn’t wake too much) and I’ve still found that from bedtime to the feeding time he leaks urine out of the diaper. When inside his regular daytime diaper overnight he at least doesn’t leak before the middle of the night change.
These are pricey and well-reviewed but in my experience they just don’t hold up. The Kirkland diapers do better when I change one in the middle of the night. These don’t even do well with changing once at night.

It’s two instead of one because they are soft and fit comfortably. Plus it’s not that they leak 100% of the time, but they leak more than the daytime diapers that I use which is silly.

reviews.name: Kristian
reviews.title: Not as good as pampers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2024
reviews.review: I tried comparing between pampers and huggies overnight diapers to see which ones I liked better and pampers definitely beats huggies for me. My baby leaked through these after about 7 hours. He has never leaked with the pampers overnights. I love the cute pooh bear print on these but they just aren't absorbent enough for my little one.

reviews.name: Amy
reviews.title: Doesn't work as well as the snugglers Huggies?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.review: This confused us. We assumed with these, they would hold up better than the snugglers huggies diapers did. We were wrong. We went to these for size 3 but will be going back to the snugglers and a sposie pad in them instead. We used these with a sposie pad and she wakes up for diaper changes 3x a night. With snugglers, not at all. They were quite a bit thinner as well which shocked me. Disappointed.

reviews.name: J. Hu
reviews.title: These overnight huggies use to work
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2023
reviews.review:
When we switched to these overnight Huggies 2 years ago, we were so happy these worked. No more leaky night diapers and less laundry to do.

Something happened in the last 3-4 months. These diapers started to leak. So we went up a size 5 and it’s still leaking at night. It’s really frustrating.

My other baby just started to need to wear overnight diapers and I got the size 3s since they worked so well before. Nope. Leaked on the first night.

We always check the leg ruffles, make sure the penis is pointing down etc. These don’t work well anymore.

reviews.name: rmc2012
reviews.title: Disappointing new product
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2017
reviews.review: Two stars because they worked for 1 night. When my 8 month old started moving more at night and having leaky diapers, I was having to change him and the sheets on a daily basis. I searched the internet for a solution and all the mommy message boards recommended Huggies Overnites. I was so happy to have found a solution until I went to buy them on Amazon and read the reviews. All the pre-2017 reviews are great, but apparently Kimberly Clark recently decided to change their product and the change is a big fail. Since there are no viable alternatives (Pampers discontinued their overnight diaper line and Seventh Generation's reviews aren't great either), I decided to give Huggies a try anyway. Just as the Huggies representatives keep suggesting to all the reviewers who complain, I decided to take their recommendation and buy my son a size 4 since he is right on the cusp of that size (in the daytime, he wears a 3). The first night it was fine--no leaks. The second and third nights, however, have been back to leaky diapers, wet pajamas and me changing his sheets daily. I guess since there aren't any great alternatives, Huggies decided they can get away with a lower quality (cheaper?) product than the previous version. In the meantime, I've had to buy some diaper booster pads. They're arriving tomorrow, so hopefully they work. Very disappointed.

reviews.name: Annette
reviews.title: Work well but way too expensive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2024
reviews.review: In general we buy target or Costco brand diapers. Got some of these, but won’t buy again solely because they are outrageously expensive

reviews.name: Tian
reviews.title: Not enough absorbency to keep baby dry throughout night.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2024
reviews.review: These overnights don’t have enough absorbency for our 8 month old. He sleeps through the night (11 hours) and his clothes and sleep-sack is wet when I pick him up in the morning. Disappointed.

reviews.name: Unforsaken
reviews.title: Do not work
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2024
reviews.review: My son still urinate through his clothes at night.

reviews.name: Marissa Montero
reviews.title: Worse than regular Huggies for overnight.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2021
reviews.review:
I bought these diapers with high hopes. In my mom group, everyone said these are a life saver when it comes to little ones leaking through while sleeping through the night. I was having to change 16 Month old half way through the night so she didn’t pee through. I was having to change her sheets every few nights because of her leaking through. Everyone suggested these so I decided to finally give them a try.

My little one sleeps through the night from 7 pm-6:30/7am. I’ve tried these for a week now, and she’s peed through every single night. I’ve done laundry every day because I’ve had to change her even more so than with regular Huggies.

I really don’t get it. We LOVE Huggies. They’re the only brand we use after trying every single brand out there. They’ve been the best. But these were very disappointing and such a waste of money. They’re absorbent, but it seems to pool in one spot and then leak out.

I was hoping to make this mamas life a little easier, but no such luck.

reviews.name: Allison
reviews.title: Not a good overnight diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2024
reviews.review: My baby always cries around 4-5 o'clock these days because of his wet diaper or leaking diaper. After changing his diaper, he can be calm down and fall asleep soon.

reviews.name: Anna Zhu
reviews.title: No leaks but very uncomfortable
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2023
reviews.review: We’ve been using these overnight for a month because it does prevent leaks. But we noticed our toddler finds them uncomfortable, he’s developed a habit of scratching is butt when this diaper is on. We finally decided to stop using them because he had constant raw wounds from scratching. We stopped using these and there is no longer discomfort shown, the scratching went away. For now, we just use regular Huggies and change him at night.

reviews.name: Janet
reviews.title: Notably thinner and less absorbent than before
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2023
reviews.review: I have used Huggies Overnites for my heavy-wetting son for more than six months. This most recent box (which was a larger box than I usually order -- I think for size 6 it was 72 instead of the 36 or 42 I have bought before) has diapers that are very noticeably thinner. My son wets through every night. There is no point in paying more for overnight diapers that are no more absorbent (and possibly less) than the Kirkland ones we use during the day.

reviews.name: Andrew
reviews.title: Not the same quality as a few years back
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023
reviews.review: Huggies was our go-to nighttime use brand a few years ago: it was absorbent, sufficiently sized, and comfortable for our baby. I was very disappointed with product quality compared to a few years back. This is not absorbent and often resulted in leakage during night time use. My daughter would wake up early because of the build-up of urine, which is not what I expect in a nighttime brand. Also, sized smaller than comparable brands, another aspect of decline.

reviews.name: KW
reviews.title: Wished they didn't leak overnight
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2023
reviews.review: Disappointed. I was really hoping these would work out for my 7 month old. He weighs 17lbs and the diapers fit him great. However, after 6-8 hours of sleep he wakes up with his pajamas wet with pee due to the diaper being full and leaking. He's not able to sleep through the night because the leaking diaper wakes him up. I will not be buying these again because his regular Huggies diapers work just the same in my opinion.

reviews.name: Kiersten F
reviews.title: Doesn’t work
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2024
reviews.review: I tried these Huggies overnight for my 1.5year old son and didn’t work. He would wake up soaked. Used Pampers and they worked great but these were cheaper so thought it try them.

reviews.name: Antoinette
reviews.title: Yea…Not Worth It
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2022
reviews.review: I had really high hopes for this overnight diaper, as Huggies is a popular brand. Unfortunately, they did not meet our needs. My 27 lb, almost 2 year old twins still drink a bottle of milk before bed. I expect them to wet themselves in the middle of the night. Unfortunately, they’ve been waking up soaking wet and leaked through since we switched to Huggies. Pampers Overnight worked much better at absorbency. We only made the switch this month, because Huggies was a better price. A few dollars saved isn’t worth the time it takes to wash and change sheets all week. I will be switching back to Pampers overnight!

reviews.name: Amazon12x
reviews.title: Disappointing to say the least...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2022
reviews.review:
I had really high hopes for these diapers because I have been having issues with our youngest son waking up in the middle of the night because he has peed out of his diaper or soaked through his diaper.

These diapers are less absorbent than the regular Huggies Little movers which are my personal favorite.

Huggies is a really great brand and generally they have really awesome products but these were a definite letdown. If you're looking for a really absorbent diaper you can still stick with Huggies but just go with their Little movers brand ones.

reviews.name: Kerri
reviews.title: So many leaks! Switching back to Pampers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2021
reviews.review:
I love Huggies, and used their Little Snugglers/Little Movers for my son since day 1. But these overnight diapers are horrible! I've been using Pampers overnights for 3 months (Huggies was originally not available) but didn't like the "baby powder" smell, so I decided to switch. I've already had 3 leaks in the past week with these Huggies!
The issue I noticed is the waistband doesn't have the same stretch. So when the diaper fills near the crotch, it creates a gap by the waist causing leaks when he rolls. I didn't have this issue with Pampers, and am tired of changing PJs and sheets in the middle of the night!
I've already canceled Huggies and am switching back to Pampers. Live and learn.

reviews.name: Alex
reviews.title: Size up
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2022
reviews.review: I have a love-hate relationship with these diapers. When they work, they are great! But as the baby grows I noticed I always have to get the next size up. For example, my son is 20 lbs now and size 4 leaks on a regular basis. Only size 5 offers the protection we need. That's 2 sizes above the recommended! I hoped that size 4 would continue to work, but now I'm stuck with a monthly supply of expensive diapers that can be used only during the day.

reviews.name: Kevin Mink
reviews.title: Not great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.review: We’ve had Huggies before but for whatever reason this box was horrible. Our son wet through them which in his 4 years only happened when wearing these.

reviews.name: DBecker
reviews.title: More leaks than with Huggies Little Snugglers.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2021
reviews.review:
I decided to give these a try bc on occasion, my baby would have a leak up the back after sleeping for 10hrs. I thought that overnight diapers would eliminate the problem...instead, they made it worse.
4 out of 5 days with my baby wearing these overnight diapers, I had to do laundry in the morning. I never had that with little snugglers...maybe once a week he'd have a leak.
The only good thing that j can say is that they seemed very absorbant based on how heavy the diaper would get. They certainly don't seem any more absorbent than his regular diapers though.
I'm going to try to size up with little snugglers instead. These were a fail.

reviews.name: K.W.
reviews.title: Usually a great product, but not this time.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2017
reviews.review: I have used Huggies OverNights for about 6 months for my 16 month old son, and I have had no problems until this most recent box of diapers. When I opened them I noticed they looked different. They had a wetness indicator stripe on them, which didn't make any sense to me at all since they are overnight diapers. Of course they are going to be wet. Very wet. And you don't need a stripe to figure that out. Every other box I've ever gotten didn't have the stripe. Then there was the leaking. Every time I used a diaper from this particular box, it leaked. Every single one. I got really sick of washing bedding on a daily basis. I don't know what happened, but this box of diapers was not up to par. \

reviews.name: Bowling Fan
reviews.title: Glue misaligned with sharp spots
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2022
reviews.review: My son has used these diapers for years, as well as our other kids. I put a diaper on from the new package and he immediately started crying and fussing around trying to wiggle out. I took the diaper off and felt something equivalent to a sharp nail or staple inside. After investing more and opening the lining, we realized the glue was all off alignment and causing sharp jagged edges. Most in the pack are this way. Will be tossing these.

reviews.name: EMack
reviews.title: Clumpy Stuffing
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2023
reviews.review: Honestly, I found these diapers are less soft and the stuffing gets much clumpier and saggy compared to the Pampers overnight diapers! Two stars because they did accomplish the goal of no leaks over night when my baby slept for 12 hours with no diaper change!

reviews.name: Matina Manandhar
reviews.title: Leaked at the first night using it
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2023
reviews.review: I have been using Huggies regular diaper since her birth. I recently switched her diaper to Huggies overnight for the night. My baby’s clothes are all wet at the first night of using it 😡. She never had leakage problem with any of her other diapers even with the cheap one. Really disappointed with this one.

reviews.name: Cam and Fiona
reviews.title: Not a very strong quality material
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.review: The diapers tear off at the Velcro tabs and we have wasted 6 already! We won’t be using these anymore as they too easily.

reviews.name: H.H. Kang
reviews.title: Not for overnight at all
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2022
reviews.review: We bought this so that our baby’s sleep is not disturbed from diaper changes through the night. This is less absorbant than the huggies plus we get from Costco and we ended up using it as a day diaper. Definitely does not serves the purpose and is not worth.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Leaks every time
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2023
reviews.review: I got this by mistake, (we normally use pampers) but decided give it a chance. Well we’re very disappointed, our baby used to sleep all night but the past week he wakes around 2-3 am súper wet.

reviews.name: Vanessa
reviews.title: Why did they change it!?!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2023
reviews.review: The most recent order we received is so different. They are not as absorbent and definitely not good enough for nighttime. My kiddo woke up completely soaked. These were our go to nighttime diapers, now we have to search for an alternative.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Buyer Beware
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2021
reviews.review: These are overpriced low quality diapers. They are stiff and crunchy straight out of the box. You can feel the rock hard clumps of the diaper filler through the outer layer which will be right against your babies delicate skin. My one year old also woke up two hours earlier than normal, completely soaked. I already opened the box and used a few so I will probably use these as grossly overpriced daytime diapers but will never purchase again.

reviews.name: elizabeth
reviews.title: Leakage
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.review: My 1 year old drinks a 8oz bottle before bed. Half the time these leak. Will try a different brand.

reviews.name: Arieal
reviews.title: Caused a rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2024
reviews.review: My son ended up with an itchy rash after using.

reviews.name: Qing Ma
reviews.title: Way too much leaking!!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2020
reviews.review: It’s 11:30pm and I’m writing this review because my baby just woke up screaming! Her overnight diaper just leaked through her pajama and her bedsheet. I had to dry her off and change her. It had only been 4 hours since we changed her diaper and the diaper isn’t even full. This has been happening about twice a week since last two months. Initially we thought it might because she outgrown her size 3 diaper, so we upgraded to size 4. Leaking continue to happen. We are so disappointed in these diapers. Where did the old version go?

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2023
reviews.review: Surprisingly it does not solve the problem of leaking diaper. Every morning my sons clothes are all wet, I feel the red packing ones are much better as it does not leak as much.

reviews.name: AmazonMom83
reviews.title: Was amazing and now below average
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2016
reviews.review: I've been using these diapers for the last 11 months for nighttime with zero problems. My son is in a size 4 (23 lbs) and they are not holding up. I'm not sure if it is this package, but they are not performing as promised. By 4am he is soaked, his pjs are soaked and the bed is soaked. All of this after months and months of zero problems. The gel is coming out of the diaper by morning and the tabs are barley hanging on. We haven't changed a thing. I'm tempted to go up a size in diaper but that would be for a 27lb-er and I still have half of a box of overnights left. Pretty frustrating when I've been a loyal customer (we use huggies regular during the day as well and have no problems with those). Very frustrated!

reviews.name: Olivia Larson
reviews.title: Leaks badly
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2021
reviews.review: I’m not sure what’s the deal but these leak so bad, I haven’t found a diaper that doesn’t leak for nighttime use. We were good with honest for a while and then for some reason I tried these and as cute as they are they do not hold my sons pee throughout the night. Along with pampers swaddlers nighttime they both are awful for nighttime and I’m constantly changing sheets and clothes if he wakes up wet. Disappointing really…

reviews.name: Jtully
reviews.title: AMAZON issue
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2022
reviews.review: I regularly buy these in store, and started buying from Amazon when they were out of stock. The huggies overnights from big box stores are perfect but the ones from Amazon are hard and crunchy like they’ve been sitting in a warehouse or something too long. I will continue to buy these from another store.

reviews.name: Be Still
reviews.title: Not absorbent at all
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.review: Not sure why it was meant for nighttime but the product is not absorbent at all

reviews.name: Wendy LK
reviews.title: GENERIC QUALITY...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2021
reviews.review:
I've been using these for a year purchasing from Walmart and they are great or were great. I don't know what the heck these diapers are but they are NOT THE SAME! Very thin and leak. Generic Quality! Returning

Edit: I do want to say Amazon gave me a full refund and had UPS pick up my package the following day after delivery (I live in a very rural area) then my refund was issued the next day. Thank you, Amazon

reviews.name: Adrian
reviews.title: Leaks, barely different than regular day time
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2021
reviews.review: Makes no difference between the regular and night time. My kiddo is sleeping 8-10hr straight and the normal day time ones dont cut it anymore (i also use huggies for day time). So i tried using night time huggies but it still leaks. I had to change the poor kid in the wee hours of morning while he screams of hunger, not pleasant. I am now using Pampers night time and am very happy with it. Dont bother with Huggies Night time.

reviews.name: Megan Antinone
reviews.title: New ones are too thin and don't work as well
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2021
reviews.review: We started using Huggies overnights when my son was having a lot of leaks overnight, and it solved the problem well. Now with this latest box from January 2021, he is leaked through for at least three to four nights in a row again. I could tell as soon as I opened the box they had changed it, it was so much thinner and I seriously thought it was counterfeit as well. I'll be canceling my subscription and finding something else.

reviews.name: Drew L.
reviews.title: Leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2019
reviews.review: I bought these diapers for 2 years and loved them. All the sudden Huggies re-did them and they are horrible. There is no elastic to hold the urine in so the diapers leak out the top- back and front. They just feel cheaper too as far as thickness. Since the re-do my daughter leaks every night- a lot. She wakes up around 2am every night with her pajamas and the sheets soaked. Now I need to find a new diaper brand. Too bad because these used to be good diapers.

reviews.name: Hirsch Boucchechter
reviews.title: The Box looks like it was used
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.review: The box looks that was used, and it was seal with packing tape.

reviews.name: jarred lang
reviews.title: I’m disappointed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2020
reviews.review: I bought these because my son has been peeing so much at night and thought night time diapers would help. I was so wrong. These didn’t do better than the regular diapers. This morning he had pee on his belly all the way to his feet. I guess we will use them as regular diapers. Someone told me Luvs has a better night time diaper. I will go and find those to give them a try.

reviews.name: Rachael S.
reviews.title: Quality not nearly as good as they used to be!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2023
reviews.review: I used these for a year and a half for my baby and opened a new box recently and realized they have changed them and they’re not nearly as absorbent. Super disappointed

reviews.name: William H
reviews.title: Unimpressed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2022
reviews.review: I was very disappointed in the performance of these diapers. Claiming to be "overnight" diapers I expected better absorbency and leak protection but my kid woke up with a wet bed overnight. We like huggies diapers but these are worse by far than just the regular ones

reviews.name: ANASTASIA BOWEN
reviews.title: Leaking, bursts with gel beads.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2020
reviews.review: We have used this brand for a while now for overnight protection. Recently they haven’t been holding up through the night. We have gone up a size. This batch seems different. They have busted from being barely full, and the gel absorbent beads have popped out. We have had a similar experience with another brand of diapers that we purchased at the same time as this order. We had a bad batch of both.

reviews.name: Colbenson
reviews.title: Not a fan
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2023
reviews.review: I know lots of people love Huggies, but these overnight diapers didn’t work for our son. He peed through his diaper 3 different nights which never happened with Pampers for us.

reviews.name: Ech
reviews.title: Used to be my favorite
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2022
reviews.review: I used these diapers for all 3 of my kids. We had a lot of the older version with Mickey Mouse on it. I opened a new box with Tigger. It is cute but they feel more flimsy. We didn’t have any leaks yet but I feel like we are paying more for lower quality diapers.

reviews.name: Vivi CT
reviews.title: New design thinner :( not as absorbent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2021
reviews.review:
This used to be my favorite night dipper! And I thought I was going crazy until I saw other reviews commenting on how thin this new design is!
Since I opened the new box with the Winnie the pooh design my baby has been waking up wet. And I haven't put 2 and 2 together until I read the reviews!
I'm returning my last box and trying a different brand.

reviews.name: alec the shoe buyer
reviews.title: Unimpressed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2023
reviews.review: The Costco brand diapers are just as effective and they’re not “overnight” diapers. Also, the Costco brand is half the price per diaper! I feel like I have been bamboozled.

reviews.name: Ann F.
reviews.title: What happened? "New" style is terrible!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2021
reviews.review: These diapers used to be perfect for overnight. Now they've changed from Mickey print with 48 diapers, to Tigger with 42 diapers at the same price. The new style diapers are much thinner, and thus don't absorb as much as they used to and leak easily. After over a year of use I have to find something else and we've always used Huggies. So disappointing.

reviews.name: Raj
reviews.title: Cheap quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2021
reviews.review: My son is 20 months old now, I have been using Huggies from the time he was born and I always loved the quality of diapers. But this time the quality of the diapers is really bad and my son got rash, and leak protection is not that great too. I hope I get a better quality next time.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Diapers hard
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2021
reviews.review: I love these overnight diapers, but this particular batch was not right. The inside of the diaper was hard. Not sure if it was stored somewhere that made it this way, but I’ve never had them feel this way. I didn’t notice it until I opened and used a few of them, otherwise I would have returned.

reviews.name: Justin
reviews.title: These aren’t great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2022
reviews.review: My daughter is waking up with a wet diaper in the middle of the night. These seem to fill after about 6 hours. She did better on even the regular absorbency pampers. We are going to try pampers overnight.

reviews.name: Patrice hawk
reviews.title: Does not hold up
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2022
reviews.review: These leak more than the regular Huggies. I was really excited even added them to the subscription but had to cancel because they leak almost every night.

reviews.name: Vicki garrett
reviews.title: There has been a lot of manufacturing flaws that is why I gave this a low score
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2023
reviews.review: I have a whole box gathered up of the same case that is ripped like this I have always loved this brand and am just shocked

reviews.name: A. Hall
reviews.title: Not pull-ups!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2021
reviews.review: My 4 year old wears pull ups at night, and I bought these accidentally. I wouldn't recommend them for any kids/parents who are used to wearing the pull-up style. These are designed like a diaper, and seem smaller than regular nighttime underwear/pull-ups. Really inconvenient to put on.

reviews.name: DC
reviews.title: Prepare to Wash Your Sheets
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2018
reviews.review: My son must drink like a horse cause these do not contain his fluids when he sleeps. I ended up purchasing some booster pads that fit inside a diaper and that did the trick. These just slowed down the inevitable. I ended up having to change the sheets every other day. I am sure if the pad within it was thicker, it would work. Unfortunately, until then, I cannot recommend this item for anyone.

reviews.name: shady
reviews.title: Leaks from sides!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2021
reviews.review: My son only sleeps on his sides, so these didn't work for him as he leaked everyday from the sides. So now I just use them for his nap coz they work for a few short hours but not overnight

reviews.name: Denise
reviews.title: False advertisement
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2023
reviews.review: These are regular diapers advertised as overnight don’t waste your money Honest has a much better product

reviews.name: Erin
reviews.title: Changed product
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2023
reviews.review: The company has changed this product and it is now smaller, no longer absorb as much.

reviews.name: Messy Jessy
reviews.title: No better than normal Huggies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2022
reviews.review: These didn't work any better than regular Huggies. My son still woke up with his pajamas soaked, just like previously with the regular Huggies. On to find something else...

reviews.name: Sam
reviews.title: Leaked, don’t buy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2023
reviews.review: Leaked more than half the time. You had ONE JOB!

reviews.name: Shastin
reviews.title: Don’t bother
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2021
reviews.review: Literally the same absorbency as regular Huggies. Not sure what makes them so special. My baby pees through them all the time so I have to change him just as often at night as if he wasn’t wearing special Nighttime diapers.

reviews.name: KolbR
reviews.title: Doesn't stop leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2019
reviews.review: Bought these because my 4 month old son was leaking thru every night if not changed every 3-4 hours. Unfortunately, these didn't change that at all. Also, the material that absorbs the liquid becomes hard and crunchy which I can't imagine is comfortable for baby. Fit is great just like with regular Huggies, but that's about all I liked.

reviews.name: Steve Post II
reviews.title: Leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023
reviews.review: Wet the bed the first night of use!

reviews.name: Simone Styr
reviews.title: Leaked everywhere
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2021
reviews.review:
These leaked everywhere. We tried for 5 or 6 nights and it was such a mess.
Might be a matter of fit, because I know others who love these. But for my baby, it was a definite no-go.

reviews.name: Olivia Lucier
reviews.title: Not that great. Little Movers are better and thicker!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2019
reviews.review:
I love Huggies diapers. Snug and Dry are great. Little Movers are amazing. These Overnights are AWFUL! My son doesn’t never leaks in any Huggies except these overnight ones. Whether it be up the back, down the legs, out the front. Leaks! I’ll stick with Little Movers at night.

PS- it’s not the size. He is well within the weight for his size.

reviews.name: Nicola Nichol
reviews.title: Leaves pieces of the diaper on the baby
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2022
reviews.review: DIAPER is falling apart while on the baby. It just doesn't hold urine for more than a minute

reviews.name: Paul
reviews.title: Leaky, Seepy Diapers :(
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2016
reviews.review: I want to like these and I want them to work because we have two toddlers and one is a heavy wetter at night. We have been using these for a while and I'm not sure if there has been a recent change but they leak EVERY SINGLE time I use them. We just don't have time for this every morning. I have taken to using a diaper a size up for our one daughter at night and have had better results.

reviews.name: Katie Takeshita
reviews.title: Product completely different
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2021
reviews.review: We've purchased these overnight diapers several times and have been very happy but our most recent purchase, the diapers were much thinner and our child has leaked through every night we've used these new ones.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Buena calidad, mejora la protección de la moch Ed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2023
reviews.review: Es una marca de mucho prestigio

reviews.name: M. Schmitz
reviews.title: Not as good as they used to be
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2021
reviews.review: They changed it to save money and they are not as good as they used to be. Glad kid is almost done with these. Sorry for future parents.

reviews.name: Amelia
reviews.title: They’re not as absorbent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2022
reviews.review: My baby still wakes up from being wet in these diapers. Don’t think I’d purchase them again.

reviews.name: Holly
reviews.title: Leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2019
reviews.review: These did not work well for overnight protection. My son woke up wet half way through the night every night even when I sized up. I love huggies during the day but these are not a good one for night time.

reviews.name: Hay
reviews.title: Started leaking every night
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2021
reviews.review: Worked at first then starting leaking every night. He’s less than 20 pounds in a size 3 so not a size issue. Pampers overnights have been working 30 times better!

reviews.name: LG78
reviews.title: Did not work at all for containing overnight leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2016
reviews.review: My son weighs 25 lbs and size 4 diapers fit him very well, except he was leaking at night. We tried just going up to a size 5 at night, which worked fine - rare leak. I thought maybe these would work better. Nope. I used them for 3 nights and each night he leaked just as badly as with daytime size 4s. It was a failed experiment and now we have just gone back to regular size 5s at night.

reviews.name: Brittnie W.
reviews.title: Tabs rip off
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2018
reviews.review: Never had any issues for the past few years I've been using these, but with this last batch I received every single side tab rips off when I try to put the diaper on. I finally had to use tape to replace the broken tab. I can't keep throwing out brand new diapers.

reviews.name: Marisa
reviews.title: The tags rip off too easily.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2019
reviews.review: The tags rip off too easily. When I pull the tag to adhere it to the front of the diaper, if often rips off, and then I can’t use the diaper. I don’t have this problem with the regular huggies.

reviews.name: Rodney Summers
reviews.title: Not for extended use
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2019
reviews.review: These really absorb but they leak like crazy. Our kiddo (15 months) sleeps about 12 hours. These keep her dry about 3 out of 7 days. It's frustrating. Other brands break her out. We wish these worked better to stop leakage.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Try something else!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2016
reviews.review: I really wanted to like these, but I did not! The tabs easily ripped off, and the diapers give the "sag" appearance. Usually we use the pampers cruisers and even huggies little movers....but these were a huge disappointment! I wanted to get something because my daughter had a few leaks during the night... but these did not help what so ever. Sadly, I would not recommend these.

reviews.name: Mary4
reviews.title: They're fine
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2014
reviews.review: I accidentally ordered these (we normally order Pampers Overnight Diapers and LOVE them), and figured that I would use them anyways. They do a fine job of keeping my son dry, but they don't seem to keep the smell at bay quite as well.
