As a result, my son smells like stale urine in the morning... an issue that we never had with the Pampers. They also don't feel nearly as soft as the Pampers diapers do, but that doesn't seem to bother him.

reviews.name: mgrimsley
reviews.title: A big no! LEAKS BAD FOR BOYS
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2016
reviews.review: I purchased these praying they would last my son throughout the night. I was really wrong. I had to change him once if not twice including the wet clothes. If your a parent, you understand how aggravating a middle of the night change is. These were useless for boys, don't buy them unless you want a wet crib and very angry sleepy child.

reviews.name: daoxing wang
reviews.title: Not worth it
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020
reviews.review: Don’t think it make a big difference compare with normal huggies disperse. Does not notice it has better absorption, but however it is thicker and have worse ventilation.

reviews.name: A Fergs
reviews.title: Not impresed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2022
reviews.review: Back to Pampers I go, multiple leaks in a row with my 8 month old boy.

reviews.name: Erinn Brimbury
reviews.title: Leaked through
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2021
reviews.review: We’ve tried these diapers overnight (about 10 hours on) and my baby leaked through every night. Went back to seventh generation.

reviews.name: smallflower
reviews.title: Old design better!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2017
reviews.review: I have to agree with everyone who commented on the old vs new design. The thicker Mickey versions held all night and rarely leaked. The newer, thinner Pooh design leaks every night which defeats the whole purpose! We don't have any issues with additional rashes or explosions so 2* for that.

reviews.name: JL
reviews.title: Somehow leaks even more than regular diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2021
reviews.review: This leaked more than the regular huggies little movers. Really disappointed with this product and will not purchase again.

reviews.name: Jocelyn Mallory
reviews.title: No Leak Protection
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers leaked the very first night we used them - half way through the night. I will not be purchasing again.

reviews.name: Deniz Perrino
reviews.title: Indifferent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2021
reviews.review: It worked the first night but the second night he leaked. We were so discouraged.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Try something else!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2016
reviews.review: I really wanted to like these, but I did not! The tabs easily ripped off, and the diapers give the "sag" appearance. Usually we use the pampers cruisers and even huggies little movers....but these were a huge disappointment! I wanted to get something because my daughter had a few leaks during the night... but these did not help what so ever. Sadly, I would not recommend these.

reviews.name: Mary4
reviews.title: They're fine
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2014
reviews.review:
If I use these, I have to tear off the extra Velcro pieces on the front. The sharp corners leave very raw spots on the bend in the front of my baby's thighs.

They work just as well as the rest of the Huggies.
I've recently switched to Pampers Cruisers. My LO has such a big bum and thighs, Huggies kept leaking after a few minutes and going up a size was just too big. But, I was 100% Huggies Skin Essentials until she turned 1. Now, they just don't work for her anymore.

reviews.name: Ziwei Zhang
reviews.title: Not good enough for overnight
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2025
reviews.review: My baby cried at 5am several days with this diaper, we tried to sooth him and feed him but didn’t work, he only fell back to sleep after we changed his diaper. We even only put on this diaper around 11pm after one dream feed. Today my baby slept through to 7am and I found the diaper is leaking. Definitely will not buy it again

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: I was excited
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2024
reviews.review: I was so excited to try these out. My one year old has been waking up in the middle of the night and I’m pretty sure it’s because his diaper gets so wet that he gets uncomfortable and wakes up from it. The first time he got a bad diaper rash, so bad the girls at daycare say it was one of the worst they’ve seen. I figured it could have been from something else (he was recently sick) so I just stopped using them for a bit. I let it clear up and It has probably been about a month, so I decided to try again, boom a bad diaper rash again. I have this big box of diapers and a very uncomfortable baby. This hasn’t ever happened with any other diapers and we use store brand, pampers, and we have tried the regular Huggies as well.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2024
reviews.review: These are literally worse at absorbing than their regular daytime diapers. My baby would be wet in the morning and would wake up earlier due to this, while using these "overnight" diapers, while in the regular diapers her skin is never actually wet because they are very absorbent. We tried these thinking they would be even more absorbent but they are actually useless for the night time and now we're stuck with them because we used a few already.

reviews.name: Patricia A Halliday
reviews.title: Quality is NOT The Same
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2023
reviews.review:
We have used Huggies since 2019. I have never had issues and I have only raved about how amazing the products are. We went back and forth between Costco diaper (pretty much huggies, made in the same factory)
Since January 2023, when you guys changed the designs and print on the overnight diapers, the quality is complete garbage. They are so thin and the absorbency is nonexistent. I have to change my daughter at least three times a night, and I have to insert an absorbency pad on top of it, and she still wakes up drenched. It’s very clear the quality and standard has gone down with the company. Us parents would rather pay more money for a quality diaper, then pissing it away on something that does not work. Myself and about 10 other mothers notice this difference and will all be complaining directly to Huggies. It’s very sad that the quality has gone down tremendously. and trust me us parents, we noticed. Now we will all be looking for new brands, and I will not be buying huggies anymore until the quality is back up to the standard It always was. I am canceling my subscriptions. Shame on the company for doing this to try and save money.
I’ll be purchasing Costco diapers again because even though they aren’t overnight, they at least absorb and I know what I’m paying for.

reviews.name: Kate C
reviews.title: Leaks compared to pampers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2025
reviews.review: Bought these because of same day delivery and slightly cheaper cost and we regret it. Our son was in a size 5 pampers overnight and a size 5 Huggies diaper leaks 9 nights out of 10. Super annoying to do so much laundry. Glad we bought the smaller pack. Won’t be buying again.

reviews.name: Harry
reviews.title: Worst Diaper ever
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2024
reviews.review: I used Huggies reg diaper and had no issues. Now that I need it for 5 5-year-olds only at night, I switched to this overnight one. Every night I have to wake up and change it as it leaking. Last time I had to change 3 diapers during one night. It is leaking and not holding. I was tired of it , almost every day we need to wash bedding due to this. So I ordered the same one from Pampers and one lasted all night and no leaking. Now I realize you get what you paid for. Not recommend this at all

reviews.name: Katlynn M.
reviews.title: No different than regular Huggies.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2024
reviews.review: I honestly should have known better, but these are no different than regular Huggies. My daughter was in these for 6 hours overnight and when she woke for a feed, her urine had leaked so bad that it had traveled up her tummy and chest. Save your money and just change your baby every couple of hours. We are so sleep deprived that since she is 4 months old, we were hoping to eliminate frequent night changes to keep her from entirely waking up each change, but it just is what it is.

reviews.name: Azul Alvarado-Dadin
reviews.title: WAS NOT LEAK PROOF
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2024
reviews.review: I would love to be a part of the 98% that love these diapers but oh my god… I hate them. I usually get Pampers Overnite but they didn’t have my baby’s new size in stock and I was desperate so I bought these to try. My baby has LEAKED 9 times out of 10 wearing these diapers. She just went up one size, but maybe I’m using the wrong size? Don’t think it’s that though. Immediately returned and was super unhappy with the product.

reviews.name: Christyna Gildea
reviews.title: Leaked thru almost every night
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2024
reviews.review: Got these diapers in hopes of having less issues with being peed thru but have ended up with more. Since we bought these, our baby has woken up from peeing thru the diaper and soaking his clothes just about every night they've been used. They're no different than a regular diaper, and in fact we've had less issues with regular cheaper diapers than these.

reviews.name: Bianca
reviews.title: Urinating through diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2024
reviews.review: My 8 month old started urinating through his diaper through the night here and there so I purchased these overnight diapers to see if it would solve the problem. Upon opening them I realized they were not much thicker than the regular Huggies. But yesterday we had accident with these diapers. The fit is the right size and it’s a good price. Baby is comfortable in them and it’s a good quality but I’m still having these problems. I’ll look at other brands after finishing these.

reviews.name: Sarah
reviews.title: Baby had a rash with Huggies Overnites
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2024
reviews.review: My baby had a rash using the overnites!! For context, we have used the regular Huggies before and they worked fine. We love them. The overnites we left on no more than 6 hours and he had a rash. The pee didn’t leak through so it does work, but I’ll have to try another brand.

reviews.name: Cormac
reviews.title: Dont work. Worse than regular diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2024
reviews.review: Every single night these leak. Went back to just regular diapers vs these "night" diapers. For the price these should absorb and fit nicely. They fit worse than the cruiser pull ups. Now have a whole pack of useless diapers.

reviews.name: Elaine Ritter
reviews.title: Diaper leaked and then disintegrated, left shreds of diaper all over my son's legs and tummy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2020
reviews.review: I bought these for my 7 month old son, who normally wears size 4 Pampers Swaddlers. He started leaking in the middle of the night some, so I tried the Huggies Overnites because they're so highly rated. Tried one for the first time last night, and after having it on for 10 hours it leaked EVERYWHERE - by far the worst leakage I've ever had with my son. His sleep sack was drenched. I'd think that maybe I just got the wrong size, or he just had a lot of urine last night, so I would be willing to give them another chance - however, my son's legs and lower abdomen were covered in little pieces of shredded diaper, which appeared to be from the most exterior layer of the diaper disintegrating. This is completely unacceptable, so I returned the entire box of diapers for a refund. Never buying these again. I would rather have to wake up my son to change his diaper at 3am than deal with this ridiculous mess again.

reviews.name: Sybil VanderHoff
reviews.title: Confusing
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2025
reviews.review: This package was weird half were regular little movers and half of the bag was the good night diapers

reviews.name: Summer M.
reviews.title: Explosive diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2023
reviews.review: I just ordered a new pack a few days ago, opened them, used them for 3 nights, and tossed them out today. The gel crystals leaked out all over my baby 3 nights in a row! I've bought this product a few times now and this never happened before, so I'm thinking it was a bad batch? The diapers have also given my baby a very red rash on creases of diaper area/upper leg. I started using Huggies overnights for the last 3 months and Huggies lil movers and for 19 months now. This made me so mad that I've decided I'm switching brands altogether 😠

reviews.name: kennadi roberts
reviews.title: Leaked the first night
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2024
reviews.review: The diaper leaked the first night we used it and now I am awake after 3 hours of asleep and by baby won't go back to sleep because she is pissed off we had to change her clothes and she was all cold. Do not recommend.

reviews.name: Niccole
reviews.title: CAUSES CHEMICAL BURNS!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2023
reviews.review: DO NOT BUY! Huggies has had lawsuits against them for causing chemical burns! This happened to our daughter. Google it and you will see! Don’t put your baby through the pain that these diapers cause! We had to get medical care for our 8 month old! Now we use the Amazon brand Mama Bear and have had no problems. These are free from chemical bleaching and I don’t think the Huggies brand is! Bleach mixed with the ammonia from urine causes a chemical reaction! Huggies knows this and doesn’t care and hasn’t changed a thing and continues to sell their product!

reviews.name: Shelby
reviews.title: Would give 0 stars if possible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2024
reviews.review: We got these because my son (less than 1 year old) pees through his diaper often at night. The 2 nights that we used these he peed through worse than he did with regular diapers. Save yourself the money and don't get these

reviews.name: Amy M Xu
reviews.title: New design is flawed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2021
reviews.review:
I've used Huggies Overnight for close to a year now. They provided awesome leak protection and fit. However, I just got a box of the Winnie the Pooh design and they are terrible. At first use, the update seemed desirable. The material seemed softer and, though the tabs were smaller, they seemed to close well enough. However, my daughter has leaked through 4 out of the 5 nights we've used them. She used to leak maybe once or twice A MONTH with the previous design. As she's gotten older, my daughter has stopped being a heavy overnight wetter, so leaks hadn't been a problem. I kept using overnights for peace of mind.

Besides the new leak issue, I've noticed that the material, though seemingly softer, is thinner and gaps. The first night we used it, a whole piece stuck to her skin when I removed the diaper in the morning. (It came off quite easily, but still! The diaper almost disintegrated on her.)

I'll be switching overnight diapers immediately.

reviews.name: kiki
reviews.title: diapers fall apart
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2023
reviews.review: i’ve never wrote a review before but these are the worst diapers ever. don’t waste your money. these diapers fall apart within an hour of my daughter wearing them. huge mess and it got all over my daughter. i’ve never had this issue with any other diaper before, even with the same brand. the huggies little snugglers are the best diapers to use and we’ve never had issues even when my daughter wears them overnight. it’s funny how these are supposed to be overnight diapers yet fall apart within an hour of wear. save your money and just buy the little snugglers, they hold up for 12 hours while my daughter sleeps

reviews.name: Lisa
reviews.title: Leaked when not even fully full
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2024
reviews.review: I ordered a size 7 because it’s not a size you find in the stores and I had been using size 6 overnights for my daughter for a while but they were a bit small so I ordered these and they seem to be defective or something because they leak crazy without even being full , the regular ones I had also bought actually held up overnight over the ones that were actually designed for overnight isn’t that crazy , returning immediately won’t buy again

reviews.name: Dana R
reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2025
reviews.review: These are no different than regular diapers. There’s nothing extra about them to make them overnight. My son wakes up wet every single time he wears them.

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.title: Not same as the one in stores
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2023
reviews.review: We buy these all the time at Walmart and my baby never leaks at night through them. These were cheaper than the ones at Walmart so I figured same product, both huggies and both for overnight but they’re not. These are much thinner and much much less absorbent. My son has leaked through every night since we got these and never did when we purchased them from Walmart. These are thinner with a middle absorbency pad in them, they remind me of papers diapers for day time. We now have to get him the ones from Walmart and will probably use these for day time wear. I thought I was saving money but it’s going to end up costing me more now.

reviews.name: Esther
reviews.title: Leak like crazy!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers leak every night, they're totally useless compared to pampers overnight. These diapers don’t wick to the back, when I come to pick up my son in the morning, the entire front of the diaper is soaked and the back is dry, he sleeps on his stomach, but this wasn’t an issue for the pampers which we used before, those had no trouble keeping all the liquid inside the diaper no matter what position he slept in (back, stomach, side)

reviews.name: Daniel Simon
reviews.title: Does not stop leaks.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.review: I bought these bc I was originally using the pampers overnites or 2 diapers for bed time. The first few nights my son woke up absolutely soaked. His clothes and sheets were completely soiled. I put two of these on last night thinking that would help and it did not he was still soaked. I also bought a size up so that is not the issue you can tell that the material used is much thinner than other overnight diapers.

reviews.name: Caroline Snow
reviews.title: They leak a lot, won’t buy again.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.review: We usually use pampers overnites but this time I accidentally bought Huggies. I won’t ever do that again. Over the course of 4 nights my son has either woken up smelling like pee, feeling damp, or fully wet with his sleep sack and sheets completely soaked through. One day he woke up with diaper rash from being so wet all night. We never have these problems with Pampers. They definitely don’t keep him as dry or absorb as much liquid.

reviews.name: mikecila
reviews.title: Skip on these overnight diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2021
reviews.review:
EDIT: changed my two star to a one. I was correct. These diapers tend to stretch out around the leg area (if your kids tosses around while sleeping) causing the leakage. After doing a deep cleaning on the bed, the diapers leaked again 🤦🏻‍♀️
——————
It’s always been a hit or miss with Huggies. I recommend their potty training pull-ups, but not these overnight diapers.

I recently bought this not only cause of the cute Mickey Mouse design (my LO has been into Disney lately), but cause they were on sale. Big mistake buying something on sale, which probably means not enough people are buying the item and they’re trying to get rid of inventory.

First, they fit weird. It fits perfectly in the hip area thanks to the adjustable tabs, but the thigh area seems really loose. Needless to say, my daughter constantly moves around on the bed and her pee leaked everywhere.

reviews.name: Callmesara
reviews.title: Disappointed _leakage
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2024
reviews.review: I recently tried the overnight diaper and unfortunately, it fell short of expectations. Despite its promise of extended protection, it failed to contain leaks effectively throughout the night. This resulted in multiple disruptions to my baby's sleep and extra laundry for me to handle. Overall, I was disappointed with the performance of this overnight diaper and will be exploring other options in the future.

reviews.name: Rob G.
reviews.title: Quality went down hill.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2016
reviews.review:
Very disappointed with these diapers, we have two boys. When our first was two we purchased these diapers back in 2013 and they worked great. They were nice and thick and allowed our son to sleep through the night. Now that my second boy turned two we bought these diapers again and right away noticed the quality is bad. There is no padding to absorb our child's wetness. We have used these diapers three times and all three times they have soaked through. We like Huggies diapers and use them during the day time with no problems, but I don't know or understand what happened to the night time ones.

07-11-2016, Just a follow up, after writing this review, the company commented on this review and asked to call customer service. My wife called and they were friendly and sent us a refund for our diapers and a label to send them samples of the diapers we purchased. That was three weeks ago, not sure if they will tell us if we purchased a defective product through Amazon or not. Hopefully they will respond.

reviews.name: S
reviews.title: Didn't work - Returning and trying another brand
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2022
reviews.review: The first night we used these diapers, our 7 month old baby leaked through the entire diaper and had very wet clothing after sleeping in this diaper for 11 hours. So disappointed! We use Huggies regular diapers during the day (size 3) and so I figured I'd try Huggies Overnights to help prevent some of the leaks the baby tends to get during the night. Our baby is about 18 lbs, so the size 3 should've been the right size (it's officially for until 28 lbs)! Well as of now it seems that regular Huggies diapers do a better job containing the leaks than the overnights do. Perhaps we'll move on to try a different brand of overnight diapers instead...

reviews.name: Ribenium
reviews.title: Beware - new Cheaper version !
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2017
reviews.review:
I can't believe this ! The product I loved has changed - I am deleting my previous review because I received the new kind of overnites - they are thinner and my daughter leaked within 2 hours ! I am in shock and want to return the box - I have used this product for 20 months and loved it but now they are worthless - I had to wake her up and change her pjs and sheets at midnight. This was not even a leak due to an excessive amount of pee! She actually peed (from the bed time bottle )as I was putting her in crib so I changed her again - this diaper should have lasted more than a few hours - and this is not just me...there are now so many reviews on Jet.com stated exactly the same thing. I dont know if the company will get the message that we noticed the difference.
Anyhow - Huggies - what have u done ? Bring back the old version with Winnie the Pooh on the front -

reviews.name: Taylor Knoepke
reviews.title: More Leaks than any other brand tried :(
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.review: Huggies are a pretty reputable brand, and my son (22m) needs a nighttime diaper to get through the night dry. LUVS did the trick. 1 size larger from Aldi did the trick. When those other brands were sold out, we tried these Huggies. He leaks through at least 1-2 times per week since purchasing. These are expensive, and have totally let us down. LUVS have been the best so far, and sizing up from Aldi is a close second. These have been the WORST. :(

reviews.name: Lara
reviews.title: Leaks - Pampers overnights are better
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2022
reviews.review: I am highly disappointed in these. We always used Pampers overnights with no issue until I ran out and Huggies overnights were on sale. We like Huggies in general so I decided to try the overnights. Every single night my son leaked. I even size up in overnights for added absorbency. After buying so many because of the deep discount I received, I decided to try adding Spoise pads to help - nope he still leaked! To be fair my son is a stomach sleeper and sleeps very long, but the Pampers overnights never leak. So I had to buy Pampers overnights and am now using the Huggies Overnights during the day. Side by side photo of Huggies Overnights and Pampers Overnights, both size 6.

reviews.name: Tyler
reviews.title: Thin diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.review: As soon as we opened these diapers they didn’t appear any thicker or more absorbent than a regular day time diaper. My baby woke up at 3am the first night he wore them absolutely soaked in pee. His Jammie’s and sleep sack had to be changed. The next few nights he didn’t wake up in the middle of the night but by 6am every morning he was soaked. Not a good diaper, wouldn’t recommend.

reviews.name: Priyanka
reviews.title: Diapers are leaking!! and are damaged
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2023
reviews.review:
I have been purchasing this item from other stores - Walmart/Target and was always happy about the product.

This time I got it from Amazon. My baby would wake up in the middle of the night with wet clothes (Mommies can imagine the nightmare after that!). The diaper was leaking!! I then checked the unused diapers, most of them had broken padding in it. You can see through the diaper that the padding used to absorb wetness is broken in the middle. That explains the leak. I have tried to get a picture.

reviews.name: Megan
reviews.title: Don’t waste your time with the NEW and worse diapers!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2021
reviews.review: Buyer beware: NEW does not mean New and improved. If I could give zero stars I would. Do NOT buy the “new” diapers. They are equivalent to the daytime diapers and a complete waste of time. The OLD diapers are what you are looking for. I have been a devoted buyer of the OLD diapers for overnight protection for many months. However they were not I stock and I needed some immediately so I bought the NEW. What a huge mistake! They are cheap, poorly made, provide minimal absorbency and allow lots of leaking. And they are higher priced than they used to be. If you want to do lots of laundry and waste some money, buy the NEW ones. Thanks Huggies for screwing over parents.

reviews.name: Veronica Odom
reviews.title: Leaks just like regular Huggies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2024
reviews.review: Seem to have no difference in regular Huggies versus these overnights besides the pattern & significantly less diapers. Extremely disappointed and will not repurchase.

reviews.name: Melissa Winfield
reviews.title: Not Worth It
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2022
reviews.review: Don't let the "Overnites" title fool you. I usually use Huggies brand and really like the Special Delivery line. I thought that the Goodnites line would give my daughter extra protection at night being that it's from the same company. Boy, was I wrong. She woke up soaked through her diaper and onside AND pj's (which has never happened before). I tried them a 2nd night to make sure it wasn't a fluke, and had similar results again. Now I'm stuck with a whole case of them which I just found out are non-returnable. Not happy at all with this product.

reviews.name: Dolly
reviews.title: No better than normal diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2024
reviews.review: We bought these in order to prevent recent leaks with our 11 month old to get through the night without leaks. We usually use Kirkland brand diapers and these are leaking just like those so we’re disappointed.

reviews.name: Brittaney
reviews.title: Buy if you want your baby to wake up covered in pee
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2024
reviews.review: Overnight my a**! My 10-month old woke up completely soaked in her pee! I mean, it soaked through the diaper, her clothes, and her sleep sack! What a waste!

reviews.name: Suzie Q
reviews.title: new style is horrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2021
reviews.review: I am pissed off to tell the truth and want my money back. According to the description, I was ordering the old style of Huggies Overnites with Mickey Mouse on them which is what I wanted. I ended up receiving the new style with Winnie the Pooh on them and am extremely irritated because they are very different and not as absorbent as the old style. The first night I used the new style my son woke up completely soaked and I had to wash his bedding in the morning which defeats the purpose of buying overnight diapers. I don't know why Huggies felt they needed to change this diaper. VERY VERY disappointed.

reviews.name: Fergie
reviews.title: Huggies count your days!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2021
reviews.review:
I’m currently writing this review at 5:34am after having to change my son’s pamper, clothes and sheets because his pamper leaked...AGAIN!!! I’m so pissed because this is the 3rd night this has happened. I’ve been using these overnites for over a year and never had an issue. These pampers in this box feel so thin and cheap. I’m so pissed! Now I have to find new overnight pampers tomorrow because I can’t do this again...DON’T BUY THESE!!!!

*update* ok so this brand is good but I just stopped ordering them from Amazon because I received a bad box of these twice. Never had an issue with the ones bought in store!

reviews.name: Forthewin
reviews.title: New design is terrible!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2017
reviews.review: Totally agree with all of the negative comments on the new design diapers with Mickey. We loved the Winnie the Pooh overnights, but this latest box of the new ones are a lot thinner and flimsier than the old ones. My toddler got a rash all over when we started this box, and she kept saying "itchy itchy" and scratching around the waist band. I finally inspected the diapers and found some hard pieces poking in the elastic around the back waist area where she's been itching, seems like some glue or something balled up in the gathers and poking through. No wonder she's been itching! Overall these new diapers are terrible and seem like they have issues beyond just being less absorbent. We are definitely trashing the rest of the box and shopping for a new brand of overnight diapers ASAP. So disappointed in huggies, especially since they were so good before!! :-(

reviews.name: M Maes
reviews.title: Horrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2024
reviews.review: 0 stars. These diapers leak if my 8 month old is asleep for 3 hours or more. And they leak badly. He wakes up soaked. He’s 22 pounds. There’s no reason this diaper should work this horribly. I want my money back.

reviews.name: Ashley Kugler
reviews.title: Horrible changes made!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2023
reviews.review: I've had a month subscription of these diapers for close to a year with 2 under 2 & the latest delivery brought some changes. They changed the designs and feel. These diapers no longer absorb nearly as much as before. Several diapers have split open and caused gel to leak all inside my babies footsie pajamas. They are horrible compared to the previous quality. I'm very disappointed since I've used these so long successfully but now I will be looking for another option.

reviews.name: Francesca
reviews.title: Diaper exploded
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2024
reviews.review: Used for the first time and the diaper essentially exploded into beads. It looked like ripped up yellow styrofoam. Very disappointed with the product. The diaper seemed very thin and did not hold.

reviews.name: KLambeth
reviews.title: They leak like crazy!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024
reviews.review: I accidentally bought these instead of nighttime pull-ups, and I’m so upset that I have 2 full packs to get through before I replace them. They leak so bad, I had to strip all of my daughter’s bedding and clean the mattress because the diaper leaked through in the middle of the night. What a huge waste!

reviews.name: Mel T.
reviews.title: Huggies changed and now they leak!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2021
reviews.review: We have these on subscription from Amazon for the last year and the lastest box that arrived is different, new design and feels flimsy. We went out and bought from Walmart and they match what came from Amazon. They both DO NOT LAST THROUGH THE NIGHT, they leak!! Huggies changed something. The old awesome design had moon and stars on them and those were worth the month. (I don't have a photo of the old ones) The new design has Pooh and Tigger on them and they are terrible. Calling customer service on the box ASAP, we now have 2 boxes of 50 that leak!

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Our regular daily diapers are more absorbent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2024
reviews.review: Every time we put these on, my son pees right through them. We now just use our regular diapers which are much better at absorbing and he normally stays dry. Don’t buy.

reviews.name: Ceejay_42
reviews.title: The new Overnites are terrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2017
reviews.review: I hate the new Overnites. Like many others have said, I used these diapers for the past couple years with no issues and hardly any leaks. As soon as I started using my first boxes of the "updated" Overnites for my 1.5 year old, I started seeing leaks almost every night. Most mornings he wakes up with a ridiculously full and wet diaper and wet pajamas. He's even in a larger size diaper than his weight would require (in the size 3 weight range but we use size 4 for overnight), so I know that size isn't the problem. Today when I got him up, the diaper had exploded and there were little absorbent crystals all over the inside of his zip up sleeper. That was last straw for us. I will not buy these again and will find another brand for his overnight diapers.

reviews.name: Ashley
reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2020
reviews.review: Okay let me start by saying that we have used Huggies for 10 years with all 4 kids. The last 2 boxes of these diapers have begun leaking every single night (our son does not drink a bottle overnight) and if they don’t leak, they’re busting open. I’ve NEVER had this happen before. I have the squishy stuff from the inside literally everywhere in my sons room because they are breaking so much. I’m so mad that I finally just put in for a return and I will be canceling our subscribe and save. DO NOT BUY these diapers. The reviews are somehow somewhat good on here but please don’t waste your money like I did.

reviews.name: M&E
reviews.title: Leak out sides and back before getting full
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2020
reviews.review: Got these for a medium-heavy wetter. We were using Huggies Little Movers Plus overnight with good results but needed more absorbency. Well, in theory, these have more absorbant capabilities. Over approximately 10 days of use, they have leaked significantly out the sides or back about every 3rd day. In comparison, the little movers leaked about once every 7 days. They also leave how skin feeling damp and clammy. Even though there well be a good 1/2 or more of unfilled diaper, they are leaking. I was a preschool teacher for 12-24 months and a nanny before this bio. I have changed thousands of diapers. It's not user error. What a waste of money.

reviews.name: April Atkinson
reviews.title: They’ve changed and leak horribly now!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2019
reviews.review: I’m not a big reviewer, but these diapers have changed and are horrible now. My son has been in huggies overnight for 10 months and I liked them the best. Now, this most recent box that came in (April 2019) they look and feel different. My son has woken up 6 out of 8 nights completely soaked in pee! That’s skeeping through the night, no extra feedings at night. Doubt I can return them now but will definitely be purchasing a different brand, probably target, since we already use their daytime diapers. Horrible change! They had to do testing and know these are way worse, yet still produced them. They look to be stretched out and not even touching his abdomen now when I change him.

reviews.name: Lunaazul78
reviews.title: Disappointed in the design-exploding diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2021
reviews.review: These were our go to diapers for my toddler. The new design is awful! When we used our last diaper out of the old design and started with the new box, the diapers immediately started giving problems. Not only do they leak but they explode and my son wakes up with tons of gel diaper inners all day over him. If it weren’t for the fact that we had zero problems before the new design, I’d have thought it was a size issue but every single diaper used from the new pack has exploded. Don’t waste your money. Huggies has officially lost a customer to their competition.

reviews.name: Abbey L.
reviews.title: Defective product
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2022
reviews.review:
The gel that is supposed to absorb the urine comes of out of the diaper. My son woke up with about 0.5 cup of it all over his stomach and back. This was after a week of having diaper leaks almost every night leading up to it.

It’s not just the overnight diapers. We had regular Huggies when he was younger and the same thing was happening, just not as much as this. I’ve never had this happen with any other brand.

reviews.name: Jackie
reviews.title: Skin reactions!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2022
reviews.review: My son developed an awful “rash” I couldn’t get rid of.. he had blisters and burns on his bum for almost 3 weeks.. we used Huggies for the first year or his life and my first sons entire infancy. I tried everything to get rid of the rash and even brought him to the doctor until it was suggested I try a different diaper.. they went away instantly. Apparently this has been an issue with Huggies diapers and I am outraged that most consumers are not aware

reviews.name: Jessica Wilson
reviews.title: Horrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
reviews.review: Don’t buy these they are the worst overnight diapers they more expensive than the Walmart brand and they don’t work. My son has woken up soak from head to toe and the diaper exposes

reviews.name: Zach Lyons
reviews.title: Not very absorbant
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviews.review: Our daughter wore these to bed and within 2 hours woke up crying needing changed. She's an all night sleeper, and in regular diapers doesn't stir. However, when we put one if these on her tonight she was up. The diper was swollen like it had been on her for 7 hours. Do not recommend these, but would recommend the regular ones.

reviews.name: Jacqui
reviews.title: Waste of Money
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2019
reviews.review:
These absolutely do not work for my baby. My 4 month old pees through every single night wearing these, and not just a little bit, he totally soaks himself and the bed. I tried going up a size to see if it helped, but no, peed right through. I stayed up a few nights and checked to see how long these last before he pees through and they only last about 4-5 hours...which is about how long the daytime ‘little movers’ last. I love buggies regular diapers, but these nighttime ones do not work.

For reference my son is 4 months old, 22 pounds and 27 inches. He wears a size 3 during the day, but I tried both a size 3 and a size 4 nighttime diape on him and neither worked.

reviews.name: HugoPosh
reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.review: We bought this product to combat occasional wet spots on our toddler’s pj’s in the morning. The first night trying this diaper we awoke to crying at 1am. It was the wettest he’s ever been- wet sheets, wet quilted sleep sack, and wet pajamas. Devastatingly inadequate. Somehow worse than a regular diaper! Wish I could rate this with zero stars.

reviews.name: Heather
reviews.title: VERY diappointed! Never again!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2016
reviews.review: I am incredibly disappointed with these diapers and will NEVER recommend to anyone! My son on occasion will leak through his normal Huggies diaper. I thought I would give these a shot since the reviews seemed good. The first night, he woke up 5 hours later and had completely soaked through his pj's and sheets. Not a happy mama. (side note; he did not drink any more than what he always does.) I have been putting these on him regularly for almost a week now just to give them a fair chance. Last night was my last straw. Less than 3 hours and he had soaked through his pj's and sheets again! I am now just using throughout the day just so I can hurry up and get rid of them. I love Huggies, but HATE these. What a waste of money.

reviews.name: S. Vincent Yoder
reviews.title: Buyer beware!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
reviews.review: I’ve used these diapers for years without issue (two kids, boy and girl)… until recently. Twice now the diapers have literally exploded gel beads all over my child. Number one, this is a health risk. Second, they are so hard to clean up (imagine gel bead snow filled with urine EVERYWHERE!) These diapers need some quality checks and a design overhaul.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.title: I love Huggies but this one is terrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2023
reviews.review: My baby never leaked through his diaper at night until I started using this one, only reason I got it is because he started to sleep longer stretches like 11hours straight so I was afraid he was going to start leaking. Big mistake! Every single night I used it on him he leaked and but the night I used the little snugglers he was dry all night.

reviews.name: mahroo
reviews.title: Doesn’t work for me
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2024
reviews.review:
I thought it is the best product but it is not! It’s working only couple of hours! Never ever worked like 12 hours! It should use as a daytime diaper
So disappointing

reviews.name: Akshay Goel
reviews.title: They Leak! Just Buy Regular Huggies!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2021
reviews.review: My baby is 19lbs. We had been using size 3 Huggies day and night and had not experienced any leaks. I decided to purchase the overnight diapers to see if they might hold more as he grows and possibly feel drier on the inside. We have used them for a few nights, and they leaked twice. Instead of getting more sleep in a drier diaper, we were up changing clothing and bedding. Not happy, Huggies!! Will be going back to the regular diapers (might consider sizing up at night). Do not buy these!!

reviews.name: Blake Kenney
reviews.title: Defective Diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2024
reviews.review: The absorbent materials came OUT of the diaper during the night. My toddlers sleep sack was soaked and covered in the small little white pieces from inside the diaper. Very gross.

reviews.name: ACS
reviews.title: Latest box are no better than regular diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2021
reviews.review:
We've been using this brand of overnight diapers for about 6 months now. I opened a new box of size 4 overnights today and these diapers are no better than the regular Huggies we use during the day. There is a noticeable difference between the diaper I used last night (previous box) vs. tonight (new box). My son started fussing 3 hours after being put to bed and the diaper was nearly full already (no changes to his liquid intake).

Not recommended! These will not cut it for babies who sleep through the night (8+ hours).

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Poor quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2022
reviews.review: My kid can’t even last 6 hours, he peed through the diaper multiple night and he’s too young to roll over. Our daytime Costco brand diapers are thicker than these. When I change him his skin is soaking wet too. They aren’t even keeping him dry and he’s only wearing them 6-8 hours. We used Huggies overnights with our first kid for years and no issues so wondering if this is a bad batch?

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Issues with Leaking
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.review: We purchased these because we've liked the huggies special deliveries so much. However, we have now used them 3 times at night and all three times they caused my son to wake up due to leaking. Thoroughly disappointed because avoiding that situation was exactly why we purchased them (not to mention an issue we never had with the daytime diapers we've used).

reviews.name: Micca Osmar
reviews.title: Not for girls
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2024
reviews.review: My baby got up as many as regular diapers. I didn’t see any difference.

reviews.name: LA
reviews.title: Do NOT buy if you want to get up 3/4 times a nite
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2021
reviews.review: Well.. I can at least say my routine hasn’t changed.. not a good thing. I still have to get up three to four times a night to change him. These diapers leak after about 4 hours. I would have save more money by just buying luvs with having to get up 2 to 3 times a night instead of buying these in hopes I would only have to get up once. I get up 3/4 times a night to change him. DO NOT BUY. They leak and are of no help for more desired sleep.

reviews.name: Twin momma
reviews.title: Terrible- babies leaked through, woke up soaking wet
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2022
reviews.review: We had high hopes for these diapers as the daytime ones are good. These overnite diapers are thinner than what we expected. On the first night and only after 5 hours out Huggies #4 failed our twins as they woke up soaking wet and leaking when I picked them up to feed them. Babies are within the weight limit and should’ve been a perfect fitting, well it wasn’t. I am very disappointed And will be looking at a different overnite brand.

reviews.name: yana staroselsky
reviews.title: Diaper disintegrates during the night
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2019
reviews.review:
I had used the huggies night diapers with both of my kids and was shocked to see that the diaper disintegrated during the night and everything come out.

Thinking this may have been a one time bad diaper, I thought I would give them one more try.

My poor son, he woke up to this material being all over his body, up to his chest. VERY disappointing. Although amazon did offer me a refund, I will NEVER be buying theses again.

reviews.name: Nugget
reviews.title: New Version is awful
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2019
reviews.review: These are terrible not nearly as absorbent as the “old” overnight diapers. My baby can not stand wet diapers and will wake himself up as a result of being uncomfortable. He wears a size up from his day time diapers. He slept great with the old version, 5-7 hours, and the diaper was always VERY full. With the new version he’s back to sleeping only 1.5-2 hours and the diaper is only somewhat full. The new version doesn’t have the blue absorbancy strip and I think that’s the reason these diapers aren’t working as well as the old version.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Worse then a regular diaper!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.review: My daughter is 8 months and 24lbs. I was changing her diaper 1-2 times a night 7p-7a and thought these would help her get through the night or just 1 change. WRONG her pjs and sleep sack were soaked by 10p and the diaper was barely even wet. It’s like they don’t absorb at all. Do NOT waste your money.

reviews.name: Sara W.
reviews.title: No longer works, used to be great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020
reviews.review: I loved these with my first child. They worked great! I'm not sure what changed since my second child was born, but these leak constantly (almost every night). My child normally wears a size 3 diaper so I'm using a size 4 night diaper (like I did with my first born without a problem). These just do not absorb pee like they used to and they leak out the top by 3 or 4 am pretty much every night which defeats the point. I saw other people trying out Pampers so I'm going to try those instead because these are worthless at night.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Horrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2022
reviews.review: I’ve used the pamper nighttime diapers for my son and will definitely go back to those. The stuffing in these always fall out for a nighttime. The diapers don’t “leak”, they literally fall apart being used as a night diaper. I even got a size above what my child usually needs, and these are just gross. I like Huggies days, but this is the third and last time I will try their nighttime diapers.

reviews.name: John M
reviews.title: New changes are horrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2019
reviews.review:
The recent changes to the diapers are horrendous. Now every single morning when it’s time to change my daughter, the diaper has fallen apart and the insides get EVERYWHERE. The attached photo was a diaper I tried to move from the changing table (literally one foot away) to the trash.
We are done buying Huggies Overnites. If anyone has any suggestions for alternatives, please leave me a comment!

reviews.name: candace baez
reviews.title: Terrible! Regular Huggies do better overnight
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2024
reviews.review: Baby wakes up soaking wet in these every morning. Worse then when he would wear normal Huggies diapers. Never again will waste my money on these

reviews.name: melanie rogers
reviews.title: Leak
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.review: We have been using these for quite a while with periodic leaking through, but got a new big box and has soaked through every single night for almost 2 weeks. Diaper is not even full and sometimes explodes and insides of it get all over

reviews.name: luv2bake
reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2024
reviews.review: Tried 3 times and each one leaked worse than the regular style. Will not be purchasing again.

reviews.name: Wil
reviews.title: Leaks exactly as much as normal diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2023
reviews.review: Our first night trying these, the size of the pee spot on my baby was exactly the same as with Kirkland of the same size. Might as well save your money by not buying these because they are identical to daytime diapers, just with different labeling.

reviews.name: Haneef Syed
reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2024
reviews.review: I used to be a fan of Huggies but, these ones are so not worth it.. I have to change my toddler twice sometimes thrice during the night cause they leak.. Never buying again for sure!!

reviews.name: Sandra Kirchmer
reviews.title: Much thinner than they used to be!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2022
reviews.review: I have always sworn by Huggies overnights and have even recommended them to all of my friends. But this product has definitely been changed, and not for the good. They are much thinner than they used to be! Much thinner than my daytime diapers. I used 2 diapers in this pack and my baby woke up soaked through both times. How this can be called an overnight diaper is beyond me. Will not be purchasing this again.

reviews.name: Sadie andrews
reviews.title: Worse than regular huggies but way more expensive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2022
reviews.review: I bought these as a sub for rascles and friends and I thought they would hold up through the night! No!!! I have to change my child 3 times during the night these diapers leak so bad and don’t hold anything! I’m mad because I spent almost $50 on a box and I can get rascles and friends for $20 a box!! I’ve used huggies special delivery and they are great but these are terrible diapers very disappointed!

reviews.name: Aubrey Wright
reviews.title: Waste of Money
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2015
reviews.review: I fail to see the difference between this diaper and Huggie's other diapers. I have tried multiple kinds of Huggies, and my favorite, which I am loyal to, are the Huggies Little Movers that I get in bulk at Costco. The Huggies Little Movers are more absorbent than these "overnight diapers," and you can even compare the thickness just by feeling both diapers as proof. I have to change my son in the middle of the night because he pees so much, and I am sorry to say these did not help AT ALL. These diapers are just a gimmick to get you to pay more for a worse diaper, and while using these diapers I still have to get up in the middle of the night to change my son because his diaper is so full.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Exploding and Leaking Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2021
reviews.review:
These diapers are so bad I thought they were defective. I switched brands so that I could have a subscribe and save. On our old brand we never, not even once, had a leak. Well with this diaper the first one we used massively exploded and got diaper gel all over my daughter. The second one leaked. They are a total waste of money.

(I have never written a review before, but this experience was so bad I made sure to come and drop a review)

reviews.name: Jasper Eliot
reviews.title: Fit is off, very thin and leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2023
reviews.review:
The size 6 fits more like a size 4.
The diaper is very thin.
My son leaked through these 5 nights in a row.
They were out of Goodnites in the store so I got a box of these. What a mistake and such a waste of money.
I am sorry but these night time diapers from Huggies really suck.

reviews.name: Michael Johnson
reviews.title: Recent batch is defective
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2023
reviews.review: I normally love Huggies Overnights, but this recent batch was defective. Both packs I received had the fastener part on backwards, so the only way to fasten the diaper was to twist the sides. Attached is a picture of a regular Huggies diaper (bottom) and then the Overnight diaper and you can see how the flaps are placed incorrectly

reviews.name: Melinda
reviews.title: Quality changed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2023
reviews.review: I've been using Huggies diapers for nearly 2 years and recently noticed that the quality has dropped. They seem cheap and thinner plus I keep finding lint on my son during each diaper change. The lint is stuck to him and hard to get off. I am pretty disappointed and will be switching to a different brand

reviews.name: Ruben Parks
reviews.title: Leaking by morning!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2021
reviews.review: Our little one is sleeping about 11 hours and we bought these overnight diapers because she kept leaking in the morning. Well these nighttime diapers aren’t any better than normal ones. She’s even been a little dehydrated due to an illness and she still leaks by morning. It’s like the diaper has a lot of absorbency left but the pee doesn’t get pulled away quick enough, so the diaper fills too fast and leaks. It mainly happens when she sleeps on her back.

reviews.name: Grigor Momjyan
reviews.title: Are these actual Huggies overnites?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2023
reviews.review: I buy huggies overnites from Target and these felt and looked different. My son woke up soaking wet both nights I used these ( the ones I bought from Amazon.) I will be returning these and buying the Huggies overnites from Target. These are definitely not good and will not buy the Amazon ones. They're definitely different!!

reviews.name: FLA360
reviews.title: New diaper design is garbage
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2021
reviews.review: Huggies overnights has just lost a loyal, customer. This new version with Winnie the Pooh print is thin, scratchy, cheap garbage. Truly awful! I used to recommend Huggies overnight diapers to everyone. As long as this new version is around, I am buying a different brand and will tell others to do the same. Please go back to your old design. The old version was perfect.

reviews.name: FortyOne
reviews.title: Not easy to change
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2021
reviews.review: God forbid you actually have to change your baby in the dark. I’m possible to do. Velcro is a pain to open and diaper doesn’t lay flat under baby. Yay pee everywhere mid change. Pampers are so much easier to change, they lay flat, Velcro fastener is easier to open in the dark and me and my bed doesn’t end up covered in pee. Waste of money and now I am lying on a towel in the dark until I can change my sheets in the morning.

reviews.name: Grant
reviews.title: Hard uncomfortable lumps
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2023
reviews.review: My poor one year old was saying ouch recently when i tried to put on the huggies overnight diapers and realized that quiet few of them have patches of hard lumps and they were hurting his bum. So i tossed them out the trash because he starts crying every time he sees them m. $54 down the drain.

reviews.name: Haleigh
reviews.title: Leaks every night!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2024
reviews.review: Ordered these instead of pampers because they could get here quicker. Very disappointed. Woke up the first morning to a soaking wet outfit, dripping diaper, soaked bedding and sleep sack!

reviews.name: Abigail
reviews.title: Would not reccomend, pampers overnight are better
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2022
reviews.review:
I typicaaly buy pampers overnights for my son but these were on sale. They are thin, and have hard crunchy areas that seem they would be uncomfortable and make me wonder what they are using in the product.
Will not be purchasing again. I am disappointed I can't return because I bought them a size up during the sale and just now opened the case to use.
Do not reccomend.

reviews.name: Taylor
reviews.title: Pampers are better
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2024
reviews.review: I've had nothing but leaks with these. I'm exhausted waking up to a soaked baby changing outfits and sheets in the middle of the night. I'll be going back to pampers!

products.product_name: Huggies Size 4 Diapers, Snug & Dry Baby Diapers, Size 4 (22-37 lbs), 180 Count (6 Packs of 30), Packaging May Vary

reviews.name: Autumn carlisle
reviews.title: 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 Dependable and Comfortable Diapers for My Baby
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2024
reviews.review:
As a parent, I can confidently say that Huggies Snug & Dry Size 2 Diapers are a lifesaver! Here’s why they’ve become my go-to choice:

Super Absorbent: These diapers provide up to 12 hours of protection, keeping my baby dry and comfortable through the night. It’s such a relief knowing I don’t have to worry about leaks or messes.

Perfect Fit: The snug waistband and stretchable sides ensure a secure and comfortable fit for my baby (12–18 lbs). No red marks or discomfort after hours of wear!

Soft and Gentle: The material is soft and hypoallergenic, which is great for my baby's sensitive skin. I haven’t experienced any irritation or diaper rash since switching to Huggies.

Value for Money: With 100 diapers in the pack, it’s not only cost-effective but also lasts a good while. I appreciate the quality at an affordable price.

Trusted Brand: Huggies is a brand I trust, and these diapers live up to the reputation. They handle daily messes with ease, and the leak lock system does its job beautifully.

If you’re looking for a reliable, comfortable diaper that keeps your baby dry and happy, I highly recommend these. Huggies Snug & Dry is a parenting win!

reviews.name: Raymond
reviews.title: Perfect diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2025
reviews.review: We LOVE these diapers. We are a Huggies family and usually purchase the little snugglers diapers but we decided to try these out for our little guy and we love them. They don’t leak, they have the cutest mickey design on them and are very comparable to the little snugglers at a better price point. Would highly recommend!

reviews.name: Alex S.
reviews.title: Excellent for little baby boys who have pee accidents!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2025
reviews.review: I had an issue where my son, who is 3 months old, kept peeing somehow through his diaper and it would get all over his outfits. I was using pampers swaddlers and even though I would make sure they were snug and completely covering him, somehow the pee would still make its way out of the diaper! It was incredibly frustrating because we were constantly going through outfits (both me and him because he would pee on my while I was holding him). I explained my situation in an online mom group and quickly found out that other moms were dealing with the same issue. They said they had switched from pampers to these Huggies and they no longer had pee accidents. So I ordered a box of these Huggies and tried them out. Sure enough—NO PEE ACCIDENTS! This is now day 4 of using the Huggies and we have not had one accident or blowout like we did with the pampers. I’m not saying the pampers are bad, but they just weren’t suitable for little boys and their private parts. These Huggies definitely do the trick and I couldn’t be more relieved. They are super soft and a little stretchy so they are comfortable my little guy. I’m very happy and will be totally and fully making the switch from pampers to Huggies based on these reasons!

reviews.name: Kelljodie
reviews.title: The best diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2025
reviews.review: The best diaper. The only diaper that had held up through four children. Lasts all night no leaks. Great fit and stretchy waistband. Doesn’t irritate skin or have any funky chemical smells. No rashes. More affordable than other Huggies and still work well.

reviews.name: Mello
reviews.title: Great Huggies Brand
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2025
reviews.review: Great diapers for my 6 month old. Comfortable. Stretchy. Does not leak! Great price as well.

reviews.name: Book reader
reviews.title: No leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2024
reviews.review: I was surprised to find these at this price. They are prefect for my 17lb grandson. They don't leak and are well made. They have a cute design on the. Easy to use.

reviews.name: Kristan
reviews.title: Great diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2025
reviews.review: I have tried so many brands and my son leaks through them all. Huggies are the only ones that will get him through the night without leaking. He’s not had any skin issues and they fit snug without being too tight. The material inside the diaper is soft

reviews.name: The Crawfords
reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2025
reviews.review: My daughter was greatfull. Skin protection no leeks does not have to worry about a wet bed

reviews.name: Shelbie
reviews.title: better than pampers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2025
reviews.review: Preferred over pamper any day! They do not leak like pampers.

reviews.name: Chelsie
reviews.title: Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2025
reviews.review: Great price

reviews.name: Emily
reviews.title: Reliable!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2025
reviews.review: These have been my go-to diapers for the last 6 months. I find they have great moisture retention, hold in blowouts well, and do not irritate my baby’s skin. This is a repeat purchase for me!

reviews.name: john hancock
reviews.title: 🌟👶 A Diaper That Nails Comfort and Dryness! A Must-Have for New Parents! 👶🌟
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2023
reviews.review:
I can't help but rave about the Huggies Snug & Dry Baby Diapers – they've truly revolutionized my diapering experience as a new parent. With the arrival of our precious bundle of joy, we embarked on a mission to find the perfect diaper that combines comfort, protection, and a good night's sleep for both our baby and us. Huggies' Size 1 Snug & Dry Diapers proved to be an absolute game-changer, and here's why:

🌈 Unbeatable Comfort: From the moment we slipped these diapers on our little one, we could see and feel the difference. The gentle, soft material is incredibly kind to our baby's sensitive skin. No more worrying about diaper rashes or irritation – these diapers pamper our baby's bottom like a soft cloud.

💧 Superior Dryness: What truly sets Huggies Snug & Dry apart is their remarkable ability to keep our baby's skin dry, even during extended wear. The innovative design quickly wicks away moisture, leaving our baby's skin feeling fresh and dry. Overnight leaks? Not a chance with these diapers! We've had leak-free nights that translate to better sleep for the entire family.

👍 Secure Fit: The snug fit of these diapers is commendable. With flexible elastic waistbands and well-fitting leg cuffs, we're confident in our baby's freedom to move without compromising on leak protection. Plus, the adjustable fasteners ensure a custom fit that grows with our baby, saving us the hassle of constant size changes.

🌬️ Breathable Design: Huggies has truly mastered the art of crafting a diaper that keeps our baby's skin well-ventilated. The thoughtful airflow channels prevent unwanted humidity, contributing to a more comfortable experience overall.

🌟 Parent-Friendly: As parents, we also appreciate the convenience of the wetness indicator – it's like having a personal moisture alert system! The ease of disposal with the secure tab closure makes changing diapers a breeze, even on the go.

🌟 Eco-Conscious Choice: It's comforting to know that Huggies is committed to the environment. These diapers are free from harsh chemicals and are responsibly crafted, making them an eco-conscious choice for our little one's well-being and the planet's health.

In conclusion, Huggies Snug & Dry Baby Diapers in Size 1 have undoubtedly exceeded our expectations. These diapers aren't just essential baby gear; they're a parenting lifeline that offers supreme comfort, unbeatable dryness, and lasting peace of mind. As a proud member of Amazon Vine, I couldn't recommend these diapers enough to fellow parents. Invest in Huggies – your baby's comfort and happiness await! 👶🌟🌈

reviews.name: Max
reviews.title: The best diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2024
reviews.review:
I've had experience using Huggies Snug and Dry Diapers , and here's what I can share:

1. Absorbency: Huggies Snug and Dry diapers have excellent absorbency. They do a great job of keeping your little one dry, even during overnight use. The diapers have a special Leak Lock System that helps prevent leaks and keeps your baby comfortable.

2. Fit and Comfort: These diapers have a snug fit that provides a secure and comfortable experience for your baby. The stretchy waistband and adjustable tabs ensure a proper fit, allowing your little one to move freely while staying protected.

3. Wetness Indicator: Huggies Snug and Dry diapers feature a wetness indicator, which is a handy feature for busy parents. The indicator changes color when the diaper is wet, making it easy to know when it's time for a change without having to check constantly.

4. Affordable: Huggies Snug and Dry diapers are reasonably priced, which is great for families on a budget. They offer good quality at an affordable price point, making them a popular choice for many parents.

5. Availability: You can find Huggies Snug and Dry diapers in various sizes, ranging from newborn to larger sizes for older babies.

Overall, I've had a positive experience with Huggies Snug and Dry diapers. They provide excellent absorbency, a comfortable fit, and are reasonably priced. Give them a try and see how they work for you and your little one! Happy diapering! 👶🍼

reviews.name: Stly
reviews.title: Comparing Huggies Diapers Versions. Snug & Dry 12 Hour+ are the Best
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2016
reviews.review:
Comparing Huggies Snug & Dry 12 hour +, the regular Huggies Snug & Dry, Huggies Overnights, and Huggies Little Movers.

I have 2 children and have used Huggies or Pampers diapers for the entirety of their diapering needs. Here are my thoughts on all things Huggies diapers:

Huggies Snug & Dry 12 hour+ diapers: 4 stars. Bottom line: GO WITH THESE ONES! These diapers are great! My child can wear them for hours and they do not leak or feel damp on the outside like other diapers. To me this is the most important factor in a diaper. We use these diapers day and night, (again, because they last through the night without leaking) which is cheaper than buying the Huggies Overnights usually by about 45%. Of course, at some point all diapers will leak, but my kids can stay in these all night (usually for about 13 hours) and during the day I change them usually in about 5 or 6 hour intervals--not because they need a new diaper at that point but because I like to change them before they get to that point. More liquid in more often means more liquid out more often. So the higher frequency of changes during the day is not surprising. In addition, they fit well, and the tabs are easy to undo and redo for adjusting to just the right snugness. There's no chaffing. They have Disney characters on them, which my kids like, and circles that show the size in the motif as well; so it's easy to identify the right size when switching to a different size.

I'm docking 1 star because it is a little hard to tell on the packaging whether they are the regular Huggies Snug & Dry or the Huggies Snug & Dry 12 Hour +. You have to look at the picture of the box on amazon.com to verify, and the box Amazon sends usually looks totally different than the box in the picture. But, after years of ordering them, I am happy to day the right product had always been inside the box.

Huggies Snug & Dry (regular, NOT 12 hour +): 2 stars because that's about how long they last until they leak. They do not feel damp to the touch on the outside of the diaper which is nice, but the bang for your buck is not worth it in terms of number diapers and laundry detergent due to the increase in loads of laundry caused by leaky diapers.

Huggies Overnights: 3 stars because of price. They are too expensive. The Huggies Snug & Dry 12 hour + do the same job for significantly less money. The Overnights are true to their advertising though. They last through the night and fit well without leaking.

Huggies Little Movers: 2 stars. I used these diapers with my first child for about their first 3 months of life. They often felt damp to the touch and had to be changed quite frequently. I would give them 1 star but their redeeming feature is the little line down the middle that changes color when your baby wets them, which let's you know they're wet. I appreciated this feature when I was really tired those forest few months and so was my baby. It took some of the guesswork out. By the time I had my second child I only remembered liking this feature and not how much I disliked the dampness that I tried them again. Upon using then with my 2nd child I was more experienced and did not find the changing color line feature do incredibly important. In fact we didn't finish using the pack we bought before switching to Snug & Dry 12 hour +.

If you found this review helpful, please click the button saying so. Thank you!

So… don’t pay more for these! But if they’re the same price per count then try them out for yourself. Same goes for any of the numerous types of Huggies.

reviews.name: K. Bug
reviews.title: Quality has been slipping the past year or so
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2015
reviews.review: I've been using huggies on my kids, all of them, since they were born. I tried a few other brands and was terribly disappointed in the quality. My kids were leaking through on a daily basis. I switched my youngest back to huggies, and I have noticed recently that the quality has been slipping. The past few boxes especially. My youngest has still been soaking through every few nights, and there is not all that much in the diaper. It seems like the diapers are just a little less absorbent than before. Nothing as terrible as luvs or store brand, but certainly not like they used to be. I tried the little movers and they are basically just pull ups with a different design, so I'd rather use these and get more diapers for the money. My little guy adores Mickey mouse, so he loves the design, but I would love for Huggies to go back to the good quality they were when my other two were in diapers, which was only a few years ago, my oldest is only 6. Like I said, they are still way better than other brands, but I am sad to see the quality slipping. I am having a lot more issues with the top of the diaper coming apart and the gel stuff leaking into his pajamas. He is within the weight limit and again, there is not that much in the diaper for it to be exploding. Kimberly Clark doesn't want to replace them, I had a box replaced years ago and that put me on the list of problematic customers apparently. I called and the person on the other line seemed annoyed and told me to buy a bigger size. The next size is much too big and stuff leaks out because of that.

reviews.name: The Reber Family
reviews.title: Great product at a discount price.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2013
reviews.review:
These are really great diapers for the price. They are very absorbent and hold everything in really well. As with all diapers, there are blowouts that you just can't prevent from getting everywhere, but these diapers limited the mess a lot more than any other diapers we have used.
There were only two issues that we had: if your baby sleeps the majority of the night like my son does, then these get really weighed down throughout the night. Most mornings he would wake up with pee soaked through his PJs because the diaper just couldn't hold everything through the night. I don't know if my son just pees more than usual or not, but the problem was easily fixed by buying a relatively small package of Huggies Overnites from Walmart for night time. The second issue we had with these was that they just aren't as soft as Huggies Little movers or Snugglers. My son has very sensitive skin so if we didn't change the diaper soon enough after it getting wet he developed a chaffing rash. This didn't happen with little movers. That being said though, they are great diapers for his sensitive skin as long as we get him changed often. They don't have a ton of perfume in them like all other brands out there, which is great. In fact, I don't notice any kind of added smell to them right out of the package.

All things considered, these are great diapers and they are the only ones that we buy for our son. He is a skinny boy and all other diapers just don't seem to fit him right. We have tried every diaper out there and Huggies are definitely our favorite. Great buy for the right price. And the subscribe and save delivery to our door each month makes it that much more worth it.
