reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: No Leaks and Issues with Huggies chemicals have resolved!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2014
reviews.review: I have been using Huggies snug and dry for over a year. I originally used Pampers Swaddlers and Pampers sensitive for the first 10 months when my son was born. I used these diapers as a precaution because I have very sensitive skin and so does my son. I never had a diaper rash except two times when he had something sweet. So I live and learn. I decided to try Huggies in an attempt to save $10+ on each case. Well, I find the diapers are not quite as soft, however, the diapers work well. Just fyi, I do believe the chemicals in these diapers changed at some point during last years' production. Last year, my son had a few bad rashes back to back from one case of diapers I recieved from Amazon (I always order my wipes and diapers only from Amazon). So I started researching and noticed other parents complaining of skin burns and the diaper gel absorbent sticking to their child. I never had this issue before and decided to buy Aquaphor to protect my son's bottom. This saved my son's butt! Luckily, the small bleeding spots healed within a few days! I used Aquaphor all over his body until I finished this case without any more issues. I decided to try one more case without the use of Aquaphor and if the previous issue occurred again I would stop using Huggies wipes and diapers all together and switch to cloth diapers. However, to my surprise I have not used Aquaphor since and the Huggies snug and dry seem to have returned to the previous materials without any peeling and chemical burns. Very happy to have a diaper that is economical and provides good protection without leaks!

reviews.name: Sarah
reviews.title: Almost there... but thigh fit is an issue, resulting in lots of messes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2019
reviews.review:
I grew up with 3 younger brothers, and Huggies was what my mom always went with and what my older brother uses for his son, so I decided "tried and true" should be my biggest decision maker when it came to choosing initial diapers for my first baby.
Things I like: No smell. I love that these diapers have no chemically smell like some brands (Luvs).
The elastic back. I love this detail! I was surprised to find that other popular brands (Pampers, Luvs) do not have this elastic back to hold messes in.
Things I don't like:
I wanted this to be my go-to diaper, however, I have had nothing but issues with the size of the leg holes. I don't know if my baby just has small thighs, or what, but I have had too many poopy explosions out the legs for Huggies Snug and Dry to remain my go to diaper. Nothing changed when I went from newborn to size 1, either, so I have to go with design issue. This is the only diaper that I have had this particular issue of leg explosions.
I'm not ready to say farewell to Huggies, though, and I will be giving their Little Snugglers style another try after receiving a small package as a gift and loving them. Once I've used the Snugglers style for a few weeks, I will decide from there whether Huggies will be my favorite diaper brand or if I need to keep searching.

reviews.name: Rui Sun
reviews.title: Best day time diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2020
reviews.review:
One star off for price hike

Finally find the best day time diapers. It reaches the balance of value and quality. Usually we change diaper every 3 hours and the surface of diaper is still dry and comfy. There are diapers of much better quality for sure. But I'm not willing to spend 50 cents per diaper.

Belows are reviews of the diapers I have tried -

Luv: Just ok. Good price. Absorbent. But after 3 hours the surface of the diaper is slightly wet. If your baby is sensitive or prone to rashes, pass it.

Parents Choice: no good. Very good price. Not absorbent. The surface of the diaper is always wet. Be nice to your babies and don't buy.

Pampers swaddler: no good. Very expensive. Just slightly better than parents choice. Don't understand why it is so popular.

Cuties: very cheap but no good. The surface of the diaper is always wet.

Mama Bear: super good quality. Can last longer than Snug and dry. Slightly more expensive if you don't mind. Sad Amazon discontinued it.

reviews.name: Mayra Marrero
reviews.title: Frágil
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.review: Se llenan enseguida. Tienes que estar muy pendiente de cambiarlos para evitar derrames. Si tu bebé duerme toda la noche, sabrás que amanecerá mojado aunque lo hayas cambiado antes de irse a la cama.

reviews.name: Marie
reviews.title: Kinda small compared to Pampers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2018
reviews.review:
I like the price most of all.Otherwise these are a bunch of cheap diapers and we needed a lot of diapers.
So when the doctor told us that we could stop buying expensive formula for our guy I decided to splurge and buy a package of Pampers. We'll still buy Huggies, for the daycare. He goes through a lot of diapers at the daycare as I suspect they are changing them out more frequently than we do (yes we're horrible parents) because I swear they keep asking us to bring in more diapers. So Huggies fits the bill for when you need a lot of diapers that have that wetness indicator.
However, another problem I have with these is that they seem to fit smaller than the same size of Pampers. We use Pampers for nightime and those seem to provide more butt coverage than the Huggies of the same size. He came home one day from the daycare wearing a size 6 Huggies (not ours) when we had provided the daycare with size 5 of another brand. As far as I'm concerned he's a size 5, and fits Pampers and the Costco Kirland brand in those sizes, but we're getting size 6 in Huggies next time.

reviews.name: Stephanie
reviews.title: Good economic buy, better huggies options but much more costly
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2020
reviews.review:
These are a great economy diapers. Minimal leakages on the legs (common back blowouts though!) and does an overall good job for non-crawling babies.

Best used for 1-10 month olds. After that, there tend to be more blowouts and leaks as they become more active. This is especially true once they hit 18 months or so.

I have actually used these primarily on and off for my now 4 girls in the last 6 years.

We used them up to size 5 for naptime and overnight protection for my 4 year old and 3 year old but were having almost nightly leakthroughs. We also had a REALLY bad batch just recently during covid where basicallu every diaper ripped and got "diaper snow" with all the girls who used them
(my 1, 3, 4 year old used the same size - the youngest all day, the olders just for naps)

All in all, a good economic purchase, but the Huggies little movers or the Huggies slip-ons which I have now are definitely are luxury and a great buy when on sale!

reviews.name: Samantha
reviews.title: Huggies vs. Pampers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2017
reviews.review:
I have a love hate relationship with these diapers. I will definitely say that they are not my favorite, but they work fine for us. I switch between Huggies and Pampers depending on what I can get a good price on. The newborn Huggies seem to fit bigger than the newborn Pampers. At this point, my baby is still in newborn size so I can't speak for the other sizes. I like these Huggies Snug and Dry Diapers because to me they're easier to put on than the Pampers. I also hate them because every time I take the tabs off, they seem to end up touching the inside of the diaper before I can fold it up. I can't tell you have many times I have ended up with poop on the tabs. My husband also says that they smell. It does seem like the moment they are wet, you can smell the pee.

Note: For some reason when I ordered a regular new box, they did not come with a wetness indicator (it does not show the wetness indicator in the pictures, which is fine), but I've ordered a couple of open box and they both came with the wetness indicators.

reviews.name: RJM
reviews.title: Decent diapers at a good price
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2018
reviews.review: These diapers are good and do their job but I didn't love them. I did like the fit, they are good for chunky babes, lots of width and room for chunky thighs. They would've never worked for my first who was long and lean, but they fit my second chunky little guy well. They also hold a decent amount of pee and no blowouts with them for us. The reasons I take away a star is that they aren't super soft, they are a bit more paper feeling, similar to a generic diaper like Up and Up. I also didn't love how thick they are, then they get wet, they swell quite a bit. The leg gathers could also be slightly tighter as when my baby was on the lower weight for the size they seemed too loose. Overall, they are decent diapers for their price point. In my opinion they are slightly better than a generic and a good price with subscribe and save. In the end, I prefer the softness and fit of the Little Snugglers and am willing to pay a bit more but will keep these in mind for sure if I'm trying to save money.

reviews.name: Sam P
reviews.title: I'm a fan of the Little Snugglers but these work fine and they're cheaper too
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2016
reviews.review:
The brand name and quality is there. This type works just fine for my baby boy. But if you're a first time parent, I would recommend buying the one with the blue indicator. They can be a bit more pricer but it's easier to visibly notice, especially when you don't have your sense of wet diaper touch perfected yet. Otherwise, this diaper works just fine and comes in bulk size you typically can't find in your local stores (walmart, target). One thing that I have been noticing with my son and not with my daughter is that urine tends to build up in the front (for obvious reasons) and that can create a strong ammonia (pee) smell. The odd thing is hat I've only been noticing this with Huggies...

As a side note, when you subscribe and save, diapers can be as low as 13 cents/count, which is great. But in my experience, you can get them cheaper if you use a combination of store + manufacture coupons and promotions in-stores. That's only if you have the time to do so. If you're like me, buying diapers online with the occasional coupon saves you time and you know you are getting a solid deal.

reviews.name: Amber Gribbins
reviews.title: They work
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2022
reviews.review: I recommend the little movers more but if you can't buy any I I recommend these there almost leak proof with my boy an with my girl there more leak proof boys tend to we on the front an sock it where girls we the bottom so it gets the front an back not just the front so if you have a boy little movers is the way to go

reviews.name: RK Behera
reviews.title: This diaper is ok!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2023
reviews.review: The diaper I used for my 1.5 years baby and it is ok , not that great compared to Pampers. Not very convenient to use but overall it is ok.

reviews.name: Heather Coleman
reviews.title: Absorb and Contain -Sz4
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2016
reviews.review: I normally use a different brand but a 3 is too small and most 4 are too big, so we are in an odd fit phase. Huggies Snug and Dry are the only ones that currently fit. We had purchase several types/brands at the grocery to "test". These work great for us and we have not had any leaks/blowouts. The closure tabs are so wide compared to others and that is great for extra grip. The box that I received the diaper has a blue interior strip. Most diapers begin to get thinner as the size goes up so no surprise that these are not as thick as previous sizes. I do not care for the character designs as I am not big on many of the Disney creations, but that's not a factor just nit picking. We have not had any skin issues with these though he doesn't have sensitive skin. They do not absorb like a previous brand we used but we change asap so this doesn't affect us too much. There is no indicator strip as with smaller sizes but at 15 months he pats when he goes so we are well aware. The pricing is fine, I use subscribe and save and amazon mom.

reviews.name: Chantale Sallit
reviews.title: Good
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.review: Rarely leaks, holds really well

reviews.name: The Lucianos
reviews.title: the thing I really dislike about huggies is that EVERYTHING goes to the front
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2017
reviews.review: the thing I really dislike about huggies is that EVERYTHING goes to the front ... the back will be completely dry and all the pee will collect to the front, I know it's not just from having a son because I have one boy and one girl and when they both used pampers the whole diaper would fill instead of just one area. These are my favorite huggies by far because they aren't so POOFY half the time I couldn't tell if he was full or needed to be changed cause his diapers always were just thick in genearl. These diapers are REALLY thin, like REALLY thin. So, if you are one of those parents that lets your kid walk around with saggy diapers for too long, this isn't the diaper for you, they will start to leak once they get full. Also, when he's been poopy I can't smell it. I don't know if it just masks the stink really well, this is great because I don't smell a stinky butt and everyone else doesn't either, but I go to change his diaper and wonder, "Son, how long have you been poopy for? I couldn't even smell you!?"

reviews.name: Amber
reviews.title: Not knock off diapers. Good price.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2018
reviews.review: Before purchasing this product, I read the reviews, especially 1 star reviews and negative responses from previous buyers. I purchased the diapers with shear caution. At the same time, I purchased a case of the same diapers from my usual department store. I opened both at the same time and can verify that with this particular purchase of this item, these are the same Huggies brand that I purchase and use routinely for my 9 month old. These diapers aren't knock offs and carry the same print as the ones that I compared them to. Huggies brand are the only brand diapers that don't break down my daughter''s skin. These diapers can and do leak if the elastic part of the leg isn't properly placed in the crease of the leg. Otherwise, I am able yo use these overnight for my daughter with very few wtting incidents. Taking price into consideration, this is a deal. In the local department stores, the largest box of Huggies you can purchase in size 5 is 96 count. I will purchase again and will recommend Huggies to all parents.

reviews.name: EG1234
reviews.title: Great price, very good leak protection
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2022
reviews.review: We’ve tried a variety of different diapers at this point - Pampers, Luvs, Huggies, Coterie, Honest, etc. Most recently we tried the Coterie diapers, which are very pricey. We had high hopes, but they were not nearly as good as Huggies at containing liquids/leaks. Huggies aren’t perfect (we still have some blowouts) but they’re better than others we have tried and an excellent value.

reviews.name: Alejandro
reviews.title: The inside is blue
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2021
reviews.review: Love it, my son loves them, he hates dirty diapers they make him really cranky but not with these. However the insides are blue which is not advertised. And where that might not matter to most, I prefer to be able to see if my babys pee is normal colored and what not. He's had a UTI before and the only reason I noticed before it became serious was because his pee was an off color. Food for thought. Gave it a 4star review because it should be advertised that the inside is blue so you can avoid them if you need it to be white.

reviews.name: Patricia Lee
reviews.title: Impressed. Will stay with this brand
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2022
reviews.review: Overly I feel like these are the best diapers for my baby. I used the huggies snuggies for newborn then transitioned to these. The only thing I've had are a few pee leaks during the night because let's face it im sleep deproved and didn't make sure the back was fully up without a small fold. I just bought level 2 and will stick with the brand. My baby had several blowouts in the other 5 brands I've tried

reviews.name: HENDEL MERGUI
reviews.title: Leak free good quality diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2023
reviews.review:
I’m still trying these Out but so far they’ve proven to be very absorbent, I like the quality of the diaper. They don’t leave anything on baby’s skin like white pieces. they’re not the cheapest but they are good quality and that’s very important
My baby has had rashes with other diaper companies but she didn’t have a rash since we started trying these one out

reviews.name: LeeLee
reviews.title: Great product but not enough. Liked the 144 count better
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2020
reviews.review: I like that huggies is very reliable as a diaper for children who go often. However, I only rated it 4 stars because before I had my son, there was an older version of this product that had more diapers in the pack and was a reasonable price. I don't know why they discontinued their larger pack and I'm finding that they did this across the board with all of their diapers. I feel it was bad taste that they did this during a pandemic when people are finding it harder to find much needed products at reasonable prices. To me it's greedy of the Huggies corporation to make less diapers in a pack and charge more for it. It's corporate greed at its finest and they clearly didn't have their customers in mind when they made their decision.

reviews.name: Tu-Anh Vu
reviews.title: Good value for money but not best quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2020
reviews.review: I'm a Mom who shops around for a good deal when it comes to diapers. We started out with the Target brand diaper when my baby was first born. Then we tried Pampers when someone gave us a pack. It was definitely a lot better so I used that. But when I was ready to buy the next size Pampers was not on sale so I gave this a try. It's definitely better than the Target ones we started out with but I think Pampers is still better. Also, even though the size guide is exactly the same for weight but I find this to be a little smaller than Pampers. So if you buy this you might want to buy the bigger size if your baby is at the boarder-line between the 2 weight ranges.

reviews.name: Darlene Graham
reviews.title: Not able to return
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2023
reviews.review: I wasn't able to return them but I donated them to a foster home Instead so I guess all is good

reviews.name: PK
reviews.title: IMO - better than Costco diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2018
reviews.review:
We always used to get Costco brand diapers - came in bulk and was cheap. Then a friend told us about amazon subscriptions and just gave us a box of Huggies snug n dry because they forgot to change the diaper size for their next delivery. Well... now we have the amazon subscription for Huggies snug n dry and we love it!

It’s more absorbent than Costco brand for sure. We used it day and night for a while until my son started to tank up on milk before bed and just make a total mess at night. So these are great day diapers!! We use the Huggies nighttime now for night and it has been a hit or miss on leaks. I think it may be because he is a wild sleeper, and some of the clothes I put on him are a little too tight or we may have the wrong size diaper now. Still trying to figure it out..

reviews.name: HLMGR2018
reviews.title: Did the job!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2023
reviews.review: Definitely got the job done and 1 year old approved!

reviews.name: Brittainey Spencer
reviews.title: Not soft like Huggies Little Snugglers but they are decent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2016
reviews.review: I have a 2 month old baby who was used strictly pampers swaddlers for the first few weeks until I was given Luvs then after I used those up I purchased Huggies Little Swaddlers and those were amazing!! I didnt have one blow out or leak out with baby at all. So when i found this deal on the Huggies Snug and Dry with my prime i received a discount plus i had a coupon for downloading the Amazon app I paid .14/diaper on this deal which was outstanding for what i thought was going to be just as good as Huggies Little Snugglers but they arent. They are okay.... rougher feeling to them... when you touch them they arent soft they are the kind of material you can hear crunchy kind of sound. What is a plus though is these do have the pocketed back like the Huggies Little Snugglers... not as good of quality but still decent. So I rate 4* for price and pocketed back feature. Plus the Mickey & Minnie designs are adorable.

reviews.name: A Wasser
reviews.title: Amazing except for bunching up in back
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2018
reviews.review:
Pros: they don’t leak! That is the most important factor in choosing a diaper in my humble opinion. Newborns have more sensitive skin which is why I won’t buy off brands for them. These diapers don’t irritate my baby’s skin.
They have a wetness indicator which is very helpful especially since newborn diapers don’t smell so much.
If you care, they have really cute Disney graphics. Not like it’s a dealbreaker to me, but it’s a nice bonus.
Cons: they are kind of bunched up in the back which clearly does a great job at not leaking, however, when you want to change your baby’s diaper, it immediately folds up which makes it hard to change diaper. Also I, if you like to use the tabs to close diaper before throwing out, as we do, and it bunched up, you can’t do that because it’s covered in.... yknow, diaper stuff. I took off one star for that. Otherwise, it’s perfect!

reviews.name: Ifteker Uddin
reviews.title: Good amount 👍
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2022
reviews.review: Product was good but packaging was bad. I am disappointed with the packaging. My box was damaged and inside the diaper packets were ripped. But I didn't return because I needed the diaper urgently for my 4m old. But product is good. Quality is not like huggies little snuggles .it's absorbency is 3.5 out 5.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Excellent diaper, but sizing is off
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2020
reviews.review:
So I tried a few diapers, pampers, reg huggies, Kirkland, honest, and these huggies are definitely the best. They’re far more absorbent than the pampers, and they are much softer, comfortable for the baby with a nice stretchy waist on the back. I’m not sure why some people complained about diaper rashes, because my daughter has sensitive skin and she never broke out from these. In fact, diaper rashes are caused by soiled diapers not being changed often enough, and not actually the diaper itself.

Anyway, with that said, the recommended size based on weight is way off! My daughter’s butt at 16 lbs could barely fit the diaper, and that’s when she started having blowouts, EVERYDAY! So just be aware.. and size according to your lo’s dimensions, not weight.

reviews.name: MarilynRoe86
reviews.title: Eh, they are okay, but not my first choice
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2020
reviews.review: I want to love these because I know a lot of people do, but for me, they just don’t quite make the mark. Absorbency seems okay, but it doesn’t take much for the diapers to leak through onto clothing. Stretch also seems to be an issue, either they sag in the front or they move around too much. I’ve tried true size, a size up and a size down and no matter what I tried to remedy the situation, it didn’t fix the issues. They aren’t a bad value for the money at first, but we’ve found we have to change them more than we would with other diapers.

reviews.name: Melissa B
reviews.title: Bring back the Mickey AND Minnie Design!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2017
reviews.review: I love the Huggies Snug & Dry! EVERY baby is different & these may work better for some then others. My son could not wear Huggies he would just pee out. My daughter on the other hand this diaper is all she can wear since she would pee out of Huggies major name brand competitor. I love that they still offer a pee indicator even though we just moved up to a size 4! The ONLY reason I am giving these a 4 star is because they switched the design to a black & white mickey only! The old ones were red & blue & it included MINNIE. It seemed unisex...now it’s just plain boyish looking to me! I don’t see a change in the way they are made since they switched but I’d prefer the unisex ones...especially with how much we spend on these things!

reviews.title: Lack of blow out protection

reviews.review: Wish I realized these do not have the flap in the back to prevent blowouts before i bought this. My 2 month old had more blowouts than with our little snugglers

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2018
reviews.review:
Not sure what the real difference is, but the Pooh Bear huggies are better than the Mickey Mouse. Mickey Mouse, we had a few issues with poop leaking in SMALL amounts out the side. But never had that issue with the Pooh Bear version.

Otherwise, Huggies seem to be the best for us. We tried multiple brands: Pampers and off brands (Sam's Club, Target and BuyBuy Baby), and we ended up sticking with Huggies.

If you have a Costco near buy, and a Costco membership, about once a month they have the Huggies on sell for the same price as the Costco brand diapers. The only downside, is that I've never found the Newborn size at Costco and had to resort to Amazon.

We used these from 6lbs 9oz to 9lbs before moving to Size 1.

Once, I came out all down my blouse and onto the loveseat, and we just laughed it off. But I was home and not out and about. Poop has come out in the carseat and highchair, and I am a little peeved because I have bought nicer products with this second baby and the highchair was 2 days old..

reviews.name: CGM
reviews.title: Worth the money
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2017
reviews.review: I purchased these diapers in a size 2 after reading very mixed reviews. My reason for the purchase of these is because I was hoping for a slightly smaller diaper than the swaddlers size 2. I love pampers swaddlers but my babies are in between a size 1 & 2. My son leaks out of swaddlers size 2 a little at night we have to overlap the straps because they are a little big. We do the same with these diapers but so far he hasn't leaked out. My only reason for not giving a 5 star is the same reason I don't love any of the huggies diapers. It doesn't open up as easy as the swaddlers when trying to put under the baby. It also starts to fall down a little after a pee when my baby is crawling and moving around which pampers doesn't.

reviews.title: Huggies diapers are not inexpensive and the last two economy ...

reviews.review:

It is not often these days that businesses truly stand by their product and admit mistakes. I would buy from them again because good customer service is hard to come by.

original review: Huggies diapers are not inexpensive and the last two economy boxes I have purchased have had major flaws. The most recent one has holes on the outside of the diapers right in the middle of the bottom so when pee touches the diaper the silicone just pours out and gets everywhere! I have to duct tape the holes so I can at least use them. The box before this one had seriously faulty Velcro straps. One out of every two diapers, at least, had straps falling off. I hope to never have to purchase these diapers again.

There is a cost savings in the Huggies and I like their rewards app way better than Pampers, but in overall quality, I think Pampers do better for active kids.

reviews.name: JennK
reviews.title: Ok, but not my favorite - even among comparable diapers.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2018
reviews.review:
Intro: After five years and three kiddos I have used a variety of diapers including Pampers (Swaddles and Baby Dry), Huggies (Little Snugglers and Snug &Dry), Honest, Target, and Luvs. I personally only bought Honest, Target (Up&Up), Babyganics and Luvs a couple times because I didn’t like the feel (Honest diapers and Babyganics are very stiff and papery) and absorption. That being said, I had found that Pampers and Huggies had ‘premium’ (Pampers Swaddlers and Huggies Little Snugglers) and ‘regular’ (Pampers Baby Dry and Huggies Snug & Dry) classes of diapers. I have compared these four different diapers - all in my current purchasing size (Size 5).

Pampers Swaddlers vs. Huggies Little Snugglers:
FEEL: I love the cloth-like feel of both these diapers. Huggies were slightly softer than the Pampers, but only a tiny bit.
WETNES INDICATOR: These both have the wetness indicator line (shown in yellow) which turn blue when the diaper is wet. This is not a necessary diaper function, but can be slightly helpful when doing a quick diaper check. Although, the line tends to almost immediately turn blue once the diaper is applied - but not necessarily enough to change the diaper.
TABS: The Huggies diapers have better tabs - the entire tab is ‘sticky’ allowing for a quick stick on a wiggly baby.
COVERAGE: The Pampers diapers seem slightly larger overall, although not by much.
“ELASTIC”: The leg ‘elastic’ on the Pampers is wider, allowing for more material to catch a ‘leg leak’ - but the Huggies diapers are better for back-top leaks because of the waist ‘elastic’. These ‘elastic’ areas help the diapers fit and stay in place while keeping any leaks at bay.
PATTERN: Both Pampers Swaddlers and Huggies Snugglers are fairly muted diapers, Huggies being slightly less noticeable under light colored clothing.

Pampers Baby Dry vs. Huggies Snug & Dry:
FEEL: Pampers Baby Dry is much softer than the Huggies Snug & Dry diapers the Huggies diaper is very paper-like and this is a major reason I’d prefer not to buy these diapers.
WETNESS INDICATOR: Pampers Baby Dry doesn’t have a wetness indicator line like the Huggies Snug & Dry.
TABS: The tabs on the Pampers Baby Dry are not as big as the Huggies Snug & Dry; HOWEVER, the Huggies tab area is very narrow and thus seems more ‘uncomfortable’ when the diaper is on. Pampers tab is smaller but the design of the tab area seems much better.
COVERAGE: Pampers Baby Dry seems significantly larger than the Huggies Snug & Dry.
“ELASTIC”: Pampers Baby Dry doesn’t have the back ‘elastic’ so the Huggies Snug & Dry is much better with back-waist elastic and the leg elastic afraid also wider than the Pampers. Huggies is much better at keeping leaks at bay with the ‘elastic’ areas.
PATTERN: pampers Baby Dry are a much better diaper visually. They are a light blue and white color, whereas the Huggies Snug & Dry are a bold black and white which is easy to see under light colored clothing.

Overall:
Softness (most soft to least soft): Huggies Snugglers, Pampers Swaddlers, Pampers Baby Dry, Huggies Snug & Dry.
Wetness Indicator: Tie between Pampers Swaddlers, Huggies Snugglers, Huggies Snug & Dry - Pampers Baby Dry doesn’t have the indicator.
Coverage: Pampers Swaddlers, Huggies Snugglers (because of back waist ‘elastic’), Pampers Baby Dry, and Huggies Snug & Dry.
Pattern: Huggies Snugglers, Pampers Swaddlers, Pampers Baby Dry, Huggies Snug & Dry.

NOTE: I don’t seem to notice an absorbency level difference between any of these diapers, therefore I didn’t compare this aspect.

If money wasn’t an option I would probably buy Huggies Little Snugglers. They are the softest, stretchiest, good coverage. My choice on the slightly cheaper diaper level would be Pampers Baby Dry because they are softer and have a better visual appeal.

*** Please let me know if you found this review helpful but clicking the “helpful” button below***

reviews.name: Sha
reviews.title: Decent for the price

reviews.review: Huggies are not the same as they were 12yrs ago when I had my first child. They are now cheaply made and fall part. They also sag and run big. I do however like that they don’t have any smell to them. The design is also cute.

reviews.name: Laritza
reviews.title: 🙃
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2024
reviews.review: No tienen mucha calidad pero son economicos, para el precio estan bien

reviews.name: sirgeb27
reviews.title: Look at the reviews carefully
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2013
reviews.review:
The reviews/ranking of these Huggies diapers at the time of this writing are somewhat misleading at first glance, as reviews of the diaper prior to the design change are taken into account in the overall rankings (note the ratio of good reviews to bad reviews before and after 2013). You'll see the most helpful review is from 2006! So please when looking over the reviews, I would suggest giving the most weight to those done since Spring of 2013 as those are actually reviews of the item that you are buying. Maybe Amazon can fix this with their review system, by purging/archiving the older and no longer relevant reviews that are for the old design?

Anyway, it appears that Huggies has decided to have it's 'New Coke' moment and mess with a good thing by redesigning it's diaper at some point in the Spring of 2013. These diapers, as claimed by Huggies, are now thinner but still just as absorbent, which does not appear to be the case for my family or a number of the other families that have posted their experience here since the change was made; they're definitely thinner, but no longer as absorbent based off of our experience. We had been happily continuing to buy Huggies for the past 20 months, despite the price difference compared to other brands. We have stuck with Huggies because it worked for us. However, now that Huggies has forced change on us (a change for the worse in our opinion- yes Huggies rep: we will be in contact with you on your website), we are now in full experimentation mode and like other subscribers will be looking to other brands to get back the quality we were used to from Huggies. Unfortunately, at the time of this review we do not have an alternate suggestion for you. But if we find something that works for us, we'll update this review.

Update (12/27/2013):
I have bumped the rating of this review from 1 to 3 stars. It turns out that comparable diapers from various club stores are roughly as expensive or even more-so depending on the current set of coupons available. Plus, we got used to the forced design change (we had 100+ diapers we couldn't just throw out or return) and adapted our routine based off of the performance of the new diapers. In the end we stuck with Huggies. The diaper seem better now than our initial assessment, though I'm still not happy with how the diapers got introduced. Most likely, parents reading this review are not even aware there was a design change at this point, but it is still good to note that the post-Spring 2013 reviews will be most helpful to you (unless a future design change renders these reviews obsolete as well!).

reviews.name: Buyer1234
reviews.title: Not as good and I am a Huggies fan
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2019
reviews.review:
I am a huge Huggies fan. Been using them since my baby was 2 or 3 months old. She came out of the Hospital with the other main brand and I wasn’t going to switch if it wasn’t for running out and the local store being out of stock. So, I tried this brand and never looked back. It just never spilled, no blow ups, nothing and I constantly had blow ups with Pampers. So, I guess all this time (she is 27 months now) I just have been lucky to have been buying the better kind. Decided to try this cheaper version, with 170 something diapers per box. Cheaper is never as good or better, right? Duh?! 🤦🏻‍♀️ It is 6 dollars less than the other one that comes with 120 something. Figured I would have to change more often, but not that it would fall apart. The beads just fall apart and kinda decompose on the baby once they get wet. Definitely not a 12 hour diaper. Reason why I give 3 stars is because it does not leak, even if she pees twice in the same diaper (she is 27 months old now). I think that is pretty good, but while it doesn’t leak, it does sag, her skin is a little wet when it is diaper changes de time and as I said previously, the beads become lose and attached to her skin.
The review is for the diaper on top. The bottom one is what I am comparing to. The bottom one is great, none of that happens. It is like an indestructible diaper for 12 hours!

reviews.name: Not what I thought. There's no liners for the bottoms so it's really hard to keep them up while your trying to put stuff in them.
reviews.title: Review
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2024
reviews.review: Box was damaged. Other than that was ok.

reviews.title: They were great, until recently
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.review: We loved these diapers and had them on subscribe and save monthly. However the last two boxes something has changed. They are causing chemical burns on my babies under area . We have only seen it with these diapers. So I won't be ordering anymore.

reviews.name: elijah
reviews.title: Not for sensitive skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2024
reviews.review: Causes my daughter to get rashes, almost looks like rug burn from these diapers.

reviews.name: M
reviews.title: Not the best diapers but great for their price.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2024
reviews.review: I only got these because they had a phenomenal price for the quantity. But I hated them. It’s just worth spending the extra money for better quality.

reviews.name: Tammy
reviews.title: Not durable much
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2024
reviews.review: Not bad for younger babies but for bigger babies it easily rip

reviews.name: AngelA
reviews.title: They may cover his crack, but not all they're cracked up to be.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2015
reviews.review: I read through the mixed reviews before odering and figured they were worth a try. Our son is 15 months old and wearing a size 5 diaper now. We have used mainly Sam's Club Member's Mark diapers, but can't always make the long drive to the nearest Sam's Club to buy them. The struggle is real! We started out in the Pamper's Swaddlers and they were great. We got a lot of them at our baby shower. When we had to finally start buying diapers, we realized how expensive they can be and decided to start trying some other brands. So we have also used LUVS, which gave him what looked like a flesh eating disease on his bottom. We've used the Wal-Mart brand, Parent's Choice, and while priced decently, they left a little to be desired absorbent wise. The Huggies Little Movers have been good for us, but are on the pricey side. Anything for our little man though. So this is our first try with the Snug and Dry. While snug, whoch any diaper really can be if fastened correctly, we had our first ever leak in these diapers yesterday. He was soaked in the crotch and half way up his long sleeved onesie top. So, the one review I read about a boy "peeing out the top of the diaper" is totally a thing! I don't believe we'll be buying these again. We will be stocking up on the Sam's Club diapers since he JUST started in the size 5, and using the Little Movers when we absolutely have to spend the money on them.

reviews.name: Israel
reviews.title: Chemical smell
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2024
reviews.review: I love Huggies, used them in 2020 with 1st born. However, I ordered 2 boxes of these and the diapers in both smell like permanent marker.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Less than impressed for price
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are great until you apply any pressure to it while the child is wet. Squeezes out every time in the car and we are constantly having to change pants once we get to our destination.

reviews.name: Olga Osorio
reviews.title: Huggies is not how it used to be
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2024
reviews.review: Not gentle with baby skin

reviews.name: chrystal gaudet
reviews.title: Not as good as the other Huggies brands
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2022
reviews.review: Giving this at least 3 stars because you get a good amount of diapers for the price. I am not too happy with these Huggies brand. Huggies little movers/snugglers/special delivery are way better options. My son wears a size 4 which are more than big enough with other Huggies but these Huggies size 4 are way too small for him. Barely covers his bum. Also don't hold as much pee as the other Huggies so we have to change much more often. He wore them overnight (which is usually always fine by an early morning change with other Huggies brand) and ended up peeing through his jammies and onto the bed. He also had a bunch of the gel filling from the diaper all over his stomach/lower area. These Huggies are by far my least favorite of all the Huggies. Thought I'd go for these to save money but I am sorry that I did.

reviews.name: Tessa Worsham
reviews.title: Little Movers are BETTER
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.review: These worked fine, but they don’t see it be as secure as the little movers. I prefer having that additional velcro strip the little movers have. Since Costco diapers are the same as Huggies little movers, I’ll be making the switch back to Costco diapers.

reviews.name: Doneen C
reviews.title: Bad batch
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.review: I usually enjoy the Huggies brand for my little one, but the last couple batches I received were horrible. The tab would always rip when applying the diaper and anytime my baby moved it would snap off. At first I thought maybe he needed another size, but after going up a size, I had the same issue.

reviews.name: Stephanie Andrews
reviews.title: Leak, leak, leak
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.review: These diapers were a great value but they leak. We have gone through more jammies in the last two days than we did all last week. Also, they are kind of an awkward fit. Don't recommend.

reviews.name: Jovana Sanchez
reviews.title: Subscribe and save order
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2022
reviews.review: I signed up for subscribe and save and haven’t had any issues until this month. I’ve read the reviews that state the snug and dry design has changed and this confirms my suspicions. My husband opened the box and arraigned the diapers so I was surprised when I went to change my son and the diapers not only looked different but felt different. I compared with one of the old diapers and this version felt like it would hold less liquid. We’ve had leaks with these diapers when we stopped having leaks months ago using the other diapers. We’re changing them much more frequently. I wish there was a warning that the product changed.

reviews.name: nina
reviews.title: I wanted to like these but I couldn't.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2016
reviews.review:
I bought these diapers on sale a few times for my daughter. I really wanted to like these because they are so budget friendly but unfortunately I am not sure I would recommend them.
I am someone that tries to change my daughter's diaper as often as she needs it.. there are times when I have to forget or when we are out and changing her as much as what I'd like just isn't an option. As far as the diaper causing rashes. I've had no issues with this. However, I have had a lot of leakage problems with these diapers. It is to the point where if we go out somewhere I do not put these on her because I simply cannot trust them not to leak. On numerous occasions, these diapers have leaked while out. Once they leaked through her pants onto my pants.
They are okay to use at home when you can change them as soon as your child pees or poops, however, they are not for heavy use. If you want a budget diaper, I would recommend Luvs (which is essentially the same brand anyway) they are about the same price and hold up much better.
I canceled my next month's subscription even at a really cheap cost.

reviews.name: Sara
reviews.title: Go with the more expensive Huggies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2022
reviews.review: My son is ready to move up in diaper size and I wanted to try these out to see if it was worth buying them in bulk since you get more diapers for less money. It is NOT worth it. They do not hold as much liquid so you have to change them more often and they don’t have the Velcro like tabs on the side so they fall down in the front which is not ideal for little boys. I will continue buying the little snugglers or little movers. Even though the quality of them has dropped, they are still better than these.

reviews.name: Taneaka T
reviews.title: You pay for what you get!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2022
reviews.review: These pampers absorbs well and I love that you get like 60 more diapers than the other brand for the same amount of money, but you are definitely not getting the same quality to have more. These diapers do not give protection for 12 hrs. I have to change my daughter around the clock with these diapers like she's a newborn just to avoid them leaking and she's not a newborn. Bottom line if you want more diapers for a lower price and won't mind changing your toddler every 2 to 3 hours these will work just fine!

reviews.name: T. Smith
reviews.title: New and improved leakability
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2013
reviews.review:
I have been an avid Huggies user for years. However, their new design is absolutely horrible. I used to get my diapers via subscribe and save. Some time in early May I noticed my 2 yo started waking up drenched. I thought wow maybe its time to go up a size but they still leaked like crazy. I found an old diaper in my diaper bag and compared them. The new style is much thinner and also must less absorbent. Last month I ran out of diapers and had to pick up some store brand diapers from my favorite "Bulls-eye" store. To my surprise when I switched to the cheap store brand diapers we had no more leaks. Obviously I'm canceling my subscribe and save and going with the cheap diapers now. Its a shame Huggies had to mess up a good thing. Their sure fit sure lost my business.

***Updated 9/20/13***
I do have to at least acknowledge Huggies for reaching out to me after leaving review. The new Huggies diapers are definitely not the worst, but they still are not as good as they use to be. A rep contacted me and explained the newer version now has less "fluff" padding and more super absorbent gel. This may be true but it doesn't change the fact they used to be better. That being said I have tried the other products and found that he Little Snugglers and cruisers seem to be as good as ever and far superior to the snug and dry. So maybe I will pay a little more for the good stuff.

reviews.name: Anna Hoover
reviews.title: These are great, however
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.review: These are great, however once wet the material they're made of clumps up and is hard to clean off of anything it touches.

reviews.name: Qi Liu
reviews.title: Multiple blowouts..
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2022
reviews.review:
We really wanted to love this diaper.. We have been using the Huggies diapers from Costco. This time we didn't have time to go to Costco, so we bought this.

We thought it would be very similar. But we have has so many blowout incidents, sometimes multiple times per day. It happens the most when our daughter is in the car seat, and the blowout will be in the front. It almost never happened with the Costco Huggies diaper before.

We will stick to Costco Huggies diaper. Will not by this one again.

reviews.name: Savanna D.
reviews.title: Not for sensitive skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.review: My daughter has sensitive skin at times and these leave a horrible blistery diaper rash after just a couple hours. Not worth it, and doesn’t hold much liquid compared to other Huggies.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Wrong size
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2023
reviews.review:
I bought two boxes of Size 4 I got one box size 4 and one box Size 3 I’ve already started using it now I have to be using diapers more than ever because the size is too small never even realized that
What’s gonna happen?

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Received Size 6 Box with Size 4 in it
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2020
reviews.review: We’ve been using Huggins diapers for a few years now. They seemed to absorb the best & they never made our kids break out in a rash as some other brands have in the past. For the first time ever, last month, my monthly order of Size 6 came in & we were really in need of them. Half of the box was size 6 & the other half were all size 4s. How this happened, I have no clue. Our youngest & only one in diapers has been wearing size 6 diapers for 6+ months now. I had to check my monthly order to be sure I didn’t accidentally order size 4s. I’m really disappointed I didnt pay attention more closely because we wasted about $15+ on the wrong size diapers when we thought we were getting the right size. Lesson learned - look at what size is actually in the box from now on.

reviews.name: Kelli
reviews.title: They are okay
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2022
reviews.review: I thought I was buying an awesome product. The star rating and the comments seemed promising. My little leaks out of them all the time. She’s 24lbs, so I bought the size 4. Maybe that’s to small? I don’t know. I just know that I will change her and with her first pee she will leak out. If you wait and let her pee twice before changing, the diapers seem to release their inside beads. Not exactly sure what they are called. The beads that should help with absorption will be all over her.

reviews.name: Sarah C
reviews.title: 2 month old leaks from the top back
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2022
reviews.review: I have tried these vs the Huggies snugglers and pampers swaddlers. I for sure prefer the snugglers. These have the same great contoured shape around the legs which I prefer over pampers. However these don’t absorb as fast so when my newborn baby poops and is laying on her back (so all night) they always leak out of the top back.

reviews.name: Jen
reviews.title: Leaks fast
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2023
reviews.review: Im not sure if my baby peed alot compared before but he use the one we buy at sams and that one is cheaper and way sooo leak proof than this. I know huggies price is for somthing but this one Is so differenr than thw quality of the huggies before

reviews.name: Jackie
reviews.title: Quality poorer than previous order of same diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2020
reviews.review: I have bought these same diapers before, though preciously I felt they were nicer. The price of these when using a coupon made them very reasonable but I noticed two things I was not happy with. One, the sides do not stretch as much as the same product I have bought before so you do not have as much material to pull together at each side to close up the diaper. Secondly, most of the diapers had small rough patches on the side flaps, it seemed like maybe pieces of diaper material got condensed during manufacturing. To make sure it didn’t scratch my baby I had to look at each diaper and rub off (in some instances rip out) the hard spot. For that reason alone, I won’t reorder.

reviews.name: W. B
reviews.title: Seemed a little less absorbent/thinner
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2023
reviews.review:
Bought these to try instead of Costco Huggies and I felt like it was thinner and not as padded/absorbent as the Costco Huggies diapers.
The fit seemed pretty good and it didn’t leak for my toddler during the day when we change her more often, but they did leak a little overnight.

reviews.name: Yeii
reviews.title: No los recomiendo
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.review: Estos pañales se llenan enseguida, no aguantan una noche y cuando el niño hace 1 piz, enseguida se abulta el algodón en las piernas. No me gustan nada.

reviews.name: Analea
reviews.title: Good diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.review: It works does the job

reviews.name: Arr Jay
reviews.title: good, not as good as Huggies Little Snugglers.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2020
reviews.review:
Love the Huggies with this waistband upside down poo pocket to keep messes from going up the back!
In general, these don’t hold as much as Huggies little snugglers, and they aren’t as soft (to be expected since these are the cheaper version) but I also noticed there are crunchy crystals in them now- not sure if that’s a manufacturer problem, or if as the size goes up, the materials change. This wasn’t a problem when we were in size 1, 2, or 3. My in-laws have kept their place stocked with these in the past and I never noticed the hard bits til these size 4s this summer that I got because there was a “shortage” during Covid 19 of the little snugglers.

reviews.name: Maggie M
reviews.title: Used to love these before the smell…
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2022
reviews.review: I was a big fan of these for my little guy. Super absorbent, minimal back blowouts. The last few packs I got though had a weird artificial scent to them. I thought it was my baby at first and something he ate — but it’s been every diaper in my last two packs. I’m not sure if it’s the chemicals inside the diaper, but I’m going to try another brand since this has happened with a few of my packs now.

reviews.name: Maria Bryan
reviews.title: Leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.review: I am constantly changing him because the pampers leak all day and night

reviews.name: Half empty
reviews.title: Good
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.review: Before I used a different brand, for now its ok

reviews.name: Sheila
reviews.title: Good Diapers -- when they stay in one piece!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2020
reviews.review:
I've ordered a few boxes of these diapers for my 4 month old twins. The first box or two were great: good absorbency, no red marks. These may have been size 1.

Once I got to the size 2 diapers, I began having issues. The Velcro-style "belts" that allow the diaper to close have been coming off, or the diapers have been missing them altogether. I think that this is causing more leaking issues as well; I've been seeing leaking even immediately after I've changed the diapers.

These diapers are less expensive than others, but I'm not sure the relatively small difference in price point is worth it when a percentage (albeit small) of the diapers is useless.

reviews.name: MoonStar
reviews.title: Does not hold well
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020
reviews.review: I got these because it was a good price and with having the name Huggies I figured they would be very good . Well if you have a baby who holds in their pee ans let's it all out at once these are not the ones for you. These seem to be very thin an my grand daughter peed right through them and her close after only one time peeing . Very disappointed and waste of money. Now I have 3 unopened packs just sitting here . I used to love Huggies not sure what happened to them . I do not recommend if you have a heavy wetter .

reviews.name: Raven Lawson
reviews.title: Not the same
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2023
reviews.review: Its not the same anymore. I leaks badly now my baby can't even wear it at night.

reviews.name: Briana
reviews.title: They're ok
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2018
reviews.review: They're ok. The diapers don't leak and are very stretchy. They're also very absorbant and I can't feel the wetness outside they diaper like the pampers. The price is even ok. However I took stars off because my 6 month old has monstrous thighs and the size 3's seemed to tight on the legs, the size 4's leave a gap when she's laying down and I don't want to spend a bunch more money on the "little movers." Also the design is boring, they used to be cute with baby mickey and Pluto on them and now it's big ugly mickey heads and dots but I guess that's they're way of cutting costs by using less color, too bad the savings don't get passed onto the consumer. I also hate the wetness line but I guess that's how huggies is tricking people into more frequent diaper changes so they buy more diapers.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Inconsistent product? subscribe&save nice
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2017
reviews.review: We love Huggies diapers (Luvs work for us too, just not into the fragrance, Target’s brand has also been reliable) and the convenience of Amazon’s subscribe and save, unfortunately after a couple months of receiving our shipment of tried and true huggies, this box is different from the last, not as nice but appearing the same diaper? Different color scheme... still work but at first these seemed to cause some diaper rash (this is not a common thing for us). I’m dissipointed in the consistency of product, but the rash has gone away and after switching up (we had some other diapers on hand and also cloth diaper at home sometimes) these worked ok. (Edit) Then another really bad rash happened. I think the snug & dry may vary depending on who’s shop is shipping. I’d trust the bad reviews and suggest looking elsewhere. Only giving 3 stars because the first two shipments were good.

reviews.name: Ms TruthBeTold 👑
reviews.title: Ehhhhh
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2022
reviews.review: I don’t know why I keep buying these I guess that’s the price but I always kick myself in the butt after I do. They always tend to rip they’re so thin and they’re hard to get out of the dispenser. Only reason I buy them because it’s the only kind my grandson can use.

reviews.name: Adrian Alvarez
reviews.title: Good diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2022
reviews.review: I have used these for my youngest on and off since she was born. This last box I orders was not up to expectations. The top layer (outer layer) would peel off. It would hang and made the diaper appear like it was falling apart. A few actually did and I had a few of the closure pull off.

reviews.name: Michaella Glendenning
reviews.title: THEYRE OK
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2022
reviews.review: I got these for my daughter as usually I get her Pampers but the Pampers package was a bit high in price... I'm not a huge fan of these as she's gotten a rash from them and I'm fortunate I have vitamin e cream for the area. The absorption is horrible as in the morning, her clothes are wet feeling...

reviews.name: K A
reviews.title: Flimsy compared to other Huggies styles
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2020
reviews.review: Our daughter is moving toward size 5, and usually wears Huggies Little Snugglers or Little Movers. I figured we could try this style and see what we thought. They are less bulky than our usual styles, and a bit less expensive. But they are very flimsy and feel like they could easily rip. It is also harder to keep them in the right place on our very active toddler - there is no strip thing on the side to help the diaper stay in place like on our usual styles. We'll use these up, but have absolutely no intention of buying them again. We'll probably primarily stick with Little Movers.

reviews.name: ELLE541
reviews.title: Use caution as this batch was not the same as others before.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2017
reviews.review: I've always been a huggies mom, but for some reason my order of these arrived looking totally different. The mickey design is black, red and white instead of the colorful graphic that we have had. It's not nearly as full or absorbent, as we are used to. I had to go back to using Snugglers because these were not good. My daughter is about to move into size 3 soon so i'm not going to fuss about it, but wanted others to know my box from Amazon was NOT the same as when purchased from the store. I'm about to order the Huggies Movers and I'm hoping I don't have this same issue or I will stop ordering from Amazon. I'm praying Amazon doesn't turn into Walmart and manufacturers make product specifically for Amazon that is cheaper quality to meet the price demand.

reviews.name: **IamRedEemeD**
reviews.title: Great quality, and Price! Love huggies!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2016
reviews.review:
Update: i just order size 4 for my child I notice this package feels thinner and almost seems cheap, I was in love with Huggies, and had never had problems, I am willing to give it a try and hope they work just as well as the previous ones I had ordered but to be honest they almost feel and fit like the Walmart brand I just hope they work,
I the size 2 and I love them, i am planing in buying size 3. They absorbed very well and my baby seems to be very comfortable. I read some people's reviews and I s scared to buy since they say diapers are too thin and don't absorb, but who will leave their kids diaper on for more than 4 hours?? No diaper is going to absorb or not smell bad if is kept for to long in my opinion. I will definitely be purchasing again!

reviews.name: Briana
reviews.title: Absorbent material leaking out of diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2022
reviews.review: It might be hard to see in the photo but in the latest package I received of these diapers, all of them were thinning at the very top inside part of the diaper so the absorbent material was leaking out. I did not notice this until a few nights of my son having the absorbent material covering his genitals, leading me to investigate the diapers. I’m not sure how safe that is but, just a heads up. these diapers were good until I received this shipment.

reviews.name: Potato
reviews.title: Affordable
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2022
reviews.review: First and last time I purchase these. I have a newborn 1month this weekend. Ran through all the newborn diapers I recieved for baby shower and decided to try out these due to price. Needless to say I was disappointed. They are good but when you compare to other more expensive ones these are at the bottom of the barrel. I highly recommend getting Kirkland brand ones in bulk.

reviews.name: The Homeschool Adventurers
reviews.title: They changed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2022
reviews.review:
This is a modal window.

No compatible source was found for this media.
They feel different. Last year I bought diapers to last me for an entire year. The one on the left is their original model and the one to the right is the new model. To the touch they feel different and even the package feels different. They feel/look cheap compared to the original model. Regardless I will be testing to see if the absorption is good.

reviews.name: Craig Adamson
reviews.title: More of Bargain Brand
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2018
reviews.review: Not a fan of huggies not that they don't work, but if I had to choose I would go with Pampers as they are the best out there and they know it so its super expensive right up there with the specialty brands like honest, 7th gen etc. Huggies definitely has a price point that is only out matched by the Costco Momma Bear brand. Unfortunately both have the annoying super tight elastic back part which makes it hard to lay the diaper down flat with out it curling up on you. This exactly what Pampers has figured out as it always lays down flat, because honestly when you fighting a tired, teething, that has diaper rash who wants to fight the diaper and the baby.

reviews.name: Brietta cyr
reviews.title: Leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2023
reviews.review: My son has very sensitive skin and these did not cause any rashes. However, they don’t absorb very well.

reviews.name: Yuanwen Ji
reviews.title: Only one problem is that it is easy to form lumps if the time is long
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2017
reviews.review:
I have to stop this recommendation because when I used the second box, I found a new question. Baby has rash on both sides of the thigh. In order to prove this problem, I changed the other brands of diapers, rash disappeared after a day. When I re-use the product two days later, the rash appear again. It makes me very disappointed. I'm thinking about how to deal with the rest of the diapers.

"Very good！At first we thought that it was a bit thick, but after I found that it was suitable for male baby. It is really dry and has a strong water absorption. Only one problem is that it is easy to form lumps if the time is long, so you'd better to change diapers in time."

reviews.name: Maulik
reviews.title: BE AWARE of the recent downfall in the quality of these diapers!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2021
reviews.review: Earlier lots of these diapers were quite ok but greatly disappointed with the last lot that we got as part of our subscribe and save order. Each and every diaper that we used had gel leaking out even after little wet. Cleaning my son off the dirty gel was a headache. Immediately had to order another box of diapers and we are opting out of Huggies for now.

reviews.name: Stephanie
reviews.title: Weird salt texture in diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2019
reviews.review:
I love buggies but I just started to notice that this pack of the diapers feel different. The front feels very rough and bumpy so I opened one up and found a bunch of hard little pieces(kind of like salt) in the diaper. And there was a piece that was slightly detached(as shown in the picture) that was harder/stiff feeling then the rest of the diaper. I’m confused on what this could be.
Huggies is my go to brand and I’ve never experienced this before.

The thing I order came in 3 bags of diapers. I did not notice this in the first bag that I used. But I am noticing it in the second bag.

reviews.name: Jamie Lynn
reviews.title: Ehhh I prefer luvs.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2022
reviews.review: I was a fan of Huggies for my son as a newborn but as he’s gotten to 1 yr they just don’t hold as well as they did. I’ve since moved onto luvs

reviews.name: Karen James
reviews.title: Not as good as I hoped
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2021
reviews.review: I like the snugglers but don't care much for these. I've had more leaks with these and a big blow out. The pad absorbs pee but it doesn't absorb poop very well. My baby is breast fed. Her poops can be more runny at times than others.. And we just had a big blow out in a clean diaper because nothing got absorbed from Her poop like snugglers do. Disappointed.. Was hoping they would be better.. Now I have a whole box I wish I could trade for snugglers.

reviews.name: Jordan guihan
reviews.title: They work but not my favorite
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
reviews.review: The little absorbent beads almost always break through the diaper and get all over my kids butt. He’s 2 and never slows down so I’m not sure if he’s just to hard on them or what but when he wears these I have to change him much more frequently or this happens every time. Kind of defeats the purpose of buying less expensive diapers if you have to change them more frequently. This is the second time I’ve bought these thinking I may have gotten a bad batch the first time but I’m still having the same problem with them.

reviews.name: natalie
reviews.title: Buy little movers instead
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2019
reviews.review: The sizing on Huggies snug and dry is way off. I had to buy a size six just for the length but the waist was to big. My baby is about average size so this just didn't make sense and I am not a newbie by any means with diapers. We simply switched to Huggies little movers and suddenly the sizing matched (size 4 was perfect for my 10/11 month old). Yeah, I know this is a size 5 review, so, know that we had problems with this sizzling to and had to quickly move on the the size 6 because of blowouts up the back (not enough length).

reviews.name: Brianna Russell
reviews.title: Blowouts
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2023
reviews.review: My daughter has never had as many blow outs as she has had in these. Great holder for pee not as much for the Poo

reviews.name: AllP
reviews.title: Leaky diaper equals sad baby
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2016
reviews.review: Very excited to get such a big box for the price. Upon putting them on my baby however I realized why I am not a lover of Huggies. Poop leaked out the side of my daughters diaper and onto her pants. Not a great first impression as this was diaper number one from the pack of over 100. She had slept through the night finally the past two night but kept waking every few hours last night, I finally thought of the new diaper and sure enough her Jammie's were soaked, and her legs felt damp where it has leaked. Very dissapointed, and feeling sad that over 150 diapers will go to waste because I don't want to punish her wearing them.

reviews.name: KipKip
reviews.title: Absorbency questionable.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2018
reviews.review: I don’t love these diapers. They do okay. I don’t believe they as absorbent as they claim to be. Pampers baby dry was my preferred choice and use (Feb 2016 until last three months). Pampers changed the make of them slightly which while thinner for weight with a new quilted weave are not as absorbent either. This has left me on a journey of finding a new diaper. So far Huggies overnight is closest to the prior making baby dry pampers. This may be good for size 1 or 2. I do not recommend otherwise. (PS. We journal every diaper change due to diet so we see the intake of food/beverage and output use of diapers.)

reviews.name: {AJK*MamaBear}
reviews.title: Very droopy!! Ughh
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2016
reviews.review:
Any one else notice the change?!? I have been an extremely loyal huggies fan and consumer for almost 8 years now. Loyal like ignoring all of the reviews and continued to buy regardless of the changes that people have reported have been made. Until this months subscribe and save......:(
Or monthly shipment has always included a big package of the Snug and Dry. After one #1 in it, my daughters diapers have begun to sag to her knees! No I'm not using the wrong size and nothing else changed in her size to constitute this happening. Sad. I'll still love you Huggies and will continue to buy only because I always have and hope you will make it right. But definitely disappointed right now. Why fix something that isn't broken?

reviews.name: Charlotte
reviews.title: Good, but not as good as the more expensive line
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2020
reviews.review: I've been using Huggies Little Snugglers and Little Movers since my 14 month old son was born. Lately he's been going through A LOT of diapers so I thought maybe I could save some money with the Snug & Dry... big mistake. Sprung a leak on day one of usage. Definitely not as absorbent as the more expensive line of diapers. If you can afford it, stick with the Snugglers or Movers. I've learned my lesson!

reviews.name: PATTIE GOWING
reviews.title: These were different as of January 2022
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2022
reviews.review: I do not like the new version of these at all! They used to be soft, thick and felt like good quality. The new box I got in Jan is lacking significantly in quality. Much thinner and more plastic feeling. Super bummed because these were my favorite style of diapers for my last 2 kids. Not worth the price anymore in my opinion.

reviews.name: Brandon
reviews.title: Great Diapers But Not Competitive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2022
reviews.review: I've been using these diapers for a while. They work great and don't cause the diaper rubbing that our baby had gotten with Luvs. That being said, the Aldis brand was just as good and absorbent but half the cost. These diapers are too expensive with the other options available.

reviews.name: Ms. D.
reviews.title: Just ok
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2023
reviews.review: I didn't really care for these diapers. I feel like they didn't do a great job.

reviews.name: Janica R.
reviews.title: Lesser quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2023
reviews.review: Lesser quality compared from the rest. It is thin so the Absorbency is just for minimal pee. It can’t handle massive poop. It leaked and it cheaply made. Will switch to other huggies type.

reviews.name: Kate Noris
reviews.title: Product change? Not the usual diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2022
reviews.review: My 15month old son has used this brand and diaper since birth. We have always ordered from this listing. The last few shipments the diaper has looked different and he has leaked big time. I almost think that we got knockoffs? Or the diapers changed make and style?

reviews.name: Etny Soriano Fino
reviews.title: Hay mejores
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2023
reviews.review: Son buenos pañales pero creo que otras marcas son mas abosrbentes!! En lo personal siemto que estos pañales son muy delgados

reviews.name: AllP
reviews.title: Leaky diaper equals sad baby
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2016
reviews.review: Very excited to get such a big box for the price. Upon putting them on my baby however I realized why I am not a lover of Huggies. Poop leaked out the side of my daughters diaper and onto her pants. Not a great first impression as this was diaper number one from the pack of over 100. She had slept through the night finally the past two night but kept waking every few hours last night, I finally thought of the new diaper and sure enough her Jammie's were soaked, and her legs felt damp where it has leaked. Very dissapointed, and feeling sad that over 150 diapers will go to waste because I don't want to punish her wearing them.

reviews.name: SoonerFam
reviews.title: Size 4 diapers have hard spots like they’ve been wet and dried. Not normal Huggies quality.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020
reviews.review:
****update**** I bought diapers from Walmart in size 4 and 5 to see if they were the same as the ones I got from amazon and they are. It’s not an amazon problem, I guess it’s just the way they are now. My son gets yeast infections in pampers and luvs gets wet on the outside after one pee with him, so I’m going to have to just use them until I find something else reasonably priced. He uses the Huggies Overnights because they are the only ones that doesn’t leak at night and those are still great! They are still soft and do not have those hard lumps like the regular ones. New, but definitely not improved. 😬

I have used Huggies on all 4 of my kids and never had a problem until this box of diapers. The size 3 was so plush and soft, these size 4 are awful. They are thinner and crunchy. You can feel hard spots all inside them like they’ve somehow got wet and dried. First bag out of this box was okay, But I noticed these were wrong as soon as I grabbed one out of the second bag. I opened the other bags that came in the box and they are all the same. Some are better than others, but none are soft and some are so bad that they actually crunch when you bend them. I’ve requested a return for these and I’m going to go buy a box from Walmart to see if this is a new Huggies design issue or an Amazon issue. I love Huggies and would hate to switch, but if this is the new quality then I won’t have a choice.

The size 3 diapers have red dots along the sides of them and is super soft and nice, but the size 4 with the hard lumps has the diamond design along the sides and around the waist. You can also tell that the size 4 diapers leg and back ruffle is different. Size 3 is bigger and has more elasticity so it has a more snug fit, the size 4 is shorter and stretched out. I didn’t noticed that on the first bag, but that could explain the couple of leaks we randomly had for the first time since using huggies.

reviews.name: Spooky Sophie
reviews.title: Exceedingly grim review
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2016
reviews.review:
I am not in the habit of leaving exceedingly grim product reviews, partly because like most people, I've better things to do and partly because if I'm unhappy with a product I just don't buy it again. These diapers, however, have inspired in me an unprecedented degree of frustration and disgust. I thought I was getting a really great deal on these. That is until I used them for a few days. These are NOT the Little Snugglers I'd assumed they were, which is what I've been using prior to this misguided debacle. As a first time mom, I was not aware that Huggies made a bargain basement grade diaper, but apparently they do. I realized these were not the diapers I'd been using as soon as I opened them, but I thought "Hey, they're Huggies. How bad could they be?" Brace yourself.

My baby is only 7 weeks, so she doesn't care, really. She didn't at first, anyway.
