As a matter of convenience, you'll want to be aware these don't have the nifty wetness indicators I've become so spoiled on. Which is not to say that you won't know when to change them. In fact, you'll have no occasion to wonder, as you'll find that upon exposure to moisture, the padding inside the diaper will instantly swell to a tell-tale puffiness twice its initial dimensions that will remove any doubt as to the status. That's only if you've managed to ignore your baby's irritated wailing or the spreading wet spot they're laying in.

I rated them 2 stars because if you need a lot of diapers for cheap, these will certainly fit the bill. Just don't expect much in the way of performance. In fact, if you're after a great deal, I'm certain you could just scotch tape some premium paper towels onto your baby and achieve similar results. Perhaps you could just forego a diaper completely and simply stuff your baby's pants with wads of generic single ply toilet paper lifted from a lonely rural truck stop. That way, at least you won't have spent any money and you'll find the results not dissimilar.
I pray that I am never on so tight a budget that I'd be forced to resort to these sorry diapers. Because in all seriousness, here's the real cost: four times today alone, I've rushed to find my screaming newborn lying in a wet spot, having soaked through her clothes and bedding, all of which have to be changed and washed. In addition, I've had to start using the Honest Company's Healing Balm (pricey, but effective) at every change, as she's been developing red, irritated skin because the diapers don't pull moisture away from her poor little bottom. I've never had this issue with other diapers. I change her frequently, so it's not an issue of the diaper overflowing or that she's left to soak in a wet diaper for long periods. It's an issue of these diapers being garbage.

reviews.name: KatTay
reviews.title: They changed the diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2024
reviews.review: These feel like paper now. We’ve used them with my daughter in sizes 1 and 2 and loved them. While she doesn’t get any irritation they’re just so thin.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2024
reviews.review: I am a Huggies user, I usually love them. I was surprised at how bad these diapers are. My baby is constantly wet and leaking with these. I am extremely disappointed with this line of Huggies. Will go back to buying the regular ones.

reviews.name: Samuel Steward
reviews.title: Leak
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2024
reviews.review: After the 2nd box of these I can't buy them anymore. They burst open at the seams by the legs and leak into clothes. Frustrating to have to change clothes just because a baby filled the diaper.

reviews.name: Madison
reviews.title: Poor quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.review:
I fell in love with these Huggies pampers, the mickie mouse ones to be exact. They were doing so well until they came with these new mickie mouse designs. They are now so frail and not lasting long. I have attached pictures.. the one with only micky head (on the left) amazing !!! One night I wasn’t feeling well and my son had them on all night and no leakage … the one on the right with all of micky …. They are not even lasting 4/6 hours without looking frail (I also attached a pic to show) … now I got to find a new brand that’s is as awesome as these use to be 😔
Update: it’s only fair that I provide an update, I left a review with Huggies and they contacted me and refunded my money and due to their kindness, and great customer service I bought the Winnie the Pooh overnight pampers for my son and they are amazing.

reviews.name: Nizam Safi
reviews.title: Good for liquid only!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2024
reviews.review: When these are wet and baby poops it spills (size 1) out, had to switch back to the Huggies little snuggler for size 2.The size N will be much more useful in that stage as they are much more thinner.I was hoping this budget item would help but the backlash is much more severe than the savings ESPECIALLY in public.

reviews.name: Carrington
reviews.title: Cheap quality now
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2024
reviews.review: Loved these diapers at first but I think they changed the way they make them. They’re thin now and the butt sags after one pee. 😭

reviews.name: Melina Rodriguez
reviews.title: Cheaply Made
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2024
reviews.review: I decided to buy these for the first time since they claimed they are 12 hour leak proof. I have put that to the test and it’s not true it can’t barely handle any liquid.. very disappointed will be looking at another brand.

reviews.name: BLady
reviews.title: Great , glad I switched! - UPDATED
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2021
reviews.review:
My son (8m) has been in pampers brand since he was born. They started to leak overnight the older he got and I let it slide- then started to experiment. I went to luvs , great price, bad absorbency, I was changing his diaper close to every 2 hrs vs every 4-5 with pampers. I used up the pack and waited a while before trying another brand. Note , pampers brand are still leaking @ times 😒 - so my fiance is like how about HUGGIES ? Now we thought about switching to this brand due to price but it was close to pampers so we said nvm - now we wanna switch for quality so we get a pack from the store. Love the design, they stretch SO good & absorbency is A1, haven't had a leak since I bought them I believe. Even if I did , I wouldn't probably let it slide just because of how comfortable they are for him & flexible. Plus I'm not betting on it , the absorbency is great. We came to amazon & they had a 200 pack- 200 LADIES AND GENTLEMEN! Ordered these with the quickness and going to stick with em until I see wrong.

Update 7/3/21- I have since switched. When your child goes to pee they will smell just like that- pee. I thought it was just 1 diaper. But it turned into ALL the diapers.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Little snugglers are better
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2024
reviews.review: I have always used little snugglers. I got this because they’re cheaper and still huggies so i thought it would be better quality because “snug & dry”. They really aren’t at all. I have to change more frequently than little snugglers. I have had way too may blowouts with these diapers. I wouldn’t really recommend especially if your little one sleeps all night.

reviews.name: Gwen M
reviews.title: Not good if your child is a heavy pooper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2019
reviews.review: This may be a great diaper for some kids. It's thin and lightweight, so I imagine it feels like you're wearing nothing, as opposed to the equivalent of wrapping a bath towel around your swimsuit area. However, if your child drops poop that rivals an elephant's output, I do not recommend this product unless you personally enjoy scooping copious amounts of human waste out of your child's pants and you have the ability to sanitize your home or vehicle like a doctor's office. It's a good thing my dog enjoys eating poop, otherwise this would have gotten a one-star review. I also had to purchase a box of candy canes to freshen my dog's breath because Dentastix don't work when you regularly feast on pounds of putrid toddler garlic butt mud. In addition, if your child drinks water and milk like mine, be prepared to change his diaper every half hour or you'll find yourself drowning in pee. One cup of juice, and this diaper starts gushing like Niagara Falls. Some people like getting peed on, but I find it less delightful. So, purchase at will, but if you find unappealing the idea of warm liquids and/or matter gushing out of your toddler onto your lap while you're trying to keep said toddler hushed at church, then perhaps you should rethink purchasing this item. DISCLAIMER: I have zero credibility because I don't write mommy blogs.

reviews.name: OP
reviews.title: Para que otras personas sepan la cálida de los pamper y sus propias experiencias
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2024
reviews.review: Estos pamper era mi primera ves que los compré pero no los remiendo son de muy mala calidad

reviews.name: Yazmeen
reviews.title: No Leak Protection AT ALL
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2023
reviews.review:
These were once my favorite. I have grown to absolutely Hate them! I finally had enough today. No more than 5 mins after I placed a new diaper on my daughter, she pee’d on my leg while sitting in my lap. The diaper was completely dry and placed on her correctly. They say up to 12hours of leak protection, meanwhile, her clothes and car seat are always wet after having the diaper on for 30mins!
The absorbency is also not great either, even if they dont leak through the sides or the top, the poor quality leaves her clothes or the sheets damp!

reviews.name: chenghu xianyu
reviews.title: The worst Huggies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2024
reviews.review: I used overnight, black Huggies and the Huggies from Costco. This one is the worst. Always leaking. Don’t buy it and go with other type of Huggies

reviews.name: Michelle
reviews.title: Quality is good, straps/fit are bad
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2020
reviews.review:
I usually buy Aldi diapers (for the price and toddler's needs, great diapers), but I haven't been able to find a size 4 so I bought these in a pinch. They are soft, nice design, and mask some of the poop smell.

I hate the straps. They do NOT hold up well and I have to keep unstrapping them, adjusting the diaper, and strapping them back up. When the strap starts to separate from the diaper it also scratches/irritates my child's skin which makes him scratch and now he's red. I've gone through this pack faster than I go through the ones I buy at Aldi because of how annoying it is to get these diapers to hold up.

If you do not adjust the straps to keep a tight a fit every hour, these diapers will leak in the sides if you child has runny/messy poop. These are definitely not diapers I'd recommend if you have a very active child that can cause the diaper to shift out of place and separate.

Their snugglers are much better if you want to stick with Huggies.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Great for urine, terrible for blowouts
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.review: I really wanted to like this product & gave it a couple boxes worth. They work fine for urine but unfortunately we have had several stools leak out and go everywhere. It’s almost daily we are experiencing stool leakage :-(. This has created multiple outfit changes & extra laundry. I am finding this is not the case with other brands of diapers & will be switching back to those. I’m bummed.. the price was right and they are adorable— just not worth the mess everyday :-(

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Not absorbent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2020
reviews.review: We bought Pampers almost exclusively with our first child, but these Huggies diapers were cheaper and they're a well known brand. So I thought I'd try them out. I hate them, I hate these diapers! The design is a fail. They don't fit snugly. The opening at the legs are a bit loose. The diaper doesn't come up in the back very far at all. When the diaper comes off, the Velcro straps curl inward and rest inside, in the mess! They stick to the wipes, and to itself making it difficult to wrap up. And finally, these diapers are not very absorbent. It boasts of 12 hour protection. I wouldn't dare to leave it on for more than an hour, but probably even less than that. The diaper leaked. More than leaked, my baby was soaked through her clothes all the way up her back. And I had just changed her not that long ago, it's not like it was already at capacity. This happened twice! A diaper has one job: contain the mess. It should be able to absorb the amount of one urination. Will I buy these again? It's a no from me.

reviews.name: Softy
reviews.title: Not for heavy wetters
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2023
reviews.review: We have used these for a month and have had about 6 catastrophic leaks, half of which were on furniture. Our kid drinks a lot of water, and the diapers just couldn’t cope. We usually use Huggies Little Movers, which are much superior. I’ve been trying to use these up, but the latest leak was bad enough that it’s not worth it. If your kid doesn’t pee a ton at once, they might be perfectly serviceable, but we felt a bit deceived by the “snug and dry” label.

reviews.name: Duck Fan
reviews.title: Leaks, tears and messes oh my.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2013
reviews.review:
Subscribe and save is what saves these but I have to say I have been rather un-pleased with these and have went to buying Kirkland brand diapers instead.

My biggest problems with these were the fact that the ripped all the time. I had roughly a dozen or so rip on me in two different cases. They would mostly rip along the tab that holds the diaper at the waist. No idea why but they just did. My son wouldn't even be fighting me half the time he could simply be laying there and it would rip when I was trying to put it on.

My other problem with ripping was sometimes when taking off the wet diaper the sticky portion would rip where it was connected to the diaper and then I would get some nice spongy pee all over me from the diaper. It would create a mess that my son just loved....

I can say that these worked well for the most part and held up with my active toddler. He only once even got them off himself but with the two problems I listed above and the leaks we would get which I thought were just normal I went away from these and started getting the Kirkland ones which I have to say have never ripped on me or leaked even when wearing overnight which would always happen with the Huggies.

I might try these again someday but I have to say they might not get my money ever again unless I find some new and improved version later down the line. As for now I will stick with the Kirkland even though they cost me pennies more and I don't get to sit around every month as the UPS guy brings them to my door.

reviews.name: KL
reviews.title: Not much absorbency
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2024
reviews.review: These didn’t seem to have much absorbency I noticed no difference in this brand versus the Luvs brand. I was told that maybe I purchased the wrong one because it’s not overnight leakproof.

reviews.name: Dua-Yusuf
reviews.title: They don't feel as good
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2024
reviews.review: Not a good quality. I've bought Huggies before but not this specific one.

reviews.name: Kat3Hill
reviews.title: Woke up wet every morning
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.review: Our 6 month old was waking up wet even after changing his diaper once between feeding so we bought these thinking it would solve the issue, it didn’t. He still woke up wet. To me it’s not worth buying another type of diaper. Gotta change them in the middle of the night and hope for the best.

reviews.name: Ritarn2
reviews.title: Should be called snug and wet
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2017
reviews.review: I noticed something different about these diapers, 1. was the character print which I liked. 2. was the quilted pattern on the inside of the diaper and 3. the blue strip liner. I also unfortunately noticed that these diapers consistently leaked at night. I at first thought that I hadn't pulled the side tabs snug enough but after having my baby waking up wet night after night I knew it was not user error but that these diapers suck. These diapers may absorb more but they leak out some of the moisture that they've absorbed. I have some of the older version of snug and dry left over that I use at night but these "new" version I will only use during the day. I also noticed that these new diapers cause itchiness on my sons private parts I have to apply a bit more diaper cream to prevent him from having irritation. I don't like these new diapers and wish I could get some sort of refund otherwise I may have to switch back to using pampers. They cost a tad bit more but pampers in this case is a better product. I have Huggies on amazon prime auto-shipment but will stop any future shipment.

reviews.name: Ann
reviews.title: Big 4
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2024
reviews.review: My grandson wears a 4 in Huggies. This brand of Huggies run big. He pooped and it leaked all out the diaper.

reviews.name: Irene Lopez
reviews.title: Second time order was left at wrong address!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2024
reviews.review: Nothing wrong with product but left at wrong address, My house address is clearly posted on front of home!

reviews.name: JThomas323
reviews.title: Not a Quality Diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2019
reviews.review: I’ve been using these diapers for nearly two years after getting a 20% discount during Prime Day in 2017. At first, they were great. But I feel like the quality has gone downhill (or maybe just the size 6 diapers are terrible). I noticed a difference when they started shipping them in regular boxes (as opposed to a box like at the store). My son was over a year old at the time, and leaks and blow outs were very few and far between, so that hasn’t been much of an issue. But They started bunching up and the lining of the diaper seems to disintegrate while being worn, even when dry. They are also thinner-I accidentally tore one while opening it up. Last month, I skipped our order, but ended up needing a few diapers to hold us over. I picked up the cheapest brand at Walmart. The difference in quality was startling. The Walmart brand diapers were much better than these. While the price point is great (and I have loved that discount) I will be canceling my subscription.

reviews.name: andrew hoover
reviews.title: Leaks a lot
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2024
reviews.review: Got a lot of leaks and it doesn't hold much. I'll stick to target brand.

reviews.name: Adam Re
reviews.title: Terrible quality - tabs pull strings of diaper off with it
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2023
reviews.review: Unlike any other diaper we’ve used, when you go to remove these from your baby, the pull tabs take some of the diaper material with it resulting in stringy cotton whisks to come off and either get stuck on your baby or make it difficult to remove in one go (which is important when dealing with a blowout). Will never purchase this brand diaper again.

reviews.name: Emily
reviews.title: I had always purchased Huggies through a large wholesale retailer and have always been very satisfied with the product
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2014
reviews.review: I'm a hardcore Huggies fan (I was a nanny for several years for a couple different families, and I now have two little diapered ones of my own), so it hurts my heart a little to review them badly on here. I had always purchased Huggies through a large wholesale retailer and have always been very satisfied with the product. I was introduced to Subscribe and Save shortly after the birth of my first son and was impressed with the great prices and convenience, so I decided to try it out. There is a VAST difference in quality between the product I buy at the large wholesale store and the product I received through Subscribe and Save. I tried out several Subscribe and Save shipments before deciding to continue buying the Huggies elsewhere. With the birth of my second son came a renewed desire to save some money, so we tried out the Subscribe and Save Huggies again to huge disappointment. My now 18 month old son pee's through the Subscribe and Save Huggies within 3-4 hours (sometimes in as short of a time as his 1.5 hour nap...) and my 3 week old son is pee'ing through his size 1 in about the same time, 3-4 hours. We do not have this problem with Huggies purchased elsewhere. So, I don't think we'll be continuing our Huggies diapers Subscribe and Save, because at the rate we're going through them we're not really saving any money at all.

reviews.name: Brianna
reviews.title: Poor Quality for Huggies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2020
reviews.review: I love Huggies, and these seemed like a great value price-wise, but the quality is awful! Switched from the “Little Movers” style to the Snug n Dry because my size-3 3.5 month old isn’t “moving” yet so I figured I could get a little more bang for my buck with the less expensive option... but these are crap! They’re constantly tearing during diaper changes. I should be able to strap my baby into his diaper without ripping off the tabs or tearing holes in the leg-wings. And he’s constantly leaking poop out the leg holes. I realize at his age the poop is still pretty liquid... but come on! Also, when he pees I can smell it. Obviously pee has a smell.. but I could never smell it when he wore the more expensive line. I will be getting rid of the 150+ of these I have left and switching back to Little Snugglers!

reviews.name: Jen
reviews.title: Love Huggies - can’t stand these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.review: I don’t know if these only work with certain little bodies but these were horrendous. I tried sizing up, sizing down every which way; tucking the top, fluffing the sides etc. they would always leak. It’s specifically this line of Huggies, they’re little snugglers work great on my daughter but these were always a mess!

reviews.name: Martha Edwards
reviews.title: Product wonderful, but not Subscription
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2023
reviews.review: We use these diapers for the Grand. They work great. 1st delivery was perfect. the 2nd, through Subscribe and Save was NOT. Should have delivered on the 9th of the month according to subscription date. Was told should be here by 13th DIDN'T show told it should be the 19th. 10 days for shipping! Had to purchase 3 additional packages from the store. With Prime get 2 day shipping, 10 days with subscription, no more subscription.

reviews.name: KJB
reviews.title: More blowouts than any other brand
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2021
reviews.review: We wanted to like these because they’re cute and relatively inexpensive, but compared to every other brand we’ve tried these do the worst job at keeping things in. We have had more blowouts in these diapers than all other types combined. The side ruffles just don’t keep things in, unfortunately. Once when nursing, we even had a pee blowout - I didn’t even realize that was a thing until a waterfall of pee fell out the side of the diaper. That’s a no from me! They are also a pain to change, because they curl up and are hard to lay flat (and naturally curl up afterward as well — but in a way that makes it hard to fold up to throw out). That said, if the pee hits right, the diapers are fairly absorbent.

reviews.name: Bre
reviews.title: Don't buy- shreds
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2024
reviews.review: They are very absorbent but they also shred so little strings are constantly in the diaper and can wrap around areas they shouldn't-will not be buying again.

reviews.name: Kandi
reviews.title: Absorbency beads everywhere! Bad batch?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2019
reviews.review: I use Huggies often, we aren't brand snobs in our house. I'm sure that we've used this exact kind of Huggies as well, but this box was just awful. Our 2 boys are in size 5, one of them much more active than the other, and these didn't work for either activity level. We could change their diapers every half hour, or leave them on through a 3 hour car ride, but despite and time frame, we always found those little absorbency beads on their tushes! We are down to the last few diapers, and it hasn't improved. My MIL even texted me to ask if she did something wrong, after she noticed them when changing a diaper, while babysitting. I don't know if we just got a BAD batch, or something has changed since we last purchased this exact kind, but I am not willing to waste my money again, lightening deal or not.

reviews.name: Julia
reviews.title: Leaks like a son of a gun
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2022
reviews.review: We normally buy Kirkland brand diapers (basically Huggies) but we are nearing potty training so didn’t want to keep buying the big cases. Bought these because I figured they were comparable since Costco diapers are made by Huggies. These are not it unfortunately. We never ever had leaks with Costco Kirkland diapers in the almost three years my daughters been in them. We’ve had leak after leak with these diapers! I’m not sure what the deal is? Very disappointed in the quality, these are also very papery in comparison to other quality brands. These feel cheap. Not buying again.

reviews.name: Em
reviews.title: Little sand like texture all over the diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2022
reviews.review: Not sure what it is or what happened I opened the first pack of diapers and noticed what felt and looked like salt on the diapers I thought that was odd and wiped them off but then I noticed it was leaving white/clear balls all over my sons private, again thought it was odd and maybe there was the inside the the diapers were cut some where, I opened the second pack this morning and same thing I the sand like salt texture on the diapers and it’s on all them seems pretty odd as I have never had this happened or ever noticed something like this on diapers and I have three kids. I don’t know how to contact the seller to let them know so I figured I’d leave a review instead

reviews.name: smtn
reviews.title: It burst opened for the 3rd time. I should have listened others.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2016
reviews.review:
I've been using Hugggies Snug & Dry diapers for my baby boy since newborn. I was happy that Huggies keeps him dry and saving my $$ for bulk order until I received my last purchase in size 2. They have been giving him a lot of leak, waist band breakage and horrible mess in diaper crystals.

My baby boy is now in 4 month and he sleep through the night for 8 hours. I bath him and change his diapers before he goes to bed. The 1st breakage occurs during the night (less than 5 hours after new diapers changed for the night) and second incident happened at his 2 hours afternoon nap (I always change his diaper before I put him to sleep). For the 3rd time, I was frustrated to find out that the waist band was burst opened again and leaving all crystals mess on him AGAIN. It wasn't pleasant to wake up and bath a baby at 4am. I'm going to unsubscribe my next order and start looking into other brand.

reviews.name: Reviewer
reviews.title: They leak
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2024
reviews.review: They're okay overall but if our little one sleeps uninterrupted through the night, these will leak every time.

reviews.name: Marco Gonzalez
reviews.title: Entregar cada cosa correctamente
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.review: En este pedido que hice de pañales huggies, venían los dos paquetes de pañales venían abiertos, y eso no es correcto,todo tiene que venir completamente sellado , creo que esa es mi insatisfacción, y creo mo recomendaría de nuevo.

reviews.name: RJ
reviews.title: What happened?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2021
reviews.review: I used huggies exclusively for my 1st child so when my 2nd arrived I didn't question which brand of diapers I'd use... until I received multiple boxes of 'bad' diapers in multiple sizes.. I don't know what changed but the filling has hard clumps (I've noticed the same thing happening to pull ups- also made by huggies). The inner lining becomes so hard that the top edge cuts into my baby's belly. Thankfully pampers redesigned their diapers (they had a few years of subpar diapers as well) and are back to the quality parents want and trust. Sorry huggies- I don't know what you changed but we are not a huggies family anymore :-(

reviews.name: Sarah Marie
reviews.title: / Disappointed and have 2 boxes of 246 diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2016
reviews.review: These diapers leak a lot, even though other diapers of the same size don't... Around the inner thighs the diapers are just too loose, very different then the other Huggies before, the diapers are also much scratchier, then other brands. These don't compare to the Up and Up Target brand diapers. I thought by being such a big name brand I wouldn't have to say that. :/ Disappointed and have 2 boxes of 246 diapers. Will have to "suffer" through it. These diapers leak at night, even after only being on 2 hours, if my babies sleeps on her side, and pees or poos it goes right through the side she is laying on. The size 2 Up and Up diaper can be on all night and will not have this problem when she sleeps on her side. :/ I have done different sizes, my baby is almost 14 pounds, so the size 1 does not fit... I'm not sure how Huggies can correct this, and have seen similar reviews concerning the same issue... I will not buy Huggies again, they cost more then other diapers, and seem to lack in quality, which is a shame...

reviews.name: Alesha
reviews.title: Too many overnight leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2020
reviews.review: I have been using Huggies for my 14 month old since he was born. Never had an issue until I bought these 3 months ago. I have had to strip sheets at least every other night due to leaks. I know sometimes you get bad batch of a product and since I have used Huggies for so long, I decided to order again. The second box was just as bad. My son is only 25 pounds and the diapers fit snugly, but the absorption just isn't there. I even ordered and tried the little movers and they were no better. I'm really disappointed that I have been so pleased with Huggies for this long and now that we have reached a size 4 we are having all of these issues.

reviews.name: Sherri
reviews.title: Use Little Movers instead
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2018
reviews.review: I made the mistake of purchasing these instead of Little Movers that come in the purple box. I thought there wouldn’t really be much of a difference, but there is. The cheaper price was nice at the time of purchase, but I bought 136 low quality diapers when I made the choice to save $10. These are thin and they don’t have the double grip strip that little movers have. I change my daughters diaper a lot more often now just simply because they don’t stay in place and I can’t put her to bed in these because they’ll slide around and she’ll accidentally pee everywhere. So I had to buy a pack of little movers to put on her at night before bed so she can have a diaper that stays put all night. I don’t want to toss these or give them away, so I’ll just suffer with them as day-use diapers until they finally run out.

reviews.name: Bug
reviews.title: Quality seems to have changed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2023
reviews.review: I LOVED this brand for smaller sizes but for size 4 the quality seems to have changed or something. Really disappointed in them this time. They get all lumpy really quick if even a little wet and now they are leaking easily. Disappointed in them this time. I loved them in smaller sizes though

reviews.name: Jordan
reviews.title: They are thin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.review: I bought these on sale and my 2 year old is leaking through. I normally use Rascal and Friends and don’t have that problem. These seem thin and don’t hold a lot.

reviews.name: I am Me
reviews.title: They ok not bad
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2024
reviews.review: They ok I got the wrong size but they hold pretty good

reviews.name: I
reviews.title: do not buy!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.review: What happened to Huggies? Not only do they leak and are paper thin but my poor baby now has rash’s and burns! I feel terrible, Do NOT buy these diapers

reviews.name: Justin Brisbon
reviews.title: Defective, leaking moisture absorbing beads.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2020
reviews.review: I usually buy Pampers Swaddlers, but needed a diaper in between their size 4 & 5 so I tried these Huggins Snug and Dry since their size 4 was perfect. Unfortunately I ended throwing away most of them until just giving up on them all together. They have tiny hard beads that feel like sand and leaked out of most of the diapers Before being used. The changing pad felt like it had sand all over it. In some cases I would feel them on my baby's skin which I can imagine can't be comfortable for him. I would say 40-50% of the diapers were damaged or defective. I have 2 packs left and can bring myself to even gift them to anyone.

reviews.name: Sheria Brooks
reviews.title: Smh this was disappointing!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2021
reviews.review: While I loved how these diapers didn’t feel as bulky as the others the absorbency is lacking in the poop department. My daughter has pooped up her back three times since buying these diapers and this has never happened before with any of the other Huggies diapers. Also I was holding her legs up and she peed and it literally ran down her butt and out the back of her diaper wetting her clothes and blanket. I won’t be buying these any more once she finished this box. I might donate the unopened pack from the box and just buy the special delivery ones since they worked perfect and didn’t irritate my daughters skin. She has developed a rash from these however with two days of diaper cream the rash is clearing up.

reviews.name: Michelle Ulloa
reviews.title: Great for pee not for poop 💩
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2020
reviews.review:
When they talk about the new absorbing technology they are not kidding. 10/10 for the ability to wick pee right up and even when “full” the diaper is not big and chunky. Super cool.
HOWEVER ....the diapers are super short so they don’t go up as high as other brands which means it cannot hold a baby poop to save it’s life. Every. Single. One. was out and up the back which resulted in a complete wardrobe change. Used a different diaper brand for a day and all the poops stayed in....thank goodness.
Wanted so badly to like these because the price is great for the quantity and they really are super absorbent for the pee. Oh well...back to Costco I go.

reviews.name: Jasmine
reviews.title: Bad quality/very flimsy material
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2018
reviews.review: Ok so I use pampers always and have never switched to another brand but recently i though of giving Huggies diapers a chance since the deal sounded nice ( almost 172 diapers in 32 bucks). When i opened the diapers pack, i realized that the whole diaper felt very thin, which first i thought is awesome since we are going lean in diapers and pads but when i put it in my son and checked after 2 hours it was wiggly. I ignored that and changed him to fresh one. I usually fold and toss the diapers in pale comfortably but this time the whole diaper was torn into peices and some soked material came out of it and sticked to pale walls. I am disappointed at the quality of diaper. Even though this is famous huggies. I got size 5 for my son.

reviews.name: D. Bishop
reviews.title: Recommend the premium ones over these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2015
reviews.review:
Purchased these instead of the ones I normally get - Little Movers or whatever the name is for the size 6 "premium" Huggies. Having used the other ones from day one with the new baby, could instantly tell these were not as well made. They are much thinner, the elastic around the leg is much wider (might be a better fit for larger/heavier babies) and we had numerous leak accidents. Not going to 1 star it as they still do a decent job, but they required me to change much more often, which doesn't lend itself to saying that there are more in here than the premium ones, and thus a better value. We did find that if you have them sit a little lower than the waist, and thus fold a bit of the diaper over, that leaks were reduced. Again, this could be specific to our toddler's weight/build. She's tall and probably a bit skinny.

The box of Little Movers arrived yesterday and very happy for it. Despite the fact these are much cheaper and frequently have Amazon Mom coupons, I don't want my little one to have the potential for leaks

reviews.name: Brian & Amy Chilcott
reviews.title: TERRIBLE- always breaks apart
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers are the WORST. I bought them a couple times. The first time, they busted open a bunch of times. I thought maybe it was a bad batch, since huggies are a name brand expensive diaper. I bought them again and it keeps happening. The gel inside comes out all the time. A few times a week. And it’s not after an overnight diaper. It’s after my daughter has the diaper on for an hour or so. They are terrible. Never again. I did bring this up to corporate and they were very very helpful and responsive.

reviews.name: jamie
reviews.title: Slimy coating on packs of huggies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.review: The outside of both of the packages we covered in a greasy slimy feeling. Like someone rubbed grease all over the plastic packages

reviews.name: Madhu
reviews.title: Not good
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.review:
I do not like this product for below reasons:

1. Quality is not good seems rough for touch
2. Caused rash in our baby
3. Small thread like substance releasing from the diaper gets stuck to baby

I definitely like Kirkland diapers better.

reviews.name: Megan
reviews.title: Splurge for Pampers, it’s worth it!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2020
reviews.review: I was drawn in by the cute Mickey Mouse design on this product. However, Huggies has fallen short yet again. My son (2 months) has been wearing these for the last week and has had a constant scent of urine. This diaper does not contain the smell of pee very well, which I have never experienced with other brands. Also, today he went through 3 outfits due to poop somehow shooting out of his diaper. Although this happens from time to time, it is rare that it escapes the diaper and requires an outfit change. I will NOT be purchasing Huggies again. I will be sticking to Pampers and Costco brand.

reviews.name: Breana
reviews.title: Smell
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2023
reviews.review: I use Huggies on my baby often and it seems like every single time I buy them on Amazon they have a weird smell almost like ink or some strong chemical. I am not happy and I wish I could return but I already opened it.

reviews.name: Julie Singh
reviews.title: Disappointed!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020
reviews.review: I recently saw these diapers online & after having success with the Huggins Snugglers wanted to give these a try. Needless to say I was quite disappointed. My daughter is 6 weeks old wearing newborn size, so perhaps these are better for larger babies than her. My biggest complaint on these is when she poops it goes everywhere! The Snugglers diapers have a flap in the back that keep most stool from escaping up her back, but these do not. I have had to clean more mess & change more clothes in the last 2 days than I had the week prior.

reviews.name: Kathleen Sinclair
reviews.title: THE FILLER GETS SO BULKY
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2022
reviews.review:
If you enjoy picking diaper lint out of your baby's thigh rolls, I'd certainly recommend these.
As soft and comfortable as they may seem, the filling bulks up so badly. I check his diaper every hour and with these, I have to change him every single time.
We know lots of parents love huggies, but we'd choose other brands over these.

reviews.name: Russell riley
reviews.title: LEAK LEAK LEAK AND ARE NOT WORTH THE MONEY. BUY THE HUGGIES LITTLE MOVERS INSTEAD
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2019
reviews.review: These diapers sucked. I always buy Huggies little movers but I went with snug n dry this time because I got more for my buck and I regret it. I literally have to change my kids diaper more frequently then before and I've had to change his clothes and bed sheets due to leaking through the diaper. If I could get a refund on these I would have. I would of sent them back to Amazon to but I already used some. I wasn't going to go buy more diapers when I already have these. Don't ever buy these. They suck and are worse then the family Dollar diapers for a single $1. literally $1 diapers did better then the snug n dry.

reviews.name: Mindy Hammock
reviews.title: Worst diapers I have ever used
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2018
reviews.review: These are some of the worst diapers I have ever used on my 4 children. Huggies has really not been holding up to thier brand name it seems lately. These diapers do not even come close to holding the amount of urine that even the worst brands can hold. Not even kidding that a single very small amount of pee make these diapers look like my kids just jumped in the lake, then when taking it off it feels like it has not even been used any yet weight wise. The only reason why it's not a 1 star is because they dropped to a pretty low price but knowing what I know now they can drop to half that price and I wouldn't buy them again.

reviews.name: Linda Morgan
reviews.title: Gift
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2024
reviews.review: Convenient

reviews.name: Ms
reviews.title: Recently something has change
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2022
reviews.review: I have bought this huggies product for my little Girl, and had no issues whatsoever before. But now I see that something is coming out of the diaper, is like the gel it self and is all over my baby's bud , I think this product has an issue 😕 , like it didn't happen before. Is the box I recently bought 🤔 ..what can you do to help me with this problem

reviews.name: Gabriela E.
reviews.title: They Leak
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
reviews.review: These diapers are not good! They leak. They don't have good absorption. They fit small also. I do like how they snug in baby buy they run very small.

reviews.name: FurBabyMama
reviews.title: Worst diapers we tried
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2020
reviews.review: I have been on the hunt for diapers for my son. Tried every single brand available on Amazon and even the WholeFoods brand too. These are really bad! I would honestly say that they are my least favorite. They aren’t soft to the touch, you can feel the grainy gel inside, and they don’t hold in my 6 month old’s poop. All the other diapers we tried were infinitely better If you like huggies, go for the night time or 360 cruisers but stay away from this one. Glad it was on sale because we won’t be using them!

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Every single diaper leaks gel
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2021
reviews.review:
My son has been wearing Huggies Snugglers since he was born. We tried these because there were more per package and we had a hard time finding the snugglers in a size 3.

I’ll never buy these again. It doesn’t matter how much or how little liquid there is in these diapers, EVERY SINGLE ONE leaks gel. I find the gel all over his skin every time we change the diaper. If I can’t find the Snugglers in his size, Ill just be on the look out for a new brand

reviews.name: MomOfTheMs
reviews.title: Seems generic
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2022
reviews.review: We purchased online because local stores were out of stock and our twins only use Huggies Snug and Dry, everything else give them rash. Seemed like a great deal and we could have it delivered? SOLD! Nope, wrong move. Diapers are much thinner than previous purchases and the twins have been leaking through multiple times a day which has never been a problem before. Still no rash so giving 2 stars even though 1 may be more appropriate.

reviews.name: QualityBeauty
reviews.title: Absolutely... NOT!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2022
reviews.review: We use them as day time diapers for my son and change them OFTEN just so we can hurry up and get through them. The worst ones Huggies has made. No type of protection. They start the droop and drag after a few minutes of my son wearing them. This causes a gap between the thigh and genital area. So that leaves room for leakage and mess. Won't buy these again.

reviews.name: jessica
reviews.title: Horrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2024
reviews.review: Gave my baby a chemical burn.

reviews.name: Evie Danecki
reviews.title: Fuzz Everywhere.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.review:
Holds a lot of pee, but oh my goodness... the fuzz from the sticky parts is insane.

I don't know I'd purchase these again.

reviews.name: talia bree mccoy
reviews.title: These suck, but something else
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.review: They leak and fit weird. Will never buy again. They were inexpensive so they did save me some money.

reviews.name: DeltaBravo
reviews.title: Change in Quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2022
reviews.review: Had to cancelled my subscription, the first box (Left) was perfect, The second box... at first I thought, okay maybe the colour is just faded, but the whole quality was poor, doesnt keep absorption well, easy to rip as a result you have to be using more than usual. This could very much be a production error, but I can only rate what I recieved, both are same price and quantity.

reviews.name: J. Fields
reviews.title: DONT BUY! Caused irritation - Lawsuits
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2021
reviews.review: Don't buy!! The snug and dry version of Huggies caused irritation and redness in my 2.5month old. Original Huggies and the special delivery have worked great for us but within a few days of using these my daughter had a deep red irritation to her bottom. After investigating further there are recent lawsuits against Huggies for chemical burns with snug and dry diapers. Thankfully my baby's was caught and treated early before it got bad.

reviews.name: Nick H.
reviews.title: Not recommended
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
reviews.review: These diapers do not hold up to the Huggies standard. They are thin, they leak, and we’ve had several blowouts as compared to our usual Huggies diapers from Costco. Do not recommend.

reviews.name: Sarah Walters
reviews.title: Very snug not so dry
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2023
reviews.review: These diapers for sure catch some of the pee but somehow manage to leak out of the sides. Happened not once but twice and in large quantities. I’m more impressed with regular or special delivery Huggies.

reviews.name: AWL
reviews.title: Poor fit, leaking absorbent gel spheres
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2018
reviews.review: These are borderline too small for my 21 pound 7-month old baby. He has very big thighs, but these are also hard to get a good fit around his waist. I’ve noticed more of the absorbent material in these diapers leaks out than in other disposables I’ve used, regardless of if he wears them 1 hour or overnight. I bought these because at the time, they were a better price than the store brand that I normally buy (and love) and would be delivered sooner. However, next time I’ll pay a little extra and wait another day or two to get the diapers that have been my go-to.

reviews.name: Stephen M.
reviews.title: New diapers explode pee fluffies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2020
reviews.review: Historically we have lives using this brand of diapers. We have changed thousands of diapers and like the wetness indicator on these diapers. However, the new version of diapers has suffered with lower quality. They seem absorbent as usual, but the outside part of the diapers holding everything in have been ripping apart with regular use. We have found the “white fluffies” with absorbed pee all over our house several times since they came out around April 2020. The old diaper version would never have this issue. It is more work than it is worth using these diapers.

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.title: What Happened??????
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2022
reviews.review: These diapers protected my daughter throughout the night last month, but when I received my new shipment I noticed the diapers looked different. The printing looked faded (Big deal), but what was really different was the blue pad which was part of last month's supply, was missing, the result it seems, is less overall leak protection. I find myself changing diapers more often than before and every morning she's soaked. What Happened???

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Don’t waste your money, they leak every single night!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2018
reviews.review: These diapers are okay for during the day, but they’re terrible for nighttime. I change my 17 month old’s diaper at least twice a night with huggies, and every night I have to change her pants, shirt, and bed sheets with it as well. There is no reason to spend the extra money on huggies diapers when luvs are cheaper and can hold eveything through the night. I’ve never had a problem with regular luvs leaking or soaking through during the night. With luvs I changed her less at night, she slept better and longer because they hold moisture better and she didn’t feel wet during the night.

reviews.name: Reneé M
reviews.title: Poor quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2023
reviews.review: This box was not up to the usual good quality that I've come to expect from Huggies. Bring back the diapers with the blue colour inside! Those were far superior and leaked less.

reviews.name: Shelly Smith
reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2019
reviews.review: Flimsy, cheap, not the usual Huggies quality (we've used Huggies for years). Thought this deal was too good to be true and it was! The diaper is super thin and has no support or form when worn, so the back is constantly riding up and causing wedgies - uncomfortable for the toddler and a MESSY situation for #2's. Also felt the need to change more often because they fill up with pee so fast and it gets a deformed shape - just weird. Won't be purchasing again. Good quality is worth a few extra $$.

reviews.name: Roland
reviews.title: (1) It smells bad. chemical smell
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2018
reviews.review:
I only give two stars, the reason is that: (1) It smells bad. chemical smell; (2) every two or three weeks at night the diaper leak pee, and my son would wake up in the middle of night with a wet pajamas and the bed, it is very disturbing.

We have used the Huggies for two years, and for the last one year we have ordered from the same seller - this one. I just wanna say it is very disappointing, and honestly, in the past I had confidence in the HUGGIES, now I just don't know what to do?

any suggestions? Thanks,

reviews.name: Dana Elliott
reviews.title: Used to love huggies, but never again
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2020
reviews.review: We have preferred huggies for my youngest son since birth. They fit him better. But after this last box, we will never use them again. There is a very hard material inside these diapers that I cant imagine having on ME, let alone my infant. They aren't as absorbent as other brands and my son tends to get rashy with these. The last straw was changing his diaper after only wearing it an hour and seeing a CUT into his leg!!

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Absorbing beads leaking out of diaper!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2021
reviews.review: I’m really disappointed in these diapers. I’m not sure if anyone else is having this problem but my daughters ‘diaper area’ is covered in the absorbing beads almost every time. I can’t imagine how awful that must feel in such a sensitive area. The beads are all over her and the changing table. We don’t have the money to ‘waste’ any diapers otherwise I would just buy something else... I’m concerned it could be harmful too.

reviews.name: K & D
reviews.title: My wife and I liked Huggies the best and have continued to use them
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2017
reviews.review:
Firstly, these say they come with a wetness indicator. They don't. Some people have reviewed that they believe they received 'fake' Huggies or that the quality changed drastically from regular Huggies and I can't disagree with them. My wife and I liked Huggies the best and have continued to use them. Now we purchase these and the quality just isn't there and the product description is a blatant lie. I won't even get into if these are fake Huggies (Fuggies?) but I wouldn't be surprised. I would not buy these again.
Just in case Amazon does go back and update the product description, as of June 30, 2017, the product description states: "Wetness indicator changes color when it’s time for a diaper change"

reviews.name: shannon
reviews.title: Broken tabs, missing tabs!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2018
reviews.review: Up until this month I’ve never had an issue. I feel like that needs saying because either I’ve been lucky or they’ve been spot on. However, this last box was horrendous. 1 out of every 5 diapers esas either missing a left tab completely or hanging by a thread rendering it useless! I’m really upset because I plan accordingly and order these to ship automatically and now I’m almost out of them already due to the amount I’ve had to throw away. I’ve gotten rid of the packaging a month ago otherwise I’d try to post a product number.

reviews.name: The Girl Geek
reviews.title: What happened to Huggies?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2019
reviews.review: It would be a lie to say that these diapers are not absorbent. they contain little gel beads that soak up a large amount of urine. This causes the diaper to sag and by morning you will find little gel beads in the feet of the pajamas. During the day you will find little gel beads throughout the play area. I was told after contacting Huggies that these are non-toxic beads. That really did not consult me, I don't want our baby eating any beads. my money was refunded after the diapers were returned.

reviews.name: Michelle B
reviews.title: I will never purchase these again!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2018
reviews.review: These are terrible diapers. I ordered because they were cheap & Huggies usually has good quality diapers, but these are not good. They are really thin & as soon as they get any amount of moisture in them they get super saggy & the leg holes stretch too far. The filling inside gets really clumpy. My friend came & needed to borrow a diaper for her child & I handed this to her & she said she had purchased 4 boxes because they were a good deal but hated them too so she returned them too! Ugh! I would not recommend them at all

reviews.name: Haley
reviews.title: Not what they used to be
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2023
reviews.review: I’ve been using this huggies brand for three years. The last six months we’ve been having blow outs and wet throughs constantly. After this box is out, we’ll be paying a little more for pampers instead.

reviews.name: Viet Nguyen
reviews.title: Poorly sew
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2021
reviews.review: So far we got about 5-6 of these diapers being poorly put together. The first few we thought oh it's probably just one or two, now that we used about 15 diapers, it's almost 1/3 of it being like this. I can't put this on my newborn, it can definitely cause chafing or irratition. I thought huggies was one of the top brands for babies, very disappointed. Would not recommend.

reviews.name: Lauren
reviews.title: Blow outs!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2022
reviews.review:
I am a mom to 4 kiddos. I bought snug and dry for my newborn. They leak constantly! I will be getting little snugglers and then little movers asap.
I'm slowing moving to cloth diapers...last baby and staying home more than working.

reviews.name: BG
reviews.title: Not like the regular Huggies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020
reviews.review: I got the Huggies snug & dry diapers for our daughter. I had used Huggies diapers before, which were really good, but these are not as good. The absorbing area is not that much, and I don't think it absorbs as good, so it leaves wetness in the skin. If you're buying these because the little snugglers were good, then you will be wrong. I would say just get them, as these are not as good.

reviews.name: Jordan glover
reviews.title: Disappointed with quality.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2017
reviews.review: I have recently switched from pampers to Huggies and I am not satisfied at all with the snug and dry brand. I switched due to price. The quality is terrible and they don't absorb anything hardly. Lots of my friends were trying to tell me that huggies were better but I don't see it unless I got a really terrible batch. I noticed it really bad when I was carrying my daughter and her pee leaked through completely and got all over me. I ended up getting a Huggies size 5 from Costco and they fit my daughter better and the quality is much better. I think I just got a really bad batch or I may go back to pampers.

reviews.name: Ida M.
reviews.title: What happened to huggies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2022
reviews.review: I am unsure of what Huggies or Amazon did to these diapers but they leak. My baby is starting to sleep 4-5 hours straight and my baby is soaked through layers of clothes smh what a waste of money.

reviews.name: S and L
reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2013
reviews.review: We have been buying huggies diapers for more than 3 years now. When the new type of Snug and Dry were delivered to our house I could tell a big difference in thickness. My son (12 months) has had several leaky diapers since. I agree with the others that it's not really about how thick a diaper is, it's about how it holds the liquid. Obviously there is a mass amount of unhappy people with the thinner diapers, Huggies. Maybe you need to go back and think about your customer reviews and consider that many of us were plenty happy with the other Snug and Dry diapers. My babies NEVER seemed uncomfortable with the thickness, and they moved just fine in them. I don't think a thinner diaper was needed. We WERE very happy.

reviews.name: Kayla Starr
reviews.title: Caused Rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2022
reviews.review: I have never experienced an issue w a specific diaper brand giving either of my daughters a rash until right now. I thought maybe it was the diaper ointment but after we stopped using these, the rash went away a couple days later (was lasting 8 days when I figured it could be the diapers).

reviews.name: Jessie L.
reviews.title: Huggies Snug 'N Dry newborn diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2018
reviews.review: Loved the elasticity and softness of the diapers, but every 1 out of 3 diapers or so didn't hold up whenever my son pooped. I constantly had to change and clean his outfits almost every time I changed his diaper since the poop always came out of the leg areas of the diapers - it seemed like there was nowhere for it to be absorbed well into the diaper, so it just went out the sides. I was hoping they would work well for us since I have heard good things from other people, but unfortunately they just didn't.

reviews.name: Michelle B
reviews.title: I will never purchase these again!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2018
reviews.review: These are terrible diapers. I ordered because they were cheap & Huggies usually has good quality diapers, but these are not good. They are really thin & as soon as they get any amount of moisture in them they get super saggy & the leg holes stretch too far. The filling inside gets really clumpy. My friend came & needed to borrow a diaper for her child & I handed this to her & she said she had purchased 4 boxes because they were a good deal but hated them too so she returned them too! Ugh! I would not recommend them at all

reviews.name: Haley
reviews.title: Not what they used to be
reviews.review:
June 2017 update: One week after we stopped using Huggies diapers purchased off Amazon, my son's itching stopped dramatically. I want to be clear that this was NOT an allergic reaction b/c he had multiple actual bug bites, especially around his diaper area. Again, he was the only one in our family being attacked for about 3 mos before I realized it had to be the diapers. I also want to note that we stored the diapers in our home sealed inside the manufacturers bag until we used them and we keep a very clean house/ very attentive to detail. We continued the scabies/ mite treatment for about two weeks after we stopped using the diapers to be safe. We weren't seeing new bites and all his old bites were healing well b/c he wasn't relentlessly scratching them any longer. I had to throw away probably 2 packs of Huggies 172 count (still in manufacturers plastic bag/sealed) and probably spent close to $500 on various treatments for my son and my home b/c I did not know what it was at first so this Huggies negligence basically cost me almost $600, many sleepless nights, worry about what's literally eating my son, and lots of pain to my 2 yr old son. I will NEVER buy products from them or their Parent company every again !!!!

Original review: My son got bites all on the upper part of his butt, i thought they were mosquitoes bites at first but new bites developed even when he wasn't playing outside and they were getting bigger and itched him so bad that he would scratch till he bleed. He was the only member in our house getting these bites. Nevertheless, I treated our entire home and backyard, spending a lot of money! I was also constantly treating him w/ 4 different treatments, he was getting sulfur soap baths twice a day and we also got medication cream from doctor...the old bites healed but new once kept developing. This went on for almost three months till I realized that the only thing it could be was bugs in his diapers since no one else was getting bites in our house and there weren't any bugs in our home either...I would search the beds almost every night when he would wake-up itching and screaming but would find NOTHING. I now know it's b/c the mites are almost totally transparent until they change color after drinking plenty of your blood, yikes!! It makes me wonder if there were also eggs and larva on the diapers which you definitely couldn't see. We will NEVER use ANY Huggies brand item EVER again!!!! I would give zero stars!

reviews.name: sjc8187
reviews.title: Just like the thin brown paper towels you use in the Grocery store bathroom.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2016
reviews.review: I have ordered these from Subscribe and Save for over a year, I have been a Huggies fan since my first baby 14 years ago but they have really let their Snug and Dry diapers go to waste. Their Snugglers and Cruisers keep getting better, but I feel like they are purposefully making Snug and Dry worse to get us to buy the more expensive Huggies brands that come with a lot less diapers. I have 3 babies right now, and of both genders. These diapers are now paper towel thin, and I don't mean Bounty, I mean the crappy brown paper like thin you see in the grocery store bathroom! I am CONSTANTLY changing diapers, after 1 time of being peed in, they are falling apart, ripping at the seams, if they are peed in more than once by the baby, there are crystals EVERYWHERE, even when the diaper is no where near being full! All THREE of my babies are getting rashes from their diapers busting open in their sleepers and rubbing and chaffing them. I have never thought I'd see the day where Huggies would lose all care of quality in one of their products to get people to spend more. The more I have to change diapers, the faster I am running through the box and having to go out and buy more. Thank God I am a seasoned mom and I know this is not normal because I WON'T be buying these again! New moms may not realize that their baby's diaper busting open every single day, 3x a day isn't always the baby's fault, it is the diapers fault! I bought a 3 pack of generic diapers from the dollar tree to keep in my car for when I am out and about and those GENERIC diapers work SOOOOO MUCH BETTER! I don't want excuses, I don't want to hear it's the same absorbancy but thinner, because it is definitely not the same absorbancy, they rip like those thin brown paper towels in the grocery store bathroom, and they are now the WORST diapers I have ever used in my life! Not to mention the sizes are smaller now with snug and dry compared to cruisers and snugglers, I will not be buying any Huggies anymore! I refuse to keep buying more and having to go to the more expensive huggies brand every month because this company has lost all sense of morals, ethics, and pride in their products. Shame on you Huggies.

reviews.name: Brian MB
reviews.title: Not normal quality for the product.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2025
reviews.review: I don't know why these diapers don't fit properly. I've been buying this same size diaper for at least 3 months. I've bought this brand and style for at least a year and never had a diaper leak on me. Normally buy at local store.

reviews.name: Vv
reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2025
reviews.review: Cheaply!!!!!!! ITS NOT THE REAL HUGGIES DIAPER THAT I BUY I DONT like them they don’t hold moisture. They are thin. They leak. IT GAVE MY BABY A RASH I DONT RECOMMEND. The price was right & also thought they were the real Huggies. They are not. DO NOT BUY if I could give 0 stars I would. It gave my baby a rash.

reviews.name: Aurora
reviews.title: Horrible new desing, guaranteed TO LEAK! Shame on the money makers for Huggies!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2013
reviews.review: We have children that are now in college to infant age. We have used only huggies since 1991 as they were all allergic to pampers. It is a shame to what huggies has come to! These diapers are so thin they do not hold anything. Now, I have to change my son's diapers three times through the night, and even then sometimes the mattress will be wet because the diaper does not hold. These diapers are designed for dehydrated children. They have been designed to make more money (as you have to constantly change them) not to help parents and their children to keep "Snug and Dry". I have a toddler and an infant and the toddler gets rashes between his legs because the diapers do NOT last and sag to often giving him a rash where the diapers rub in the inside of his legs, and I do change him three times more than with the old ones, and still these new ones do not last! Anyone who does not know us will think he gets those bruises looking marks because we are doing them while is the diaper!! I find myself changing more diapers throughout the day and night, more often then ever before! I do not mind to do what I have to do to keep my babies happy and dry, but this is not how huggies used to be! I do not appreciate huggies advertising a product that is false advertised compromising my children's well being. The good thing about this, is that I will run out soon enough and will not have to use them again. I am a subscribe and safe Mom for Hughes size 4, and size 2, but that will stop in a few minutes after am done writing this review, as I will stop my subscription. It is a real shame to look for ways to improve the way you can make money even if it is at the cost of these children and their parent's expense. I am very disappointed this is the way you thank your faithful costumers. This is the product you produce to have our beautiful, innocent little angels to use? We are talking about human being, about our children, the most precious thing in the world that you are putting in a position they should never be put into.

reviews.name: Kelli
reviews.title: Poor fit and absorbency
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2025
reviews.review: I mistakenly bought these diapers thinking they were the little movers. Did not stay up on my daughter and every time I would change her it would be all scrunched and had fallen way down. Also the only diaper my daughter has ever leaked through and literally had pee running down her leg due to poor fit.

reviews.name: Debbbbbb
reviews.title: Leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2025
reviews.review:
If I could give a 1 star I would! These have leaked 70% of the time within 30mins of wearing them.
Never had diapers leak so quickly.
I tried these as they have the poo blocker but they are a waste of money. I’ll stick to pampers thanks!

reviews.name: Tamara
reviews.title: The new design is so disappointing!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2013
reviews.review:
My daughter was born last year and I used Huggies from the very beginning. I was so happy with them and would recommend them to anyone! Throughout all the different sizes, she hardly ever had a leak.

Fast forward to May when I got my monthly shipment and they were the "new and improved" design. I first noticed that they were a lot thinner than the old version. The padding of the older version never bothered me or my daughter. They were comfy and soft and they WORKED! Since using the new ones, my daughter has leaked through more times in the last few weeks than she has in the entire year of her life. She has woken up many times from a whole night's sleep soaked through, but this hardly ever happened with the old diapers. The worst is when she is in her car seat. If she even has a small amount of pee in her diaper, after being in the car for 10 mins or so, I'd take her out and her entire bottom and legs would be wet through! This has happened on multiple occasions. I go through so many of these new diapers because I feel like I now need to make sure she has a new diaper before we go anywhere in the car. Her caregiver (who has three children of her own) has also told me that these new diapers "suck".

I have read many reviews on here and it seems that the majority of people using Huggies in the past were happy with them, but that once the new designs came out, ratings have dropped and reviews are negative. I really wish that Huggies would listen to us and go back to the tried and true diapers that everyone loved. I was hoping that I could switch to Huggies Little Movers and get the same quality of diapers that the old Huggies offered, but it seems that all types are "new and improved". I will be returning my most recent shipment and now I need to find a new brand of diapers that worked as well as the old Huggies. I got a small package of Pampers, but they feel even thinner and I'm not sure how they will hold up. Has anyone tried other brands and found one that works well? My daughter is currently in a size 3, but is probably ready for a size 4. Any help would be appreciated!

reviews.name: John Babicke
reviews.title: Blowouts every time!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2024
reviews.review:
Normally we use the Huggies “little movers” which tend to be pretty good. I ordered these because I was running low and the others weren’t going to arrive on time. Comparing the two product features, there didn’t seem to be much of a difference- these even seemed like they might be superior to the “Little Movers”. NOPE! Blowouts every time. Without fail. Big poops, small poops, doesn’t matter. Even wet diapers are leaking!

What does “Up to 100% leakproof” even mean? What a non statement. I guess it’s true because 1% leakproof would still be “up to 100%”. These definitely don’t come close to leakproof. Don’t buy these. Stick with the “Little Movers”.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Not Great for Sensitive Skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2024
reviews.review: I did not realize that Huggies Snug and Dry were made differently than standard Huggies (little snugglers, little movers, overnights) at the time of purchase. Huggies are usually great for my daughter’s sensitive skin, but using Huggies Snug and Dry resulted in a gnarly diaper rash for her. After a brief google search, I was able to determine that Huggies Snug and Dry are the budget line of Huggies diapers and made a little bit differently. If you’ve never used these before and your child has sensitive skin, I would recommend starting with a small package to test for a reaction before buying in bulk like I did.

reviews.name: it's me!
reviews.title: RASH ALLERGIC AWFUL CHEMICAL SMELL DEFECTIVE
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2020
reviews.review:
These diapers are defective--the blue gel comes out of the pad and my son had an immediate allergic reaction. I have used only Huggies lil movers or lil snugglers and these are completely different--I was proud that at 16 months my son has NEVER had a diaper rash--and literally after a few of these diapers his little tush was speckled red, almost like raised little welts! And his poor little bumhole looked like a ring of fire. He screamed in the tubby from the pain and I am angry that such a product is available. After this happened, I looked online and found that there is a class action suit against Huggies for this exact problem. I have requested a refund and I am returning the rest of the diapers. I have only used maybe 5 or 6 out of the 180. Thankfully, I stopped using the diapers and he is healing up today, but I can imagine that if these diapers are not eliminated how many children have been in the hospital from the reaction to the chemicals.
Also, on the Huggies chart, I only bought these because it looked like they checked the same boxes as lil movers or snugglers aside from the grippy velcro thing that I don't like anyway--says chemical free and fragrance free. This is not true-I thought my son had a #2 after he wet his diaper because the strange chemical smell that is emitted--my husband and I agree it smells like buttered popcorn in the weirdest way.
WHAT the heck Huggies???
And Amazon, why are these still being sold? Look at the reviews.
Spend the extra .10 a diaper! You will change less diapers, and your baby's booty will be grateful.
DO NOT BUY THESE DIAPERS!

reviews.name: Brianna Cowles
reviews.title: great for overnight, but that's pretty much it.... maybe not even that.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2016
reviews.review:
I have a borderline hate and dislike for these diapers. I bought a size 2 as my twins are transitioning into that size. My little girl is a bit chubby and her twin brother is skinnier. These diapers are "okay" for over night as they do keep my babies drier and they don't wake up with terrible rashes due to being wet. But these absolutely suck for day time and awake use. As a new parent, I kind of rely on the wetness indicator. Which these don't have. These are so good at keeping moisture at bay that it's pretty much impossible to tell if my kids are wet or not unless they've had the diaper on for many hours; which by then, they develop a small rash and it's just painful for them to get changed. Even pressing my finger down onto it on a hard surface makes it hard to tell if these are wet. And I refuse to let my babies wear one diaper for 12 hours. Even IF the claim is that they will stay dry for 12 hours. Which is also not true. I'd give it about 6 max.
Not only that, but the front cut of the diaper doesn't seem correct. It's like they don't fit properly. I'm either having to make the diaper way too tight to make the front fit properly, or it's too loose and we have blowouts or side leakage. This is on both kids, and for both pee and poo, so I know for a fact it's not me and how I'm changing them.
It says they protect against leaks, but I've had leaks out the sides and even soak throughs from in front. Not from one of them having the one diaper all night, either. It just randomly happens to soak through. So not only do I have a diaper change, but I have a clothing change as well.
My boy is a very wiggly and active baby, so a lot of the times when he's a tiny bit wet, he's also wet out the sides for the same reasons as listed above. NOT recommended for an active baby. His sister is pretty calm and the odd thing is that she has more leaks and blow outs than he does.
Either way, I will not be ordering this product again.

reviews.name: Steff
reviews.title: Useless
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers were not good for us. My little one is crawling and these diapers did not hold up they bunch up without having anything in them and fray within seconds. We had no luck with them holding up at all. Night time with these diapers was a nightmare. I had to change my 9 month old every couple hours and even then he had leaked through. I saved a few dollars up front buying these but in the long run I spent more because I had to change the diapers so much more sometimes with nothing at all in the diaper because they just stretched out from moving around. Also all the extra laundry from all the leaks. Never again! Don't waste your money if you have a little one who is crawling or walking.

reviews.name: FaithfulMarineWife
