reviews.title: Should be relabeled: Huggies Snug & WET - NOT for heavy wetters!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2019
reviews.review: These are probably the worst diapers we have ever used, and we have gone through many different brands and styles of diapers with 3 kids over a span of 5 years! I decided to try out the Huggies Snug & Dry diapers since they were on sale on Amazon - and now I know why they were discounted so heavily - because they truly do not keep your kid dry! They are paper thin, swell up very quickly, do not retain moisture, and leak every time! They even start to fall apart (ie beads start falling out everywhere) due to not being able to hold in all the moisture! And this is only with 1-2 hours of use! To put us out of our misery using these awful diapers (since we had a mega huge box of them to still get through), I ordered different (more reliable diapers for our son - LUVS - yes, cheap LUVS!) and we used those during nap time and night sleep times, then designated these diapers as the "day time use only, preferably when you know there isn't going to be a poop" diaper, until we finished them off! Perhaps these might work on other babies/toddlers who are not heavy wetters, but they did NOT work at all for our 2 yr old heavy wetter! I recommend using either LUVS or Huggies Snugglers over the Snug & Dry! They both are better, in the same size. Although, unfortunately & sadly, even LUVS (& Pampers) diapers have recently been downgraded in quality due to the manufacturer trying to save money, but even they are better than this diaper! Maybe that is what happened to this diaper before we tried it, too :( I have a feeling it's going to be harder and harder to find a good quality diaper anymore these days...

reviews.name: Valee5
reviews.title: WARNING!!! DO NOT BUY THESE HUGGIES!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2013
reviews.review:
Huggies why are you still selling these? How many babies and parents have to suffer before you pull this product? Amazon, please look over the reviews since Huggies changed their diaper. The reviews for this diaper should not be combined with the reviews from the original snug and dry diaper as it is NOT the same product. Your subscribe and save customers should not pay for and receive anything but the product they originally ordered. Huggies is dragging your name through the mud right along with theirs.
These have been the only diapers I would ever put on either of my girls, until now. When I first received this last box of diapers I thought they seemed awfully thin but then never thought much more about it. So when my daughter started wetting and messing through her diaper I just thought time to go up a size, even though this was never an issue with my older daughter. After all it couldn't possibly be the brand/diaper I had for so long in-trusted. So when my baby started getting diaper rashes, which she never gets, I just figured it must be from her teething. Until no matter what I did; oatmeal baths, baking soda baths, creams/ointments, corn starch it kept coming back and with a vengeance. Finally I took her to an expert (my mother) and after leaving her bare bottomed or in bloomers for the entire day it started clearing up. When bedtime came and I discovered I had no diapers in my diaper bag. I reluctantly used the "off brand" diapers my mom had. To my surprise the next day the rash was gone. After returning home and placing one of her" Huggies" on her the rash was back by the very next change. Thats when I figured out it was her diapers this whole time. What really gets me when seeing all these reviews. Is that huggies knows about all the issues and discomfort these diapers are causing. They leave comments stating the same thing after every one star review. Yet continue to sell them, promote them as the same product. (you too Amazon) These diapers should be pulled from store shelves as they are causing great discomfort for babies. Huggies you need to pull up your pants and take this one back to the drawing board or better yet go back to the original. SHAME ON YOU HUGGIES!

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: half of the diapers only had tape on one side so you could not use them.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2025
reviews.review: A lot of the diapers approximately 1 out of 2 did not have tape on both sides, i.e. tape was only on one side so you have to throw them away.

reviews.name: Stormi Lane
reviews.title: Made my baby break out!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2024
reviews.review: I have used huggies on my baby since we had her but this was my first time buying them online. They came in and when I opened the box I thought they looked and felt VERY CHEAP and they started making her break out into a diaper rash. So disappointed in this purchase. 😞

reviews.name: That.1.Hippie.Artist
reviews.title: Paper thin diapers, do NOT buy these !
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2018
reviews.review:
I have been subscribed to Huggies for a long time for my 24 month old and used them way back in the day for my now 20 yr old. We switched out subscribe and save this month from Huggies little movers to snug and dry, to save a few bucks, and because we only need them in the evening and overnight now since we are potty learning... so I thought it was the obvious choice she’s not running around she doesn’t need little movers, she sleeping in them, snug and dry seemed the better fit for the need......and boy was that a HUGE mistake!
Never in my life have I seen such thin, paper towel feeling like diapers, especially from Huggies. I actually laughed to myself and said WTF happened to this diaper as I pulled it out of the box thinking it was a random messed up diaper... and I pulled out a few more and realized that they all are just THAT THIN!
Then I thought maybe they had a breakthrough in some super crazy absorbing material and thought I’ll give them a try.
AFTER ONE PEE the diaper is wet to the touch on the outside. Yes after wearing them for 20 minutes they are seeping through and it’s not even close to full or saggy, after one pee she came to sit in my lap for stories and I could feel the moisture on my leg of the pee seeping through the diaper!
The last 3 nights, My little girl has woken up crying multiple times each night and in the morning because the bedding is wet, and she’s wet and cold. I’ve never experienced this with a diaper, not even with cloth diapers. I am so so so very pissed.
These are going back.

reviews.name: Sin
reviews.title: Regret buying, my LO cry's it leaves marks and bumps
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.review: They are somehow smaller than a size 1 parents choice and about the same issues I have with luvs. Luvs are the same size as a newborn diaper, just a giant band. These are tiny diapers with a giant band. The only diapers I've found(and I've been through so many brands just within the few weeks my LO was born)that I like are rascal and friends. They've went up in price, but worth it to me. I got a size 2, cheap same day delivery, but nothing like what I was hoping for. Something that fit. Positives nice stretch band, not thin material, and curves. But I dunno why so many diapers are so small on the legs and butt. The only difference in size is the dang band that's always too big. The first picture I have a size 1 parents choice (I stopped using them because of all the bad things coming out about parents choice, it scared me)underneath the size 2 Huggies.

reviews.name: PAULIE KNUCKLES
reviews.title: The worst dippers ever!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2024
reviews.review: These are the worst diapers; they are so thin that they don't even hold any pee. Since my 2 year old started to use these diapers, almost every night he has wet through his pants and the crib (which I found out about every early morning when he woke up and cried from sleeping, all because of that), even after I changed him before he went to bed. I am so disappointed and definitely not going to spend any money on this brand of diapers again.

reviews.name: Tiger Mom
reviews.title: ppGood
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2016
reviews.review:
I'm curious, the huggies I bought from a physical store, ( target, Costco, BabiesRUs, Walmart, etc, ) works perfectly fine. But the ones I ordered from amazon my daughter's butt turns red. The diapers frays into little tiny pieces and suck on the babies skin. The package box wasn't the one showing here, it's a brown box with huggies logo on it.
Well, of course the price is much better on amazon plus the subscibe and save, it's even better. But it just doesn't work if the babie,s butt turns red.
I found a good deal on Walmart.com, but the same thing happened, the big packages have good prices, they don't have them available at the physical store, so I ordered on Walmart.com. The same exact thing happened to me. The diapers came in a brown box, my daughter's skin turned red again after using just one diaper.

I spent a lot time did my research, found out that most of the physical stores has only the smaller package, which is very expensive if you divide them per count. But they all have bigger packages with better prices on their store website. Like Walmart.com, target.com, BabiesRUs.com. Etc. so far I've tried Walmart.com, it seems to b a defective batch like I ordered from amazon. Haven't tried other store web sites yet.

My conclusion is: there's no bargain, if you want a good product, you got to pay the price.

I just have one question for the manufacturer, how do you distinguish the good batch and bad batch? Do you make a cheaper version at a lower costs and only selling them on line?

Moms, if this product doesn't bother your baby's skin, it's a good choice considering how much cheaper than the ones in the store

reviews.name: candlehappies
reviews.title: Horrible diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2024
reviews.review:
I always buy little snugglers. I honestly didn’t know these were any different. Well they are there is O protection near the legs - meaning even babies that never have blowouts WILL . First diaper blew out every where. They super cheap and have little no protection. The only reason I ordered these was bc they were on sale . I had the perfect amount till these were supposed to arrive . They lost them and arrived 5 days late .
Don’t bother with these . Buy LITTLE SNUGGLERS
Do not keep babies dry
Lacking all the top layer of protection
No side protection
Lining is ultra thin - which means you change them in half the time when little snugglers keeps them dry
These do NOT save money or time
If u have a sensitive baby that gets rashes easier- these will make rashes WORSE

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Terrible!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2024
reviews.review: There is nothing snug or dry about these diapers. I know everyone’s experience is different but mine was terrible. She peed through them, butt was always wet when I changed her and no I did not keep the diaper on her for extended periods! They sag horribly and she had on several occasions peed right out the side of the diaper while I was holding her and to my surprise the inside of the diaper was bone dry (but not my clothes!) they left cotton like remnants on her private parts which were annoying and not easily wiped away. Unfortunately my kid is allergic to pampers or I would go back to them

reviews.name: Ali Khokhar
reviews.title: Worst diapers ever
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2024
reviews.review: We normally use swaddlers but needed a small pack until baby was ready for next size and ordered this. These are worst diapers ever seen. Even worse than sam's club brand. They look cheap and leak. Huggies do have better diapers but this style and product is extremely bad

reviews.name: Tiffany R.
reviews.title: Absorbancy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2024
reviews.review: I got this pack of diapers because it was a bigger pack than the little snugglers. The snug and dry does not hold well for a baby. There are a ton of leaks and blowouts with this diaper. This is not a leak proof diaper.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Horrible Poop Absorbency
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2021
reviews.review:
This is one of the worst diapers I’ve tried. It simply does not absorb poop - everything leaks out. It works ok with pee, but it’s not that I have a crystal ball to predict when my baby is going to pee and when she will do hew blowouts.

My baby is only two months old. I had this diaper on her when she was in a car seat, so sort of in the seated position. She pooped a lot. When I lifted her up immediately after, her clothes were clean. I carried her to the changing station and put on her back to change. By the tome I took off her one piece suit, all pooped leaked all over her back. I thought perhaps it was an isolated accident, but the same happened again and again. This diapers simply provide zero absorbency for poop.
I previously tried Target brand diapers and they worked better keeping poop from leaking on the back. Unfortunately, Target brand has lesses protection from leakage the sides.

Also, this diapers are rough. They feel like they are filled with fiberglass. No wonder Huggies doesn’t want to disclose what material they use. Even Target brand was much softer than these.

Overall, not a good diaper. Poor value for the money. Looks like we are paying for the band name.

reviews.name: kailee
reviews.title: The most horrendous diapers that were ever made
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2024
reviews.review: Writing this after the most ridiculous blowout I’ve ever encountered. I think it might’ve been better if my son wasn’t even wearing a diaper at this point. We haven’t had a blowout in months have had multiple since using these. Ordered these because I was running low on Kirkland. NEVER AGAIN! If you’re reading this please run for the hills!!!!!!

reviews.name: Bee Jee
reviews.title: Gave my LO a rash on his urethra
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2024
reviews.review: I have been using huggies Special Delivery, Plus Snug and essential. None of these gave my LO any issue so I ended up ordering the Snug & Dry and It gave my baby inflammation on his urethra. It was bad and I am still trying to find ways to heal it. Do not recommend it- I moved to Pampers.

reviews.name: Elyse Hobert
reviews.title: This is false advertisement
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2024
reviews.review: You do not received the new improved diapers its the original ones even though the picture shows the new kind its not so don't get your hopes up for the new improved ones because that is not at all what will receive.

reviews.name: M&M
reviews.title: But this time I feel like I have to let other parents know what to ...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2018
reviews.review: I normally do not write reviews. But this time I feel like I have to let other parents know what to expect with these diapers before going through the same negative experience I went through! The diapers are extremely thin. As soon as I put a diaper on my child, even if he does not pee for a while, the dry diaper becomes deformed and the cotton inside turns into clusters of cotton! As soon as my child pees even a little, the diaper automatically turns into a deformed diaper from the inside. The cotton inside breaks into a few clusters of cotton and if you dont change the diaper soon enough it will release all the urine onto your child's clothes. I was suprised to see that whether used or not, the diaper is very bad quality even if my child only has it on before it becomes a dirty diaper. I normally buy Luvs since they are less expensive and lock wetness pretty well. But they are not as popular as Huggies which was shocking to me. I guess ill be going back to other diapers. Please see attached an image where you can see transparently what happens with the diaper with just a very few use.

reviews.name: tamara
reviews.title: Horrible leaky diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2024
reviews.review: For 27 years, all I have ever used or gifted to other mothers is Huggies. I tried these in a pinch while waiting for my normal diaper subscription to come in and I feel we can't get rid of them fast enough. The sides where you attach the diaper rip often, the diapers leak quickly, and are even wet to the touch. I cannot express enough how horrible these diapers are. I will forever stick to my normal huggies diapers that we have come to love and trust that they will work. Do yourself a favor and don't purchase this particular style of huggies diaper.

reviews.name: Chelsea Wilson
reviews.title: Poor quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2021
reviews.review:
I dont know if i got a defective batch or if this is just the poor quality of the diaper but the gel on the inside of the diapers that absorbs liquid comes out when my 7 month old pees in them. Every time i change his diaper the gel is in little balls all over the place and it takes forever to clean them off of my baby. I cant use them overnight unless i wanna change his diaper every hour or two.

And im back to add to this review with more bad news. Turns out the stuff that absorbs liquid comes out of the diapers before even using them. Im halfway through the second pack of the three packs of diapers and i just noticed these tiny hard white dots coming out of the diaper. Like a hard powder. It gets EVERYWHERE. I hate these diapers. But I assumed i couldnt return them since i was already at the end of one pack by the time i noticed this problem the first time. I just went back to Luvs. Never had any issues with them and they are way cheaper. Save your money and get yourselves some luvs.

reviews.name: Felcule Mugabekazi
reviews.title: Don't buy if your baby has sensitive skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2024
reviews.review: I am very disappointed now my son has sores and don't know what to do, he never had this issue since he was born until he wears these diapers

reviews.name: Amanda Elkins
reviews.title: No #2 containment
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2024
reviews.review: Not a fan of the Snug and Dry. Every time my baby did #2, it contained only half of it. This is the only diaper I have this issue with. Will not be purchasing it again.

reviews.name: Nayyirah Zaman
reviews.title: bad quality, constantly leaking
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2024
reviews.review: the quality of these diapers are considerably worse than any other diaper we've used. my baby has leaked every day since wearing these, so we are throwing them out and getting our typical brand instead.

reviews.name: Tim
reviews.title: The new Huggies are like the "New Coke"...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2013
reviews.review:
The design changes made to these Huggies Snug and Dry made a great diaper a terrible diaper. It's like when Coke came out with New Coke!! Our boy almost never had nighttime leaks, and now it happens 80% of the time with the "new improved" version of this diaper. They still work OK as daytime diapers where the child can be checked frequently but you can buy less expensive diapers for that purpose. What the manufacturer says about the new diaper is almost silly, where they claim the new thinner version should be just as absorbent as the old due to there being more absorbent material. They apparently didn't take into account the RATE that the diaper must absorb the piddle! My feeling is that the old version with more padding could take in and distribute the piddle faster and therefore keep the child dryer. You would think they would have thoroughly tested this new design, but maybe they only tested with toddlers who didn't drink much or weren't boys!

The manufacture has been requesting that we call in and discuss this problem with them, and I did so. They were very nice and interested in hearing my story, but unfortunately didn't indicate that they had a solution. To me this is very reminiscent of that time many years ago when they came out with "New Coke" and claimed it was better, but everyone immediately could tell is wasn't and revolted!! That was one of the biggest blunders of a company in years and is used now in training classes of an example of a bad decision. This change to Huggies is similar. They took a 4.5 star rated product on Amazon and "improved" it down to a 2 star rated product!! I suspect a few Huggies employees are in the hot seat now for this decision!

reviews.name: Justin
reviews.title: Gasoline Scented Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2019
reviews.review:
Very disappointed and concerned at this point for my 7 month old infant daughter. This is the SECOND time that I've received a shipment of Huggies brand diapers from Amazon that smell like pure gasoline. Now, I am religiously applying multiple layers of diaper rash ointments on poor baby's private area and bum. I figured the first time was just my imagination and just experiencing some weird olfactory senses malfunction.

I have no clue what is stored at either distribution's warehouses or of the set up, but for infant diapers to reek of gasoline coming out of the box and plastic wrap packaging is more than disheartening and concerning to say the least.

I certainly hope that my daughter doesn't experience any future complications or adverse effects due to this incident...Now I am stuck with a brand new box of diapers that I don't even want to bother to return (as what's the point to sending it back if it will get destroyed or sent to someone else and this happens again) and an upset baby who can't get comfortable at all. I hesitate to order any other brand of diapers from Amazon as I have no guarantee that I won't run into this issue again. Disappointed that I may have to give up the subscription discount as the products offered on Amazon were in larger quantities and cheaper for the discounts compared to retail stores.

reviews.name: Mama
reviews.title: Poor Item Quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2024
reviews.review: I am not sure this is a true Huggies Snug and dry Product, the quality is poor and light and the back of it feel like there is sand in the Diaper without even being used., my 11 month old pee right thru it. and I dont leave wet diaper on her to a point I can say its a second time pee.

reviews.name: Mari2727
reviews.title: Gives my daughter a rash on her lower back
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2015
reviews.review: I wish I could give these diapers a zero rating. Ive been buying huggies for my daughter since she was born..I would typically buy them from the pharmacy so when I signed up for Amazon prime and saw that I could get them a few bucks cheaper and the convenience of being delivered to me i went ahead and signed up for a subscription. Now when I recieved my order I saw noticed that it came in a Amazon box instead of a huggies box but I didn't make a big deal about it. The first night I noticed that my daughter had developed tiny red bumps on her lower back where it has the little folds in the middle of the diaper. That's never happened before so I thought it could've been a minor irritations rom something else so I put a bit of a&d and continued to use the diapers and monitor it. After a few days she was scratching and very uncomfortable and the rash was huge and it covered the entire lower back area of my baby girl. I heard some rumors about fiber glass being found on some of the huggies products and that was causing rashes and normally I wouldn't really believe that but now I don't know what to think! I called Amazon to complain and they are issuing me a refund but this is completely unacceptable on huggies behalf! Hope this review helps and informs u moms and dads out there.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Horrible rush
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2024
reviews.review: My son has sensitive skin and I decided to switch prom pampers and Costco brand to Huggies because I read that Huggies do not have chemicals. Baby got horrible rush all around the diper area. I do not recommend it.

reviews.name: kt c
reviews.title: 1 star because no stars isn't an option
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2022
reviews.review:
I've been using Huggies for my kids for years, but these are next level terrible. The leak protection is subpar, but that's not the worst part. My son keeps getting terrible rashes from little white fibers that wrap around his privates. The beads don't even come close to staying off his skin, and some of the beads in the bottom of the diaper are even rock hard BEFORE USE. My kids (in sizes 4 and 5 huggies Snug & Dry) have been getting absolutely horrible rashes for weeks, and I just finally figured out it's these diapers. I have been in contact with Huggies even to complain, to try and save someone else some 'butt' ache. They might be cost effective, but they are worse than Luvs.
I've had little luck with huggies being as good of quality as they were a couple years ago for a while now, so I'm switching brands.

reviews.name: SP
reviews.title: Cheap and seem fake
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2024
reviews.review: The edges are cut awful, these leaves marks all over my baby. And 3 blowouts. I had a similar pack of these given to me for baby shower.. these are similar.. but not good. Wish I could return.

reviews.name: NiNi
reviews.title: Don’t buy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2024
reviews.review: Don’t buy had some weird stuff in it. I returned mine and got a refund I just want to protect other parents out and their babies. I think their wipes are safe tho just not the diapers.

reviews.name: Cynthia
reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and don’t buy these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2024
reviews.review: We usually but Huggies little snugglers or little movers and love them. I saw these for a very reasonable price so decided to get them. Well, I’m probably going to just buy the regular ones and consider this a lesson because any time he has pooped in these he has had a blowout. All over him, his clothes, whatever he happens to be on or I change him on, and me. Not happy at all.

reviews.name: Kat
reviews.title: Do you have if you want diaper rash and leaks try Huggies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2017
reviews.review: Horrible awful leaky whoever said Huggies for boys and Pampers for girls never had the experience I have had with Huggies. I have tried every type of Huggies every size of Huggies every single one of them leeks and gives my poor son a horrible diaper rash. As soon as I put Pampers on him and some diaper rash cream that clears right up and guess what the Pampers never leak. The Pampers however have a horrible tab that rubs my sons poor little legs but we solve that by putting Band-Aids or gauze under them still also not right but at least give him a full and comfortable night's sleep not to mention us. I have both a son and daughter and Huggies have never worked for either one. I must be glutton for punishment but they were out of Pampers and we all know running out of diapers is a parental crisis :-) so I thought I would give them one last shot. I'll be contacting both companies and if you have any other brand recommendations I am all ears. I'll take Pampers any day over Huggies but it sure would be nice to have a diaper that actually works how it is supposed to without having to put down protection for crying out loud. Do yourself a favor and run for the Hills from Huggies.

reviews.name: M.K.V
reviews.title: Terrible rash & doesn't absorb
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2024
reviews.review: I want a full refund. These diapers are terrible. My newborn screamed and fought because the diaper was burning her. She now has a swollen vagina and red bumps and red, inflamed rash. I have antibiotics prescribed and it did nothing because i didn't know that the problem came from the diapers. Now that shes using the old diapers, the cream is working and her vagina swelling is going down. The other Huggies for sensitive skin does not bother her skin, I wanted to try these because of the pretty design and it ships overnight.

reviews.name: Stephanie W.
reviews.title: Leaky and stringy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2022
reviews.review: We have been purchasing this exact diaper through subscribe & save for years. A few months ago, they changed the design, but all seemed to be working fine except the diapers were stringy every time we removed them where the adhesives are. Since this wasn't affecting the functionality of the diaper, we were fine with it. But this last order that we received April 6th, the stringiness reached into the diaper, and left residue on my daughter's body in a way that is not healthy or acceptable. But the most disconcerting thing about these new designs is that these diapers now leak. Our daughter and and we have been woken up in the middle of the night every night for the last week with a totally soaked bottom, necessitating washing her down, changing her PJ's, sheets etc. We are canceling our orders, have asked for a refund, and will be switching to a different brand from here on out.

reviews.name: thetoothdoctor1348
reviews.title: Worst diapers ever!!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2021
reviews.review: So I decided to switch from my normal pampers brand and give huggies a try. Let me just start off by saying these diapers are horrible!!! I have been using them for about a month now and my daughter has leaked massive amounts of poop out of these diapers on average of 4 times a week. Now, when I say massive it is all over her clothes, car seat, sheets, you name it. After seeing the first couple explosions OUTSIDE the diaper I was expecting the inside to be even worse. But no! Every time I found that more poop was outside the diaper than inside!!! How does that even happen? No absorbency what so ever and not snug enough around the thighs. And yes, I am using the correct size diaper and putting it on properly. This is the last of my 5 kids so I like to think I know what I’m doing. Bottom line, I HATE these diapers and will be switching back to Pampers!

reviews.name: Jessica
reviews.title: Buy them elsewhere
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2022
reviews.review:
I’ve been buying the Snug and dry diapers since my baby was a month old. Now she’s 14 months and I ordered them on Amazon just because I was trying to get some extra at the house. DO NOT BUY ON AMAZON. Buy anywhere else, seriously. They’re not made the same when you order from here. The ones that work AMAZIN have a blue colored panel inside the diaper and is absolutely great at absorbing. They’re wonderful for nighttime especially. And cheaper than other Huggies. They’re our favorite. But the ones I ordered here I thought felt thin and cheap. Which honestly the good ones already feel cheap enough… but these are awful. My kid was having blow outs every other diaper. And forget about overnight. We’ve had several screaming fits because we have to change her clothes and crib bedding due to massive leakage.

Order from target, Walmart, freddies ANYWHERE ELSE

reviews.name: Troy J. Miles
reviews.title: WARNING!!! WARNING!!! WARNING!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2016
reviews.review: Parents; please read to the end regarding your child's health...I switched to Huggies because of the price. However, after 3-4 days of using them, my baby girl's entire crotch area, front to back, got red, bumpy, and welt. My sister is a family doctor and said it was a bad diaper rash. After treating it for 10 days, the area only got worse. We changed to Luvs diapers that she was on before Huggies. Within 24 hours the area started to look better. It is now a week out and still has a red area, but is getting better. I googled Huggies and any possible recalls, but there was none. Now I am stuck with about 200 diapers that I can not use. Huggies should recall these diapers, put a warning out, and refund my (our) money we are out. With my search, I found a parent showing pictures of their baby's bottom using Huggies diapers, and it looked identical to my baby's injury. Per the parent's complaint, she states the cause was due to a chemical burn from the gel packets inside the diapers that is activated when urine come in contact with it. I am just glad my baby is doing better now, but never to buy Huggies Brand again. Please keep your baby safe!!!

reviews.name: 4leafclover
reviews.title: Lower quality with wetness indicator- please change diapers back!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2017
reviews.review: These diapers worked great before they added the wetness indicator. Not sure what else they changed, but am now in the process of finding another diaper since these will no longer last through the night despite boating 12 hours of dry. I have been ordering these purposefully without the wetness indicator because the snugglers just didnt last as long. Also these leave chemical beads on my son's bum when the diapers are barely wet. Now that they are the same as the diapers with the wetness indicator, what else can I do besides switch to a brand without it? It does seem like these are lower quality diaper packaged specifically for amazon to offer a 20% discount for a inferior product. The diapers look similar EXCEPT for the pictures on the outside images and there is some sort of code on the okd diaper. Again this makes me question the authenticty of the diaper. The new version is pictured on the left and old version that worked is on the right. I just can't help but feel like they lowered the quality to just sell on amazon. I will also take a picture of the diaper after an overnight use for comparison and edit the review in the next few days.

reviews.name: Oliver Van
reviews.title: I dont do reviews unless the product is really bad. These diapers dont come in retail packaging but ...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2015
reviews.review: I dont do reviews unless the product is really bad. These diapers dont come in retail packaging but rather in brown cardboard boxes like the boxes you see on the second column. I've been using Huggies from the local Walmart and Samsclub during the last 3 years for my baby and never had any diaper rashes. The first time I bought it from Amazon about a year ago my baby developed rashes the first time we used them. These rashes are not from being allergic but from wearing the diapers just for about 3 hours without it being wet. We had to change her constantly to use up all these diapers. I thought we just had a bad batch or something. On Black Friday I was shopping online and thought I would give Huggies from Amazon one more try. These Snug and Dry are definitely thinner (less paddings) then the local ones and you can tell they are different because the ones from the local store have purple gluing tape and these ones have white gluing tape. We went ahead and try it and to my dismay my baby developed diaper rashes again just from the first day using it. I would never again buy Huggies from Amazon. I will not even use it even if it's for free !

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Do not buy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2024
reviews.review: These are the worse diapers I have ever purchased. They don’t hold liquid at all. The gel comes out of these diapers and gets everywhere. Causes the worst diaper rash I have ever seen and very painful for my child! Very thin material and have to be changed more frequently than other diaper brands because of the problems I listed above. Do not buy these diapers. They are not worth it and a waist of your money.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: My son complains every time he wears these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2018
reviews.review:
I usually get pampers but my son is in the process of potty training and I cloth my 7 month old so I am done spending a fortune on disposables, I just couldn’t justify spending the extra money on pampers swaddlers.
My son hates these diapers, he’s 3, so that’s a good thing...kinda. He only wears these to bed and it takes 10 tries for me to put it on to where he is comfortable. He says they are too tight and hurt his legs. I have to loosen them to where they are almost falling off of him in order for him to be happy.
I now realize why I have always spent the extra money on the pampers.
These diapers absorb just fine, most of the time he’s waking up dry anyways. I just wish he didn’t scream and fuss and make me adjust them every single time I put one on.
I found a pampers swaddlers kicking around tonight which I surprised him with, I put it right on and he didn’t complain once.
Hopefully by the time these diapers run out he will be potty trained, if not I will be spending the extra money and getting pampers.

reviews.name: Jayhawks1
reviews.title: REFUND!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2018
reviews.review: I love the Huggies Little Movers & the Overnites so thought I would give the Snug & Dry a try since they are a little cheaper & thought they couldn't be that much different than the Movers......well I was so wrong! I should have listened to the negative reviews as they were right. Sometimes I read negative reviews & I don't have any of the problems they list so was hoping they would be wrong but as others stated the diaper is extremely thin, like half the thickness of any other diaper we have tried. She leaked every single time & I change her at appropriate intervals but with this diaper I started to change her twice as often & she still leaked & the diaper sagged like it was so heavy even when the diaper was half as full. It would pull down on her stomach & was like a big glob of wet toilet paper, hard to explain but not at all what you want. The diaper also didn't pull the wetness away from her skin so she instantly got a rash. I can't say enough good things about the Little Movers & the Overnites so I won't try switching again.

reviews.name: JessicaS
reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE THESE!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2020
reviews.review:
I am saddened to say that like many other reviewers on here, my baby also developed a rash. I am a first time mom and this was his first rash. And it’s a HORRIBLE RASH that covers everywhere the front of the diaper touches. He whales when I change his diaper, and it is heartbreaking. I switched him to cloth diapers to hopefully help the rash go away quicker.

Like many others on here, I did notice a size difference, pattern on the actual diaper difference, chemical odor, and hard spots inside the diaper. He has leaked through every diaper over night from this pack we’ve used before he developed the rash.

The ones we purchased from Walmart have never leaked, nor given him a rash. I don’t know what the return policy is on these (since they’ve already been opened), but I would suggest buying Huggies from your local store so that if you have an issue you can report it and return them.

reviews.name: Tay
reviews.title: HORRIBLE LEAK PROTECTION
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2022
reviews.review:
Size- Newborn.
They do not absorb at all. They are so thin! My son voided once and I felt something hot on my leg. I did not know the urine went straight out onto the sides and wet up his clothes and my clothes! We both had to change. My husband's friend told me that he had to double and triple huggies and how much money he wasted. I thought he was exaggerating. I ended up using a sanitary napkin (cut in half) placed to the front (I have a boy), to help absorb the urine. HOWEVER, the poop... we were not protected from the poop!!! Oh Lord... (shaking my head). The poop leaked out on the sides. USE PAMPERS INSTEAD.... Wayeeee better protection. I am seeking to return this defected case of huggies.

reviews.name: Sunny9
reviews.title: HATE the new Sure Fit design!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2013
reviews.review:
I have heard (and seen in these reviews) that MANY moms hate the new Huggies Snug and Dry Sure Fit design, and I completely agree with them. The Huggies reps keep saying that these diapers are just as absorbent as the other design, but moms can tell you that in reality, they are not!

I have been using Huggies for my son since he was born, and I've been very happy with the Snug and Dry Diapers for 13 months now. When I got the box with the thinner Sure Fit diapers, I was disappointed by how scratchy and rough they are. Also, the outside of the diaper starts to feel damp after awhile, and my son wets through them much more quickly than the previous design.

Worst of all, today was the first time since my son was a newborn that I actually had to scrub poop out of his clothes because it leaked all over the place. Not happy with these at all. I have been a loyal Huggies customer for a year and have spent hundreds of dollars so far AND I was planning to use them until my son potty trains and on our future kids. I also had been recommending them to all my new mom friends- not anymore! Time to buy some Pampers Baby Dry, which I know are at least absorbent and comfortable.

reviews.name: Tamara Louissaint
reviews.title: These are the worst diapers I've ever used
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2024
reviews.review: My son was soaked every night in these... I also put double diaper one night and he was still soaked. Such a waste of money. I got these because of the price but I see why they affordable because they are like paper thin. Just horrible. I will need to go back to Swaddlers. So disappointed.

reviews.name: Gerweezy
reviews.title: NOT snug and DRY
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2025
reviews.review: Baby soaked through it after 20 minutes. Back to pampers

reviews.name: Brian OCrowley
reviews.title: New is NOT improved!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2016
reviews.review: Well to start with the box I received does not look anything like the box they have pictured here. I received a brown box that that just said huggies on the side- no pictures, no brightly colored box. That made me a little doubtful of the quality of the product to start with. When I opened the box I found the "NEW and Improved" diapers. Yes they were thinner than the Huggies diapers that we had been buying from Costco- the only reason I bought these on Amazon is because we live so far from the store. I thought it would be nice not to have to take up lots of space in the car hauling diapers. I have 5 kids and have used Huggies for years and love them, but this new style is terrible. My kid has been waking up in puddles every day. Even if the diaper is only used for a short time and not completely full, I feel it leaking through the diaper when I change him. I hope this is not the same thing that Costco is selling now or I will be switching to another brand that has not lowered their quality standards. Shame on Huggies for putting their name on this GARBAGE!!!

reviews.name: Tiliyuck
reviews.title: Caused horrific groin irritation in my
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2020
reviews.review:
This product doesn’t leak pee or poop which compared to other diapers like target brand, however it gave my newborn son a HORRIFIC reaction (angry red, peeling skin and little pimples) on his groin area which has taken over a week to heal so far and we’re still working on it. Lots of air drying and washing lots of different cloths that are being used to contain/pee and poop in the meantime with VERY frequent changes.

The pee absorbency of the diaper is great, however the beads from the front of diaper leaked out all over him within 3 hours, which is a huge issue in the evening as the diaper boasts providing upto 12 hours of protection.

Upon further investigation this is a known unaddressed issue with the “snug and dry” diaper as there is a pending lawsuit. They should be ashamed of themselves having children endure irritations keeping the product on the market until the known issue is addressed and resolved!

reviews.name: Egrain
reviews.title: Worst Huggies ever
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2015
reviews.review:
These are the worst Huggies ever. They run SMALL. A six is more like a 5. They BALLOON up at the slightest hint of wetness. The box states 12 hours and that is a joke unless you like seeing your baby straddling a basketball sized lump. I bought these for my grand children and I have been a loyal huggies user since my own children were newborns. I will not buy these again. NOT FOR HEAVY WETTERS ... I have a 1 year old granddaughter in diapers and a 2 year old grandson who is a 37 lb heavy wetter . I purchased the size 6 and use them on both thinking it would be easier just using one size like I have done in the past. She actually wears a 4. But the little one has as much problem with these diapers as my big guy. And because they are both prone to diaper rashes I change very very frequently , every few hours at least. But these are terrible.

UPDATE ::: I was contacted by the company and given a full refund for this item. They were very interested in my opinion and experience with this product. I will continue to use the Huggies overnights with my grandkids.

reviews.name: Mrs.Teach
reviews.title: Beyond Disappointed!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2013
reviews.review:
I was ready to send a nasty gram to Amazon thinking we they somehow sent us fake Huggies only to learn that the brand made these "improvements" themselves. My son is 14 mths old and Huggies Snug & Dry diapers have been all we've used but I assure you we will be in search of something else once we finish this pack! Which, incidentally, will be relatively quickly since they are not absorbent, leak and require changing almost immediately!

Huggies statement reads... Our Snug & Dry Diapers with SureFit Design are a more flexible, less-bulky diaper that can absorb as much as a thicker diaper. We simply decreased the amount of the fluff padding and increased the absorbent particles that gel when wet to ensure the same Leak Lock® protection for up to 12 hours. The end result is a much more comfy, super absorbent diaper for your little one!

As much as I would love love love nothing more to believe this it simply is not true. While they are definitely less bulky they absolutely do not "absorb as much as a thicker diaper" - not to mention this is the first pack of diapers in 14 mths that my son has gotten a rash from. As sad as I am to say it we'll be shopping the diaper world for something better.

reviews.name: M
reviews.title: Worst diaper ever
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.review: I’ve been using Huggies special delivery diapers for all my 3 children but sometimes when it’s not available I switch it up and this time I decided to try these snug and dry ones and it caused my baby a horrible rash! They don’t keep dry at all! It took me getting through a few diapers to realize the rash was being caused by the diaper since no rash cream what so ever was working to clear it up! DO NOT BUY THESE DIAPERS. It’s not worth it. At least not from Amazon.

reviews.name: C D
reviews.title: we had to change these every 3 hours - up to 12 hours, in their inebriated, vivid dreams only
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2016
reviews.review:
manufacturer (Kimberly-Clark Baby and Childcare Brands) advertises this item "eliminates leaks for up to 12 hours".

from our experience, we had to change this every 3 hours or so, or it leaked. Of course, 3 hours is within the "up to 12 hours". we initially thought we had a bad batch, but we bought another box from a local retailer and it leaked again. We bought again in a different package size (56 per box) but it also leaked. Definitely, we did not get a bad batch.

corporate false claims these days is common place. and this manufacturer in particular talks about donations, business ethics, concern for the community, ownership and the such.

If you care to read their bull, you can find it here (spoiler: get ready for a good laugh)
[...]

How exactly are they
Accountable: We take ownership for our business and our future.

or do they
Caring: We respect each other and care for the communities where we live and work.

when they blatantly lie by making surreal claims?

Maybe they tested their diapers on baby mice or they deprived their "subjects" of water so that they can claim the 12 hour leak proof. Disgusting.

reviews.name: Mazy C
reviews.title: Worst diapers ever!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2024
reviews.review: These sag horribly once peed in ! One small pee and it’s over. I feel like I need to change my son’s diapers every 45 minutes with these. The leaks are awful. I don’t know what happened recently but I saw a similar experience to mine on a recent date.

reviews.name: Roxy
reviews.title: WORST DIAPERS EVER
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.review:
I was truly disappointed with these diapers. They consistently failed to contain my daughter's mess, resulting in frequent, embarrassing pants changes. Every time she had a bowel movement, it seemed like we were in for a disaster. Not only did this inconvenience us, but it was also quite embarrassing when we were out and about. I would not recommend these diapers to any parent. They are simply not up to the task of keeping your little one dry and comfortable.

Instead, the Huggies little movers diapers, work much better.

reviews.name: Dave
reviews.title: LEAVES GELS, DIAPER RASH & FEELS LIKE SAND
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2016
reviews.review: I don't write reviews but my Huggies experience has been so bad I had to share. I don't have experience much experience buying diapers since I only have a 9 month old but this is the worst diaper I've experienced. I ordered the month supply (SMH) First of all, I noticed you can feel the pellets in the diaper- like you're holding a small bag of sand. EVERY SINGLE DIAPER leaves these tiny gels all over my baby's butt. It's already difficult to change my little one but she now hates each and every diaper change cause these leave her with diaper rash and I have to use 3-4 wipes to take off all the who-knows-what chemical off of her. At first I thought it was just a few bad diapers as I was using a mix of pampers and huggies but I stashed the pampers away and used the buggies exclusively and consistently HUGGIES leaves a trail of gels pellets. I change my baby often too! The first 6 months I used pampers swaddlers and she never had a diaper rash. Never going back to Huggies and throwing out the rest. I've rather spend more money buying Pampers/Honest.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Back to Pampers we go!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2018
reviews.review:
We always used Pampers Little Cruisers diapers for our 2 year old, mainly because Pampers were what the hospital used when he was born and we just sort of stuck with that brand. When we made the decision to be a bit more financially savvy and not spend so much, I purchased this box of Huggies because they were much less expensive than the Pampers, and Huggies is still a great brand.
The diapers work fine when it comes to holding in pees and poops. The problem is that ALL the pee seems to go into one area of the diaper and creates almost a WAD, and my son looks ridiculous walking around with this giant, sagging butt. Seriously, I know he's 2, but this diaper ruined outfits with how low it hangs. And my son found them uncomfortable - he would grab and swat at his butt and thighs when the diaper got really heavy.
This is definitely a case of "you get what you pay for". The Pampers Cruisers don't sag, even with several hours worth of pee in them.
Thumbs down, Huggies.

reviews.name: M
reviews.title: Leaks, huggies movers of same size doesn’t
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2024
reviews.review: Useless, I buy Huggies little movers of the same size and they have no issues. Tried this and it’s a disaster.

reviews.name: A. Selby
reviews.title: Not like they used to be...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2018
reviews.review:
I have purchased Huggies Snug & Dry diapers many times both on Amazon and in stores. I have never had any problems with them until this last order.

I noticed right away that the material seemed different than usual - more plastic and less absorptive. I believe Huggies must have changed the materials or the way they make these diapers.

The first day my son wore these I noticed leakage with every diaper, and not just at night. That didn’t used to happen with Snug & Dry. Then the next day he developed horrible open sores on his bottom near where the diaper leg holes were rubbing. Again, not something we have experienced before with these diapers. I had to discontinue use right away in order to let those sores heal, and my son was in pain whenever I wiped that area for several more days, poor baby.

I would not recommend buying these diapers, even if you have used them in the past. Like I said, I don’t know exactly what is different, but they are not like they used to be.

reviews.name: Gabrielle
reviews.title: Doesn’t live up to the brand name
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2018
reviews.review:
I usually use the huggies little movers, but I saw the amount of pampers that came
In this pack and I thought, wow what a deal. So I purchased these pampers thinking they would live up to the brands name, but nope.

The first week with them were good. I noticed they don’t have the stay in place tab on the sides which is why I believe we began to have issues with them. They started leaking at night. Never had this problem with the other style.

Not only that, these run small.

My daughter is 27lbs and for these to fit good I think she would need a size 6 (for 37lb babies). And the size 5 is advertised for 27 lbs and up.

Anyways, will not be repurchasing this pamper, we will stick to little movers.

I think If they would fix the size issue and put the stay in place tabs it would be a perfect pamper because it’s soft and thin. Thin is good it absorbs a lot without the bulk.

reviews.name: love_melissialenox
reviews.title: Snug and dry these diapers are definitely not - - avoid or get used to a wet child, bed, bedding, couch, car seat -- wet wet
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2015
reviews.review: Hands down, easily the worst diapers in terms of absorbency that I have ever used or been told about. My 2 year old niece will awaken from a daytime nap soaked through even if the diaper had just been put on an hour beforehand. Unfortunately I ordered a box in a very large quantity of these diapers and so we tried and tried again just so that I would not have wasted the money, however, these diapers ended up costing the untold hours of time effort and patience in washing clothing and bedding, and not to mention the embarrassment of a child who was constantly wet through. I'm left to wonder if there's a money back guarantee. I previously purchased Huggies Little Movers which were wonderful she was never wet in the morning after a nap or at any time during the day. Huggies should take this line which they have so in appropriately titled snug and dry off the market. If I could give 0 stars I would as we ended up throwing more than half the box away - - I wouldn't even donate these to anyone because they don't hold any liquid for more than an hour.

reviews.name: OR
reviews.title: Terrible quality, non-stop leaking after "improved" design
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2013
reviews.review: Have been using Huggies diapers since my son was born in late 2010 (started out with Pure & Natural, then switched to Snug & Dry when he was about 1) - and never had any problems with them. Loved the absorbency and the fact that this diaper easily lasted through the night and through at least 3-4 hours during the day (and my boy is a heavy water-drinker!). Everything changed when Huggies came out with a "new and improved" design (aka Leak-Lock system) in April 2013. The new super-thin diaper is anything but leak-lock or absorbent! My son has been waking up completely wet every morning (which means almost daily laundry for his pajamas and crib sheets), and unless we change his diaper every 1 or 2 hours (at the most) during the day, it's going to leak out as well. I'm sure anyone who's ever changed a 2.5 year-old's diaper will relate to just how "easy" it is to get a toddler to stay still for such frequent diaper changes. I'm going to give it one more shot and try out these diapers one size up from what my son currently uses, but based on everyone's reviews here, I think we may need to start looking for something new in a month. Sad to give up on the formerly trusted brand (although, incidentally, the Pure & Natural diapers are still as good as they used to be, and I'm currently using them for my 2.5 month old).

reviews.name: Jinus Jose J. Miranda
reviews.title: Not a good quality of absorbency diaper.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2020
reviews.review: Huggies that are made in USA are quality diapers. Specially those we buy in rite aid stores, Costco or Walmart stores. But this huggies that I bought here in amazon is a No No! My daughter ended up having her groin reddishly like pressure ulcer stage. Then I noticed it’s because of the absorbent material of the diaper that I bought here in amazon. The quality of the absorbency is like a sand paper when the diaper gets soiled and wet. I returned my first order of huggies diaper hoping that it was just a simple diaper mistake but the replacement diaper is the same quality! Made in CHINA type quality of diaper. I don’t know why or how did that happen. But me writing this post I hope I could warn parents buying about this type of diaper here in amazon.

reviews.name: Zahraa
reviews.title: Does not hold
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024
reviews.review: Terrible diapers, used them for 1 day & they don’t hold more than 1 hour. I changed my baby’s diaper & within 45 mins i had to change it again because of how loose and heavy it became. Going back to Kirkland Diapers.

reviews.name: JennyMac
reviews.title: I would NOT recommend buying these diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2018
reviews.review: I would NOT recommend buying these diapers. I have been using Subscribe and Save for awhile to buy diapers for my toddler and my baby. This most recent box came in a plain brown box - which is fine- and the diapers inside were black and white, not colored, like previous ones or boxes you get in the store. Which is fine! I figured they were saving money by not printing in color. Anyway, my son has had horrible diaper rash since using these, chafing on his legs, and the diaper crystals completely exploded all over him during the night last night. The crystals have been falling out and peeling off on him a little bit over the past few weeks but this was EVERYWHERE- all over his body and jammies. It is clear that Amazon or Huggies are cutting corners on these and they are a lower quality diaper. Even though it costs a little bit more, its definitely worth purchasing these from a brick and mortar store because you don't know what you will get with Subscribe and Save!

reviews.name: Angie
reviews.title: Rashes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2024
reviews.review: This product caused my baby to have rash all over the diaper area, I have started using those diapers for 4 days & my baby’s skin broke out on the second day even though I change her diaper every 2 hours…. Very disappointed.

reviews.name: J Cordaro
reviews.title: It’s a diaper that doesn’t stop blow outs
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2019
reviews.review: My son is 3 and had zero blow outs. My newborn daughter had zero blow outs. Until we decided to buy diapers off amazon and selected these. In two weeks she had five blow outs. Not because she sat in it, but because these were just terrible diapers. They just aren’t snug or fit right. I’m literally typing this after the fifth blow out. My daughter was laying on me on the couch when she decided to go. No big deal, let it out, then I pick her up and my shirt is soaked. Annoyed I change her and find there is barely any poo in the diaper. Guess it just shot out the back. Like I said, my son is 3 and had zero blow outs in all his years. We used Pampers. My daughter is 4 weeks and of those four weeks we bought these two weeks ago and she had five blow outs. If this review doesn’t drive you away from buying these then you deserve what you get.

reviews.name: MBA 2009
reviews.title: Diapers should stop leaks not fit baby's bottom perfectly
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2013
reviews.review:
I've been using huggies for the past 15 months. They worked great until the most recent change. Here are the issues:

1. The diapers are now extremely thin and they will often leak after just two hours. The thin diaper does not use newer leak protection technology requiring less material. It just leaks.
2. They can no longer be used over night. I compared the new version with the old, using them both at night. When you press your finger to the old diaper it feels slightly damp. The new diaper feels soaking wet when you press your finger to it and is extremely flimsy.
3. The new diaper leaves a lot more whitish residue on baby's bottom and genitalia. And it does not clean off easily. I assume this is the material breaking down from being wet.
4. The tabs tear off very easily and don't stick well.

Huggies has slowly made their diapers worse. They had previously removed the nice curved tabs that worked well and the pocket in the back to stop a large BM from escaping. The absorption was still good so I kept purchasing them. With the new changes, Huggies has lost a customer.

The new diapers do not sag in the bottom at all. If looks are your only concern, and you don't mind changing diapers every hour or so, these are for you. I say give me back the sag and diapers I can use all night.

reviews.name: LP
reviews.title: Causes rash after a day of use
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2022
reviews.review: I really wanted to like this product. While it was did not provide the most absorbency of diapers, it was a good price and was able to be shipped fast in our time of need (we ran out of diapers that day). Unfortunately, after a day of use, my baby had a horrible rash- not a diaper rash but a contact rash- bright red and my baby would cry and fight me each time I tried to change her diaper. Now I have a ton of diapers that I cannot use and am out quite a bit of money because there is no refund offered. I should have listened to the other reviewers who had the same problem. Now I know that I need to stick to my trusted brand of Pampers for the safety of my baby.

reviews.name: Alisa
reviews.title: Super cheap / flimsy diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2018
reviews.review:
We decided to try this one because it said it didn't have added bleach or perfume in them, but MAN- what an obvious difference in the overall quality of the diaper. My kiddo ( 14 months), isn't too concerned about having something be the most plush material out there, but this diaper is paper thin and very stiff, almost like a tyvek suit, and the absorbency gel comes out and can be found on my baby's bum after just a couple hours. It's doing enough of a job to not be causing any diaper rash, but the sides are pretty coarse and have caused some red marks on her, as she is walking and sitting down all over now ( lots of moving ).

I don't know why this pack was different than other Huggies Snug & Dry that we've had, but it not only had different packaging, (with no confirmation that it doesn't have bleach, perfumes.. etc), it also seems to have a much lower quality over all.

reviews.name: Gary
reviews.title: Leaks!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2019
reviews.review:
I bought these for my 15 month old. I've used all of the major brands of diapers, plus many store brands over my 7 years of having kids in diapers. This has been one of my worst experiences.
We opened the first package while we were camping. They were ok during the day. Because it was cold, when I put him to bed I put flannel pajamas on him, plus two fleece sleep sacks. He slept through the night. When he got up in the morning, the diaper had leaked, not just around the legs or at the top by his belly, but through the entire diaper. He was soaked through his diaper, pajamas, and the first sleep sack!
The second night, because I didn't want a repeat, I put a second diaper over the first. That night he only leaked through one pair of pajamas.
I have these stashed in my car for the emergencies where any diaper is better than none. Although, not much better.

reviews.name: lilmarce
reviews.title: Pee seeps through and double the price as most!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2020
reviews.review: I bought these diapers in size 6 and 4 and they’re both awful and twice as much as other better diapers! I normally buy Parents choice at Walmart which I’ve never had problems with. I wanted to get diapers on subscribe and save and this seemed like one of the better options so I got them and then later realized the huge price difference (sleep deprived mom lol). I figured well at least they must be awesome for that price so it’s ok for this time but I was wrong. The urine seeps through the diapers after I have literally just changed them and I end up with a pee stain on my shirt after holding my child. It’s happened several times. They also seem to bother my sons because they will start picking at it which they don’t normally do. I’ve talked to other moms and they’ve also had bad experiences with these, including diaper rash.

reviews.name: nijah
reviews.title: Not a savings if you have to use more!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2021
reviews.review: Never again! I've used huggies since my son was born and they worked fine but of course wanted a cheaper option and seeing mickey on the box didn't help. I ordered a size 2 and this has bn one of my worst diaper experiences since the 90s version of luvs ...THESE LITERALLY DONT HOLD WATER! As soon as he pees just a little bit you can feel the moisture on the outside of the diaper, they don't hold the shape so they get loose around his back very quickly. I was already one of those parents changing his diaper almost every hour but now more because it leaks so easy and also noticed in several changes it left lent on his private area ! Not a savings if your consuming more of a product. I will never buy again actually just switched to luvs and I like.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: One Star
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2016
reviews.review: These diapers are a fail. After switching from Huggies little snugglers, I was very disappointed in how these were made. They have more of a chemical smell, are not as soft, and they don't have the stay in place sticky for the tabs. They sag very low after being filled and the little snugglers never gave me that problem. They feel cheap and I wish I would have sent them back before using any cause now I'm just trying to quickly go through them by changing my baby's diaper more often. He has got more diaper rashes since using these also. No pee leaks but plenty of poo leaks at the back of the legs if not changed immediately although the snugglers are the same there for us. If I could I would buy only the bambo nature diapers or andy pandy brand is the best if you're rich... Also I just hate the tacky print they use. It shows through any light clothing. Why not use something trendy/classy? I'm switching back to little snugglers even if they're more expensive...

reviews.name: Heather
reviews.title: Caused bleeding!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2020
reviews.review: I'm not a person who writes reviews, however, I was so dissatisfied with these diapers that I felt I should share. Too many unnecessary blowouts to mention and simply because the diapers are not made wide enough to cover the baby's bottom appropriately. Secondly, the back of the diaper scrunches up and does not lay flat as you try to place the diaper underneath them to put one on. And most importantly, one of the last diapers from the box I ordered, stuck to my child's bottom and peeled the skin which caused bleeding. There was no previous diaper rash in the area to have caused any oversensitivity, nor had the diaper been on too long, as I change her diligintly. Frankly, I expect more from the Huggies brand. One star for the Micky Mouse design (eye roll) Never again!

reviews.name: MissBillie
reviews.title: Cranky and wet
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2016
reviews.review: I absolutely HATE these diapers!!! I have twin boys and have used SAMs club and Walmart brand diapers since they have been born to save money. I found these on here for the same price as Walmart, (.17 per diaper) so I got excited to finally try a name brand and bought 2 cases. I can't believe these are called snug and dry! What a joke!! I have to change their clothes at least once a day because they leak terribly! And they wake up way before morning because their clothes are soaking wet!!! Take my advice and steer clear of these. I have put up with this for several days now, and I can't take it anymore. I would love to throw the rest of them in the trash, but I'm not the type to waste money. I will be so glad when they are gone!! I can't imagine anyone liking these. Maybe they are ok for tiny babies that don't urinate much, but these are no good for 18 month olds.

reviews.name: cristina
reviews.title: BLOW OUTS every day!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2016
reviews.review: I got these because the thought of diapers being delivered for a very cheap price sold me on the item. The diapers would come in a Huggies brown packaging box, once I opened them they looked like Huggies but the straps on the diapers would sometimes be different even with in the same box. now this is why I gave them one star, today alone I have had 4 blow outs, FOUR. That is a lot of changing and washing instantly because I am nursing and didn't want the clothes to be stained. I have had a blow out every day for the past month and I didn't want to buy new diapers so I just used the left over ones I had but as of today Im giving them away and going to Costco. I may have saved myself 2 cents a diaper but now Im spending more with laundry and detergent. And yes she is 13 pounds and this should be fine for her but its not. trying to save some parents the mess with this review!

reviews.name: Lilly
reviews.title: Money wasted
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2020
reviews.review: My baby is wearing "movers" another huggies diaper, I can say I am satisfied with it. But for some reason I could not find movers stage 4 in Amazon or Sams, the only suggestion in amazon wfor stage 4 in huggies was "snug and dry" so I bought it. Snug and dry is smaller, absorbs very little. I have to change the diaper very often if I want to avoid accidents. At night I have to change the diaper at least twice and if I do not do it, the urine comes out causing my baby's clothes to get wet and I have to change everything, even his blanket. It is a really bad diaper. I already bought Movers in walmart and I will throgh what is left to the trash.

reviews.name: Ariana Mendoza
reviews.title: I wouldn’t recommend
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.review: Cheap material, not sure why but they are very thin diapers !!! No pee or poop has ever came out and with these diapers it’s a mess . I wish they had a return policy. I tried canceling order after reading the reviews but the order was already on its way and I couldn’t cancel . Sadly I will be giving them away my baby has no use for them.

reviews.name: Sanique Gibson
reviews.title: Regretful purchase
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2024
reviews.review: Thought this was a good buy knowing this is the brand i used for my son in the past. This diaper is now made of such a cheap material I have to be careful my finger doesnt wrip it while putting it on my baby girl and its absorbency is extremely weak.

reviews.name: Hina tariq
reviews.title: Worst diapers everrrrr
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2024
reviews.review: They get full and feel wet after 2 hrs of use. My babies don't feel comfortable with these. I've used different brands some might me really cheap but I never experienced such thing as I am experiencing with these. I couldn't even return it. I am never buying them again ever.

reviews.name: java
reviews.title: Not an improved product
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2015
reviews.review: Beware when using these " new and improved" diapers. My daughter got a very severe allergic reaction to these. We have always used this brand with all of our kids and never had any issues until we ordered these "new and improved" from Amazon . We had no idea that it was an allergic reaction. We thought it was a diaper rash but after several days we finally realized that it wasn't a diaper rash. We found some older diapers we had stashed around the house and compared them to these new ones and noticed right away that they were totally different . We stopped using them on our daughter and the next day the rash had diminished significantly and totally disappeared within a couple of days . There is nothing improved about them. Needless to say we will not be using these new diapers on our daughter any longer. It just makes me very upset that she had to go through the suffering because some big shot at Kimberly Clark decided to cut corners to improve their margins.

reviews.name: Reid/Mason Holiday Party
reviews.title: Switching. Back to pampers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2017
reviews.review:
We were using pampers saw these were more quantity per pack So we gave these a few month trial run, we dont run out of diapers now but we keep getting bad leg blowouts with loose stool that require him to be stripped of clothes in the tub and wash clothes immediately, we are also somehow getting wet pijamas in the morninglike the diaper is not retaining the urin fully

The pampers are also easier to grab the "velcro tabs" when putting on a fresh diaper

So kind of disappointed since diapers are an unavoidable expense and we were hoping staying with a brand name we could save a few dollars but i guess pampers do work best for us

We also realized the baby is very alergic to whatever is in these, red raised areas where diaper touches butt and leg creases, very painful, put on pampers gone, put on a huggies again and its back wtf

reviews.name: Erica Silver
reviews.title: If you can read, Don’t buy!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2020
reviews.review: Should’ve definitely read reviews first, this can’t be a real huggies diaper! Didn’t want to go out during pavdmuc but Everyyyy bad review is definitely real!! I been noticed this diaper is Thin, scratchy, and hard!! Not comfortable at all! My daughter is all of a sudden developing a rash constantly now after wearing these! Let’s not talk about “leak protection”... I have to change my diaper every hour and these leak soon as they’re full!!!! My daughter has never, NEVER filled a snug&dry from the store like this!! Also the band(straps) and sides rip/tear so easily, soon as I pull it to widen up to my baby’s butt it rips. Buy huggies from somewhere legit because this isn’t it...should’ve requested refund soon as I saw they weren’t the real deal

reviews.name: Hilary Shoop
reviews.title: Big mistake in buying these diapers!!!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2018
reviews.review: If I could give them a 'zero star' rating I would but unfortunately that's not an option. I have a 18 month old son that sleeps anywhere from 8-12 hours straight when he goes to bed at night. Some nights he would wet through his diaper and pants and undershirt and so when I saw that these diapers had a 12 hour protection, I was thrilled. However, this couldn't have been farther from the truth. He woke up around 1 am one night and was soaking wet with urine. Keep in mind he had only been wearing the above advertised Huggies diaper for 4 hours at this point. I thought maybe it was a fluke and so I gave the diapers a second chance and this time he wet through them in 3 hours during the day. So disappointing and misleading. Needless to say, I sent them back for a refund.

reviews.name: Meagan
reviews.title: Only Good For Newborns
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2024
reviews.review: Had to get these diapers instead of my preferred brand Honest. Grateful they came early next day since I really needed them. Gave both my babies a really bad rash & they got extremely soggy anytime my kids went to the bathroom so gross. Definitely will pass next time.

products.product_name: Huggies Little Swimmers Disposable Swim Diapers, Size 5-6 (32+ lbs), 17 Ct

reviews.name: Clint Rodricks
reviews.title: Dive into Fun with Huggies Little Swimmers Disposable Swim Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2024
reviews.review:
Introduction:
As a parent who loves spending time by the pool or at the beach with my little one, finding the perfect swim diaper is essential for hassle-free water adventures. Recently, I discovered Huggies Little Swimmers Disposable Swim Diapers, and I'm excited to share my experience with this reliable swimwear solution.

Performance (5/5):
Huggies Little Swimmers Disposable Swim Diapers deliver exceptional performance both in and out of the water. One of the most impressive features is their ability to hold both #1 and #2 securely, even during active water play. Whether my little swimmer is splashing in the pool or building sandcastles on the beach, I have peace of mind knowing that these diapers provide reliable protection without swelling or sagging.

Fit and Comfort (5/5):
The perfect fit is crucial for any diaper, especially when it comes to swimwear.
