Huggies Little Swimmers excel in this aspect, offering a snug and comfortable fit that allows my child to move freely without restriction. The stretchy sides and waistband ensure a secure yet gentle hold, preventing any leaks or accidents while providing all-day comfort. Additionally, the easy-to-tear sides make removal a breeze, even when dealing with wriggly toddlers.

Ease of Use (5/5):
One of the highlights of Huggies Little Swimmers Disposable Swim Diapers is their user-friendly design. Putting them on is a simple and straightforward process, thanks to the tear-away sides and easy-open tabs. Whether I'm getting my little one ready for a swim or changing them after a water session, I appreciate the convenience and efficiency of these diapers. Plus, the vibrant designs and cute characters add a fun touch to my child's poolside attire.

Overall Impression:
In conclusion, Huggies Little Swimmers Disposable Swim Diapers have become a staple in our family's summer essentials. With their reliable performance, perfect fit, and ease of use, they provide the ideal solution for worry-free water adventures with my little one. Whether we're hitting the pool, beach, or water park, I can trust Huggies Little Swimmers to keep my child comfortable and protected, allowing us to focus on making lasting memories together. If you're looking for swim diapers that hold up to the demands of active water play, look no further than Huggies Little Swimmers.

reviews.name: Tony Rosati
reviews.title: Perfect!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2024
reviews.review: These Huggies Swim Diapers are great for keeping pool messes contained! They fit my little one well and seem comfortable for splashing around. No leaks so far, and they're easy to put on and take off.

reviews.name: Lynn Rose
reviews.title: Works great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2025
reviews.review:
Great for the pool. Easy to use and fun vibrant designs. They are comfortable for my son. I love that the sides can come apart for easy off to go to the bathroom. (Didn’t notice that first tome and tried to pull them down)
Worth the price and would recommend.

reviews.name: Liz Lanning
reviews.title: Great disposable swim diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2025
reviews.review: Exactly what you expect. Swim diapers aren’t meant to hold liquid, so it won’t absorb the pee. But they’re tight enough to hold solid poop inside. Didn’t cause any skin irritation. Cute designs for the kids.

reviews.name: Lauren Bright
reviews.title: Cute and work
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2025
reviews.review: These are super cute and work well

reviews.name: Jason
reviews.title: Fantastic and affordable swim diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2024
reviews.review: These swim diapers are great. They are durable - they will last as long as you keep them on while your baby is at the beach - without coming off or the sides coming apart. They stay on well even after your baby goes in the water! It is a little bit of a pain to put on - you have to hold your baby down and press the side against the diaper so that it sticks, but this makes taking the diaper off super easy - you just pull at the sides and it's off! The diaper is also labeled "front" and "back" to make it easy to put on the right way. Overall, very happy with this swim diaper and it hasn't let us down so far!

reviews.name: Erin
reviews.title: Our favorite swim diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2024
reviews.review: These are our favorite swim diapers! I love how easy they are to take off once used!

reviews.name: Esteban A
reviews.title: La mejor marca!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2024
reviews.review: Este es el mejor no se infla exageradamente es muy muy buena y tb se zafa y puedes reusarlo si en caso tienes q cambiarlo o decides no usarlo xq tiene los patrones a los lados que son excelentes lo recomiendo de verdad vale la pena pagar un poquito extra por mejor calidad y cuando se trata de bebés es mejor calidad a precio

reviews.name: B
reviews.title: Great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2025
reviews.review: I used for a trip, and they worked great.

reviews.name: Bri
reviews.title: Holds up nice
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2024
reviews.review: Worked for kids in water, seemed to do the job

reviews.name: Roma
reviews.title: Great quality for the price
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2024
reviews.review: I use these often with my son for his swimming lessons.

reviews.name: Molly
reviews.title: Swim Diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2024
reviews.review: These swim diapers work great. They also fit well and I like that the sides can be undone and done again. It makes for easy removal and changing.

reviews.name: HC
reviews.title: Work great!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2024
reviews.review:
I bought the swim diaper for our vacation with our toddler. The quality is excellent and durable!
They are easy to put on and bring when traveling. Highly recommend.

reviews.name: Macy Mueras
reviews.title: Love these!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2024
reviews.review: Easy to use, the size 3’s can fit babies in size 4-5 diapers, though they may be a bit snug. You can machine wash them up to 4 times before you need to throw them away( aka they start falling apart), but you have to hang them dry. I have two toddlers and we’ve gotten half way through a pack after swimming all summer! Great value and my toddlers seem to like them. No rashes or any other problems at all.

reviews.name: Deborah
reviews.title: Lives up to the hype
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
reviews.review: Purchased because of the positive reviews for my grandson when he came to visit. He is currently being potty trained. We went in the pool daily. These do not get soggy like regular diapers and protect the pool from accidents. They go on like pull ups and tear on the side to remove. However they are not "reusable" like the pull ups for potty training. Once they get wet you can't pull them down and back up. No biggie because I bought more than enough. Just something to keep in mind if you travel to your swim location.

reviews.name: danesita
reviews.title: Swim Time Success with Huggies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2024
reviews.review:
Absolutely love these Huggies Little Swimmers for my little one! We've tried a few different brands of swim diapers, and these are by far the best. They fit perfectly on my child, who's in the size 4 range, and we've had no issues with leaks or accidents, which is a huge relief.

The fact that this pack comes with 36 diapers is fantastic because it means we're set for quite a few pool days. They don't swell up like regular diapers in water, which seems so much more comfortable for my kid. Plus, they're super easy to pull on and off, even when wet, which makes changes at the pool a breeze.

I knew it was going to be important for our trip to Punta Cana. Our son is not potty trained and has random bowel movements at all hours of the day so I didn’t trust that he was going to be able to hold it in or tell us that he had to have a bowel movement while we were out swimming. This came in a pack of 17 which was super helpful since we went to the pool multiple times some days often after his nap. It was supposed to do. I wanted to make sure that this hotel didn’t have an incident of hand foot and mouth disease as many of the hotels did and we didn’t wanna contribute to that problem. This product is great it has adjustable straps on the side that run the full length of the diaper so if you need to make it a little bit bigger or a little bit smaller it adjusts. We bought a size 5/ 6 since our son is in between sizes.They were not super expensive and for the price they did exactly we were supposed to do. We went to the pool and ocean with confidence.

reviews.title: Do the job
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2023
reviews.review:
These diapers serve their intended purpose well. They effectively contain number 2, ensuring your child doesn't leave any surprises in the pool. They do not absorb pee. I was initially unaware of this and made the mistake of having my 2-year-old wear one to lunch before hitting the pool. It turns out, these diapers aren't designed for holding pee, so that was my oversight in not understanding their proper use.
However, one positive aspect of swimming diapers like this is their durability. They don't disintegrate after prolonged exposure to water. My child found them comfortable, and there were no marks left behind after use, nor did she complain of any discomfort.

reviews.name: T. Fisher
reviews.title: Great until the poop comes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2013
reviews.review:
We like Huggies diapers. We have stuck with Overnites as our main nighttime diaper for a while now, and love the daytime diapers too. So we decided we'd try Huggies again, when our son started his swimming career at age 2. After reading several reviews we decided to order the large size, since people said these run small. Yes, it's true. Our son is just 25 lbs/12 kg, and not chubby, but the large size fits him well and still has some room for growing.

Our first impression was pretty good. Easy to put on, our boy likes the colorful characters (especially Nemo), and they keep the pee inside the diaper well. After swimming it was not very easy to remove the wet and kind of heavy diaper, but we could manage somehow.

The bad part started when our son finally pooped in these. The poop stayed inside -- that was no problem. But when we tried to remove the diaper, especially with him putting up a fight and fussy, we could only get it to come in such a way that the diaper turned inside out on the way down his legs. Poop fell all over everywhere.

Next time he's poopy in these diapers after swimming, we've decided we are going to cut them off with scissors rather than pull them down off his legs.

We still like these diapers, but make sure to take as much time and care as possible when pulling them off after a number two. If you are getting in a spot where they look to be turning inside out, be sure to nip that in the bud right away.

reviews.name: stillhouse1
reviews.title: Fit okay but a little hard to attach
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.review: Fine for use under a bathing suit. Absorbent without expanding. Taped sides were a little tricky to unfurl and attach. Next time I might try the swim diapers that go on like pants and rip down the sides when it is time to come off.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.review: It’s smaller than the usual Huggies diaper, i think it’s one size down

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2023

reviews.name: kdea473
reviews.title: Required at the pool
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2019
reviews.review:
Our toddler has been in swimming lessons (mommy-and-me) for a little over a year, so we have used 50+ swim diapers (more, once you consider time on vacation). In that time, we have used Huggies and one other brand.
I think Huggies fit a bit snugger than the other brand, and also probably tighter than Huggies diapers of the same size. They are tough to pull on, and even tougher to pull off once wet. (I usually just pull them apart at the edges.)
To keep them from absorbing pool water, these diapers have essentially no absorbancy. As a result, we've had a number of instances of wet car seats and wet clothes en route to swimming lessons. (We dress before we leave home and make the short drive to the YMCA for lessons. Easier only to use the dressing rooms once, when we are done.) They do hold up okay to bowel movements (as I discovered last week).
We will continue to buy swim diapers until our daughter is potty trained (and then again when our younger child goes through lessons) but I wish they weren't so much more expensive than regular diapers.

reviews.name: Alyssa Hopkinson
reviews.title: Work great- but expensive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.review: These work great and don’t get saggy but WHY are they so expensive?!

reviews.name: Rebecca H.
reviews.title: Product Title is WRONG
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2023
reviews.review: The product title says "size 3" and lists the weight range for a size 3 diaper, but the actual product in the image is a size 4 and that is what gets sent. So... order this only if you're looking for size 4.

reviews.name: Jacqueline
reviews.title: Excellent, Need an XS Size Though Please!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2013
reviews.review: Much cheaper than the grocery store, but these are still expensive for what they are, .50 per use which for us is often as short as a 1/2 hr, depending on her mood. I'll happily spend it though rather than wash the reusable swim diapers! These run big though. My daughter is 8 months and 15 lbs and the Small is still too big and has to be sort of rolled down and smushed up at the legs to big into her swimsuits. She's been in the water since 5 months and they were very large at that point and needed her swimsuit just to get them staying up. An XS would be a great addition, especially since I think they run large -- I'd think a baby size Small was in the 0-6 month type range, and these size Small are suggested for 16-25 lbs. No real complaints though other than the prints aren't all that cute. I'd rather a cute pattern than the cheesy Disney stuff. Oh and because these aren't meant to absorb water, definitely don't put these on your child until you're ready to get in the pool -- they don't absorb THAT liquid either!

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2014

It held in the stool except where the stool had reached the sides. Probably because it wasn't the right size for her. The "tear away sides" are not very easy to tear...especially when covered in stool. Have used these for my niece as well in a larger size and it worked well for her but doesn't hold urine well....so when she wore it to walmart with her bathing suit....she ended up peeing on the floor. Oops! Definitely good for the pool though...just don't rely on it outside of the water in say....a store. :)

The diaper could not contain it. We evacuated (no pun intended) immediately. That was the first and only time I've had a negative experience with Little Swimmers. Maybe it was just a "bad poo." Who can tell when it's extruded into water? But the diaper certainly could not contain it. Still, however, the track record for these is good and solid (unlike my son's poo). To the people who got in the pool later, I'm sorry.

They work well and don't slide off him in the pool, which was a concern because he's a long, somewhat lanky baby. He needs the butt to hold his pants up.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2023
reviews.review: I ordered size 3 for a vacation and they sent size 4, but it had the size 3 barcode sticker on it. I had to use Amazon chat to request a refund, which went smoothly, but I was super bummed they couldn't send me a replacement because it was from a different merchant--- the stores near me aren't selling swim diapers yet and if I wanted to reorder the right size I wouldn't get free shipping unless I made an order over $25 again (I don't have Prime). If I wanted to get my refund sent back to my card it'd take 5-7 business days, otherwise I could get it in 2-3 hours as an Amazon gift card. I got to keep the size 4s they sent, which is cool, but it doesn't really help me out since they don't fit my son, so I'll just save them and hope we'll get a chance to use them when my son is big enough.

reviews.name: Rachel
reviews.title: Not a hit with us
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2023
reviews.review: My daughter loves the Finding Dory images on these. The problem is that they are definitely too small. She usually wears size 5t-6t Easy Ups or size S/M Goodnites and the 5-6 size was too small. Maybe I misunderstood the sizing. Also, a word of warning - my husband tried to use these instead of our usual disposable training pants. These are more permeable, liquids go right through them. I could see them containing a mess but they do not absorb urine.

reviews.name: GT
reviews.title: Does not hold pee at all
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
reviews.review: I saw the reviews and should've taken note. Be very careful- this does not hold pee, so put on when it's time to get in the water and take off when you're child is out...

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2018
reviews.review: I bought the medium for my 26 pound 23 month old and they barely fit. They're a bit smaller than a Pampers cruisers size 4. I just can't see how they'd fit a 34 pound toddler, so I'd definitely recommend going a size up. Despite the tight fit they worked well. We were in the pool for a couple hours and so far as I could tell they didn't leak. My daughter didn't poop in them so I can't say how they'd have done with that.

reviews.name: Michael Burriss
reviews.title: Just like buying at store. Got onsale/ discount for max subscribe.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2023

reviews.name: Elizabeth
reviews.title: Not absorbent at all
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2018
reviews.review: It's not absorbent and doesn't really hold poop that well in the pool. Our toddler peed in it before we go to the pool and it completely leaked out in the car seat as if she wasn't wearing a diaper. She also pooped in the pool once and when we opened the diaper there was remnants but it must have all leaked out so they had to clean the pool. It's really not that great but I don't know what else to use for swimming.

reviews.name: C. roth
reviews.title: Whatever makes you feel better about your kid peeing in the pool
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2014
reviews.review:
In reality, these swim diapers don't keep your kids pee (or worse) from getting into the pool. However, since naked kids openly urinating in pools are generally frowned upon, these swim diapers are a better alternative to nothing or a regular diaper. Swim diapers are specially formulated to keep from expanding into a big gooey mess when wet (unlike regular diapers).

Swim diapers are often required in public pools or water parks so the management can lull patrons into a false sense of security that they are not swimming around in baby urine. Go along with the charade and pick some up today!

reviews.name: Tommy and Sarah
reviews.title: Misleading quantity
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2020
reviews.review: When I ordered these it read, "2 pack of swim pants," so I mistakenly thought if I put in 2, in the quantity I would recieve 4 packs. I only recieved 2 packs total. Buyer beware!!!! You will only get 1 pack per order. A little shady, if you ask me.

reviews.name: April
reviews.title: Not quite the same product as described
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2021
reviews.review: The description gave size and weight for what size you needed and in this case I wanted 3-4 size but got size 3 and the weight was less than I needed.

reviews.name: great.
reviews.title: Too small
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2022
reviews.review: Sizing was iffy. Too snug. Buy up one size

reviews.name: Caitlin Wheeler
reviews.title: Ok for swimming, but don't wear if you're not in water!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2015
reviews.review: These diapers don't bloat when they come into contact with water, which is a huge plus. On the downside, they also don't contain P. I once forgot to bring a regular diaper to change my son into after swim class, so I put on a clean swim diaper... And next thing I knew there was pee all over my son and his car seat. These don't seem to contain anything, so any water leaks right out.

reviews.name: Theresa H.
reviews.title: Wish they made a smaller size.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2015
reviews.review: They're too big for my two month old, but I knew they were going to be. It's not a defect of the product itself; rather, the brand as it's the smallest size they make. The Pampers brand were no better. It seems as though children under 16lbs don't swim, apparently. The tabs on the side did allow me to adjust it some. So long as my son didn't have any runny messes, it would work. He didn't stay in the water too long, so it did the job.

reviews.name: Life Of Teachers
reviews.title: Eh.

reviews.review: Do not leave this on once you get out of the pool. They absorb literally nothing so you’ll end up with a puddle of pee.

These definitely were great for the pool but i needed to change my son as soon as he got out because otherwise he would leak right through as soon as he peed
i also found that the size was a little small he wears a size 4 pamper brand and i bought the Medium

reviews.review: Ordered a size "small" which said15lbs-25lbs. The package I received said size "3-4 15lbs-34lbs." Would not have ordered knowing it was a size 3-4 with such a large weight range. Decieving online description.

reviews.title: These need to be made better
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2017
reviews.review: I like that these are detachable on the sides, but these don't hold much, only holds small amount of pee, expect pee & poo to come out the sides at times, my daughter's bathing suits usually smelled of pee or poo, only used because the water parks make it a requirement.

reviews.title: My daughter loves the design and I like that it's held up nicely in the water
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2016
reviews.review: My daughter loves the design and I like that it's held up nicely in the water. It's crap outside of the water though. My daughter peed in it after the beach (it was still dry after the beach) and it leaked all over the store we were in! This happened twice! It wasn't a large amount of pee either.

reviews.name: Michael
reviews.title: Good product
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020
reviews.review: Like the product it is exactly as we wanted. Advertised as two pack if ordered from amazon as seller only one arrives.

reviews.name: K. Zak
reviews.title: good disposable swim diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2012
reviews.review: I generally prefer Pampers brand items but was unimpressed with their swim diapers. I tried these and had somewhat better success. Of note, these diapers are not really designed to hold much. They effectively become saturated in the water and if your child has any stool, you will have a leaking problem if you don't get them out of the water fast. Even dry, they don't hold much volume. But I have had more success with these over the Pampers.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2019

reviews.name: Jamie
reviews.title: They do leak
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2024
reviews.review: I use these just about every week with my 2 yr old as she is a water baby. I have used them in the past for my older kids but it wasn't until recently that I noticed they do in fact actually leak. At first I thought the diaper just shifted but nope everyone of them that my daughter has used since noticing has leaked. She has peed multiple times in them and it leaks out. If your child poops that will stay in the diaper but water will get in making a mess and when getting out of the pool you will be able to see brown water running down your kids legs. I however still recommend using them because it will save you from clean clumps of poop out of the pool if they do end up going while in the pool just don't expect it not to be 100% leak proof as they aren't.

reviews.name: Julie
reviews.title: Does the job. However, the "varied" characters are ...

If a child is wearing only this, their pee leaks through the diaper, swimsuit and water or you or the towel if you are holding the child. Solid waste is the only thing contained by these. Also, this is double the price i see in stores. Walmart sells 20-packs for $9. If you are going to use these, pair them with a plastic swim cover and buy them in the store.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Good, but needs label for fathers, too.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2015
reviews.review: The description says the "Back label helps moms and kids tell back from front". I would like a version in which the back label also helped dads tell back from front. I don't see why they would make a label that is unable to be read by fathers.

reviews.name: Naveeda
reviews.title: We tried two different sizes, but they still leak ...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2017
reviews.review: We tried two different sizes, but they still leak from the sides (even when the baby is not in water). Not sure if it's the product, or something we are doing wrong.

reviews.name: Karen P.

reviews.review: Didn’t feel like these were nearly as absorbent as other brands that I’ve tried in the past. However, I got them for a really good deal and so I am satisfied with the amount I got for my money.

reviews.name: alexis zimmerman
reviews.title: Will leak
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2023
reviews.review: I like these but you have to make sure that you don’t put them on until you are about to get in the water or it will leak

reviews.name: Melanie
reviews.title: Rubbed our sons balls almost raw
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2024

reviews.name: miamimirki
reviews.title: Does not hold urine.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2024
reviews.review: My baby only but her feet in the water but these diapers couldn't even hold in urine. What's the point? Better to use a regular diaper if not submerging in water. Maybe only good to contain poop, I don't know. We tried twice and both times pee was everywhere.

reviews.name: Dustin Comstock
reviews.title: DOES NOT HOLD IN WATER/URINE
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2024
reviews.review: we put these on our daughter in our home. She then peed in them in the house and soaked our floor and couch while we were getting her swim suit out of the bedroom. It did not hold in any fluid of any kind. She managed to walk around with wet feet slip and fall because we didn't realize these had 0 absorbency. I'd give it 0 stars if I could. We are very upset.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Not absorbant at all
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2023
reviews.review:
Despite following the instructions meticulously, the diapers failed to provide even the slightest level of absorption. It was as if they were designed to let all the liquid seep through and leave a trail of discomfort in their wake.

To make matters worse, the urine leak occurred almost instantly upon wearing the diaper. I had hoped that Huggies, being a renowned brand, would offer a solution to prevent leaks and ensure a carefree swimming experience. Instead, I found myself dealing with an unnecessary mess that could have been easily avoided had the diapers performed as advertised.

reviews.name: Nasbi Pams
reviews.title: items defective
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2024
reviews.review: the diapers are like plastic papers, doesn't hold water or urine. if your child urinate when diaper is on, all the clothes get wet as if they were not even wearing a diaper. I have encounter this several times, and had to change to child clothes twice before the swimming class.

reviews.name: Krzysztof Fizyta
reviews.title: Warning - wrong size, not absorbant. Read recent reviews.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2019
reviews.review:
I ordered the small and received size 3-4. They did not fit my child well.

Also, they are not absorbant at all. The couple of times my child peed before getting in the pool he was all wet. They did not hold any liquid!

I don't trust these diapers and am so disappointed in the quality. In the past I bought these on the grocery store. The sizing was correct and they were absorbant. These simply do not work and may result in a pool disaster.

Read the recent reviews. They say the same thing I am writing. Also, I bought these diapers twice, thinking the first purchase was possibly a mistake in shipping. Both orders were in the wrong size.

Finally - Amazon is not allowing me to return my second, unopened order.

Update - I contacted customer service for a refund and they gave it to me. For some reason the refund can not be processed through the site, only via contacting customer service.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Major fail!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2024
reviews.review: Put one on my daughter 5 mins before getting into the pool. By the time we arrived at the pool, she was soaking wet with pee, didn’t absorb anything. Tried them again another day and watched her stand next to the pool while pee ran down her legs (while diapered!). Will not be buying again.

reviews.name: sb
reviews.title: PLEASE AVOID!!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2023
reviews.review:
OMGGGG wish I read the one star reviews. Let’s just say these hold NOTHING in. Pee leaks out instantly through a brand new dry diaper. ALL OVER ME!! And don’t even get me started on poop!!!! Brown leaking water everywhere!!!!! It was the most embarassing
and gross moment of my life by the pool!!!! Please please avoid at all costs. Read the one star reviews. I have NO clue how anyone rates this 5 stars. They just have gotten different diapers than I did.

reviews.name: Katie
reviews.title: These do NOT hold in poop
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2024
reviews.review: We used these at the pool this summer and my daughter had poop all in her swimsuit, up her back, stomach and sides. These absolutely do not keep poop in that isn’t rock solid.

reviews.name: Jasmine Bonilla
reviews.title: Useless.. not even worthy of 1 star
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2023
reviews.review: I'm not sure how these little swimmers received 5 stars.. They don't absorb anything. My 3yo peed through them several times. The only thing accurate about them on the package is that they don't swell. Yeah, they don't swell because everything leaks straight through them. So unless I received a bad batch or something, these were no bueno and a waste of my coins 😒

reviews.name: Eric Rodriguez
reviews.title: These don't hold water
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2019
reviews.review: Oh, I did not like these at all. My daughter was wearing them at the buffet on the resort to which we traveled, before heading to the pool. She was sitting in a high chair and I noticed she was getting fussy. When I looked, there was a pool underneath the highchair and the seat was completely soaked. She peed and the stupid swimmer could e even hold in one bathroom use. I was mortified. We had to cover her in a beach towel and change her poolside. Thank goodness we were just about done at breakfast. For the rest of the trip, I didn't put the swimmers on until she was ready to go in the pool.

reviews.name: Samuel A Paproski
reviews.title: Will leave rash and will leak
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2023
reviews.review: We bought these diapers to use for our son on vacation at the beach. After only using for a couple of hours the diaper was leaking out of the top and sides. It wasn't holding any of the waste. Also, after just a few hours of using at the beach, our son developed a rash on both of his inner thighs from the plastic. We will never buy these again ...

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Pee does not stay in outside of the pool!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2017
reviews.review: Don't know if it's normal, but when my little guy was outside the pool in between swims his pee went straight through. Twice. I can't say for sure whether or not it stayed in there in the pool of course. Think it's a little unreasonable to expect us to change a babe into a reg diaper if we only got out of the pool for a quick burger or to go to the bathroom ourselves only to put them in a new swim diaper. Also not sure if this is how all swim diapers are. I was glad I'd brought a dress & an outfit but not happy that I ended up going home in just my swimsuit due to getting peed on twice....

reviews.name: Christina
reviews.title: Hold water, leak
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2023
reviews.review: Do not buy these! Get the pampers brand!!!! I gave these a couple chances and every time my child pooped, it would squish out of the diaper and was a huge mess, so disgusting. I have never had an issue with this in the pampers brand so just save yourself from going through this and don’t get these!!

reviews.name: Taryn

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2022
reviews.review:
These diapers fill with water from the pool and spill right back out. They offered no protection while in the water. Thank God my toddler was in the water by himself and it was a small toddler sized pool. Otherwise, not only would it have been a waste of money on the diapers, but then we would also have had to empty a large pool (waste of water).

I have purchased these diapers in store before and never had this problem.

reviews.name: Sarah C
reviews.title: ... used these in the past and they are a great product. But my problem is I just received ...

reviews.name: Christine
reviews.title: These diapers hold nothing and leak very badly
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2015
reviews.review:
We use these for our twin boys and the first time we had a terrible leak (didn't seem to hold anything at all), I thought maybe something happened and the swim diaper wasn't positioned correctly (that's the only thing that I thought would have explained the fact that the diaper held nothing). However, we just used these last weekend and ended up with two huge messes!

With the first mess, we were on our way to an amusement park ten minutes away from our home. By the time we got there one of my sons was completely soaked, as was his car seat (and we had just put the swim diaper on before leaving the house). We had no other swim suit with us so I had to wash out the one he was wearing and put it back on him.

The second mishap occurred when we had just gotten home and were walking into our house. My other son was crying because he had "wee-wee" running all down both of his legs. This has NEVER happened with other swim diapers or regular diapers and, again, it seemed that the diaper held none of it.

I cannot believe these are even being sold. What is keeping kids' bodily fluids out of the pools when they're wearing these things??? I am very upset about the experiences we've had and couldn't be more displeased with this product.

In my strong opinion it should be pulled from the shelves until they can work out these issues.

reviews.name: mary s
reviews.title: I feel like I have to warn parents who are going to ...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2016
reviews.review: I have not bought these through Amazon. But after today's experience, I feel like I have to warn parents who are going to put their children in swim class while still in diapers. I have my daughter in a 12 month program at the YMCA. I change her at home before we leave, both bathing suit and swim diaper, so that if we are running late, I am just taking her exterior layer off and we are good. The drive to the YMCA is about 15min. She peed twice, once when we got to there and then again right before the class started. The diapers don't absorb. I would be curious to know what the fluid oz for these are. She is 22 lbs (just had her 12 month check up) and she is in a M size. I can't imagine that these would hold poop if she did happen to poop. Overall, I don't recommend these but not sure if there are any other options out there that actually work. I don't want to experience poop in these, that's for sure. Maybe that's why babies should just swim in the ocean?

reviews.name: Shraddha
reviews.title: Not worth it
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2022
reviews.review: This thing inflates like crazy and is very uncomfortable inside the pool. Kiddo had a hard time. Not satisfied

reviews.name: Julie
reviews.title: Big mess
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2015
reviews.review: The reason these don't swell is b/c the pee or poo goes right through them. My 18m old was in one on 2 separate occasions for 5 minutes before going outside to play with the water table and pool and the first time he had poop in one...when he sat down it was everywhere. And he sat on quite a few things. That was a fun cleanup! I thought well maybe there was just too much of it and really couldn't believe it was the diaper's fault. The second time was pee and I had just put him in it, picked him up, he peed and it just ran through it onto me. I've been peed on a lot with 2 kids (hey it's better than puke) but I thought I was safe with a diaper between us. I have no idea if all brands are like this but now I'm worried to use any swim diaper in a pool with other kids. I don't think they'd appreciate it.

reviews.name: Ashley
reviews.title: No absorbency at all
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2018
reviews.review:
We bought these for a day at the pool and there was no absorbency to them at all. She peed a little while after putting this and her swimsuit on and it leaked out everywhere. Her suit and my lap were soaked and it was running down her legs. The sizing was correct but they just didn’t absorb any urine.
I ended up changing her into a cloth diaper for the day.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Aren’t diapers supposed to hold in pee?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2021
reviews.review:
Maybe these diapers are only to hold in poop because it definitely leaks pee very easily! Maybe people just don’t watch their kids but my baby was at the splash pad and it’s a good thing my 1 year old has the sense to run to the grass to pee and I saw every stream of pee come straight through the diaper (not to the side, THROUGH).
Disappointed.

reviews.name: VeryTiredMama
reviews.title: Will not hold urine
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2011
reviews.review:
I guess if you put this on right before you got into the pool, you might not notice that this diaper holds no urine at all, it doesn't even slow it down. I put the diaper on under my daughter's swim suit and then put her in the car seat to drive to the pool, thinking this would save time and fussing. Well, imagine my surprise when we got to the pool and my daughter's clothing and her car seat were DRENCHED in urine! I checked and the diaper was on properly, and as I was holding her she peed again and now we were both soaked in her urine. So much for saving time and fuss. I had laundry to do for both of us and I also had to remove the car seat from the car to get the cover off and wash and dry it.

I guess these will hold in a BM, as they seem very snug, but I won't be using these again and I won't recommend them.

Oh, and although our daughter weighs only 28 pounds, the medium just barely fits her, it's supposed to fit up to 34 pounds.

reviews.name: Deanna
reviews.title: Size
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2019
reviews.review: Size I ordered was way too big for my daughter

reviews.name: Angie, When will those clouds all disappear?
reviews.title: I'll make this short and to the point
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2012
reviews.review: These swim diapers DO NOT hold up to poop. I just had an extremely bad day yesterday because of this fact. I was at a public park with fountains, and when I took the swimming suit off of my 18-month-old, it was filled with poop. I had to soak the swimming suit in the toilet while I cleaned poop off of my daughter, myself, and the public bathroom counter (there was no changing table at this place). It was an absolute nightmare. And the amount of poop did not justify the explosion. I don't know what to advise, since as far as I can tell, Huggies pretty much has a monopoly on disposable swim diapers. Don't take your baby swimming unless you're sure they've pooped first? Be prepared to absolutely hate life if your child happens to poop while wearing one of these useless things.

reviews.name: Parker
reviews.title: Causss yeast infections
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2017
reviews.review: DO NOT PURCHASE. My son got a yeast infection from wearing these diapers at the beach at 4 months of age. The peditrician said that this is common because they were created to keep moisture in! Two thumbs down.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Such a waste though I have a whole pack left over
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2016
reviews.review: My son is 28lbs and wears huggies size 5 diapers. We got the large and it fit him snug. The diaper leaks though - what gives? We put the diaper on him as we were on our way to the pool... when he peed it all came out running down my friends arms and legs as she carried him. So embarrassing. Thank god we were already at the pool and she could just jump in but I figured these diapers are meant to hold in urine.. not just let it seep out. For that I wouldve just left him in swim shorts! This happened 2x! We wont use these again. Such a waste though I have a whole pack left over!

reviews.name: Mrs. K
reviews.title: Plastic pants in the future
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2012
reviews.review:
My 7-month old grandson went for his first swim yesterday, and did so in Huggies Little Swimmers. Later his mother and I noted an obvious contact rash with hives on his little bottom, with a few hives spreading up his back and on his legs where it came in contact with the 'innards' of these. I wrote to Kimberly-Clark requesting a breakdown of what is in the product, since I don't want him exposed to the offending component again. We will wait and see how they respond. My Little Bun is fine and his rash is improved.

The little dude didn't happen to poo so I can't speak to how well they would hold up in preventing a Code Brown in the water. But I will not use these again when there are plenty of cute plastic pants which I presume would perform much the same service as these without giving my sweet grandbaby an itchy rash.

reviews.review: Took my son to the lake and thought these were the best ever, until he peed outside of the water and it ran down his legs instead of being absorbed by the diaper.

products.product_name: Huggies Size Newborn Diapers, Skin Essentials Baby Diapers, Size Newborn (6-9 lbs), 31 Count, Packaging May Vary

reviews.name: stephen duchac
reviews.title: The BEST and SOFTEST Diaper!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2025
reviews.review:
This is a modal window.

No compatible source was found for this media.
Let it be known that when it comes to diapers, I have tried soooo many out on the market. Even a brand that is higher-end who doesn’t even sell their product in retail stores. I’ve paid just about every price point too, so trust me when I say that I know the difference between a high quality, effective diaper versus a cheap, poorly designed one.

I decided to give this Huggie diaper a go and I’m so glad that I did! First, it is so unbelievably soft. A lot of times, I’d put other diapers on my babies and they’d feel stiff, coarse and just ultimately uncomfortable. They couldn’t be comfortable and yes, they get changed frequently, but my sweet babies live in them, so wouldn’t I want their diaper to be as comfortable as possible?! Of course I do, so these are just about perfect. They are snug, but not overly snug. I’ll be honest, I do not like Huggies Snug and Dry diapers, as they were too tight on both of my babies in the inner thigh area. One of my babies was long and lean and they were still too tight on her, so if you’re baby is a little more chunky like my second, I would say don’t get the Snug and Dry. Get these instead.

Second, this design really is effective in preventing blowouts and leaks. The diaper pad is very absorbent, but it’s the double-lined barrier around the legs that prevents the leaks the most. This doubled-up barrier is still of course soft on delicate skin. The biggest star of this diaper is the little pocket they’ve put on the back of the diaper right where those blowouts love to find their exit point and make their way up your baby’s back. I cannot tell you how many times this little pocket has caught what would’ve been a mess all over the back of my baby’s outfit or bouncer seat.

As far as price point goes, these are a little more expensive, but well worth it in my opinion. You really are getting your money’s worth on these diapers. Give them a try! But be warned: you’ll get hooked and your baby will love them!

reviews.title: Great product for babies with sensitive skin! 5/5 stars!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2024
reviews.review: When my oldest was born he could use any diaper. We loved Pampers. When my youngest was born I bought the same Pampers we used on my oldest. My youngest broke out in a horrible diaper rash at such a young age. He has been proscribed strong butt cream to help him through horrible episodes. One point he almost had to be hospitalized. We tried the Pampers then Huggies. I read online Snugglers were great for young babies with sensitive skin and it worked until Snugglers were not an option for older babies. The next option was Movers. We tried those but the horrible diaper rash days were back. After buying tubes of diaper rash cream and not being able to see my baby in pain any longer I found these as a suggestion on Amazon. The reviews were great! And at this point I was so desperate for my son to find comfort.. We have used these for almost a month now and they’re such a life changer! We hardly ever have to use diaper cram any more! My son has not cried once since being in these diapers! It’s truly a miracle! The only down fall is the diaper is not as absorbent as the other Huggies brands, I think that’s due to its soft material. Sometimes if my son needs to pee a lot, his pants might become wet. It doesn’t happen often and I’d take that over a horrible diaper rash any day!

reviews.name: Anne W
reviews.title: My favorite diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2024
reviews.review:
I love these diapers! They are very soft inside and out. I have tried all of the Huggies on my 2 year old and 6 month old, and these are my favorite. All the Huggies absorb very well, and prevent blowouts the best for my little one. However, I prefer the Skin Essentials for a couple reasons.

1. They are so soft!
2. I don’t love the double grip strips on the snugglers and movers. If your child is wiggly, it’s hard to get the diaper on without the purple part rubbing them (it’s very irritating if it rubs on the babies skin). Not a complete deal breaker, but something to consider if your child moves around during diaper changes.
3. I prefer these minimalist design on these. Again, not a deal breaker, just a personal preference.
4. They have never irritated my son’s skin who has eczema.

One thing to note, I don’t think they are the best for overnight absorption if your child is a heavy wetter. I do prefer the Huggies overnights for night time.

I did compare the absorption of these versus the little movers and snug and dry. I poured 8 ounces of water and waited 30 seconds to test the absorption. All absorbed very well!

reviews.title: My new favorite diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2024
reviews.review: I have tried so many diapers, even expensive bamboo and charcoal diapers. My old favorite was Millie Moon but I didn't like the shape of them and it didn't have a great fit because of that. These feel almost as soft as Millie Moon but better with the way they're shaped so it's easy to secure the diaper and the front top and back top overlap a lot so there isn't any weird gaps and you don't have to strap on the diaper tight because of the shape. Anyway my daughter started getting these little bumps all over her diaper area that would appear and disappear and I had no idea what it was so I decided to try these and the rash she had was almost gone after less than 24 hours. And 48.hours after them arriving the bumps are completely gone. I immediately ordered a big box. Another fantastic thing is the top liner in the diaper that touches the baby's skin is so perfect bc it does not stick to the baby when it's wet. Her old diapers would give her a wedgie of that top layer and it would keep her skin wet and cause rashes I hated it. I won't go back to any other diaper! I just wish Huggies would change the wipes. Take one and wipe your face with it. It's so rough! It's almost painful. I never knew until I used one to take my makeup off. I'm currently using hello bello unscented wipes. One side of them has these little bumps on them and I love that.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2024

The name “essentials” makes it feel like the quality would be compromised but it’s the complete opposite. Diapers are extremely soft, softer than SD. Print is minimal & does great with pictures or light colored clothing, especially for newborn photoshoots. Very absorbent and incredibly soft around the leg cuffs. Inside material is also very soft (especially for my little guy who has very sensitive skin). My son stays dry and I also don’t have to worry about leaking or diaper feeling moist to the touch on the outside.
These diapers are just like toilet paper; you get what you pay for. As a mom who’s tried every single brand out there, Skin Essentials is worth every penny and never switching to anything else!

reviews.title: The best diapers for babies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2024
reviews.review: In my opinion these are the best diapers. I tested many companies and versions. These huggies are the softest and most pleasant in the entire line of diapers; they absorb well, do not rub, and do not leave behind granules on the baby’s skin. in general, the haggis brand itself is the best, very good absorbency, but the diapers from other lines are hard, the elastic cuts into the baby’s skin very strongly and leaves granules on the baby’s skin. This series of diapers is definitely better and of higher quality. I finally found something that I will order again

Cons: you will have to change them very often, they crystallize faster than any diaper I ever purchased

reviews.name: Katlin Chance

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2024
reviews.review: We have not used a variety of Huggies that our daughter doesn’t like! These are so soft and high quality! No blowouts or leaks in the 3 weeks we have used this style. We use the size 1 and they are true to size. The neutral and subtle Mickey head pattern is nice also. The interior has a liner very similar to an always infinity pad, which I have personally raved about for years and was excited to try on my baby!

reviews.name: Amazon Customer

reviews.review: Most diapers aren’t that different but this actually was game changer. There was noticeably less mess in his bottom after a runny BM - unlike Pampers with the holes in the liner that sticks to his butt, this liner actually soaks in the mess away from his skin. It’s so soft and gentle - definitely worth the money!

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2024
reviews.review:
Good diapers, even better pull ups. I have many younger kids (foster mommy) so we love the versatility.
Doesn't feel wet, which is especially great for bedtimes!
Soft but not thick& plush like i expected, although that's understandable as reviewers on other natural diapers despise this feature.
These diapers run big, so sizing down for full optimation is ideal, but works the same, more or less, if you get bigger. If you truly don't like the bigger size, just save until they can wear 🤷🏾‍♀️. Win Win

They swelled up so much and had a very strong pee odor by the morning time where the special delivery has never done that. I do like them for the day time though where I can change my son more frequently. I’d still recommend them as a clean brand.

reviews.review: It was hard to find in supermarkets, it was nice to find it here, but the last diapers I bought leaked immediately with the first urine, and also caused diaper rash, even though we changed them very often, we couldn't understand what was different.We will try another brand

reviews.title: Strange odor - but we typically love huggies

reviews.review: We love Huggies products for our baby, however, this item had a strong chemical smell when it became soiled. I returned it out of concern, especially since it’s a product for infants. I will continue to purchase this item, just never through this retailer again, I have many concerns about the products being distributed by “Big A” and my trust in their reliability and quality has been completely diminished.

reviews.name: Adam Krakowski
reviews.title: Metallic smelling
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2025
reviews.review: The diapers were okay I guess but they have a metallic smell that gets worse after baby wets the diaper. Looked it up, Amazon sold Huggies have this issue. Won’t be buying these diapers from Amazon again.

reviews.name: Eimag
reviews.title: Not Very Impressive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2024
reviews.review: I’ve always bought huggies diapers and they are always great quality. I typically go between little movers and special delivery, special delivery being my favorite. Apparently these are the replacement for special delivery which is such a bummer. They feel very thin, and have that slippery feeling that less expensive diapers (think Walmart brand) usually have. I don’t find that they are as absorbent as snugglers, movers, or special delivery. Most importantly, they fall down so easily. As soon as the diaper gets even a little wet, the diaper is pulling at the tabs and slipping down both my toddler and baby’s bums. Considering these are the most expensive huggies diapers now, that’s pretty unacceptable. Also, although not important, the print is so lame. To go from a cute, colorful, 101 Dalmatians on the special delivery diapers, to a boring barely there micky ear is no fun. I will absolutely not buy these again. Stick to the regular huggies.

reviews.name: Sarah Beth
reviews.title: Soft but not effective
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are kind of strange. While I do like them because they are super soft I feel like liquid comes out the front of the diaper. Instead of keeping the liquid contained inside the diaper, the outside of the diaper feels damp. Very weird and I won’t buy them again.

reviews.name: Danielle
reviews.title: The worst diaper for overnight
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2024
reviews.review: This is by far, the worst diaper I’ve ever used overnight. The diapers seem alright during the day but by the morning, my son’s diaper is ripping off because these cannot hold much at all for overnight. I’ll be switching back to pampers pure. I’ve never experienced this issue with a diaper before. I’ve experienced this with both of my boys who are in different sizes and both their diapers are ridiculous in the morning. Will never buy these again. I really miss huggies special delivery! These don’t compare at all!!!!

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2024
reviews.review: We loved Huggies Special Delivery. Had I known they were being discontinued I would have bought every size in bulk. We switched to Huggies Skin Essentials as they were supposed to be the most comparable. They are not. Every poopy diaper is suddenly a blow out, we’ve had to take apart and wash the full car seat several times now which is such a pain. We’ve seen an increase in diaper rashes. The inside layer is not as soft or absorbent as Special Delivery. Baby has sensitive skin so will need more time to shop around to find something closer to the comfort and performance of the Special Delivery line.

reviews.name: Kirstyn
reviews.title: Not worth it
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2024

These feel like cardboard compared to those and the inside of these are so thin you can almost see through them. Wont be buying again. Dissapointed as we will have to use pampers now as these replaced our favorite.

I never had any leaks with the special delivery diapers but these leak so often. They are just as soft as special delivery but they leak way to much. Sadly I will have to find new diapers!😮‍💨😢

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2024
reviews.review: Everything about these diapers is nice. They are soft, absorbent and leak free. However, my daughter got the worst rash she’s ever had after using them. We had to return them. Overall I think it’s great if your child doesn’t have a reaction to them.

reviews.name: Joy
reviews.title: Definitely not 100% leakproof. Not an every day diaper.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2024
reviews.review: I REALLY wanted to love these but they are such a flop. I know they advertise for their softness and clean materials for sensitive skin, BUT that’s pretty much all they’re good for. Definitely not a convenient, every day diaper. On the box it says “100% leakproof”, but that is SO NOT TRUE AT ALL. They hold barely any pee and each time my baby has pooped, every single time it has leaked out through the legs, been a blowout, or just leaked straight through the diaper. Not being dramatic at all unfortunately :( I think they’re good for when your baby specifically has diaper rash and you’re on top of diaper changes like almost immediately after they pee. Like, seriously not kidding if my baby poops and then pees after, it leaks from somewhere. To be fair, they’re really really soft and easy on the skin compared to a lot of diapers but not convenient at all. (Also yes she’s wearing the right size I checked lol)

reviews.name: Dark Fortress
reviews.title: I only use these diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2024
reviews.review: I only use Huggies Snug & Dry, ever since we were able to try them for free. That's because they never leak. I have two babies one is 8 months and the other is 2. They can both wear size 3 which is convenient for me. When my youngest was in the other sizes, it was more of a pain because the various sizes are very difficult to tell apart of they ever get mixed together like in a diaper bag. The only noticeable difference would be the number on the front but they look identical otherwise. I do wish they would use something more visually different for the sizes like different colors or patterns. Other than that, I have no complaints. My kids generally seem very comfortable in them and it literally takes the worst blowout you've ever seen in your life to even leak a little, where other diapers I have tried would leak from the smallest normal amount of baby's #2.

reviews.name: Simple Jane
reviews.title: No more soggy diaper disasters!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2024
reviews.review:
As a mom of a very busy 1-year-old, I can confidently say these Little Swimmers are an absolute lifesaver. My little fish loves the water, and I love that these diapers don’t swell up like balloons the second we step into the pool. The stretchy sides? Genius. I mean, who knew baby rolls could get cuter?

Changing them mid-swim is a breeze too—just tear away those sides and boom, done! No wrestling a slippery toddler while they look like they’re auditioning for a dolphin show. And the leak guards? Let's just say they’ve saved me from some seriously embarrassing "code brown" situations. Plus, that back label helps me avoid the classic "is this on backwards?" diaper struggle.

If only everything about parenting was this easy!

PLEASE PLEASE use swim diapers in pools and splash pads to avoid diaper particles and feces getting into the system and causing E.coli for others! I loved that they had Velcro tabs because I remember the ones my nieces and nephews wore years ago only being available in pull on which isn’t ideal for a newborn. Bonus points for the finding nemo print which was perfect for our Disney loving family.

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.title: Good
reviews.review: I really love the Huggies brand in general - it’s my favorite diaper brand aside from Target. I purchased these for my 16lb 6 month old baby boy for our upcoming trip and upon opening they looked really tiny… because they are really tiny! My son is very small and these are still very tight around the sides and it made me nervous when he went in the pool because I thought he would bust out of it. They held up very well with no accidents which was perfect, but it makes me wonder if I should have sized up? I would say if you’re on the fence about size, even if your baby fits in the size range, but hey maybe he’s a little chunkier babes, just size up for peace of mind.

I tried many doggie diapers and they were all terrible. I read a note from a woman who said "don't spend your money on doggie diapers, Little Swimmers are great." She was correct. If you need a bit of help with a pup who is having issues with incontinence -- try huggies little swimmers - works great for a female dog.
NOTE: my dog has a nub for a tail, so you may have to put an opening for your dog if she has a tail.

We've only used them a couple times, and she didn't poop, so I don't know how they hold up to newborn/infant poop. But the fact that they go on like a diaper rather than pull-up is perfect. She is now 3 months old and 11.5lbs

Maybe if I try a size bigger that won't happen? But it barely held any pee at all. Idk if its supposed to or not since its a swim diaper. But when I took it off and wrapped it, it was so small like it didn't hold any pee. Might try a larger size if I try them again?

reviews.name: Richard P.
reviews.title: A Great Option for Baby Wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.review:
As an adult paraplegic, I definitely use my share of body wipes whether made for adults or babies. Because I have more sensitive skin, I tend to defer to baby wipes as they're made to be more effective yet gentle.

I bought this box of Huggies Natural Care Baby Wipes. They are hypoallergenic, though I did buy the scented ones. Unscented is an available option. This is a box with six individual packages with each package having 48 wipes. I absolutely love the cap for these packages as it offers a great way to seal the package and keep the wipes fresh. It makes it a lot easier to justify buying these in bulk.

These have a nice thickness to them, though they are not overly thick. They are soft, only slightly scented, and do a really nice job of dealing with clean-up needs. I'm just super pleased with them and find them to be very effective. They also don't agitate my skin at all.

These wipes are not considered flushable. The packages I received also have Disney designs on them that are quite adorable.

I'm not always picky about baby wipes, however, after using these it's hard to imagine using others. These are just different - they feel better, work better, and keep the skin cleaner. These are a great option for baby wipes.

I feel like they actually clean and cleanse the skin unlike the huggies clan which are so thick and I feel like just push everything around. These even absorb the urine smell so much better and clean poo in much less wipes than the other ones that are more expensive. These are definitely the way to go! Lea e a nice clean gentle scent and actually helped clear up a rash once I switched to These ones. The thickness and moisture level is perfect 👌 👍

reviews.name: Aaliyah Palmer
reviews.title: The best wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2024
reviews.review:
I recently made the switch to Huggies Natural Care Refreshing Baby Wipes, and I couldn't be happier with my choice! As a parent, finding products that are both effective and safe for my baby is always a top priority, and these wipes check all the boxes.

First and foremost, the hypoallergenic formula provides peace of mind. I love knowing that I’m using wipes that are gentle on my baby's sensitive skin. We’ve experienced no rashes or irritation since we started using these, which is a significant relief!

The refreshing scent is another advantage. Unlike some baby wipes that can have overpowering fragrances, Huggies got it just right. The subtle scent leaves my baby feeling clean and fresh without being overwhelming.

Each pack features a convenient flip-top design, making it easy to access wipes with one hand—an absolute must for any busy parent. With 168 wipes in total, I appreciate the quantity provided, offering great value. The wipes themselves are thick and durable, which means they’re perfect for tackling everything from diaper changes to messy hands and faces.

Overall, Huggies Natural Care Refreshing Baby Wipes have exceeded my expectations. They blend quality, convenience, and safety perfectly. I highly recommend them to any parent looking for reliable and effective baby wipes. Thank you, Huggies, for creating such a fantastic product!

reviews.name: ~GMB
reviews.title: Just for Babies? I hope not...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.review:
While Huggies is a well known name brand, the fact that it's marketed for childcare isn't often why I purchase them.

For my family member and I, I buy them for Bathroom Care. Any concerns that might happen in or near the bathroom. For example, small product spills, gathering stray hair from the floor, and the messy bathroom visit.

Although I'm not fond of this simple fact, I need to use toilet paper and a wipe from time to time.
I will say that I do try to limit the number of Huggies wipes I use because the wipes don't break down after going in the trash.

As for the amount and the money, one receives more wipes buying Target's Store Brand per pack. However, you can order larger quantities [ that's more packs] with Huggies. So, one may want to look around and do additional comparison shopping before one commits to a retailer.

reviews.name: Cowboy
reviews.title: Much better than Pampers wipes.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020
reviews.review:
We've had kids in diapers for the past five years so we know a few things about wipes and diapers. Numerous brands have been tried, yet we always come back to Huggies for their quality and value.

For the past 1-2 years we have been loyal to the Huggies Natural Care wipes because they are soft, strong, unscented, easy to pull from the package, and a good value. I recently came across these Huggies Refreshing Clean wipes and they were a tad bit cheaper so I thought we'd give them a try, knowing that Huggies hasn't disappointed us yet.

These wipes are exactly the same as the Huggies Natural Care wipes except for the mild scent. They come in the same package, same size and thickness, with the same design on the wipe. The scent is pleasant and clean, not the unpleasant baby powder smell that other wipes have. They are also one cent cheaper per wipe, which adds up if you go through as many wipes as we do. This is a high quality and affordable wipe!

Update 03/22/2020: Huggies were all sold out during the corona virus hoarding of 2020 and we had to purchase some Pampers wipes by default. Huggies are a superior overall product than Pampers. The wipes are comparable, but the packaging is so much better with Huggies which is why we purchase the individual packs. Huggies has a filp top and Pampers has a resealable flap. Huggies has a much larger hole to pull the wipes from. Huggies wipes also come out individually while Pampers come out in a long line.

reviews.title: Love the scent and how thin they are
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2025
reviews.review: I do love these baby wipes, not only because I love the scent so much and believe it is the best mild and clean smell out there but I love the texture and thinness of the wipes. I have tried other wipes and found the bamboo to be so thick and it has a yucky texture and others are so thick too that they feel like they would take forever to decompose. I love that these feel kind of like a strong, soft paper and it makes me feel good knowing they may break down faster. All the types that don't feel like paper leave me with a not so nice feeling. When I wipe baby's bum it feels like they get more off rather than those super thick wipes that are so wet and slippery that they can't catch anything, if you know what I mean. Yes, the paper feel actually helps get the poop off rather than the thicker slippery feel. I hope they keep making these the same texture HOWEVER, I really hope they make a more organic version SOON! Because I keep trying others for a more organic conscious buy.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2020
reviews.review: I checked the price on these baby wipes compared to our local big box store that my husband likes to call "Wally World", and it was almost the same price per package (give or take some change). I usually buy the cheaper kind when I shop just because we don't use them on babies. We use them when we go to the restroom to feel "cleaner". So this brand is an upgrade to what I always purchase. The only thing I don't like is if you wipe these on a surface like a countertop that's dark, you can see that they leave behind quite a bit of tiny white fibers. That means when you use it on your skin it does the same thing. The off-brand or store brand I normally purchase does not do that. The smell to me is also kind of like chemicals. I have been opting to buy more cosmetic or beauty items that contain less chemicals and essential oils instead, and I'm getting used to more natural products. The only reason I did purchase these was b/c of the Coronavirus and I have tried not going to the supermarket or grocery stores at all if I can help it. I probably won't be buying these again.

reviews.name: Mr. McIntyre
reviews.title: Not Pleased With The New Closure Design & New Fabric
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2021
reviews.review:
If it's not broken, then don't fix it.... words I grew up by. But apparently someone working in the packaging design Dept for Huggies grew up in a completely different era. The new closure lid is a bit bulky compared to the last, and as a result I have found that they don't stack on top of one another as easily as the old package design had.

Also, I noticed that about a month or two prior to this new packaging design, that Huggies has started using a different type of fabric for their wet wipes. This new fabric is much, much more coarse feeling, and has a rather rough feel to it when compared to the extremely soft and gentle fabric from before this new change. This new fabric texture could almost be called a "wet / soggy fine grit sandpaper". Granted, it's not quite that rough, but it certainly is nowhere near as soft and gentle feeling as it was just a couple of months back.

It is so rough feeling in fact, that I am absolutely experimenting with other brands.

reviews.title: Be careful !! There are now SCENTED "Natural Care" Huggies !!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2021
reviews.review:
How distressing! I've ordered Huggies Natural Care for years only to discover that my latest box, with exact same markings, is scented!! I don't want scented. I thought all Natural Care Huggies were unscented which is why they were NATURAL.

If you are sensitive to scent, the cucumber and green tea smell is quite noticeable and who knows what it will do to the skin when used.

The packaging is super deceiving. It looks exactly like the unscented box. Of course, I COULD have noticed the word "SCENTED" in the description but I didn't.

My review is based on the fact that the markings to note that it's scented were not different enough to notice.

reviews.review: These wipes are great. Nice and soft, good value. My only advice is to count the wipe packages inside the box. When they arrived, I picked up the box and immediately know that it felt light. Sure enough, I opened it and found only 8 packs instead of 10. The top of the box was taped shut, so my best guess is that it probably broke open (either at the warehouse or UPS transport) and only 8 made it back into the box. I contacted Amazon and since this is a non-returnable item, they gave me the option to refund or replace. I chose replace since I needed the wipes that I ordered. Just make sure you count them right when you get them!

reviews.name: Sunel
reviews.title: Why mess with a good thing?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2023
reviews.review:
I've been getting these wipes for over a year now and up until now have been very pleased with them. They were soft, thick, with an appropriate level of moisture, and a very light scent. Baby also had no issues with it.

Until the most recent shipment -- I noticed something was different right away. The wipes now has a slight texture to it, almost like bounty, didn't feel as soft, looked thinner, and seemed to be drying out quicker. I still didn't think much of it until my toddler started getting rashes. He would also wince and pull back as if they were uncomfortable. The final straw for me was when I decided to use it as a makeup remover wipe (something I occasionally did with these before) and it felt like it was literally scratching/burning my face! I feel terrible for having subjected my toddler to these and will NOT be ordering more. I hate when companies take a well-rated product and start cutting corners at the expense of their customers. Onto the next!

reviews.name: Jh
reviews.title: No wonder there is no refund
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2023
reviews.review: Received wipes today. I usually use Pampers and Target brand wipes but I gave Huggies a try. I must say it was the worst wipes I’ve ever used. I had to use three times as much wipes as I usually do with other brands, and still cannot have my toddler clean. Looks moist but it is not. Very difficult on the skin to clean and pick up soil. I would like a refund. I have used two packages to see if one of the batch was bad, nope they are all horrible. Should not be labeled as baby wipes. This is more for hand wipes. No wonder there is a no refund policy.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2020
reviews.review: I ordered these months ago and was really happy with what I paid for the amount of wipes I got. I have had a really hard time finding the refreshing clean wipes since. Turns out Huggies did another rebranding of the SAME exact wipes. They’ve now changed the name to Huggies Natural Care wipes. That would be fine if you still got the same amount of wipes for the same price. Well the price hasn’t changed and you now get only 48 wipes per soft pack instead of 56. Shady a** business practice. I know a lot of other parents who love these wipes. I’m really disappointed in Huggies for this. If you’re going to lower the number of wipes you should adjust the price to reflect that!
